formatted_address: 1331 Rue Sainte-Catherine E, Montréal, QC H2L 2H4, Canada
name: Studio Africando

formatted_address: 447 Rue Saint-François-Xavier, Montréal, QC H2Y 2T1, Canada
name: Restaurant Bonaparte

reviews.text: The food and drinks are unique and very much amazing. I recommend sitting at the bar and having a great conversation with very astute and knowledgeable staff. I assure you this is well worth the visit and I personally did the 6 course menu but I feel ridiculously full and Ill so perhaps don't eat the entire bowl of bread they bring you 😁

Service was impeccable, and that to me is very important when you are paying so much at a restaurant. The waiters are friendly, and down to earth. I've been to many expensive restaurants in Montreal where the service was horrible and the waiters were rude and obnoxious........ Also the Food is delicious and very fresh at Bonaparte! Will return

Best restaurant, reasonable prices. If you are visiting Montreal is a must go restaurant!!! Good service.

Definitely will come back!

The bartender Mark was amazingly knowledgeable about not only the food, but the local culture and history of not only Quebec but Canada in general. The food and drinks are unique and very much amazing. I recommend sitting at the bar and having a great conversation with very astute and knowledgeable staff. I assure you this is well worth the visit and I personally did the 6 course menu but I feel ridiculously full and Ill so perhaps don't eat the entire bowl of bread they bring you 😁

Service was outstanding! Our server was friendly, nice, and very attentive. I wish I remember her name (I am not good with names!) so that I could talk about how good she was to us (we visited on October 10 for dinner). 

We ordered appetizer - goat cheese in filo dough and loved it. I enjoyed this dish to the point that I forgot I wasn’t a big fan of goat cheese. Haha. 

For the main course, I had the chicken breast. Chicken breast was cooked to perfection. I figured the best way to judge a restaurant was to order dishes with every day simple ingredients. Chicken breast usually tastes similar whatever you do to it but it was not the case in Restaurant Bonaparte. 

My partner ordered the vegetarian dish - tofu with vegetables. He thought the food was not seasoned heavily (which was a good thing) so he could taste quality food itself. 

We had a great experience in this place and when we come back to Montreal to visit, we will definitely visit here again.

formatted_address: 4740 Boulevard Wilfrid-Hamel Bureau 150-A, Québec, QC G1P 2J9, Canada
name: Aki Sushi Administration

formatted_address: 6079 Rue Sherbrooke Ouest, Montréal, QC H4A 1Y2, Canada
name: Ganges Restaurant

reviews.text: This spot is worth a visit. They have large portions for fair rates. Regularly well organized and with good character. I highly recommend this place.
The food was excellent.  Service was very good. Always had a great experience
This place is superb and roomy, the menu was delightful and the rates were very fair. quick, efficient service and very personal staff. Recommended.

I have been dining regularly at Ganges Restaurant for over 15 years. The spice, quality and value of the food is always on point and the overall experience is just what you can expect for Indian fine dining. Although the management and ownership of the restaurant has recently changed it is still the restaurant I know and love (thank you Raju for the great service!). Their efforts to update the P.O.S. system and menu are also appreciated.

Without doubt a really solid restaurant offering Indian food! 
Their dry flatbread is simply amazing! The spicy mix is just right!
Their assorted appetizer is really good, except for the samosa, which was, and always had been kind of blend.
Moving on to main dish, their lamb biryani was simply amazing! I got so focused on eating that I forgot to take a picture. The curries are all very tasty! Albeit a little too much on the sweet side. The chicken tandoori is very solid, especially the thigh pieces, since the chest pieces tend to be a bit dry.

Service is good, would go back for sure!

formatted_address: 215 Boulevard René-Lévesque E, Montréal, QC H2X 1N7, Canada
name: MishMâche Montreal

reviews.text: Very good place for breakfast.  Their menu is slightly high priced but it is worth it because their food is good.  The service by the waitress was excellent.  She knew we were new to town and helped us with the order.  The place is quaint and relaxing.  Beautiful interior.  This is at the ground floor of the Hotel Chrome.  Great food and awesome service.  There is also parking on the main street.
Consistently good! Highly recommend their eggs bene with pears.
The food is good but very overpriced. Portions are small and you do not get sides with a main plate.  Also, our waiter seemed very confused but he was friendly.
I had the best eggs benny at this place, so good in fact, I came back the next day to try their burger! I have made this a regular resto I visit weekly. The staff and the food are exceptional!
Delicious burger - well lit and welcoming environment.

formatted_address: 590 Rue Jarry E, Montréal, QC H2P 1V5, Canada
name: Quebec Deli

reviews.text: Food is ok but they keep hiring ´waitresses’ that have no idea what they are doing. I was once a newbie waiter, my boss knew it and made sure that I got (+\-) proper training and supervision until I could fly on my own. Quebec Deli should do the same.
Not Very Good for the last 2 years,now even worse with new owner. Just close down already please
Nice service... plates are fulll...everything was delicious...
Food is good and portions are generous. Prices are honest.
It's a cute family restaurant. The prices are fine, the food was really good and the waitress are chill. A perfect place for a date if you want to get a traditional poutine made in Québec.

formatted_address: 3435 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2X 2T6, Canada
name: Montreal Skeleton Key

formatted_address: 999 Rue Saint-Urbain, Montréal, QC H2Z 1E9, Canada
name: Chez Chine

reviews.text: What a gem! Did not expect to see a nicely designed restaurant. We didn’t realize that the restaurant was inside the holiday inn on the second floor until we got there. Food was good and a little on the pricier side ($$$). Bathroom situation was weird because you need to be a guest and have a key to use the washrooms. Apart from that, it was all very nice. Staff was so polite!
The Dim-sum is awesome here, plus its probably the nicest restaurant in Chinatown.

We love their dimsum! So good! Especially the shrimp dumpling! 
Their BBQ duck is the best! 
Our kids love the fish pond!
Amazing environment, delicious foods, wonderful services.

A beautiful restaurant with affordable prices (about 30.00$ a head for a four course meal) and the food is great. Only cons are the unfriendly staff and the Hip Hop playing on the radio. We even asked why this beautiful Asian setting was complimented with such awful music and were simply told «that’s what appeals to American visitors»... In Chinatown… In the middle of Montréal…. A shame. If you can live with the music (it doesn’t play loud or anything) and don’t mind curt service, this one is a memorable experience. Recommended.

formatted_address: 600 Grande Allée E, Québec, QC G1R 2K5, Canada
name: Dagobert

reviews.text:
The inside is nice, there are many bar stations and the staff was pretty friendly and helpful. The music was fun and pretty mainstream with all kinds of different stuff from the past 20 years. One thing about this place is that it's very geared towards young people. Nearly every person there seemed about 18 or even younger. So keep that in mind when planning to come here if that's something you want or not.

I only stayed in the main room on the ground floor which had mainly hip hop and rap when I went.

They charge $2.50 for coat check.

Visited this nightclub during a trip to Quebec City. Enjoyed the multiply levels with different music, different vibes on each floor so you’ll find something you like. Security were fairly friendly even to non-French speakers (and even drunk non-French speakers). If I’m ever back in the city I might come here again, tequila is cheap!
Nice club vibe and love to see them support local artists like iLL Fuego by playing their music!
Never seen such a bad DJ, the mix is so bad! Like for real. I only give 1 star cause its a good layout of the dance floor or else THIS BAR IS AWFUL

Rudest bartenders ever. So I tipped $1 per drink (My usual standard) and the bartender had the audacity to straight up tell me to my face that "You didn't tip me enough." Umm. A tip is a gratuity, NOT a requirement. To tell someone that "You didn't tip enough" is probably one of the rudest things you can say to a customer who just paid $7 for a beer. I don't know how much you guys pay your bartenders but if they are that desperate for tips, I highly suggest paying your bartenders a bit more. Highly don't reccomend.

formatted_address: 177 Rue Saint-Zotique E, Montréal, QC H2S 1K9, Canada
name: Trattoria Piatto Pieno

reviews.text: It is BYOB!! I heard a lot about this place but was disappointed when I tried it. I expected more based on what I heard. My pasta was undercooked. The veal lacked taste. My friends seemed to enjoy their meals though. They suggested getting the pizza next time. I find that what I ordered was not worth the price. Our waitress was friendly but the service is horrible. We asked a question to a waiter and he replied by "I'm not your waiter". All evening we refilled our own water cups and wine glasses. Also, We were super squeezed the way we were seated which made it a hassle for us and the table behind us everytime we wanted to get up to the bathroom.

I recommend this place if you're looking for a nice Italian terrace where you can bring your own wine. 

The food is delicious and the service is great

Owner did us a solid and added to our reservation last min during F1 weekend. Calimari was absolutely amazing and the pizza is hard to beat. Great thin crust in wood fire stove. I recommend this place to everyone.

Food was good , nothing out of the ordinary and a bit pricey for what you get. 
Service could have been faster , not a deal breaker but overall not super impressive.

I would like to share that I have come here on several occasions, I insisted to bring my in-laws saying that this would be a great dinning experience in the proximities of little Italie. 

First, I came with an 18 month baby, I was not offered a high chair, I needed to ask for one 20 minutes after we were seated. 

We were alone, no one else has entered the restaurant as of yet which surprised me. This place is usually packed.

Ie ordered fired calamaris, the cook probably dropped the salt in there, it was not edible. The waiter took all the calamaris back as replaced them, they were good once replaced.

The plate of cold anti-pasto piato pieno was acceptable (it’s hard to miss) yet the fried eggplant were not touched as they were rubber like texture and the Italian sausage was over-cooked.

The menu didn’t hold la soupe du jour, 
They didn’t have fettuccini, and then lastly when we asked for the veal, that too was not on the menu (the kitchen didn’t hold many items listed on the menu) 

We asked for some bread for my 18month baby that was hungry... it was apparently in the oven ... that took 45 minutes. We got the entres after 45 min of ordering, and we had a gap of one hour between finishing eating our entres and the main course arrived. Needless to say: no one was hungry anymore. 

The owner seems to be present, and quite frankly very nice and social and even encouraged the waitress to find some crayons for him to have something to do. That never happened. 

I won’t be going back and will not be recommending this place which breaks my heart as it’s a restaurant that hold plenty of beautiful memories for me.

formatted_address: 3580 Rue Notre-Dame Ouest, Montréal, QC H4C 1P4, Canada
name: H123 (Hello 123 - St Henri)

reviews.text: High end, elevated vegan fare with an amazing assortment of natural wines, in a beautiful, well designed space. Experience the warmth of H123 in Saint Henri. The menu is diverse and creative, the staff accommodating and helpful. You must try the blueberry cheesecake. Trust me.

The best vegan restaurant in Montréal. Hands down. No joke. You can live for meat and still have an incredible experience. Yes. It’s that good.

Recipes are incredibly tasty, delicate, gourmet and all around creative. Staff is lovely, know their food and know their wine, and the menu changes often enough for your experience to be renewed. 

Bonus : Ambiance is super cozy and intimate.

So finally I went back a second time with a group of friends for a simple drink and we were very well welcomed.

I did not take a drink the first time but actually they have a very interesting choice of beer and wines. Wines are expensive (14$/glass) but they are good and it's better than the usual cheaper and undrinkable

The owner worked on a new dish to replace his vegan cari and made us try it, it was actually pretty good, based on asparagus and mushrooms, we enjoyed it

Last night, I ordered the wild mushroom risotto and a smoothie for delivery from H123. I was so disappointed when it arrived, the portion for the risotto was so small! It came in 5x7" to-go box and only 1/2" of food on the bottom like only 10 bites of food, I was shocked! It cost $15+tx the risotto and the total order was over $30 - I don't eat a lot and even I was hungry when I finished! I called the restaurant to see if there was a mistake, I explained to the woman over the phone that my delivery portion was minuscule. She went and chatted with the manager and came back and told me that everything was portioned so there was no mistake. On top of that, when the smoothie came it was completely liquid like water! I love Hello123 and don't understand what the heck is going on at H123! I have to admit, I rarely if ever write reviews but I felt compelled to warn others!!

Absolutely amazing food!!! It’s the second time we go to H123 and both times the food , the drinks, and the personable service were above our expectations. Do not hesitate to go there even if you like meat : you will very happy!

formatted_address: 5333 Avenue Casgrain, Montréal, QC H2T 1X3, Canada
name: Restaurant Caroline

reviews.text: Healthy, cute and not expensive!

Nous avons louer le très beau restaurant de Caroline Dumas le mois dernier, un soir, pour un événement bénéfice. Nous étions près d’une une cinquantaine. Caroline et son équipe avaient préparé pour nous un magnifique repas. C’était magique: le lieu, le repas, l’accueil de Caroline. Mémorable.
Les cafés sont super bons et le service et très sympathique ! Parfait pour commencer la journée ☕️

Très bonne expérience chez Caroline, le lieu est superbe et lumineux. Les plats sont beaux, délicieux et très abordable, élaborés avec d'excellents produits. La cerise: un service impeccable et chaleureux.
Je recommande cette expérience.

Petite visite au comptoir pour les options Keto suite à l'article dans La Presse, mais rendu sur place il n'y avait pas de Keto au menu. Bon... Sinon j'ai trouvé les portions un peu "juste" mais le goût était excellent.

formatted_address: 2108 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2X 2T2, Canada
name: Blvd44

reviews.text:
So I need to be honest, I almost didn't come here based on reviews I saw online. A lot of people were complaining about staff/ dress code and I can say I had the complete opposite experience.

We went to Blvd44 on Industry night, which is Monday. If you want to dance and have a good time, I suggest this is where you go!

I had messaged the club on Facebook before I went about the dress code since so many people in other reviews seemed to have an issue, here was their response:

"Here is the dress code with no baseball caps, no jogging pants, sports shoes/ running shoe, sandals must have a strap in the back. No Bermuda shorts."

My boyfriend and I dressed appropriately and had no problems getting in. The bar staff were so fun and so nice and the club has a great atmosphere PLUS a great patio area to sit in if you're a fool like me and wear heels you just bought to the club for the first time.

The only thing I would say the club COULD work on is consistency. We saw many people just wearing tank tops/ sports jerseys/ ball caps/ not what they had told us was dress code. I'm not sure if it's because these people paid for bottle service, or maybe because it was a Monday night but it would be helpful to have some consistency there. 

All in all ignore any reviews you read anywhere else. If you want to have some fun on Monday night in Montreal this is the place to be.

(Pics are from the patio!)
Back in mtl 2 weekends in a row. Came to boulevard last week had a crazy good night. This week part 2. Hope the cute girl at the coat check is there. What a great service
Great club. Really good service and hope to come back. And the bartender ashkan was really nice

great ambiance and the service was super fast! i was at the same bar the whole night with a bartender called Cerine...WOW. she made the greatest cocktails and she was entertaining all her clients until 3am! good job.

large and varied bar filled with charm and authenticity. Expertly proportioned drink to make it a feast for our taste buds, not to mention a pleasant and professional service by Cérine. Go ahead with your eyes closed.

formatted_address: 2560 Rue des Carrières, Montréal, QC H1Y 1M9, Canada
name: Pankeke

formatted_address: 8899 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2N 1M2, Canada
name: Brasserie Beauharnois

reviews.text: Very fast service. Food is average. But a good lunch option
The brasserie Is a grade placé tout eat & have a biere
Quick, good and frendly place. Recommenced!
Great experience. Very cheap food. Food is tasty, without being awesome. I usually come every week with the guys from work. Very fast and efficient service, we are in an out within 30 to 45 minutes
Good price and amazing staff very friendly..

formatted_address: 2175 Rue de la Montagne, Montréal, QC H3G 1Z8, Canada
name: Maison Cloakroom

reviews.text: Elegant and sleek experience. Welcomed at opening hours we were the only patrons for our first drink which made it feel like a private visit. The mixologist was incrediblely friendly, knowledgeable, and made our drinks to suit what my boyfriend and I were craving.

Very very nice speak easy. I love the mix of the bartenders. They always make me discover very interesting stuff. I love the fact that it’s next to the tailor shop. I go regularly and will keep going.

This sophisticated bar is my idea of heaven. The knowledgeable, friendly staff seek out your flavour profile and cocktail desires and then make you a drink based on what you’re feeling like. They so clearly care about their craft and about serving the best drink, every single time. The space itself is delightful, the music is excellent but quiet enough that you can easily chat with friends. It’s a small place and I can imagine it fills up to beyond capacity quite regularly, but we are old so we go to places early! I can’t recommend this place highly enough. And I can’t wait to go back on my next trip to this fabulous city!

We stumbled across this place (have fun finding your way in!) and had such an enjoyable time. We told the bartender what we liked and he made drinks that suited out individual palates. 

I highly recommend a visit!
The best drinks in town. Charming and cozy

formatted_address: 655 Grande Allée E, Québec, QC G1R 2K4, Canada
name: Bar L'Inox - Brasserie - Sports Bar - Craft Beer - Happy Hour

reviews.text:
Amazing! We understand this is the oldest microbrewery in the area and the beer was great. Service was warm and friendly. We went super casual and had the Deluxe European Hotdogs. 
Great food, great price. Sit, eat, enjoy and then keep walking and experience Quebec ♥️
A fun environment with unique hot dogs stuffed into baguette European style. The outdoor ice bar was a cool touch during the Carnival weekend.
Cool, hip brewery suitable for US tastes and atmosphere. Exceptional staff. Easy to drink, heavy and light beers. No complaints.

Great variety of in-house beer. The European hotdogs are a nice change versus the typical American style you'd find in Western Canada. The brettanomyces fermented and aged three melon ale is perfect for the beer nerd searching for something to expand both mind and pallet. Cheers, Inox!

If you are ever in Quebec city and need a pint definitely go here, the beer is amazing, thier sour IPA is the best I've ever had and the wait staff is some of the best if ever experienced, the dude made our stay that much better we even went back the next night and had even more fun as it was karaoke night and we had a blast.

formatted_address: 20 Rue Sainte-Anne, Québec, QC G1R 3X2, Canada
name: 1640 Bistro

reviews.text: Had a spontaneous trip to Quebec and went out for dinner with my wife. We had been on the road for a couple of days and had not been eating very good food, so we decided to treat ourselves. And boy was it worth it. The atmosphere was great with some casual live music. The food was amazing. I have stopped eating meat 15 years ago and only recently started trying some again in small quantities. Tried some of the wife's braised beef and it was incredible. All the dishes were full of flavour and well balanced. Thoroughly enjoyed the experience and although it wasn't cheap it was definitely not expensive, especially for the quality.

This quaint, cozy yet modern restaurant was a delightful opener for my family visiting Old Town Quebec! Although we don't drink, it seemed to have quite the array of fine wines supplemented with a simple non-exhaustive menu. All of this was complemented by professional and courteous staff. 

         We forgot to take photos of everything to our dismay, but the food was as much as delicious as the presentation. The price was fair for the location, menu and quality of food. Definitely recommended!
Came here for lunch when it was very cold and it was a great place to warm up. Not busy. Cosy and good service. Good value for money. Fish and chips were very good with a soup .

While touring through Old Quebec we chose this restaurant for last dinner before we returned to the US the next day. The meal we had certainly was worth the wait - our party of four have very eclectic tastes - and two of the party work as chefs in other establishments in Maine. We chose a selection of dishes that ended up representing French, Italian, and Western cuisine, and in each case, each of the meals was presented simultaneously and every dish was done exactly as ordered. The menu board, highlighting the specialties of the day were in the languages you'd expect, but also in Mandarin, to the delight of some of our party. All in all, a fitting meal in a marvelous place.

Had the set menu with french onion soup, pork chops and finished with creme brulee. Also added the fish and chips appetizer, sort of like 2 fish nuggets but very, very well done (good). There was live music which really set the the atmosphere; over all the experience was fantastic!!!

formatted_address: 403 Rue des Seigneurs, Montréal, QC H3J 1X7, Canada
name: Perles et Paddock

reviews.text: The set up for the wedding we attended was absolutely stunning. The restaurant is small but we did not feel stuffed in. The staff could use some fancy manners to go along with their fancy food, however. When you’re told someone is the brides sister - you should not be rude to anyone, but definitely not the wedding party.  I probably wouldn’t go here again because I don’t live in Montreal, but overall it was lovely.
One of the best in Montreal. Impeccable service. Beautiful venue. Delicious food & creative menu. A must in Griffintown
Excellent food! The atmosphere was great. The service was great. We were a group of 4 and let them pick out food and wine.... they rose above our expectations! Definitely a must try!

The place it’s gorgeous, great decoration and lovely. I’m giving 2 stars because: since we came in on a winter- sunny Sunday (it was not snowing) me and my friend right away, we were instructed to remove our winter boots and winter coats, we did it without an issue, although the rest of the people who came in were not instructed at all the same, in fact nothing was instructed to them. Therefore every time we needed to get up to the bathroom our feet got wet. We tried to put on our boots and the eye look we got from the same staff members was not very pleasant. 
Perhaps the rules can be applicable for everyone.

One of my favourite restaurant's in Griffintown. The decor is stunning, especially considering the building was a garage in it's past life. The decor alone makes this place one to check out.

The food for dinner was excellent, although I did find that it was very pricey for the quantity of food you get (hence 4 stars). I love their seafood options.

An other bright spot for Perles is their cocktail menu which I found to be excellent, with strong drinks.

Service was solid, and what you'd expect for this price point.

formatted_address: 8818 Boulevard Saint-Michel, Montréal, QC H1Z 3G2, Canada
name: Cafe Sins

reviews.text: This bar is super fun i hosted one of my birthday party's there and the owner was so sweet. Great food great atmosphere i would definitely go back there. Super clean bar the people are out of this world sweet they knew exactly how to make my party a memorable one. Thanks again you guys
Cleanest bar in the area! Good variety of drinks and have multiple screens to watch sports. Great during the world cup and playoffs! Good vibe too.
Great cappuccino and coffee ; you can watch 3 games at any one time
good place
Super

formatted_address: 6388 Rue St-Hubert, Montréal, QC H2S 2M2, Canada
name: Last Call Irish Pub

formatted_address: 998 Boul St-Laurent 6th floor, Montréal, QC H2Z 9Y9, Canada
name: Restaurant Impérial

reviews.text: Very authentic restaurant with great seating! Great for large gatherings. The food was delicious and the staff is super friendly. I would come here again if in the area!

This place is great for Sunday dim sum. We came later in the afternoon around 1:30 and they were still open and still had some selection. Very tasty and affordable. Highly recommend a visit and trying all of the dishes. The best part about dim sum is that the dishes are small enough that you can order a bunch to try but large enough for sharing

Meh. I rarely give places low ratings but this one deserves a 2 star... we went in during lunch hours and they were kind of busy but not fully packed. The girl in the front desk didn’t greet us and unhappily placed us in our table. Food was either cold greasy or can’t compare to other dim sum places that I’ve bad. The ladies pushing dim sum carts around were very nice though.

Food was average level in the town. Their service was good if you’re speaking Cantonese or a repeating customer( this is what I observed) . Very cold atmosphere and you won’t feel be welcomed.  When we checked out at cash, the lady even did not speak a single word,  just passing the machine to us after she put  into the amount . NOT A SINGLE WORD! No communication at all.  Not a enjoyable dim sum at all.

Fully accessible place! This is my highlight in Chinatown. I made the 'mistake' to ask a la carte instead of Dim sum....but next time will try it! Good ratio price versus quality, lot of room , not noisy.  Service very efficient and quick . No dessert.  Would definitely recommend!

formatted_address: 191 Rue Saint-Paul O, Montréal, QC H2Y 1Z5, Canada
name: Santos

reviews.text: The ambiance is nice. The bartender are super nice. The food is super delicious but the portions are very small. Thats the down of it but its still amazingly good. Also, since its a very popular place if you make reservations make sure you're there on time because you WILL loose your table. If you plan on going out have fun, go ahead don't hesitate cause its worth it! Plus, at night it turn into a club! Enjoy!

Great atmosphere, outstanding service.  Only down was the tacos.  Kinda dry and over cooked tortillas.  That could be a question of personal preference.  The Calmar was really good, we ordered a second serving.

It's a nice place for tapas and drinks - the cheese board is fabulous, but some of the tapas are pretty small for the price. Later in the night, the music gets pretty loud, so be aware of what you're in for! Nice and cozy for a few drinks though.

They have a great Cocktail Menu. We only went for drinks. It's a very cool atmosphere. Great music. I was excited that they gave me a Maple leaf cookie with my drink! Craft cocktails are a little pricey though.

I went to Wednesday night tacos and sangria and Latino music for my birthday. It's nice we got the booth for our reservation, they kicked people out so that we could sit! We hadn't received the Wednesday menu upon arrival and I had to tell it to my guests. But afterwards the service was good, we were able to get tacos at 5$each. We were sad the lamb tacos were absent though, that would have been yummy. The shrimp tacos were awesome, and the sangria was awesome too- Spain style, filled to the brim!! I loved the Latino music, but it was broken with some hip hop or pop, which I'm not here to listen to, and I would have loved a mini dance floor, but we left before 10pm :) too bad the lighting was terrible for our pictures!

formatted_address: 24-1750 Rue du Périgord, Québec, QC G1G 6N1, Canada
name: Brasserie Maltco

reviews.text: Best brewers in town
Super bières à un prix très compétitif pour de la bière de micro , surtout sur place, vous sauverez beaucoup !  J'ai adoré la Neipa ainsi que la Irish red ale!
J'ai acheté leur bière (la tannante et la sacripante) dans un IGA et elles sont super bonnes je recommande!!

formatted_address: 6389 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2S 3C3, Canada
name: Pastaga

reviews.text:
Was wandering near Little Italy and Mile End  and stumbled upon this neat little restaurant/wine bar.  As a person from Toronto, eating Quebecois fare was a priority.  The service and passion of the staff, swayed me to their specialty dishes cauliflower with vadouvan and maple glazed pork belly on carrot pancake - OMG!  Fantastic taste and uniqueness!  They suggested 2 large apps to make it a meal and advice taken.  Reasonable prices as well. No room for dessert though. Will try other dishes later this week. 

Thumbs up if you found this helpful 😀
A nice French inspired restaurant with a good selection of natural wines. Friendly staff. The food was fine, but lacked any wow effect.

One of the best meals I've ever had. Period. Service was perfect,  the wine pairings brought out the best of the wine and the food. So many perfect bites. I wish I lived here,  it was such an incredible dining experience.
Super nice staff, the food is very well made, and beautifully designed.
Top top quality. Truly chef level stuff at good prices. The poutine was one of the most interesting takes on this dish. Had the salmon as well - top flavour. Highly recommended.

formatted_address: 3277, av des Églises, Charny, QC G6X 1W2, Canada
name: Bar Billard Regi

reviews.text: Meilleur bar de karaoké en ville!
Tranquille et sympa
Parfait pour le Karaoke du vendredi soir entre 22h et 3h am. Pas chic chic, mais bien amical comme endroit!
le meilleur sur la rive sud de quebec
Oui j'ai jouer aux d'art

formatted_address: 410 Rue Saint-Pierre, Montréal, QC H2Y 1Y3, Canada
name: Pub Saint Pierre

reviews.text: Located in the heart of old Montreal, this place is a great spot to grab drinks after a meal. It is a modern style pub with a decent beer selection. Not much room to stand as it is more of a sit down style of place. You will need to order food with your drinks, but when a pub serves an absolute boss of a chocolate chip cookie with ice cream, that is absolutely not a problem.

Good. A fine example of a specific kind of restaurant. It can be delicious food with excellent staff service. The vibe is pleasant. You may think about coming again if you wish to taste a particular kind of cuisine.

The barman was hilarious, so funny, walking and dancing around! Such a great ambiance!

The girl who took my order made a mistake thought and I didn't really liked my Pad Thai. 

The steak we ordered was great though! As you can see in the picture. 

Price with 2 🍻 : 88$
Great happy hour deals. Even during weekends! Servers are really friendly. Fresh oyster and great beer selections on tap.
Happy hour specials $2 oysters: yes please! So good!!! Pad Thai was excellent! Great service too!

formatted_address: 1231 Rue Sainte-Catherine O Second Floor, Montréal, QC H3G 1P5, Canada
name: Esports Central Gaming Complex

reviews.text: Beautiful ambiance with gaming experience from PC to VIRTUAL game online. Bartender Bruno was very sociable and professional. You have Zombie Games, light saber game, racing car games, etc. Very clean place and clubbish atmosphere with chill music ambiance. Excellent for burthday party or any type of celebration. Price varies depending on what type of game you want to play. I play  15 min of VR killing zombies and that cost 20$ which was also plenty of fun. However be careful as you may get dizzy and sweaty. I recommend to "not drink alcohool" before playing  VR as I felt like throwing up after 10 intense minutes of game play. Drink water or juice. Play, then drink alcohool. Just a suggestion. 5 stars for great ambiance and customer service from all staff.
Awesome place. Really enjoyed my time here. Fair prices. Great equipment. Helpful staff. This is what any gaming lounge should aim for.

All though the name can be misleading, this place is basically a fusion between a PC arcade and a bar. Its an awesome place to have a get together. 
+ Atmosphere is fantastic, these people really care and it shows.
+ The chairs are nice (actual "gamer" chairs at the tables) and have a lot of couches.
+ The staff is really nice and overall great people.
- Food and rates are a tad pricey for students but its free to get in so its not like everyone has to pay to have a good time. 

Outstanding place, i wish i get the opportunity to come again soon!
Love the vibe there. Great staff and top notch equipment. Would recommend this place to anyone in the area to checkout and hangout.

Esports Central is a place best experienced when playing on their superb gaming PCs with a group of friends after having a few drinks at the bar. Chill vibes, great and super helpful staff make it an awesome place to go for a few late night games, to kill time before catching a movie or simply to have a good time. 

With a wide variety of activities, everyone of all ages is guaranteed to find some good virtual fun. A must go if you’re in the area.

formatted_address: 3685 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2X 2V5, Canada
name: Dirty Dogs

reviews.text:
Same as their small location from before but now much better with the added table space. A great place to have a meal with friends.

Service is very fast and super friendly. They don't have regular ice tea on the menu but the server offered to make me a homemade one that didn't have any alcohol in it. 

The food is also well presented, much more restaurant friendly. 

I will say the the poutine mac and cheese is not as fun as the hot dog mac and cheese. I LOVE mac and cheese and the taste was just a bit lost with the poutine gravy. It still tasted good but I wish they had a mac and cheese option!! It's so good there. Next time I'll try the burger :)

Had a mixed experience. Went last night and it was fairly quiet. There were two servers and initial service to order was pretty slow as they were behind the bar chatting for some time.

I came with my partner as he wanted a bite to eat and I only wanted dessert as I'd already had dinner. I ordered the brownie and was told there were none and there actually wasn't any dessert and there hadn't been any for a few weeks. Ended up getting a milkshake instead which tasted good but the straw was so thin that it was a workout to actually drink the milkshake.

My partner's sausage was good, half the fries weren't hot though however. He did mentioned that he enjoyed the Dirty Dog beer though which is nice.

Overall atmosphere was good but food and service were just okay.
I loved this place. Beer was extremely cold and i liked it. I had hot dog with pulled pork it was sooo good. I will defenatly come back.

I had to stop at this spot just off the name alone lol. ordered the poutine with fried chicken and substituted the waffle for red peppers. This meal was great!! Service was top notch and they explain everything on the menu thoroughly. I didn't order a drink, but the ones my friends ordered we're pretty large. I'd recommend this place for a quick bite.

The only reason why my rating is 4 stars is because the bathrooms were not up to standard. Missing soap and proper hand drying. If people who prepare my food cannot wash their hands properly it makes me squimish. Other than that, great music, yummy foods (take the bbq sauce on the side) and decent price. Service was happy go lucky and welcoming.

formatted_address: 5430 Rue de Caen, Québec, QC G1P 4K9, Canada
name: AMAQ Productions événementielles

reviews.text: Amaq avait fait le mariage de ma soeur en juin 2017. J'avais très bien aimé la soirée. Je les ai tellement aimés que je l'ai choisi pour mon mariage le 4 Janvier dernier. Encore la tout était magique et magnifique. Maxime (mon mari) m'a dit qui va les reprendre pour sa soirée karaoké du bureau. À bientôt!

Ma mère a appellé pour mon party de 18 ans c'était malade! Il avait toutes les chansons sur les quelles on voulait danser en plus que l'animation était super et l'éclairage WOW! On a même fait du karaoké. Merci pour tout! Je les recommande vraiment.

Très bon service, super amical et excellent animateur.
J'ai même eu droit à un T-Shirt à l'effigie d'AMAQ que je porte fièrement.
Offres un excellent services et l’équipement étais A1 !

formatted_address: 6862 Rue Jarry E, Saint-Léonard, QC H1P 1W7, Canada
name: La Station des Sports

reviews.text: Been coming here for years. Great TV set up and sound. Service was okay. The food quality however has gone down substantially. I don't even wish the calamari on my enemy, I could not  finish my burger. 5 friends at my table and we all thought the same thing..terrible food. Please bring it back to its former glory. I won't be coming back for awhile atleast.
3.5* ...Plenty of screens... actually there is screens everywhere. The place is fairly big. Good for big events. However the food is barely ok.. and not enough vegetarian options!
Great place to enjoy with friends. Good for wacthing sports game on TV. Price are good and also meal have a good taste
This restaurant is a nightmare. Horrible service with a bunch of classless people.  Will definitely never go back.
Amazing place, very good vibe, food and drinks! I definitely recommend.

formatted_address: 1255, rue Jeanne-Mance Niveau 6, Montréal, QC H5B 1E5, Canada
name: SIX Resto Lounge

reviews.text: I really, REALLY enjoyed the vibe of this place. I love their modern, hip design, and that they're actually standing out from all those elegant chic but non memorable type restaurants (and hotels, as it's attached to the DoubleTree). The food was delish and fresh, the place was clean, there was background music for ambiance, but not too loud, and the waitress was really kind. I would come back here anytime I visit Montreal again.
Such a beautiful and relaxed atmosphere. Drinks and food are good. Great place for a sexy date night or girls night out🖒
Beautiful place! Upscale and quite! Don’t hesitate for a second!
My fiancé and I got the filet Mongin, duck confit, French onion soup, and cheesecake and I loved absolutely everything we had. Definitely a must to come here!
Nice spot for drinks

formatted_address: 1165 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2X 2S6, Canada
name: Z Tapas Lounge

reviews.text:
Ambiance is good, tapas with latin american influence. All in all, some dishes were awesome and tasteful and some others were less impressive. Everything's good, just some dishes are less outstanding. 
Coup de coeurs goes to : filet mignon with maple syrup. It loose a point for the following reasons : uneven tastes among the dish, sangria too sweet and not enough alcool, a tad too relax service even if they were very kind and courtois. Bref, a hundred dollars later for two, yes its good and yes its great but I am hesitating a bit where in that price range there is many options available.
Great for a bite! Loved the decor. Good wine selection as well.
Delicious and creative small plates, great place for a 5 à 7. Please bring back the plantain tart on your permanent menu.
Good services.  Food was good but a bit too salty.

Well.. 
Isn't tapas supposed to be bite sized 

Quite a nice decor. It's beautiful and cozy. 
The evening started with a tartare duo (duck and salmon) the duck on being way more refined. This alone was quite the copious entree. Next was a sopa de tortilla which was tasty but the avocado in it didn't quite work. Then was a croquette de bacalao and empanada picadillo. Again way better one (empanada) than the other. 
The next plate was a risotto. I was not as pleased as the rest. The risotto was grainy and hard.
Main plate was duck with beets and hazelnuts. The amarillo and feta mousse as accompagnement was fantastic But the duck was undercooked and quite greassy. 
The dessert was a good comeback with the delicious tres leche cake and creme brulee served on big plates.

formatted_address: 7077 Blvd. Newman, LaSalle, QC H8N 1X1, Canada
name: Compras

formatted_address: 387 Boulevard Armand-Paris, Québec, QC G1C 7T2, Canada
name: Pub Resto Broue

reviews.text: Correct
Good service

Le service est rapide et les déjeuners sont servis rapidement, idéal lorsque tu vas au travail après.

La demoiselle m'a servi avec un sourire attentionné, et les clients autour semblait être des habitués de place et le plaisir d être ensemble semblait évident.

J'y vient de temps en temps et je ne suis jamais déçu.
Super ambiance pour nos retrouvailkes du secondaires. Personnel génial, participe à l'ambiance général sur place.
C'était bon

formatted_address: 4155 Chemin de la Plage Jacques Cartier, Québec, QC G1Y 1W3, Canada
name: Quai 1635

reviews.text: Fabulous little spot right on the Seaway. Great beers, service and friendly locals. Don't miss the walk down the Seaway. Very cute old homes well maintained. Some cool looking B&Bs as well.
Great discovery with Mtarégion.  The lobster roll was one of the best I've ever had.

Good fod with a good view.
The menu is very sober but still very enjoyable.
I really had a good time there.
Great beers on tap, really good nachos, gravlax, great atmosphere by the river in general!!!
Nice place to have a drink and look at the St-Laurent river.

formatted_address: 1220 Rue de l'Union, Sainte-Catherine, QC J5C 1B3, Canada
name: Resto-Bar Le Petit Forum

reviews.text: great bar

Ce n'est pas l'endroit que je recommande pour une soirée festive. 
Quelques machine â  sous .Serveuse sympathiques...
Service exeptionelle et le prêt à manger es toujours frais
Le pool gratuit c'est plaisant
Place paisible ..bon choix de repas

formatted_address: 575 Boulevard Wilfrid-Hamel, Québec, QC G1M 2T2, Canada
name: BALLROOM COUNTRY

reviews.text: Really nice Country bar with free line dancing lessons on key nights. Lunch time really quick and reasonably priced.
Oh yeah

Pretty impress by the place!!! Suggest to everybody who wants to enjoy a meal with friends and also a couple of beers 😎

We also enjoy the fact that we could chill with real cowgirls and that kinda rare in this city.

Very nice vg burger by the way

Staff was very courteous and helpful....food was very good....the ambience was Like any other place (I have vision issues) but atmosphere in general was very good. We were at the Bar and the manager told us about some of the upcoming changes.

 Looking forward to that......we are going there this summer again for sure !!

Very crowded (too much) there aren't enough space for all the people they let in. Music is way too loud so don't go there if you want to have a talk with someone or if you want to have a group party.
There is like three or four hangers for coats, so it's very upsetting during winter.
The lack of place force you to put your bag on the floor.
This is a bar with country music and line dancing. If you're into that, it's a place to go but leave your bag/coat in your car.
This place isn't easily accessible by public transport. There is ample parking, though.

formatted_address: 1886 Rue Notre-Dame Ouest, Montréal, QC H3J 1M6, Canada
name: Le Boucan Smokehouse

reviews.text: The atmosphere was great and cozy. The food was delicious, especially the 5 napkins burger and the wing are to die for. Fries are crispy and BBQ sauce is slightly spicy to perfection! And the buttermilk pie is awesome! Staff is really nice and the service is great. 1 con: The rose wine wasn’t that good and the place is supra tiny, you’ll feel the cold breeze each time someone comes in or leaves the restaurant. Overall, it’s a great place to enjoy delicious bbq!

Holy mother of delicious foods in my belly. Welcome to Yummy town. This place is the bomb! Been going there for years. The service is really excellent, it's refreshing. You have to try their 5 napkins burger. I always go back to it. You will need 5 or more napkins. The meat is perfectly cooked and smoked, along with the smoked bacon, the smoked cheese, etc. Their wings are also super good (try their habanero sauce if you like spicy things). Overall, great place, have gone many times and will go back again. Call to make a reservation first! 👍👌

This family owned place just knows how to make comfort food right. They have super simple menu but amazing tasty dishes. Their pit master certainly knows whats going on. The staff are super friendly and fun. Its a small place so make sure you show up early for your weekend night out as this place gets packed very quickly. Try their Ribs and also dont forget their super delicious desserts.
Great food and service. Plus a nice selection of beers and cocktails.

cozy little BBQ joint, with crispy fries and great sized servings. The smoked chicken was super tender and delicious, the poutine with pulled pork was massive and amazing. they seem to have a good selection of whiskeys and some nice beers. price was good for the amount of food. would go again!

formatted_address: 196 Rue Fleury O, Montréal, QC H3L 1T5, Canada
name: Les Cavistes | Bistro Bar à vin Boutique

html_attributions: Les Cavistes | Bistro Bar à vin Boutique
Les Cavistes | Bistro Bar à vin Boutique
Les Cavistes | Bistro Bar à vin Boutique
Les Cavistes | Bistro Bar à vin Boutique
Les Cavistes | Bistro Bar à vin Boutique
Les Cavistes | Bistro Bar à vin Boutique

reviews.text: Very nice and very well decorated restaurant. The beef tartar was great followed by an amazing steak. The waitress that served us as equally as amazing. My partner did not enjoy her meals as much as I did, she took the rabbit pasta. My special dessert which consists of oysters and martini was also above average!
Really great experience here. The staff were helpful with food allergies and the quality of food was on point! The food was delicious and the staff were awesome.  Great all around.

This place is a bit out of the way of you are in Montreal for a weekend. However it is a great place to hang and worth the detour. Great place, service  food and drinks. The menu was diverse and the food tasted amazing. It is a fun area to be I  too. Backeries and coffee shops before dinner and an amazing cocktail bar after.

Visited this restaurant for the first time on 07 July 2019. Offers a very good menu and extensive wine list. Entree & main course were good quality, but dessert was the best course. The service is really excellent, and the outside terrace is a lovely place to enjoy dinner. Highly recommended, I'll definitely be back.
Excellent service and food

formatted_address: 401 Rue Notre-Dame Ouest, Montréal, QC H2Y 1V2, Canada
name: Somwhr Liquor Lounge

reviews.text: Small club and always packed with a younger crowd. The staff is what makes this place even better! They really try their best to impress their clients.

BAD MANAGING. they let only bootle service reservation however, its midnight and people on guestlist manage to show up on time and they prioritize table reservation that DONT arrive on time. BAD priorities DONT ENCOURAGE AT ALL. BAD SERVICE, BAD ENERGY FROM THE STAFF.
Great music, staff is awesome and the service is excellent! I highly recommend this venue
Amazing club, the vibe is amazing, music is great. The staff is very friendly and professional!! Thank you Somwhr
Make a reservation in advance for the best service. DONT TOUCH THE ROPES

formatted_address: 4559 Rue Wellington, Verdun, QC H4G 1W8, Canada
name: Honi Honi

reviews.text: I often take my friends to this place with my highest recommendations. I  go to this restaurant often. I get very good feedback from my friends. The the food there is tasty and the crew is welcoming and cooperative. Whenever we visit this place we have a delightful evening.  I warmly recommend this restaurant.

Salmon was fresh and tasty. Rice was a bit dry and couldve used a bit more flavor and moisture. Good quantity for the price. Would not go all the way to Verdun for this but would go again if I am in the area and friends wanted to try.

I've been to this restaurant a few times, and I consider their poke one of the best in Montreal. They also have a good price, between 15-20 dollars per bowl (and the bowls are very well served!) depending on your choice of protein. You can create your own bowl, which is a really positive point in my opinion. The service is usually good, but last time I had to ask for the check 2 times, and I end up to the cashier because they were taking to long to bring it to the table. At this point they told me that they were having trouble with the checks, but they could have told me that before (instead of waiting for me to ask for the third time).
Ordered from here today and the food tasted like mold ... totally overpriced, 46$ for two polé bowls. Do not recommend this restaurant, terribly disappointed!
Great food. Amazing staff. Willing to help us with translating the menu. Very understanding and able to help, even with my extensive allergies.

formatted_address: 5555 Av de Monkland, Montréal, QC H4A 1E1, Canada
name: Monkland Taverne

reviews.text: One of Montreal's best kept secrets. Incredible, warm and friendly staff, a very talented chef, amazing bartender and great music. Take the time to discover this gem of a restaurant in the Monkland village.

Very nice place!! The ambiance is cozy and classy. We received an excellent service. They were very accommodating given the fact we came with a wheelchair. (A client was very annoyed and complained to the poor waiter because he was too close of the wheelchair) but the waiter never put pressure on us. The food was perfectly cooked and served hot. We had the shrimp and a  beef plate. Desserts are excellent too ( the cookie is a very comforting dessert you will want to hug). 
This is fully accessible! So rare in this area so enjoy!!
Can't wait to go back this summer!

The experience at Monkland Taverne is always delightful. The food is carefully prepared and the service is very helpful. The only caveat is getting a table: the restaurant does not offer reservations and the wait times can vary significantly depending on how busy it gets. Given the size of the place and the limited tables, this can be an issue.

The wait staff was knowledgeable of their menu and very friendly. The ambiance was nice and the music was at a level that permitted conversation at a normal volume (on a Tuesday at least). The mackerel and delicata squash cavatelli were both very good.
Food is always good. Portions however are getting smaller, so it can end up being a pricey meal.

formatted_address: 1525 Rue Sheppard, Québec, QC G1S 1K1, Canada
name: Restaurant Saint-Germain Resto-Bar

reviews.text: Restaurant has been established in Quebec for about fifty years. You can eat everything and drink wine or beer while eating. Nothing fast food. Traditional restoration. You can eat alone or in a group on reservation. There is a separate section where there is a bar. Good restaurant, awkward home for us for example, it seemed that we bothered the hostess, it is finally a waitress who came to pick us up. Very clean, courteous and attentive staff. Delicious food at affordable prices. No fla fla, the administration is oriented towards customer satisfaction!
The service was great but the food (went for breakfast) was king of ordinary. Still the price was good for what we had.
excellent family restaurant with choices for all.

Excellent food, reasonably priced. Service left us a bit disappointed however, it took a long time (the restaurant wasn't particularly packed) and half our group was served 5-7 minutes ahead of the rest. I'd still go back for the amazing food.
I had the best crape ever! This is  nice place to get breakfast lots of space for big groups and still able to make you feel like your at home.

formatted_address: 1680 Rue Saint-Denis, Montréal, QC H2X 3K6, Canada
name: Le Saint-Sulpice

reviews.text: Really great place overall I have a few issues though. The upper level wasn't open for one the bathroom is mess.Also the bar service was slow. But it was very reasonably priced so still had a good time!!

Cheap drinks, laid back staff, good tunes, decent amount of television, and karaoke upstairs. Plus in the summer there's a great patio. Not the best place for a date but a night out with a larger group will always find space here.

By far the thing that recommends this place is the huge terrace in the back. Also the drinks are generally not expensive. However, if you're looking for good food or interesting, well made cocktails, this really isn't the place for you. Definitely check it out if you're a student on a budget or if you want to meet a large group of friends and hang out outside, just don't expect anything special food or drink wise.
Price of alcohol and snacks is good. The terrasse is amazing. But huge lack of staff for a busy hours. And i saw a waiter throwing the rest of some beer in the fountain....
The terrasse is very nice in the summer. Drinks are budget-friendly. Very casual vibe overall.

formatted_address: 1323 Boulevard de la Concorde O, Laval, QC H7N 5Y4, Canada
name: Resto-Bar 1323

reviews.text: SAKO is a chef everybody knows in the neighborhood cause the food is great. Great staff been eating there for 2 years and never had a problem keep going guys. 6 stars for me...😋😋😋😋
Good service
RIP Patio Vidal.

Diner :
bonne qualité prix raisonnable service attentionnée et serveuse souriante.....:
Actuellement bein merci

formatted_address: 1600 Rue Robinson, Laval, QC H7W 2W4, Canada
name: Le Coloc

reviews.text: Great music, good food and great staff. Nice place to have a meal and dance all night. Music has a nice variety for all taste.
Nice place to eat and dance.
I did not like the place or there servace

Great place.  Food was great, fast service, waiters was super friendly.  Everything inside was perfect.  The reason for 4 stars is the outside was dirty with cig butts.  If im in the area again, ill go back.
Little hidden gen..Great music !

formatted_address: 997 Rue Saint-Jacques #1, Montréal, QC H3C 1G6, Canada
name: Nova MTL

formatted_address: 2088 Rue Montcalm, Saint-Hubert, QC J4T 2E2, Canada
name: Bistro Des Bières Belges

reviews.text:
Holy beer! This place has a huge selection of it.

Went there with a couple of friends and we were not disappointed. Big menu with a lot of variety. It’s like a fusion of all the different flavours in the world. 

Service was good and prices were reasonable.
The restaurant isn’t situated on a main street, but isn’t far from one. The available parking spaces are very limited, but there’s always space in the streets nearby, so not a deal breaker.

Looking forward to the next time!

I love variety and this place has lots of it. Belgian, European and local beers, lots of choices of main dishes, being mussels their specialty. I tried to take pictures of each plate but I forgot once the mussels came :p They were warm, juicy and really tasty. Cozy decor and excellent service. I will go back to try the other dishes.
Great food and great beer. Small and cozy restaurant. Prices are about what you'd expect and portions were good.

Been going for years, this place is amazing. Great staff and owner is very hands on really nice guy. I like that every time we go they have something new to try but they also keep the original yummy menu for those who don’t like change. Beer selection is incredible:-)
Very cozy place. There is a GREAT selection of beer! They have place for birthday party)

formatted_address: 1189 Rue de la Montagne, Montréal, QC H3G 1Z2, Canada
name: Ye Olde Orchard Pub and Grill

reviews.text:
Visited in 2017
Came here for a happy hour on a Wednesday and it was realllllllly empty. We got a pretty good corner table though so sweet! 

My boyfriend and I only came in to grab an entree and a drink before heading out to do some errands but the food was so good and the service so pleasant that we stayed all evening.

I initially ordered the Caesar salad as an entree and my boyfriend got the onion rings. I enjoyed my salad a lot, it was creamy and crunchy. I didn't like the croutons though but you can just skip those and just eat the salad. The onion rings were good too but I felt they were too soft, I like onion rings really crispy. My boyfriend doesn't so he loved them. He ordered another batch and we got the pound of chicken wings to share and replaced the fries with a side of salad (I wanted more!). We got the wings with the honey garlic sauce. They weren't too spicy but they were a bit too sour for me which was weird. The chicken was really good though so I just scrapped off the sauce. 

I really liked it here, prices were very decent and the server that we had was so nice! I had a great time here and I know I would come again!

The beer for happy hour was 6$ for a pint I believe. The salad as an entree is 6$, onion rings 7$, pound of chicken wings 18$.

I visited Ye Olde Orchard to do a paint nite and we decided to eat dinner there beforehand. We both ordered the stout braised beef and it was DELICIOUS! It was the most tender piece of beef I've ever eaten and the stout sauce made it very savory and moist. It was served with vegetables and mashed potatoes which were also yummy. 

Aside from that, the staff was friendly and attentive and the men wear kilts! I thought that was a nice touch.

I will definitely visit again and I highly recommend it.

The food is good and the beer is better. I might have to think twice before ordering any of the cocktails on the menu next time, though. The ones I tried I do not recommend.

Edit in response to reply: unfortunately I am far from being an expert on mixed drinks. I can tell you when something is too strong or doesn't taste good or is great. But I cannot make suggestions for a menu. Your margarita would probably taste better with a little less alcohol. And the olde fashioned could do with a tad less flavouring. But past that I don't think I can be of any use to you. Thanks for a memorable evening

Looks like nothing from the outside but big and somehow also cozy, play classic rock you want to sing along to, exactly the menu you want from an Irish pub, reasonably priced and friendly staff. Great tap selection and live music after 10 today (Saturday). It feels like home.

Went for a late lunch on the early Saturday afternoon. Only two other patrons. I ordered the braised beef and it came with mixed vegetables and mashed potatoes. It was perfectly cooked, very tender, tasty gravy, and very filling. I would recommend it. The waiters were great. I can think of nothing to improve. Great job 👍.

formatted_address: 5322 Chemin Queen Mary, Montréal, QC H3X 1T7, Canada
name: Chops Resto Bar

reviews.text: Food was good. But the peanut butter dumpling was cool for $10 I expect the food to be hot. And on the menu it says grill salmon but when I got my plate it looked like it was pan seared still very good. I had roasted vegetables with it.  I think the plate would've been complete with one even a small scoop of rice but this is a suggestion. Would I go back?  Definitely.

Definitely had a great time, waiter was great, nice variety on the menu, good food, nice portions & awesome drinks

I will say though that this was a while back I would definitely go back.

Over priced for nothing special. Maybe the other options would have been better but 68$ for beef ribs before tax was a no for me. The drinks were good for 2 meals and one drink the bill was over a hundred. I also found it weird when I asked if I can bring a birthday cake I was told yes but they would charge me $5 per person who ever had a slice money-hungry much?! I ended up getting their lemon cake and I wasn't a fan of that either.
Steak I ordered wasn't really good, under seasoned and not tender. The place is way overpriced for the quality of food that they offer. Servers were friendly thou
Amazing place to eat, a drop expensive, but worth the money.

formatted_address: 1206 Avenue Union, Montréal, QC H3B 3A7, Canada
name: Escondite Union

reviews.text:
I was craving American style Mexican food and Escondite seemed to be my best option! The small restaurant was hosting a lot of larger parties which made for a fun vibe.
The guacamole portion was quite small (especially at a Mexican resto!) and the chips were not like a classic tortilla chip. It tasted fine but I was a little surprised by it. Overall the food was decadent and tasty. 
The pricing was very appropriate which is always nice.

Great Mexican restaurant right downtown.
Serving authentic tasting food and innovative and fun cocktails based off classics. I'd say it's slightly more expensive than your average taco joint but it's also a much nicer atmosphere, great service and way better drinks than average.
I'd definitely come back and also try out any one of the other restaurants in the same group.

Justin was absolutely fantastic - made our night much more memorable and really made an effort to ensure we were comfortable and had a great experience. The blood orange margarita was awesome and the food was equally terrific! The wings were delightfully better than expected and I expected them to be delicious! The tuna tacos weren’t a favourite but the sirloin, fish, cauliflower ones were excellent. The guac and cornbread was also very tasty. Most definitely will return and highly recommend this spot!

Absolutely delicious tapas and drinks! I wanted to go there for so long and I'm very happy I got to go tonight! We had the most amazing drinks and ordered the nachos, cornbread, shrimp tacos and churros. Everything was delicious and the staff was so lovely and kind! Thank you for a wonderful evening ❤️!

Food and service was great but it is EXTREMELY overprices. 90$+ for two people and we were still hungry. I would come back if the food was cheaper or bigger portions (even if this is tapas) because it really tasted good.

formatted_address: 2160 Rue Bishop, Montréal, QC H3G 2E9, Canada
name: ECA Concordia B-Annex

reviews.text: Great place for engineering students to meet other students
Theres is little to no ac in the club rooms so it's a sauna if you dont have a window like the CSCE's room
The concordia toboggan team is cool
Great place to relax and study!
love it.

formatted_address: 1450 Boulevard Père-Lelièvre, Québec, QC G1M 1N9, Canada
name: Pizza Passion Duberger

reviews.text: Restaurant with beautiful decor, comfortable and warm. The service is perfect and the staff is welcoming, professional and cheerful! The pizzas are excellent and the lasagna is fabulous. With very generous portions and good homemade fries! I recently discovered the lunch option at Pizza Passion. There were many options and the prices were reasonable. It's been several months since I came to lunch for the first time at Pizza Passion. The service is always attentive, the food is good and the prices are fair. Well done! I'll be back.

Seems like an average place, but don't  be fooled, food is really good. My husband and I ordered a pizza, and honestly  it was waaay better than we expected. It was a great discovery, and now is our favorite pizza place. Totally recommended.

Amazing little restaurant, the ambiance is relax, the service is fast, the employees are cheerful and friendly and the food is so good ! The prices are low, they offer a small variety of popular beers, they have a mini bar so you can get drinks if thats your thing. The bathrooms are very clean, the restaurant itself is very pretty, well decorated and the lighting is good !- IT IS NOT WHEELCHAIR ACCESSIBLE- they accept credit cards, debit cards and cash. You should try their pizza, very delicious everytime.
Value for money, it's great. I recommend it!
Another overpriced place with expensive employees and cheap products (no way that was actually Coca Cola.. it tasted like cheap noname )

formatted_address: 6548 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2S 3C6, Canada
name: Melrose Resto

reviews.text: Melrose is the definition of party atmosphere, whether they are hosting an event or it's a simple night out. Food is excellent, drinks are on point and staff is the absolute best. Always welcoming and so generous. Highly recommended!

Excellent food, and service. Service was top! Food was very good, fresh, and very tasty. Cozy, cute place. Not a negative thing to say. I was pleasantly surprised, exceeded my expectations. Loved the christmas decorations.

Delicious food!! Great staff and great service!! 
I really definitely go back!!

Exceptional food and service staff are all very welcoming and professional our waitress jordan went out her way to make sure that we were well accommodating and patient. Atmosphere is very cozy as well. Would definitely recommend and will be going back in the future.
It is a cozy place. The food is amazing and the staff is awesome!!! The owner, is a fantastic person. Way to go!

formatted_address: 8500 Bd Henri-Bourassa, Charlesbourg, QC G1G 5X1, Canada
name: Brasserie Le Grand Bourg Inc

reviews.text: Good old-fashioned Quebec style brasserie style with good menu choices that have all the dishes from the day. Reasonably priced and good super friendly service. 43 years in business, still going strong even if it is one of the last of this kind. Worth a detour.
Delicious food at a reasonable price and friendly staff :) I loved it
Amazing food, great service  and affordable prices

Good food and good service. Target customers are baby-boomers just from the look of the place and especially the bathroom. You have got to visit the bathroom if you go there! You feel like entering a shrine or a spa, surprising experience to say the least...
Nice place to eat with friends

formatted_address: 975 Romeo-Vachon, Bureau 481, Dorval, QC H4S 2A5, Canada
name: Urban crave

reviews.text:
Over all good. But it can be allot better. 
Service: it was good service.
Location: Great
Food: The Montreal smoked meet sandwich was surprise. From the picture and from what I’ve experienced in the past, I expected at least twice the meet. The poutine was good. The gravy was not as salty and the cheese was fine. For the price and based on the picture, the only disappointment is with the sandwich. The first time ever I had it so skinny.

Got to the airport early for my Halifax Flight and decided to have brunch here with Adam. We both got the breakfast poutine which is eggs, potatoes, cheese, and gravy. The food was bland. It wasn't horrible but just meh. Also I don't think it was worth the price tag ($40 for both with tax and tip). You won't get many options in this terminal though as it is for Canada/US departures and it's pretty small. 

Service is ok, they are fast and the turn around after clients leave is swift so you won't have to wait long for a table. Obviously, if you have other options (brought lunch/wait it out/meal on the plane) take it and don't come here. But it's not horrible if you do go.
Great portion with fair price, the staff is quick and nice. Very satisfied!

Was not impressed.  I got tea in a mug that had coffee stains and when asked for a change, it was brought back with a mug that was chipped and black between the cracks.  A simple oatmeal breakfast was disappointing.  My sister's meal was over cooked and dry.
Feeding the inner child with tender chicken and chips! Mimosa is great, the staff is friendly!

formatted_address: 65 Rue De Buade, Québec, QC G1R 4A2, Canada
name: D'Orsay

html_attributions: Restaurant Pub D'Orsay Bar Vieux-Québec Beer Moules Mussels Steak Burgers poutine Vegetarian
Restaurant Pub D'Orsay Bar Vieux-Québec Beer Moules Mussels Steak Burgers poutine Vegetarian
Restaurant Pub D'Orsay Bar Vieux-Québec Beer Moules Mussels Steak Burgers poutine Vegetarian
Restaurant Pub D'Orsay Bar Vieux-Québec Beer Moules Mussels Steak Burgers poutine Vegetarian
Restaurant Pub D'Orsay Bar Vieux-Québec Beer Moules Mussels Steak Burgers poutine Vegetarian
Restaurant Pub D'Orsay Bar Vieux-Québec Beer Moules Mussels Steak Burgers poutine Vegetarian
Restaurant Pub D'Orsay Bar Vieux-Québec Beer Moules Mussels Steak Burgers poutine Vegetarian
Restaurant Pub D'Orsay Bar Vieux-Québec Beer Moules Mussels Steak Burgers poutine Vegetarian
Restaurant Pub D'Orsay Bar Vieux-Québec Beer Moules Mussels Steak Burgers poutine Vegetarian

reviews.text: We stopped in here for a late lunch/early dinner last June as we were traveling through the area during our 3 month tour of wonderful Canada. We couldn't have been more happy. Our server was attentive, courteous and friendly. We both went with D'Orsay Burgers. They were both juicy and well prepared. Our total bill came to $ 50 CAD ($ 36 USD). Highly recommend and would eat here again next time we are in the area.

This place was a great stop on my little trip to Quebec City. I started with a fantastic soup, and ended with the mussels. All I can say is WOW, I've never gotten a portion SO big in my life! Highly recommend. Will be back for sure when I'm in the city.

Great location, fantastic food, friendly staff, fair prices. Will absolutely visit again.
I strongly suggest you try their chowder. Holy moly, it was the best one I've ever had. Blows all other chowders out of the water.

You may have to wait for a bit when it's busy, and it's better to let them know when you are ready to order. Service is still professional and passionate. Traditional poutine is a recommendation, so is the beef tartar (almost excellent). Soups are generally well made with fresh ingredients. Burgers and pasta are both pretty good, but the steak needs to be improved for its quality and sizing. The steak may disappoint you. Btw, the fried chicken really tastes like Tongkatsu, which in fact is not bad at all.

We had an emergency as soon as we sat down and the staff were really accommodating with us switching everything to go, they asked if we knew where the hospital was and offered to help. The food was good even though it was cold by the time we got to try it at the hospital. will have to come back when things are better!

formatted_address: 2020h Boulevard des Laurentides, Vimont, QC H7M 2R4, Canada
name: MsH

formatted_address: 441 Rue du Parvis, Québec, QC G1K 9L6, Canada
name: Le Phoenix du Parvis

reviews.text: I found it overpriced - especially for the quality of the dishes. The service was friendly and quick which was nice. Looks like a nice place for a drink but if you are going for food just go elsewhere.
I ordered a poutine to lunch. The presentation and taste were interesting, specially the sauce. I will probably go back there.

Lovely place and lovely pub menu . Fantastic creative burger for burger week. Outdoor seating
Right Downtown in the lower town close to the touristic area. I highly recommend it
Good resto/pub for quebec, good foods... I like the mind of owner who want support nightlife of Quebec , unfortunately not enough work is done on that way...

Tasted their "Calypso" cocktail. Hell, I don't go out to drink often, but with something like that, it was worth going out ! Staff's really friendly, too. Haven't tasted the food yet, but if it's to the cocktails' level, it will be worth it

formatted_address: 555-721 Rue Deslauriers, Saint-Laurent, QC H4N 1W2, Canada
name: Instinct Fire HYDRANT

reviews.text: Merci

formatted_address: 998 Rue de l'Union, Sainte-Catherine, QC J5C 1B3, Canada
name: Bistro Ste 4

reviews.text: Nice

Oufff.. j'ai rentré la. Personne ne m'a regardé. La serveuse jouais au pocker dans le fond d'une salle. Un joueur de billard est venu nois servir et qui etait aussi bête que ses pieds. Sorti de là asser raide. ..
Client assez spécial 😅
Bonne ambiance bon monde mais l'alcool saoul pas
Un bars avec des personnes qui te considère comme de la famille pis la barmaid est super cool.

formatted_address: 5955 Av du Parc, Montréal, QC H2V 4H2, Canada
name: Chez lisa

formatted_address: 2179 Rue Fleury E, Montréal, QC H2B 1J9, Canada
name: Gelbison Resto Bar

reviews.text: Nice place to chill after a hard day at work. The bartender is very polite and friendly. The chef is social and very friendly. They greet the customer when they walk in and it really shows that they appreciate our business. Don't forget to have a coffee when there. You'll really enjoy it.
5 star service & 5 star food
Simply outstanding! Extraordinary food at reasonable prices. Excellent service from Claudia - A must try, i will definitely be going back
Great Italian food. Amazing iced coffee. You won't be disappointed
Friendly staff,excellent food, great cold coffee

formatted_address: 312 Rue Saint-Paul O, Montréal, QC H2Y 2A3, Canada
name: BARROCO

reviews.text: The Barroco is one of those hidden gems you wish you could find. From the staff, the manager right to the amazing foods you'll be glad you made reservations and spent a wonderful evening entertaining your pallet with some incredible culinary arts. We spent the first evening here and were so pleased we had to come back for the second night. We were glad we did.

Very good service and very tasty food. Cool ambiance, music and nicely decorated. It’s quite an intimate restaurant. We got the burrata and red cabbage to share as apetizers and then the paella (I highly recommend it). My friend got the beef with mashed potatoes which I tried and it was perfectly cooked, melted in the mouth and the sauce was very flavourful. Overall a great place to have a great diner!
Fantastic cocktails, made by knowledgeable folks. Delicious food. Had their special, halibut cooked perfectly. Great wine selection. Highly recommended

They made an amazing pasta with white sauce and truffle mushrooms. It was the special of the day. Wish they would have it on the menu. 

The paella is really good. I prefer the one in Barcelona but this would quench a paella craving in a pinch. 

Service was good. 

Place is very dim. 

Definitely coming back here
The atmosphere and decor are amazing but the food is even better. I tried Beef Wellington for the first time and was blown away. He service was excellent and I highly recommend it.

formatted_address: 4201 Rue de Verdun, Verdun, QC H4G 1L4, Canada
name: Chevalier Blanc

reviews.text: I love their club sandwich! It is good food for a 24h diner! The service is fast and the food tasty

The cheese burger I had was awesome. But i ordered the trio the poutine wasn't as good as the burger. The service was great and they treat like the family which was wonderful. Definitely loved the service but I think there's a scope for improvement for the poutine.
Really friendly staff, good breakfast options. Very up to date interior. Good amount of seating, but if busy you may have to wait.

I don’t have the words for how much I appreciate having such a delicious breakfast place so close to home. The staff is super nice, they bring you more than you ask for, fresh fruit, real maple syrup. Delicious!

Don't get fool by the outside or the inside design. That place is the place to get your breakfast. I go there almost every two week on Saturday. The food and the service is were this place shine. The fruits selection is one of the best and the plate are generous. Maybe not the best coffee (I'm not a fan of coffee in general). Your eggs will be perfect and the bacon look and taste good. 

It now open 24h, so perfect for a late brunch after drinking all night. ;)

formatted_address: 3510 Boulevard Taschereau, Greenfield Park, QC J4V 2H7, Canada
name: Zanzibar lounge & SportBar

reviews.text:
Everything at this bar makes you want to come back, relaxe and enjoy the vibe. A lot of choices of alcohol at a very affordable price.
Food is amazing !! Ordered the special Zanzibar wrap cooked on grill !!! 👌
I had a wonderful time with my buddies at their New years event ! Hands down best spot in South shore to chill and party ..
Excellent service, delicious food, friendly environment. Highly recommended.
Got in. Waited 10 minutes. Nobody came or seemed to care. Do we smell bad, look bad, or do these guys have no clue how to properly manage a restaurant ?
beautiful decor, delicious food ,

formatted_address: 3188 Rue Masson, Montréal, QC H1Y 1Y1, Canada
name: La Succursale

reviews.text:
In general good place. The nachos were very good. The best beer for us La Ronde (Barley Wine) then in this order :
1. Radshläger (Alt beer)
2. Maracuya (APA)
3. NEIPA
4. New Kid
5. Kama Citra (APA)
6. Mango (IPA)
7. Succursale
8. 1814 (Porter)
9. Milacek (Pilsener Tcheque)

We had a nice drink and the nachos were surprisingly good! Was impressed. Thought it was very unusual that they didn’t have any diet beverage for someone at our table, though the website lists a full bar. A full bar would have sugar alternative / no/low calorie mixes for options. Other than that, cute place.

Fantastic German beer at this craft brewery. Their pilsners and lagers are breed exceptionally well. My favorite hands down was the schwartz bear, just fantastic hands down!

The ambiance is warm and inviting and it has that feel and warmth of your neighborhood hangout.  The service was courteous, friendly, helpful and attentive.  This is a definite stop by if you're in the area.
It's ok but it was better before

Nachos were delicious but oh my goodness they were huge tortilla chips. I can't decide if I liked that or not. The mai tai pa was an amazing twist on the classic mai tai cocktail. Can't wait to go again!

formatted_address: Quebec, 6300 Wilfrid-Hamel Blvd, L'Ancienne-Lorette, QC G2E 2H8, Canada
name: Cabaret Le Folichon

reviews.text: Pretty old girls. Good music.  Good selection of beer. But politic of cabaret forbids to take a photo. Good bar attendant.  She makes good cocktails.  I advise to order some

0 STARS - A friend and I went on October 10th. A dancer stole $40 from me, my friend was charged for drinks we never had, and dancers lie about the number of songs that they danced for. I confronted the supervisor at the end of the night, he said he would take care of it and cowarded in a back room until close.
