Also, one of the servers didnt know I understood French, she was bad talking us to other customers because we spoke English. I have no idea how this place is still in business. There are other clubs in the area, don't make the mistake of going here!
Great staff great girls,had a wonderful time!
5 star review
La meilleure cuisine de tout les bar ( cabaret ) de la region de quebec

formatted_address: 1220 Rue de l'Union, Sainte-Catherine, QC J5C 1B3, Canada
name: Petit forum

formatted_address: 1219 Rue Crescent, Montréal, QC H3G 2B1, Canada
name: Brutopia

reviews.text: Unique bar and layout. Good variety of beers and the ones I tried were quite good, particularly enjoyed the Oat IPA. The servers/bartenders were friendly and helpful. Ordered and really liked the Patròn tacos! Very well made with a good balance of flavours. Always a good sign when a place is serving corn tortillas.

I came here with family and daughter. They were very nice and welcoming. They had great beer on tap and food exceeded my expectations. I would highly recommend for a stop in if your looking for a nice local pint.

Great beer selection, great bar tending - fast and friendly and they have 5 shots of jamieson for $20 which is a pretty nice deal. There was a love band on Saturday when we went. The place was pretty full but we managed to grab a spot at the bar and didn’t have to wait very long to get served. There’s an upstairs too but didn’t check it out so probably more space there as well.
Amazing brew pub! Slinging some of the best suds in Montreal. Good vibes, live music, food, and tasty home brews. Definitely worth visiting
This was an awesome find. Lively, cozy and hip. Beer and munchies were good. Very welcoming atmosphere and service was great.

formatted_address: 426 Place Jacques-Cartier, Montréal, QC H2Y 3B3, Canada
name: Maggie Oakes

reviews.text: Friendly service, nice atmosphere, and good food. Came here for the happening gourmand event, and ordered from their $17 prix fixe menu for brunch. Got the French toast and it was very tasty but unfortunately did not get to try the chicken and waffles as they had run out. And then got the cheesecake for dessert and it was so yummy too

Went for brunch with the family. The ambience is lovely. The food is good, not great, and maybe even over priced. However this time the service is what shocked me. Or the lack of service. When the waiter was around he was decent and helpful but he was hard to find. This is my 3rd time and I really want to love it but with the prices and services it’s not worth it. If you are planning to spend the day in the old port and need somewhere to eat then fine. But to go exclusively for this restaurant is a waste.

Service can be fantastic or very lackluster, but the food is overall quite satisfying. I've had breakfast, dinners, and desserts here and I've been very impressed with the kitchen save for the carrot cake which I thought was a little too ambitious. Also, one of the pralines on my chocolate fondant was bitterly burnt. Overall, though, the dinners have all been splendid. They use fresh ingredients, treated well, and served in inventive and delicious recipes.

Wow!!! I can't believe how the service and the food were up to par!!! I enjoyed every moment there with my friends. The server gave us an amazing service. 
I would highly recommend this place.

Came to Maggie Oakes for Happening Gourmand in February for the $17 brunch. Unfortunately, they were out of the chicken & waffles which was the main reason why I wanted to go to this place. We ordered the French toast and the avocado toast which were fresh and tasty. We also got a smoothie to start, as well as an assortment of pastries, and finished the meal with a cheesecake. The brunch deal was great and very worth it! The OpenTable app also made booking a reservation so easy.

formatted_address: 3500 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2X 2V1, Canada
name: Mediterraneo

reviews.text: C'est bon les prix sont élevés mais ça va

formatted_address: 6349 Rue St-Hubert, Montréal, QC H2S 2L9, Canada
name: Bahay Resto Pub

reviews.text: Great ambiance and amazing service !!! The food is amazing and the prices are affordable. If you haven’t tried them your missing out !!
Great service, food and drinks were amazing!!!
Great food, excellent customer service, reasonable prices, very cozy, I will definitely come back
The best service ever , very cozy and nice food and ambiance❤️✨
I'm pretty sure the pizza was a frozen one and the pancetta was bacon.

formatted_address: 5700 Av de Monkland, Montréal, QC H4A 1E4, Canada
name: Hello 123

reviews.text:
The food here was excellent. I had the Hello Burger (replace onion with mushrooms) which came with potato wedges and a green salad. I'm not sure what their house patty is made of, nor what kind of burger bun they use, but it was so good! The patty was thick and hearty, and the bun was probably buttered and toasted and tasted like brioche.

I also had their mocha cheesecake for dessert which was delectable as well. Not too heavy like some vegan nut-based cheesecakes can be. The cake wasn't overly sweet and the coconut flakes sprinkled on top added a nice touch.

The portion sizes at this restaurant are quite big, and the prices are reasonable (desserts are a bit pricey though, at 9$ for a slice of cheesecake). I would definitely recommend this restaurant for great vegan food.

A big welcome to Hello123! The Hello burger with messy fries is a runaway hit! Full bar and inspired cocktail list, beautiful terrace for the summer, and friendly, attentive staff. A great addition to the Monkland village. I am not a vegetarian or a vegan but I crave this burger.

Absolutely delicious. This is a really magical place and we'll be coming back. The decor is so gentle and creates a really lovely atmosphere. The food is totally wonderful with great creativity and choice. The service was friendly, professional, attentive and in harmony with the rest of the restaurant. Reserve because you wouldn't want to miss out. Thank you so much.

The lentil soup was very good albeit a little salty. The other seasonings in the soup gave it a little kick. I enjoyed the spicy bap as well. All were very good dishes and perfect portions. The service was attentive and cordial. I will come back and try other items on the menu.

Hello 123 is such a fantastic find! The food is phenomenal! The choices are diverse and everything I have tried here is fresh, flavourful, and well made. 

Who would have known the lasagne is vegan? And the brownie a la mode?!?! Whoa! Just had the Mexican burger lettuce wrapped and it was 🙌🏻

formatted_address: 4483 Rue Parthenais, Montréal, QC H2H 2G6, Canada
name: Chez Phong

formatted_address: 181 Rue Saint-Vallier E, Québec, QC G1K 3P2, Canada
name: Maelstrøm Saint-Roch

reviews.text:
Friendly and fast service, with a concise and flavourful menu. Marlstrøm offered a fresh and delicious breakfast to the 6 festival goers looking for a late brunch. Would recommend the Avocado Toast! 

Will return when it turns into a bar in the evening hours!

One of my new favs in Quebec City,I love the perfect combinatin between good coffee and good drinks. I asked for a lait cold Brew and it was awesome, also the atmosphere of the place, the music, everything for me was perfect. 
Alone or with Friends, to work or to talk, for sure is a place to enjoy.

The rude employee at the bar decided to do his last call 2 hours before closing time. We were going around town under the rain to local brews and pubs and was hoping for a good time here and were basically told to leave when we got there. Don't waste your energy here when there are so many other places worth your time and money.
I come here once in a while and its always the same thing: great vegetarian options, great coffee, great beer, great cocktails and great staff. So overall great place!
The coffee here is excellent and the staff is very friendly. I stumbled across this place by accident and I highly recommend it.

formatted_address: 2407 Avenue du Mont-Royal E, Montréal, QC H2H 1L2, Canada
name: Boswell Brasserie Artisanale

reviews.text: Just had drinks here but they were good, nice beer selection. The food looked delicious.
I love this place! Great space, amazing food for good prices. A cool hangout for any occasion.

My husband and I thought Boswell Brasserie was great.  Excellent beer, tasty food, and a very accommodating waitstaff, especially considering we had our toddler with us.  (Thank you for also having a changing table in the bathroom!)  It was relatively quiet when we arrived on a Monday before 6, and by the time we left it was quite crowded, but not too noisy.  Definitely recommend.
Great service and good choice of beer! It's a great place to hang out in a big group or to  be alone with a book! Very welcoming.
Good selection of food and beers at an affordable price. The ambience is very child and cozy in case you want to get away for a lazy evening

formatted_address: 395, rue de la Couronne, Québec, QC, G1K 7X4 Rue de la Couronne, Québec, QC G1K 7X4, Canada
name: Table

reviews.text:
We had two dinners here and it was fantastic, the care they took of us and the service was really professional yet very personal. I think it was Emily taking care of us both times, she even remembered us.

We tried 4 different dishes and everything was so good. The new menu is nice. Only downside is that some dishes go with fries and/or side salad yet its not stated in the menu so you order something and then you recieve a huge meal that is almost impossible to eat. I would advice including this information in the menu as well and maybe thinking more about the portions.

Thank you for taking care of us!

Nice decor but the wait for food is ridiculous.  I was staying here on a work trip, as I believe most people are as well. I had to wait several minutes to be seated, several minutes to get a coffee, wait for the food then wait for the bill. Not ideal to have a quick breakfast when you have to be somewhere on time. I was late for work 2 days in a row due to the slow service. The food was tasty though.  I also ate here for dinner and had to get the attention of the waiter to order and get my bill. I felt ignored and uncomfortable since I was alone just sitting there waiting!
Slow service even though it wasn't busy. The waffles were incredibly dry and not worth the high price

New years eve service is a complete disaster.  We spent 3 hours here and the food came terribly slow. Service was extremely disorganized as exemplified by the fact that people that came after our group received their food sooner than us. To make things worse, the kitchen did not understand the concept of “well done” for meats. We had to send food back three times because it was not acceptable for our kids. The place is expensive so think twice before coming here.

We had an amazing dinner at The Table! The service was great and the food was some of the best I have ever had. As a plant based eater, it is difficult to find restaurants that offer creative and delicious options. This restaurant offered both.  Our server was attentive and fluent in both French and English. If you visit Quebec City, be sure to dine at The Table in Hotel Pur.

formatted_address: 490 Avenue Michel Jasmin, Dorval, QC H9P 1C3, Canada
name: Restaurant Bar Focaccio

reviews.text:
From the outside I had my reservations walking in but my goodness as you see in the pictures it’s beautiful on the inside. 

The service was great, drink within a matter of minutes, we got the bread as an appetizer and it was delicious. 

The chicken sandwich my friend got as you see was massive, he loved it, along with the salad.

I got the manicotti and it was delicious. 

Really good find and it was close to our hotel.

We found this restaurant close to the hotel that we stayed. The food was really good. We had chicken barley soup and seafood linguine and they were delicious. The servers were great and helpful. They even had a free shuttle to take us to and from the hotel. What a great service!

Amazing food and pretty good service. We had the bresheda to start it was on fresh bread and had lots of flavor. I had a bacon fettuccine carbonara. It was very very good the sauce was rich and creamy! The bar service was good. The ceasar's were nice and spicy.

Traditional Italian menu layout, but the dishes were not traditional Italian food. I’ve been to Italy a dozen times in various regions and this restaurant serves clearly Canadian style Italian food. It was still tasty but definitely with a québécoise feel. Don’t expect Italian cuisine! That being said the wait staff was very friendly and do speak some Italian. I went one night on my own and had a salad and pizza and was quite surprised so I brought back a few team members the next night to join me.  Sadly, the next day The salad had so much dressing it was soggy with oil. The pizza was quite tasty as well as the soup and two of the pasta dishes our table ordered. But Everything needed salt and pepper and chilli oil to bring in some flavor, but it was a nice dinner environment overall. I had a view of the bar where the bartender was serving out wine. Each person at our table ordered a different glass of red, but I noticed the bartender just poured out the SAME house wine into three glasses?!?! LOL I guess they assumed we would not be able to tell the difference? 🤷🏻‍♂️ Anyhow I’m giving this place four stars. I’m not sure if I would return.
Very good food, excellent staff. Lasagna was excellent. The Italian wedding soup was mostly broth and lacked substance. Price was reasonable and nice place to enjoy a good meal.

formatted_address: 819 Côte d'Abraham, Québec, QC G1R 1A4, Canada
name: Albacore

html_attributions: Albacore - Seafood Oysters - Wine Bar Craft Beer
Albacore - Seafood Oysters - Wine Bar Craft Beer
Albacore - Seafood Oysters - Wine Bar Craft Beer
Albacore - Seafood Oysters - Wine Bar Craft Beer
Albacore - Seafood Oysters - Wine Bar Craft Beer
Albacore - Seafood Oysters - Wine Bar Craft Beer
Albacore - Seafood Oysters - Wine Bar Craft Beer

reviews.text: Had a great meal and wonderful service. Lucky enough to get a last minute reservation on a Saturday (I recommend reservations), but was well worth the wait. The waiter also recommended a great "funky" bottle of wine, and our co-diners were lovely.

I’m a local & it’s one of my favourites in the city. I recommend it to all my clients, not far if you are staying in the city walls. A great selection of drinks to accompany the food & the staff are very friendly & informative. Another great restaurant from the guys at ‘Le restaurant pirate’. ‘Le Chaudron’ with bacon is a must! Good work guys

Was impressed with the quality and flavour of each dish. Made with much dedication and love.

Really appreciated and enjoyed the creativity, texture, flavour of each dish with super crunchy vegetables on the bottom of a few of the dishes.

Ambience was nice and casual with cute friendly staff.

Will go back again!

Background: 4 English and 2 from Channel Islands. 

All six of us agreed that this is the best seafood we have all ever had. The food was exceptional. The service was absolute quality. Price is up, but it is 100% worth every dollar.

This restaurant was recommended to us by our hotel staff. It is outside the walled old city, but not far. We both ordered seared salmon on a bed of mashed peas sprinkled with clams. It was terrific. We told our waiter he looked like a young Kevin Klein. He acted like him, too. He laughed and said Americans always tell him that, but not Canadians. Canadians don't seem to know who Kevin Klein is. Their specialty is seafood and if the other dishes are as good as our salmon was, you probably can't go wrong.

formatted_address: 1254 Rue Stanley, Montréal, QC H3B 2S7, Canada
name: Club La Boom

reviews.text: Bartenders were nice and made really good drinks, except for one guy with long hair. I asked for a fruity drink and all he could suggest was orange juice and vodka :/ but the DJ was amazing and kept the crowd going for the longest time! Visited feb 23, 2017.

I had a terrible experience here. I was there for a Halloween party. Despite knowing the event was sold out, the club had NO line or system to handle the amount of people waiting to get in. A crowd formed around the entrance and people were pushing and shoving. It took an obscene amount of time for three (out of nine) of my group to get inside. Inside there was hardly anyone, even at 1am. The bouncers were rude and could not control the crowd. The bouncers directed us to move to one side but were letting people in from all sides. People were leaving, saying it was awful and not worth the wait. My group of nine gladly decided to leave as well, happily spending out money elsewhere. La Boom obviously cannot handle a large number of people (I wonder why...?) and I would never recommend going here or organizing an event at this venue.
I went this place a few times ago and it was a good ambiance. The deejays and their music were amazing. But this place is not haunted by the ghosts like the Club 1234 or Club Le Cinq.
I did not really enjoyed the experience. We got entry discount but after we paid we couldn't get the discount. Few people and some one left a turd in the pissoire. Very classy.

Overall terrible experience... People that go there are just really creepy and the whole atmosphere is sketchy. The place is old and the music was terrible. The drinks are overpriced and the bartenders can barely do anything other than a vodka-cranberry drink

formatted_address: 1718 Boulevard Saint-Joseph, Lachine, QC H8S 2N2, Canada
name: PASTA ANDREA

reviews.text: This is a nice restaurant. Good food and service and price is very reasonable. I highly recommend it
Authentic Italian cooked by 100% Latino staff
Its an ok italian restaurant. You won't be disapointed but not impress either. Once in a while if you feel like having pasta.

I visited Pasta Andrea for Sunday lunch with an elderly friend.
The staff were wonderful. They made us feel very welcome. 
The food was very good. I had Moules, the tomato sauce was fresh.
Good location good service good food.
Nice place, friendly staff, delicious food. We came with 2 toddlers and the staff was very patient. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to my friends.

formatted_address: 1844 Rue Sainte-Catherine O, Montréal, QC H3H 1M1, Canada
name: Kazu

reviews.text: We like a lot eating out. Yesterday we came to this superb place which friends told us about. We enjoyed a lovely time there with fine cooking and  an experienced team and a talented  chef. We  added this place in our phone list  and we shall no doubt go again soon. We highly recommend.

Excellent! 

Can’t wait to come back next time in Montreal 

We had curry ramen beef ribs and salmon bowl. All of them are fantastic.

Traditional Japanese flavour with some creative tastes!!! 

FYI portion is pretty big
Love this restaurant. Always a line outside. I think they moved to another place which is two shops away from the original one. So a little less crowded but still a small restaurant.

Best best best food ever ! Totally worth the wait because there is always a line... it's just that amazingly delicious. 

We ordered the wings, the shrimp burger, some dumpling, a bibim bap and a cheese cake ice cream... every single bites were so tasty ! The flavors, the perfect cook time, the textures... it's so good !!

And to make it even better it's so affordable!!

As always, Kazu consistently delivers! Love the new place. More spacious and the dishes are still fantastic! One after the other with Japanese themes throughout. A genuine Japanese dining experience and great staff too! Some of the dishes are really innovative and the Tuna belly, 48 hours pork bowl, and the Tsukune were really standout. If you’re looking for a special meal in Montreal, look no further! Did I mention how affordable it was? Since they moved there's even no wait time for lunch. I'm amazed and I'll be back for sure!

formatted_address: 1490 Rue Stanley, Montréal, QC H3A 1P7, Canada
name: Firegrill Montréal

reviews.text: Came here before an event at the Bell Centre. Food was great. Had the wedge salad and shrimp cocktail. My friend had a strawberry pecan salad, garlic bread and cheesecake. We both were impressed with the generous portions and quality of the food. Service was fantastic, our server was very attentive and efficient. He made nice conversation and made our experience even more enjoyable. Would highly recommend!

Phenomenal experience from drinks to dessert - everything was amazingly tasteful. Ambience was relaxing and server and host were both professional and friendly. Appetizers were delicious and entrees were exquisite. Lobster and steak were cooked to perfection. Meals were well portioned and desserts were elegantly satisfying. Great place for small and large groups.

I really enjoyed Firegrill. The food is good, I mostly enjoy eating red meat or pasta at this restaurant. The dimmed lights give the place a little intimate atmosphere. The place is clean and looks nice. Their kitchen close a little bit later then most restaurant, which is a little extra that is really appreciated.

Overall this was a very nice experience. We went there for my bf 30's birthday. The waiter was very good and we had a very good service from start to finish. The only 2 down sides we had is, first our table was at the end of the restaurant so we didn't get to see our waiter has much and I would've ordered much more if we got to see him more often. The other problem was that my steak was way underdone for me. I asked for a medium well-done and got a medium-raw. I wasn't the only one at my table who found the meat to be undercooked. But apart from these it was a very nice evening and I'll definitely go back.
This spot is worth trying. They have large portions for fair prices. Regularly well organized and with great atmosphere. Would recommend to others.

formatted_address: 2373 Boulevard Marcel-Laurin, Saint-Laurent, QC H4R 1K4, Canada
name: Restaurant Daou

reviews.text:
Daou offers top of the line Lebanese food. You can’t go wrong, the whole menu is delicious. Their meat melts in you mouth like a butter cookie (pause). However, the service is missing a smile. 

When there’s private parties the parking gets pretty full, so just park next door in the strip mall; next to Tim Hortons.

A Lebanese restaurant with high quality meat. Taste great, but should have been served with sauce or gravy so they're more moist. We separately bought humus and salad. Pretty expensive I must say, but a nice place for special occasion.

My absolute favourite Lebanese Restaurant in Montreal. 

A family owned Restaurant, all the food is made with love and care. I've been coming here for over 20 years, and the food has not changed one bit. 

What strikes you here is the quality and the freshness of the ingredients. Everything here is just so good. 

Highly recommended, and if you want to come on a Friday/Saturday evening, reservations are also highly recommended. 

Enjoy!

I went there with my son, wife and friend in September, they forgot our food, waited over an hour?? I am wondering was it an honest mistake or was it because we are black?? Hmm... I am not going back to find out!! The food was ordinary I expected better for the price I paid. Us people really like to get quality for the $$ we spend..

This is the best Lebanese restaurant in Montreal. Authentic cuisine prepared by Jamal. Owners Chadia, Souad and Gladys are extremely nice, friendly and charming. Really the food is the best.... almost as good as an orgasm! Haha

formatted_address: 2022 Rue Peel, Montréal, QC H3A 2W5, Canada
name: L'Entrecôte Saint-Jean

reviews.text: I love this place and the service was superb.  Excellent!!  Perfect medium steak as I ordered and the sauce was divine.  The wine recommended suited the meal.  It was an authentic "Paris" experience.

Reminds me of Steak Frites i had in Paris, so delicious and perfectly cooked. Tomato soup was so creamy and delicious. I ordered a medium done steak, it was so soft and juicy, and the sauce is so unique. I have also ordered a profiterole, chocolate sauce was so rich. Cream puff filling was so refreshing, perfect for a summer day! I would recommend this restaurant to everyone!
Great place to have some quality meat  which is done right.  Also have tried this in france and it was superb  highly recommend

Good experience. Service was good and food also. The sauce is really good, I heared out about it and was curious to try it.. I really like it..flavorful. Wine options were good too. Nice place to have a good talk with your partner or enjoy dinner with a friend.
Fantastic meal with exceptional service! Gabrielle was very attentive. The meat was a perfect medium, and the sauce is something out of this world (and it's a "secret recipe"). Great for date nights.

formatted_address: 1254 Rue Mackay, Montréal, QC H3G 2H4, Canada
name: Upstairs Jazz Bar & Grill

reviews.text:
(Visited July 2019)
My wife and I visited on a Monday night after reserving a table by walking in earlier in the day. The place was absolutely packed by the time the entertainment came on Jam Sessions with Jim Doxas and special guests. The musicians were incredibly talented and a joy to watch. 
The food was amazing although we weren’t offered dessert but did manage to get some Scotch and a cocktail. 
The staff were attentive, polite and friendly and I would definitely put this as a must do in Montreal! Until next time!

Great niche little venu. Music was amazing and food was good. Don't come here expecting fast service though. The server was excellent but he was the only one of. Serving a room of estimated 60. With turnover tables between sets. So sit back and enjoy the chill ambience. If you're needy and picky this is not the place for you. If you're here for the music with a support of tasty food and beverage then it won't disappoint.

Great venue, very decent food and drink options. We booked our table a few days in advance and asked for a table by the wall close to the stage and that’s what we got. It gave us a great view of the band and the volume was perfectly tuned for this size of venue. 
Highly recommended place!

Amazing spot for an intimate night of jazz. Food was meh. Steak and frites was sub standard... not sure what cut of meat they used. Maybe a hangar steak? Seafood was good and fresh. I would skip dinner next time and just come for the amazing live jazz.
Really impressed with that honest food. And seem to be homemade. We had fish and chips and burger and pasta. Everything was good. We really enjoyed our time there including service and live music.

formatted_address: 311 Rue Saint Paul Est, Montréal, QC H2Y 1H3, Canada
name: Restaurant Chez L'Épicier

reviews.text: Amazing Find! Discovered on 2nd day in Montreal. Was so impressed with all of the staff. Every plate of food we tasted was so full of complexity and flavor - from Carrot Medley appetizer to entrees ranging from Lamp Chop and Quail - both outstanding. Would definitely return again on next visit to Montreal! Interior was nicely laid out and appealing!
Impeccable service, delicious food , simple yet beautiful decor given by the brick walls of an old port building. We will be back, very often. Thank you

Wow! 
From the service to the food to the ambiance, the whole experience was just extraordinary!!

I was sitting at the bar and the bar tender Olivier was very nice and he had good stories to tell.

When we arrived , the host gave us a tour of the entire restaurant since they just renovated the whole place ! 

Now they have three different sections and all different vibe! 

The food was filled with flavours and very unique. I have been to many high end resto and this is the winner of me I must say. Better than Toqué even ! Hats off to the young chef Sami!!

Also the owner of the two was there and he greeted us very nicely. I would definitely go back here in a blink of an eye.
Just outstanding. We had a chef's tasting and re food was to die for and the experience was very very good.
Fantastic staff. The foie gras was great along with the scallops. Two thumbs up!

formatted_address: 265 Rue des Seigneurs, Montréal, QC H3J 0B3, Canada
name: Lord William Pub

reviews.text: First time here, and immediately felt welcome, very relaxed atmosphere, good seating, we sat at the bar and it was very comfortable. The range of tap beers was great. We just had a snack of the house chips and guacamole which was super tasty, they make the potato chips in house. Sean was a great host/bartender/waiter, excellent service. Definitely would come back.
Consistent quality, decent prices for good pub style food. Nice lunch place with terrace. Excellent for a 5-7, they are very accommodating and have excellent Barman  and wait staff.

Been here twice and both times it was excellent: once for a birthday party in private room, once in the summer on the patio. Food was very tasty gourmet pub fare. Staff is courteous and responsive. Will definitely be back!

Long walk along the canal? Spent an afternoon at the arsenal taking in art? If so a great place to wrap up the day is sitting on the patio at lord William.  Great beers. Great staff. Lovely place to spend the afternoon.

Neighborhood corner pub, located at the western edge of Griffin town. Dark, old looking (even though only 4 years old), serves typical pub food (which I did not have) looks small at first glance but has larger rooms not in looking distance. Beer prices are reasonable, has an out side deck. The only issue I have is service is quite spotty as staff seem angry and not aware of their patrons. I would go back on the patio so as not to deal with barkeeps. I would try the food to see if it would add or detract a star.

formatted_address: 4026 Rue Wellington, Verdun, QC H4G 1V3, Canada
name: Benelux Brasseries Artisanales

reviews.text: His location is awesome. Everything from the old bank feel to the innovative craft beers make this place somewhere to add to your list of great brewpubs. I had the seasonal maple sugar-infused "Cimonak" and was beyond pleased. I'll be back soon.
Great spot to take a few beers, but they want you to pay 8$ for a comedy stand up or you have to leave... Is it a bar or a comedy club? I don't know

Nice place to meet your friends and have the beer special , I like the panini sandwiches are awesome, as the hamburger, the terrasse is cool to have your beer in fresh air ( not sure if the terrasse still open )
Very friendly employees very nice atmosphere 
You just have to look around for parking in rush lunch hour evening parking is easy to find and the parking machine not that expensive, however I ask someone they told me the metro station is couple of minutes away only , I’m not sure the name of the station cause I don’t use metro .
Go have a beer talk to your friends about life or take your girlfriend boyfriend whoever you like or love , a nice place to have a conversation, see there .

Benelux is one of Montreal's finest craft breweries with two locations, one in the borough of Verdun and the other in the heart of downtown Montreal. I visited the Verdun location. The ambiance was warm and inviting, casual, modern in design. It is located in a former bank, with the heavy vault door as part of the decor. Staff is super friendly and knowledgeable. The small open kitchen pumps out good looking sandwiches, sausages, cheeses and other simple fare (I did not eat). The bar serves liquor, wine, cocktails and most importantly beer, of course. They brew a wide variety of styles to satisfy all tastes. Each one is a solid interpretation of the style brewed and worth trying. Would rate 4.5 if I could.

Came here more than a handful of times with some friends. Their obvious specialty is beer and bar food. They have a lot of different types of beer and sampler packs. The food is also very tasty - the baguettes are fantastic and the portions are more than fair.

formatted_address: 300 Avenue Dresden, Mont-Royal, QC H3P 2B8, Canada
name: Dépanneur Du Coin

formatted_address: 143 Rue Saint-Paul O, Montréal, QC H2Y 1Z3, Canada
name: LICENCE IV | Le Bistro + Bar à Gin

html_attributions: LICENCE IV | Le Bistro + Bar à Gin
LICENCE IV | Le Bistro + Bar à Gin
LICENCE IV | Le Bistro + Bar à Gin
LICENCE IV | Le Bistro + Bar à Gin

reviews.text: Cute place, nice decor. Great gin selection featuring many local products. A sign advertising an Express menu on a chalkboard upon entry was apparently not in effect as the waiter said there were no specials. Service was extremely slow. I went alone, was ready to order right after receiving the menu, which took at least 15 minutes and ordered only a glass of wine and a salad. The bill came to $39. I spent 2 hours there in total, and it took me perhaps 20 minutes to eat, so that leaves more than an hour and a half waiting for a menu, to order, for the food, and for the bill. Food was okay. Tuna nicely seared, but lacked seasoning. Lettuce (a standard spring mix) was a bit wilty. Canned anchovy fillets were strangely served whole on the sides of the plate.

Found this very good spot completely by accident, call it serendipity. However upon entering we were delighted to find the ambience and atmosphere very warm and cozy. Unique and very chic decor stylings and art. The food itself just wooooow , tasty and delectable with presentation way above par. Food items were a bit limited but sufficient. The only caveat would be the price of the cocktails which are more expensive than menu items themselves . However all in all the experience was great.To top it off the service was beyond excellent. Definitely would suggest Bistro Licence IV for a date night or even just an evening out with friends

Our absolute favorite from our weekend in Montreal - fun artistic decor, great music, friendly staff, and great drinks. One of the best espresso martinis we've had, along with great Gin cocktails! A perfect pit stop before going up to the Basilica for the Aura light show in the evening

What a lovely cozy stylish place. Everything about this place is amazing. The place where you dont want to leave because the ambiance is so great. You go in for the cocktails and the food but cant leave because the music keeps on getting better and better as the night goes. Just wow

Came across this hidden gem by mistake. We were walking around old Montreal looking for a nice restaurant (it was very cold so anything would do). This restaurant look cozy, hip/cool, and reasonably priced. I was with a group of 5 for a weekend trip. The wait staff were so nice and hands down the best service we had all weekend. The waiter took such good care of us and even proceeded to pop complimentary bottles of champagne to start our night. We asked him why he was doing this and he said, "because it is the weekend". It was a small gesture but added to the great experience. Every-time we were out of champagne, he simple refilled it at no charge. There was also a DJ playing some funky techno music. The food was also delicious. My friend ordered muscles and it was the largest portion of muscles  I have ever seen. I got the burger which came with fires AND a salad. It was juicy, flavourful, and a reasonable price. Cocktails were the only menu item that was over priced (17$+ for a cocktail). Will recommend to friends and I would even go again!

formatted_address: 410 Rue Chabanel O, Montréal, QC H2N 1G7, Canada
name: Fashion Cafe

formatted_address: 8379 Boulevard Henri-Bourassa, Québec, QC G1G 4E1, Canada
name: Dooly's Henri-Bourassa

reviews.text: This was one of the only places open on Christmas Eve. Ordered the chicken wings and coffee which were good. But the best thing was the manager and the server's. They didn't ask for money once we were done and didn't even charge for the pool we played for like 3 hours. As visiting Quebec for the first time, I had a lovely experience. Will recommend going in.
Rates were a bit higher than I seemed to remember, from back in the day. Service was not too bad at the bar. No table service
It was cool but noone to watch the hockey game though :0(
Nice pool tables
Coktail excellent

formatted_address: 150 Rue Sainte-Catherine O local 201c, Montréal, QC H2X 3Y2, Canada
name: La Cage - Brasserie sportive

reviews.text:
You guys already know. Free popcorn = 5 star review from the one and only Justine S. Came for a small bite to eat before a concert with my cousin. The restaurant is very nice, the service was perfect, and all the tv's around are pretty pleasant and if you think they will bother you, they won't. You forget they're there after a while. We got a really good table next to a plug so I got to charge my phone before the concert. I think the prices for certain meals is a bit high but there seems to be something in the menu for most price points and appetites. 

I ordered a pina colada (was feeling fancy), and it was freaking delicious. The best pina colada I've had in my life (also the third pina colada I've ever had).

My cousin and I got the plate to share and it came with chicken fingers, chicken wings, these sausage thingies, and potato skins. Everything was good except the potato skins, those were eh.

I love it here!

Huge space to sit and watch your favourite sports. Service was little slow. Food was tasty and nicely presented. Seems staff doesn’t care about the serving ethics, she was looking behind at someone’s table while putting the fork and spoon, which led to fork fall down on ground. These small things makes a huge difference.
Suggestion - Coasters needed on the tables.

They got free popcorns at entrance.
Overall this place is little over priced.

I have zero insight into food but in terms of a sports bar, it does the job. Lots of seating space for large groups which makes it perfect for a 5 a 7. The service is friendly and fast. There’s free popcorn! They serve appetizers as well but there’s aren’t many vegan options. Vegetarian options are available. 
The crowd is more old and professional - not a rowdy place at all which makes it comfortable and not too loud.
Good vibe and atmosphere.... free popcorn all the time with refill ... good food ..... on Sundays you pay only $3 for your kids meals which I found fantastic....

Yes this is a pretty decent Sport Bar to go &  hang out .

Place:
 Is located in the Place-Des-ART AREA  so it was conveniently located near my Hotel . Drinks were good, female Bartenders were friendly & smiled a lot. However,  I was there for the Guinness so I had 2 Pints and and Screwdriver(Vodka + orange juice) . 
Once the vodka kicked in I settled the check & left.

This place is cleaned,  packed with respectful  young professional crowd . Also  less intimidating unlike some  other  Graffiti-decorated-bars/places  on Rue Saint-Catherine.
 
So yea,  you should go there , have a drink, watched some cable live sport on the TV & chill.

Happy Drinking :)

formatted_address: 800 Rue de l'Église, Verdun, QC H4G 2N2, Canada
name: Trevi Pizzeria

reviews.text: Best and most original pizzas in Montreal

Hi! So this is a weird turn out.  I went to eat at Trevi and left my red burgundy hoodie (Reebok, new, easily worth 100+$), and called the next day to see if they had it (Nov 17). They said yes they did. My sister goes to pick it up exactly three weeks later (December 8), bartender says it's gone and they didn't keep it "it's been too long".   My sister has said great things about this bar/resto, but this is just too bad...kind of awkward? Do you often give lost items to friends as gifts?
Super fun - if you're not a regular don't even think about singing

We went there for karaoke and sang 2 songs. It was alway the same people signing, the list wasn’t respected. They should have a better listing to respect the order. Otherwise the service for the beer was excellent. Wouldn’t recommend this placed for karaoke.
The service is warm and inviting. The food authentic.

formatted_address: 5350 Boulevard Henri-Bourassa, Québec, QC G1H 6Y9, Canada
name: Emporium Microbrasserie

reviews.text: Its a big but cozy space. Excellent bartenders, servers and cooks. The pizza is to die for. I see great things instore for this place.
Very nice place, very good pizza and beer!
The head chef is amazingly talented, definitely get the ‘Rustique’ when you’re there! Great beer selection.

😍😍😍😍 Pizzzaaaaa🍕 is Amazing here!!!! La fondante porte son nom tres bien!! Et la pizza margarita est excellente aussi!
 
Attention l'imperatrice est tres bonne mais extremement salee (petetre reduire le sel)
 (The "Fondante & Margarita Pizzas are excellente but be careful the saltyness in the imperatrice pizza is overboard although its still delicious )

 🍺The Beer is next level perfection!!! The quality of the beer is highly remarquable! The flavors and tastes are clear and refined! You can tell they put a lot of effort into creating the best beer! (Mondays they have "tour guidee" of the beer making!

Their are board games available and Quiz nights and Yoga on some days posted on their facebook page! 
In the Summer the terrace is beautiful! 

Great atmosphere, great staff,great service and great food. 

The only thing i do not recomend is the "tartar de Saumon" oh was very bad. Too salty and unnedible.
Great place for a craft brew and a wood fired oven pizza.

formatted_address: 15 Boulevard Bouchard, Dorval, QC H9S 3H3, Canada
name: Restaurant Dorval

reviews.text: Great family restaurant.. good food... been going there for many years..
Very neat and welcoming place. They offer large meals and for fair prices. I liked the food very much and the staff were super amiable and informative. Recommended.
The service was good but the fries were super greasy. Other than that the food was good they seem to have good specials on every day of the week.

Ordered the smoked meat and ribs combo ($24) and the breaded mushroom ($6) and pineapple juice ($2.5). 

The ribs were good to the bone, very tender, well seasoned and full of flavor. The smoked meat was great too and the service was first class. 

I'll be heading there soon enough.
Friendly service, has a remarkable cozy traditional touch to it. All day breakfast was tasty, also great value. Will visit again

formatted_address: 805 Boulevard Décarie, Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 3L7, Canada
name: Resto Unik

reviews.text: Overall it’s a good place for having a drink with friends and listen to some live music. On Wednesdays they have jazz jam session run by students from the nearby Vanier and St-Laurent collèges. The only downside is that it’s a bit cold inside in the winter. Their heating isn’t good enough...

i been there for the jam nigth its ok everytime i go there there is not many people but barman never come to table for service even if the place is empty to ask if we would like to order something. they looses sales and tips
Cute little live music venue!
Decent service and decent drinks. The place looks terrible

Excellent burgers, good fries, good salad. The server remembers your order even when not having seen you in a while. The place itself is a bar with live music some evenings, so not so impressive for lunch. I've been having occasional lunches here for the past couple of years and not much has changed.

formatted_address: 3979 Rue Saint-Denis, Montréal, QC H2W 2M4, Canada
name: Lockhart Montréal

reviews.text: Great place for HP fans! the decor was really nice and the food was delicious. The cocktails are a little pricey compared to the food but definitely worth it. The service was great. Would definitely come back!
What a super cool find! Was so happy I found it and got to visit before heading back to SA. Great vibe. Awesome service. Amazing cocktails
A worthwhile stop for the fans of HP. Lockhart had its own cast of characters between the staff and customers. Drinks were ok. However, I can't complain about mine being on fire - that was cool.

All seemed well. I arrived on time for the reservation and waited at the door for a long time (half of the tables weren't set either) took 15 minutes to get water at the table too which wasn't refilled all night. Went to order a drink off the online menu and it no longer existed. The music was terrible dance 00's jams. Ordered a bunch of food items too and it was alright. (Dry fries, uncooked rice, sloppy presentation) drinks were fun, but I saw the bartender roll his eyes a few times. Not worth it to go back. They left empty plates and cups on the table for the entire night as well. The waiter Isaac was entertaining though.

Very nice ambiance, good looking interior. Good cocktails. Decent food. Servers were pretty rude though, which took away from the experience. Also, they are a resto-bar but didn't have any wine or beer when I came.

formatted_address: 7 Ave, Prince Arthur St W, Montreal, QC H2X 1S4, Canada
name: Le Rouge Bar

reviews.text: Bottle service was great and friendly staff. Our bottle service girl I think her name was jade was a lot of fun and really nice. Deff will be going back next time we’re in Montreal

I went there on Friday for my 18th birthday and they are very strict with the dress code for men so be sure to wear nice black shoes and the drinks inside were very cheap compared to others... the bartender was very nicee and she didn’t even ask for “a mandatory tip” which I appreciated and gave her one unlike other clubs where they are rude about it and she was just overall nice... the music was good and I had a guest list for 20 people and we didn’t have to buy a bottle nor a booth and ended up getting a booth for free.. I love rouge, it’s so much better than any other club
Had a great time here. Bottle service is a good value. Good music and friendly people

Been here twice and unlike some other reviews I noticed I must disagree with them.  I found the bar staff to be extremely friendly and professional. The bouncers were attentive and professional as well. Obviously there was a wait but that's to be expected when you go clubbing. Great music and amazing vibe. Definetly reccomend Rouge to anyone looking for a great night

Always fun to go to the rouge, we never had a problem resrving a table or a booth. Bottle service can be sometimes a little slow but it is understandable because of the amount of people. One of my favorite clubs in montreal, definitely would recommend it for any birthday partys !

formatted_address: 426 Rue Saint Gabriel, Montréal, QC H2Y 2Z9, Canada
name: Auberge Le Saint-Gabriel

reviews.text: I had a chance to go at a wedding which was hosted inside the Auberge Le Saint-Gabriel. De building inside is very old and bigger than it appears from the outside. The service during the event was remarkable. Not sure if the servers were special caterers for the event only or usual workers at this place, but we were served in a way that was far above par. Nice place to host wedding under 100 guests. It seems to be relatively popular on the weekends with the fine dining on the first level and the cool looking bunker-like dance club in the basement.

Went here with colleagues for our Christmas dinner. It was snowing during dinner and so greatly attributing to the Christmas atmosphere. Beautiful restaurant with a great atmosphere. Great food and an elaborate wine list. Friendly staff. Highly recommended.
Wonderful food and drink with a beautiful setting. You feel like you've gone back in time to a more elegant but simple time. Did I mention that the service was terrific. We'll be back!
It is a lovely place with delicious food. Specially Beef Tartare.
Nice cozy place. Food is decent as well. House-dance music on Saturdays is pretty good.  Nice lasers

formatted_address: 3333 Rue du Carrefour, Québec, QC G1C 5R9, Canada
name: Dooly's

reviews.text: Came here on Christmas Eve and they didn't charge anything for the pool we played for like 3 hours! Plus they prepared some entrees and salads for free! Love the gesture! Will definitely come back here again when in Quebec.
Chicken wings on Fridays are only 10 cents each!!! And they are delicious! Plus you get to play golf or billard.
Very expensive too much paying for service
Wow

Il n'est pas possible de commander des ailes de poulet en soirée parce que les employés refusent de le faire. Assez cheap comme endroit. Si vous voulez un service au table  pour votre alcool oubliez  ca, les serveuses  ne se déplacent  pas aux tables. C'est arrivé a plusieurs reprise. Clairement aucun gérant compétent pour gérer la place. À  éviter!

formatted_address: 4006 Rue Sainte-Catherine, Westmount, QC H3Z 1P2, Canada
name: IMADAKE IZAKAYA

reviews.text: I did not feel welcomed at all at first but the service gradually became more and more friendlier. The atmosphere is nice, get to enjoy people shouting sake bomb time to time and it makes it entertaining. The staff can speak both French and English fluently so that is good. The food is good, everything is flavoured beautifully and tastes pretty good. The prices are my only concern, as the plates are very small portions because it is an izakaya, the priced seem a bit too high for me. About 8$ a plate. I would definitely come here a lot more often if it was a bit cheaper. Overall, had a nice time here. Good food and atmosphere.

So I enjoy this place for the ambiance, the decor, and the nice little bites you can order without feeling too full. But definitely do not come here on an empty stomach because you will spend well over 50$ if you want to feel full. Great place to hang out with friends and it can get loud which I guess is normal for an Izakaya since it's the equivalent of a pub. Go there and enjoy yourself! It's well worth it! And I also want to note that I was very impressed by one of their waiters who ran a block after us in the cold with just a t-shirt on to hand over my mom's cellphone that she accidentally left behind. Wow! That was spectacular! What a service all the way to the end! Thanks again!!

Amazing place for Japanese food with a very lovely atmosphere. The sake bombs are fun to do in a group! The desserts aren't the greatest but the rest of the food is delicious.
4 stars because they do not take American Express :/

I went to a few "Izakaya" place and this one is the best. Best atmosphere, best service, food is awesome. I bring my friends for their birthdays and they don't know what to expect and they fall in love with the restaurant. Reno keep up the great work! Alex and Ben Dover!
Amazing atmosphere. Gets expensive fast but the quality of the food is well worth it. This is a great place you go for a big night out with long time friends.

formatted_address: 410 Place Jacques-Cartier, Montréal, QC H2Y 3B2, Canada
name: Homard Fou - Bistro Français - Fruits de mer - Bar à Vin, Cocktails - Terrasse

reviews.text:
This was our last day in E Canada so I wanted lobster. We sat outside on a lovely warm day. The whole lobster was cut in half and easy to eat. But it was over cooked and dry. It had a coating of crumbs...odd. I was so disappointed after spending so much money for lunch.
My traveling partner ordered the chopped beef lunch special. It was more rare than rare and she could not eat it.

Gross. I wish I could give it 0. This restaurant lost all inspiration. Everything is from frozen. The mussels had a weird smell and they were overcooked. The french fries are obviously made from frozen but they seem refried. The edges are transparent, which says a lot about the lack of cleanliness of the kitchen.  The salad they include is weird tasting with some kind of soggy raddish and Asian dressing. I love Asian food...but this isn't even Asian-cuisine. The fish and chips lacked flavor. The tartar sauce tasted like you kissed a fish in the mouth. Gross. The pasta was mushy and the tomato sauce acidic. This restaurant obviously preys on tourists and doesn't care for repeat business. The bathrooms are dirty. The inside of the restaurant is empty despite the illusion of a full terrace. They also gave us 2 dirty cups and we exchanged them for other dirty cups. Would not recommend.  Locals would never go there by choice.

Probably one of the worst restaurants experiences ever. The only reason this place is in business is because it’s on the busy strip. The food quality was far from great. Service was slow! It took well over an hour to get the food. We had ordered beef hearts and got steak instead. I had ordered dessert with my “three course” dinner. I never got the desert, even though I told three different waiters and they all said they will check on it.. It never came! The ice-tea was room temperature with literary one ice-cube in it! The salad dressing was pretty gross. Overall, I would not recommend this place to anyone!!!!!!!!!!

Food was fine but horrible service.  Had dinner here Sunday October 13th, waiter was a tall blond younger man.  Waiter was dismissive and never returned. Male host brought us silverware, refilled our drinks and offered assistance.  We were never asked once about the quality of our food etc.  waiter popped his head out the door and I raised my hand for assistance, he actually stuck his hand up looked at me and walked away... check came and the waiter had 3 extra wines on our bill.  Another waiter responded to our question because our waiter dropped the check down turned and left. The shorter dark haired host did his best to save our meal.  Taller waiter with short blond hair is the wrong person to represent this business.

Loved it here. Amazing food, amazing service, I would recommend that anyone living in/visiting Montreal makes a stop here! It’s a beautiful summer location in Old Port, eating outside was wonderful. I very much look forward to returning. Thanks to the staff for making our time there excellent!

formatted_address: 1225 Cours du Général de Montcalm, Québec, QC G1R 4W6, Canada
name: Ciel! Bistro-bar

reviews.text: Amazing view, amazing service, and an amazing place to have Sunday brunch. We tried 2 different plates and we were both very happy with the quality price of the food we got. Highly recommended if you visit Quebec City this year.

Amazing view 
The food was tasty - we went for lunch and I ordered green salad with chicken wings. The quantity was very less for chicken wings so I ordered one more wings and after waiting for 20mints staff came to me and said sorry! the chicken is frozen so we can’t prepare right now, you can order something else. Which was turn off .you can go here just to see the 360 view with food and drinks. Thought the staff was very humble and prompt.

Great views, did not feel rushed, our hostess was amazing and made great recommendations! We loved it! My boyfriend said it was the best bread he ever had (lol). Very expensive but, for a special night it was well worth it and amazing !

I did not like this restaurant at all. You have to pay too much but you get a little food with low quality. The fruits were not fresh at all. There was too much oil in my plate. I ordered omelet, it was just egg with some cheese in it. Although, There was some vegetable on the side, but I did not like the omelet at all. It was something you could get with 10 $ not 23 $. The coffee was terrible. I wish it was not included but it was at least better. You only pay for the place. if you go there in the fall you may have a  nice view of the city, but we did not have that either since it was foggy.

This place is definitely worth it! You can get a beautiful 360 degree view of Quebec City while enjoying your delicious meal. 

The beef croquette and the apple risotto were excellent appetizers to start the meal. The risotto was creamy and very well flavoured while the croquette was crunchy and had a meaty richness. 

The main dishes were the highlights of the meal. The chicken ballotine was incredibly tender and the sauce paired very well with the chicken. The scallops were also delicious. They were pan fried to perfection and tasted delicious with their own house smoked bacon. The corn salad was also a nice added touch to the dish and prevented it from being too overwhelming. 

Overall, it was an incredible dining experience and I would definitely recommend coming here!

formatted_address: 97 Rue du Sault-au-Matelot, Québec, QC G1K 3X7, Canada
name: Don Vegan Restaurant - 100% Vegan et Vegetarian - Wine Bar Cocktails

html_attributions: Don Vegan Restaurant - 100% Vegan et Vegetarian - Wine Bar Cocktails
Don Vegan Restaurant - 100% Vegan et Vegetarian - Wine Bar Cocktails
Don Vegan Restaurant - 100% Vegan et Vegetarian - Wine Bar Cocktails
Don Vegan Restaurant - 100% Vegan et Vegetarian - Wine Bar Cocktails
Don Vegan Restaurant - 100% Vegan et Vegetarian - Wine Bar Cocktails
Don Vegan Restaurant - 100% Vegan et Vegetarian - Wine Bar Cocktails
Don Vegan Restaurant - 100% Vegan et Vegetarian - Wine Bar Cocktails
Don Vegan Restaurant - 100% Vegan et Vegetarian - Wine Bar Cocktails

reviews.text: I've had the chance to visit many nice restaurants across Toronto, Montreal and Quebec City and this is seriously one of my favourite. The food is epic, some of the best I've ever had. The tastes are extremely high profile and there's really been a lot of careful thought put into the tastes. Very nice area too. I recommend going in the later evening then for a nice walk in that general area.

Best vegan food in Quebec City by a long shot. Make sure you book as it is usually busy any night of the week. The thing I liked most about this place apart from the high standard of the food of course was the variety, it is not one solo cuisine here which is nice if you and your group have different tastes. Prices are perfect too! Absolutely nothing to complain about here 🙂

This restaurant is a true gem hidden in Quebec city! I am not vegan, nor vegetarian but the food was not lacking whatsoever! 3 out of the 4 people that accompanied me were carnivores and we were all so satisfied! Definitely suggest trying the dumplings (DONplings) and the Ravioli was divine! The service was very prompt and friendly which made my group feel very welcomed and comfortable. We had an anglophone who was not bilingual with us and the waitress was very sweet switching back and forth from French to English. The atmosphere is sophisticated but laid back with the funky decor and graffiti walls. I highly recommend trying this place out if you haven't already, vegan or not, this place is for everyone! I am most certainly returning soon! :)

Lovely restaurant in a beautiful part of downtown Quebec city. The decor is pretty cool - a contrast of vegetation and graffiti art. The menu has a nice choice of vegan dishes. We had the coconut curry (tempeh) and the don risotto. Both were packed with flavour and really delicious. The cocktails were good too. Service was speedy (almost too fast) and friendly - don't be shy to ask what each of the dishes are, they are very nice and take the time to explain the ingredients and textures. We will go back to try some other dishes! They have two sittings, one at 18:30, and another at 20:30. Enjoy!

This place gave me an out of body experience, I’m not even exaggerating. This is the best vegan food I’ve ever had, and I live in one of the top 5 most vegan friendly places in the US. The ravioli was out of this world! Do yourself a favor and eat here while you’re in Quebec. My only regret is not eating here everyday of my trip! And my only complaint is that they don’t sell their recipes! ;)

formatted_address: 8500 Boulevard Henri-Bourassa, Québec, QC G1G 5X1, Canada
name: Bar Billard Blou

reviews.text: Good place if you are looking to fight the owner. Some people just need to feel important . Go to the shaker next door
Super
Billard room
Belle place intimeet relax. On y rencontre du bon monde
Belle place pour prend un verre et jouer au billard

formatted_address: 5375 Av du Parc, Montréal, QC H2V 4G9, Canada
name: Bar Tapas Taza Flores

reviews.text: Fantastic food! We had 6 or so dishes and they are were great! The stand outs were the octopus, beet salad & tartare!! Such a great meal, can't wait to go back.
Amazing food, drink, and awesome atmosphere. My only complaint is that it took wayyy too long between our first course and our second course of food to come out. Otherwise everything was great.
Thank you for an amazing evening the food was so good and the service was phenomenal. Was visiting out of Toronto for my wife’s bday and the experience was amazing. Thank you

Nice atmosphere, good food, short-staffed and not the friendliest service we've had.

We were a group of 22 and we had to fit in an L shaped seating because there are no other spots in the place to accommodate a large group, it was very tight, not recommended for large groups, max 16.
Food was good, we had the group menu: guacamole (very good), tomato/red pepper cold entree (good), calamari(good), beef tataki (the best I've ever had), beef tartare (very good), trout tartare (good), cod fish fingers(very good), garlic shrimps(very good), fries(I found them so so but my wife liked them, I had the impression they were cooked in the same oil as the calamari 🤷🏻‍♂️), shorizo (good), cheese platter (very good selection of delicious Quebec cheeses).
Beautiful place for some drinks. Wonderful and unique cocktails. No wifi though...

formatted_address: 351 Place Royale, Montréal, QC H2Y 2V2, Canada
name: SeaSalt & Ceviche Bar

reviews.text: Steak was nice but not great... seafood.. octopus...overdone....oysters good n coffee great... service was fast n friendly... atmosphere... excellent!!.....price was fair
Went for a private dinner. Very nice and prompt service. Delicious food cooked to perfection. Good selection of wines and our glasses were never empty. I would go again and try your full menu.

The restaurant has arguably one of the nicest corners in the old port of Montreal. The terrasse decor, although quite simple, is also one of the nicest out there. Our waitress was nice and made a few recommendations, which we appreciated. The food was alright. We had a SeaSalt Ceviche, a Crab cake burger and the fish & chips. On their own, the elements were all relatively good (4 stars), but where things felt short is that the fries were clearly sitting in the kitchen waiting for our meals to be done. The fish came back still making steambfrom the hot oil, but the fries were cold. I'm guessing the person who created the menu knew what they were doing, but the kitchen staff seems to he having trouble delivering. Will I be returning back? Maybe, but only for cold appetizers and drinks.
Great food and great service. The oysters were amazingly fresh and the fish and chips was great. My wife loved the lobster roll as well. Would highly recommend

If you love Old Port and seafood this is your jam! We sat on the patio outside and enjoyed some delicious food!

We tried the crab cakes, shrimp and Mac and cheese. All the food was mind blowingly delicious.

Highly recommend :)

formatted_address: PLACE DE LA CITÉ, 2600 Boulevard Laurier #180, Québec, QC G1V 4T3, Canada
name: Restaurant Normandin

reviews.text: We stayed down the road from this restaurant, we ate 3 meals there during our stay.We did order breakfast one night for dinner and then ate breakfast 2 mornings. The staff was amazing, we do not speak French and they spoke broken English but we had no problems communicating to place our order. They were attentive and friendly. All of our meals came out in a timely manner, exactly as we ordered. The food was delicious.
Great place for lunch! Reasonably priced and lots of options, highly recommend the Vegetable Lasagna and Pouding Choumeur - delicious!

Went for supper took 5 minutes for seating but 20 minutes to get served. And 38 minutes later to see our food that was mediocre.  Ordered lasagna and forgot to serve our garlic bread,  never came back to ask if everything was ok.
We went over to the other Normandin but they were closed for renovations and no idea why this was so long and not that great. Usually this place is very good to excellent.  They did have some staff from the renovation restaurant here. With that being said I will give them another try.
Solid service this time around. Food is always good and a great value for the price. Kudos to Amélie for her smile and professional attitude as well as her efficiency.

The food is always good and the price is right. Sometimes the service is not up to par. I went there Saturday, the first waitress that had our table was not in a good mood, a second waitress came to our table thinking we were in her section, the first one came back and complained to the Second one that she was in the wrong section, the they both left us and the second one came back saying she would take care of us from now on! we were happy because she was in an excellent mood and served us very well.

formatted_address: 5617 Rue Sherbrooke Ouest, Montréal, QC H4A 1W4, Canada
name: Rustik Pub & Grill

reviews.text: Overall experience was OK. We felt a bit not welcomed by staff and left after the first beer. They have faithful customers who will stare at you whole time trying to remember if they saw you there before or not. Drinks are cheap. It was late and kitchen was closed so I have no idea about the grill.
I had lots of fun .. like i always do
Relax lowkey place to have a good time. Good prices
Super fun and great prices and even better staff
Its a nice place really but the music wack other than that its ok

formatted_address: 121 Avenue Duluth E, Montréal, QC H2W 1H2, Canada
name: Mollie

reviews.text: Nice patio in the sweet summertime... Very friendly service.  Good beer.
Awesome place with very friendly staff! (Very personable and quite hilarious.) Delicious drinks, great selection of liquor, and outstanding food. Very nice interior design as well.

Top ! Less crowded and more affordable than the neighbouring bars on Duluth, has outdoor seating, top service, super nice server, good beer. Got beer and platter of charcuterie /cheese and portions were good. Will go again
The terrace was wonderful and the staff were so nice! The service was excellent. I'm definitely coming back! What a great atmosphere.
$8.90 for lime custard dessert. It was pretty good.

formatted_address: 1590 Rue Barré, Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 4M6, Canada
name: Tabacalera Aro

reviews.text: Back before I got into wine in 2005 I lived their quality,  price, and team for over 6ish. MC # 4s likely still better than others. ♡
Great cigars. Ho se gurr!

Best cigar spot in town. Great selection and variety. Aro & company are great people and very helpful in helping select cigars. And the first Wednesday of every month they host a "big smoke" BBQ event that is a great party. Highly highly recommend for cigar enthusiasts.
Despite the appearence (which is a bit creapy) the quality is top!! As well prices! Definitely i will go back!
Nice place for cigars

formatted_address: 1041 Rue de Bleury, Montréal, QC H2Z 1M7, Canada
name: Hôtel Monville

reviews.text:
I stayed at this hotel during the Montreal marathon in September because it was near the race start. It’s perfectly located: walking distance to downtown, old Montreal and China town, with easy access to the Metro and airport transportation (by bus).

The hotel is ultra modern and minimalist; if you like that look and feel, it’s really beautiful. Very clean with great service. Our room faced north and had a beautiful view of the city. The only thing that was a bit weird is the walls in the entrance are painted black and the lighting is quite dim. At night, without daylight flooding the room, it was really hard to see anything—I had to feel around for the closet doors. But honestly, that is quite minor.

There is an excellent restaurant downstairs (I had a delicious corn chowder and smoked meat sandwich). 

I’d definitely stay there again and would recommend it.

Honest price/quality ratio, but no wow. Missing on the little finishing details that would make it great.

Staff were nice.  Check-in was a breeze.

The standard rooms are on the smaller side but fine. Bed was comfortable.

Special for drinks and appetizers for habs game, but there was a group celebrating so we couldn't have a seat in view of the game... Kinda defeated the purpose.

I was surprised by this hotel - I wasn’t expecting much but it was all that I could find on last minute notice. It ended up being a very pleasant surprise. Staff are professional - small things like always opening the doors for you - and rooms (while small) are quite modern and comfortable - minimal, but in a cozy way. The employees at the lobby restaurant are the only reason for loss of a star - I don’t need to hear excuses for slow service because of someone not making it in for their shift. This isn’t the customer’s problem to solve.

Very nice staff and amazing service. The rooms are a bit small but for the price and being in downtown they were satisfactory. Overall a great experience. Would definitely recommend.

And also you have to order room service atleast once. Don't ask me why, it will ruin the surprise.

I've stayed here twice and the staff is always respectful and professional. There's one particular Front Desk Agent with curly blonde hair in a high bun and glasses - whose just a bubble of pure joy. She's one of the sweetest staff on duty. The hotel is very elegant and beautifully designed. The French know best on how to utilize space and make it efficient. I love what they've done to the shower, the various doors for privacy, and the automatic curtains. The bed is always cozy and the room is thoroughly cleaned. If you love amenities like me; this hotel has one of the best. The tea selection is amazing for in-room, along with many cups, as well as the shampoo is of good value. And the lighting in-room is best for taking pictures. I've never had any issue with noise or disturbances even whilst staying on a Friday night. May I also add that the proximity to nearby shops and cafe's is very convenient - as the hotel is in the heart of downtown.

formatted_address: 7241 Boulevard Wilfrid-Hamel, Québec, QC G2G 1B8, Canada
name: Cabaret Carol

reviews.text: bon staff, bar pas super propre, et beaucoup de gaffe  mais j'aime le fait que les horaires soient flexibles
Le chinois plein de tattoos qui joue toujours aux machines y joue toujours aux machines .
Le staff es sa coche belle place pour y travailler sa roule bien ambiance chaleureuse 💋
Certaines danseuses sont pas honnête voler un handicapé faut pas avoir de classe . J'ai parlé à  mon grand chum et ces une fausse danseuse surveillé vous ces une noire.
Belle petite place pour aller se faire du fun avec ses petits chums ou sa petite équipe de rap!

formatted_address: 272 Rue Seigneuriale, Québec, QC G1C 3P8, Canada
name: Pizza Passion beauport

reviews.text: SO GOOD! Poutine and pizza were amazing! The staff were very pleasant and friendly. Did I mention the food was SO GOOD!!!
Awesome pizza and poutine. Great service.
Nice restaurant with delicious foods plus friendly staffs. Also love there cool design washroom
Friendly staff and a very delicious pizza.
Great service, great food, waiting is not too long.

formatted_address: 49 Rue Green, Saint-Lambert, QC J4P 1S2, Canada
name: Resto Billard Snooker La Bande Au Coin

reviews.text: A rustic (some would say outdated) decor and average menu offset the popularity and atmosphere of the place. It was busy all throughout our visit on a Saturday afternoon where the clientele was a pleasant mix of hardcore players, couples on dates and entire families sharing a great time. The efficient staff did a great job of keeping up with everything.

old timey pool room featuring the most snooker tables around. Host of several championships including provincial juniors. Opens early, closes late; food and beverage licensed.

League play most of the year, and membership is offered for a nominal amount. (i wonder if that includes a locker) The regulars all have their locker.

Friendly staff, easy parking, and plenty of tables.
It's a family place to go to, good service and what's great is all age to learn to shoot pool.  Did not eat there but they have bar food like Burger fries and more.

It's a great place to spend the evening playing snookers or billiard. The ambiance is calm and the staff are great. If you ever go here, buy yourself an All Dressed Hot-dog, probably one the best Montreal style Hotdogs I ever ate.
Great place to go for a family activity during the weekends that is different for the kids.

formatted_address: 250M Wilfrid-Hamel Blvd, RC15, Quebec City, QC G1L 5A7, Canada
name: SNO Nordik Brewing Company

reviews.text:
Sampled 9 of there 10 beers on tap and I'd categorize all of them as introductory style beers. For those just starting to drink different styles of beer, this is a great place to start as none of the flavor profiles are overly strong and will not offend the sensitive palate. Very good starting point, as many of the better styles have been softened and the flavor intensity scaled down in taste.

The tap room is located in a mall plaza and has a very commercial look and feel. If your in the immediate area is stop by but not worth making a special trip from downtown Quebec City.
Excellent craft beer,  good food and a smiling staff to boot!
Loved the beers I tried. Will definitely come back and I will have to try the food for sure !
Their light beer is very good, very refreshing
Good lager and nice people!

formatted_address: 155 Bates, Local 102, Mount Royal, QC H3S 1A1, Canada
name: Montreal Jazz Trio

formatted_address: 1255 Rue Saint-Vallier O, Québec, QC G1N 1H3, Canada
name: Bar La Babiche

reviews.text: Always a good time there and doing karaoke is fun.
Nice bar
Worst toilets ever. Doors have no lock and no toilet paper avaible. Also only credit or cash is accepted.
냉동피자에 병맥주인데도 맛은 꽤 괜찮았습니다. 월요일 저녁 아무도 없을 때 가서 그런 것인지는 모르겠지만 할아버지 사장님(?)이 짧은 영어로 계속 말 걸어주시고 뭐 물어보면 열심히 대답해주셨어요! 실내에서 담배를 피셔서 놀라긴 했는데 전반적으로 친절하게 해주셔서 만족스러웠습니다 ㅎㅎ

La sélection de bières est assez limitée et de base, mais ça ajoute à l'expérience. Pour une soirée arrosée entre amis qui souhaitent repousser les frontières et se livrer comme jamais, La Babiche is THE place! DJ Gaétan y roule sa bosse depuis longtemps et ça paraît, il mène de main de maître la cérémonie et permet d'enchaîner les hits sans temps mort. Soirée mémorable garantie, même si t'es trop saoul pour t'en souvenir. Cheers!

formatted_address: 8100 Rue Saint-Denis, Montréal, QC H2P 2G6, Canada
name: EtOH Brasserie

reviews.text: It's a great place with a cool vibe. The beers are very good and remind me of my time in Vancouver. The food could be a bit better. There are no fries and the Tortilla chips are unsalted.

Finally got a chance to visit this brewpub, it's far from my house, but the subway is right across the street. We sat at the bar, and Simon the bartender took very good care of us. Excellent variety of beers, with around 20 taps, and everything we tried was spot on.
The food options were simple, sandwiches, salads, chilli, cheese and charcuterie plates, but everything was delicious and reasonably priced.
I really liked it here, and I'll be back!
Very nice bar! Would go again for beers 🍻🍺
This place is great. It offers a great variety of beers and it's in the middle of a lively street. Sometimes the music can be a bit too loud but I like it nonetheless. The service is great too
Good and big place, loses stars because they don't serve tequila. Yes : it is an essential drink wherever you are located. Sorry if you don't agree.

formatted_address: 700 Rue De La Gauchetière O, Montréal, QC H3B 4L5, Canada
name: Aria

reviews.text: 4 star typical restaurant. Would give 5 if salad was fresher

The best experience in the vicinity. John's Filet mignon is a must try! Angie's welcoming staff are just on point!
Good job to all!!!
They offer a vast variety of fresh food. I liked dining here. Staff members are always super nice, rates are affordable and the spot is always neat.
Had the tuna steak and it was an amazing choice. As good as a beef steak. Would recommend.

It's one of my go to lunch spot to meet with my colleagues. Food is good, a bit on the expensive side. We never needed a reservation to go there. The location is so convenient, right inside the BNC building.

formatted_address: 8660 Boulevard Maurice-Duplessis, Montréal, QC H1E 3L1, Canada
name: Café Cortina Bar

reviews.text: Guido and Tina are the best people in the world! This bar is nothing without them. 10/10 recommend
A nice place to join up with friends .
Very nice waitress. Quiet enough spot for a break during weeknights..
Great place to have a drink and coffee
I have ordered a take out veggie wrap several times a d I never had an issue. Today is a different story. The wrap was extremely soggy. I couldn't eat it.

formatted_address: 9530 Boulevard de l'Acadie, Montréal, QC H4N 1L8, Canada
name: Nostos

reviews.text: The best charcoal grilled chicken I’ve tasted in Montreal! Very juicy, tender and flavorful. Prices are good for the portions that you get. Staff are super nice and welcoming. It’s a great place for an outing with friends and family.

Very family oriented place with great service. Although it does get very busy, every time of the day, the service and food is great and affordable. A nice place to take your kids for some quality time.
Very good food but they don't hire enough servers (only 2 on Wednesday) and it was full. I will come back to try the rest of the menu.
Great meeting spot for lunch.  Great prices and very good quality.  Quick friendly service as well.  Highly recommend.
Excellent Greek chicken. Delicious.

formatted_address: 4922 Rue Sherbrooke Ouest, Westmount, QC H3Z 1H3, Canada
name: Estiatorio Kavos

reviews.text: Food was great and the servers are really nice! We were a big group but they still took the time to care for us. The ambiance is a little dark, perfect for dates or family dinners.
50/50 good vs disappointing dishes. For the price it should all be amazing. There's way better Greek food in Montreal. Food gets a 3 but the attentive service gets a 5.

The restaurant is beautiful and interesting. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. The food is fantastic! The Atlantic Mussels and Chicken Skaras were particularly delicious (see picture). Fair prices, highly recommended (just avoid the black liquorice candy on the way out ;-) )
Good food. Better service.

We had our company holiday party at Kavos last night and it was the first time every employee and partner loved the food. The chicken, lamb chops and fish were outstanding. The appetizers were out of this world. We were a group of 27 and service was top notch. 

Thank you to all the staff at Kavos for making the Mondo Payments holiday party a memorable one !!!

formatted_address: 1820, av. Pierre-Péladeau local FA01, Laval, QC H7T 2Z1, Canada
name: Jack Astor's Bar & Grill

reviews.text: Great service, we were honestly worried that there would be a language barrier as that was the first place we have gone so far. English menu and the staff we bilingual. Our waiter was very very polite and attentive. The buddah salad was delicious, the fried chicken was better than we imagined it could be, the buffalo chicken sandwich was also very good and the fries were perfectly crispy.

I visited this restaurant on Saturday June 2nd. We went with a group of friends three kids included. First time for me, but our friends knew already the place that is why they recommended it to us. Since we announced our presence, the staff was ready to received us, as we reserved a table the day before. We started ordering some soft drinks and 15 minutes later, we placed our order.
