It didn’t take much for our food to arrive. I was impressed by the presentation of my dish and later, by the flavours. I chose the Bombay Chicken Curry Bowl and it was really amazing! I don’t know if it was the sauce mixed with the ingredients, but it was delicious. Kids chose their menus and they were very happy, they ate them all! I went to the bathroom and I could observe that the entire place it’s very clean. I also liked the ambience; they have TV screens all over the place. They have a “Sharables” option; I recommend trying the Golden Calamari, really special. They offer Pick Up service or Skip the dishes, also, you can subscribe on line to their email list to receive exclusive offers and treatment. I enjoy a lot my experience there, I’ll definitely return from time to time!

As a bar this place is super good, the bar side is really cool with variety of drinks
The place is clean service was perfect too.
The food is delicious but the size of the meal should be bigger compared to the price, in my opinion.
Very youngish style of restaurant, loud and alive. They have a very special way of celebrating a birthday wish is fun. The food and drinks are awesome fresh and rich ingredients .

Service is nice and the atmosphere is enjoyable. However, my pasta dish, for which I paid extra for chicken, tasted very bland. As for the actual pieces of chicken, they were very overcooked and ranged from strangely rubbery to hard. The nachos however were good.

formatted_address: 2155 Avenue Chauveau, Québec, QC G2C 1B2, Canada
name: Brasserie Lionel Inc

reviews.text: Does not accept any cards (credit or debit). No food menu. Basically a tavern like thee old days.
Beau petit bar de quartier sportif, bière pas cher -> 4,75$ la pinte. C'est rendu dur à battre.

Stephany est belle beaucoup Elle est brillante top shape je l'aime comme amie oupluszz
💵
Chill. Ya rien qu'ya changer depuis 20 ans.
Lendroit des sportif...bonne biere,bon service,bon prix et surtout belle ambiance

formatted_address: 6700 Boulevard Pierre-Bertrand, Québec, QC G2J 1A8, Canada
name: Café-Bistro La Pause

reviews.text:
Awesome place.

The food is very good and the owner( which is currently the only usual worker) Is super nice.

Usually open from Monday to Friday for breakfast and lunch and the close time varies depending on the owner schedule.

You can always call to get something prepared in Advence or verify the open hours.

Bottom line: I'm happy to have this bistro so close to were I work.

I am an happy customer.
Proprio ou gérante très sympathique, le café Coffee Crisp était excellent et unique!
Super bon.poulet
Un régal.  Service courtois et  sympathique
La poutine est une des très bonne en ville. Le club sandwich est un incontournable.

formatted_address: 2600 Boulevard Laurier, Québec, QC G1V 4T3, Canada
name: Les Jardins de Babylone

formatted_address: 48 Rue Saint-Paul, Québec, QC G1K 3V7, Canada
name: Louise Taverne & Bar à Vin

reviews.text: Beautiful restaurant in the heart of old Quebec. Staff were welcoming without being too obvious but the menu was the show stopper. Numerous dishes prepared to perfection and each one was carefully curated for maximum impact. Great wines accompanied the meal and experienced Sortilege whiskey for the first time and guaranteed it won't be the last ! Only one suggestion ...replace the paper napkins with linen.

Very nice restaurant, did not personally eat their but enjoyed their beverages. Very nice cocktail selection and the drinks were made well! Definitely suggest to stop by if you are in the area. Location is beautiful!
Cute little restaurant. Server was pleasant. I tried their fish and chip. Delicious. Not oily. I loved their fries.

Quaint atmosphere, flavorful menu with interesting combinations. Daily specials and Chefs Choice. Cocktails!
This isn't a large place, and it's busy, so reservations are recommended.
The servers are very helpful and friendly.

Wednesday night, hitting Quebec at 5pm with no idea where to eat. Quite a few in neighborhood but tried Louise Taverne and so glad we did. Without reservation we wete seated in comfortable seats at the bar. Staff very friendly to us and we were able to observe all great food coming from kitchen. We enjoyed the fish & chips, very hot and plentiful. Salad was fresh, cold and flavorful. Highly recommend.

formatted_address: 3481 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2X 2T6, Canada
name: Urban Science presents #LeCypher

formatted_address: 585 Boulevard Charest E, Québec, QC G1K 3J2, Canada
name: La Revanche

reviews.text:
Nice selection of games, you can't go there to eat or drink only so prepare yourself to pay 7$ for sitting if you don't want to play.
Regarding food, it's pub food, could have more quantity for the price though.

Too expensive, but a lot of table games. I forgot to mention that the animation-explanation team was excellent.
I thought that if my food-beverages consumption was adequate, the playing fee costs would not apply, but it was not like that. Hence the total cost was quite expensive for me.

Favorite coffee shop in LA, or maybe the US....I end up getting two coffees everytime...the pour overs are strong and flavorful and the document latte is delicious. Also highly recommend the affogato.
Great game suggestions from the game master. It was nice that they could explain rules in English for the games. Time flies here!

♡An amazing place to try new table and board games with friends ! 
♡It can get packed pretty fast, so come early 
♡The food and drinks are a little bit pricey For example: 7,50 for a latte with Coureur des Bois in it (It was delicious though)

formatted_address: 3401 Boulevard Sainte-Anne, Québec, QC G1E 3L4, Canada
name: Batifol Bar & Grill

reviews.text: Had some breakfast and some lunch items - good variety, solid foods! It took our waitress 2 extra reminders to order one of our food items, but other than that she was very nice! The “fresh” juice ($5 per glass) is fresh from the bottle/box, but not freshly squeezed:/

My son has a severe egg allergy, and unfortunately his experience was terrible: they served him a plate that included his allergen in two of the three items, despite his asking they confirm his meal did not include eggs before ordering it.

They did serve him a second plate, that he seemed to enjoy very much.

I write this review in the hope that the owner takes the initiative to have his employees go through allergen sensitivity training.

If you have food allergies you might want to keep away unless you get stronger assurances they take this seriously.
Good food, good service
The menu is simple but fun interesting diversity. It was quiet and service was fast and polite

Had the simplest breakfast out of a table of 4 and was served few minutes after my friend. Unfortunately eggs were cold. Also would prefer fresh fruit over fruit salad. 13$ for 2 eggs sausage and bacon is too expensive considered the whole experience.

reviews.text:
I got to say I really appreciate the service I got at Palason. I came in looking for a good set of darts. 

I knew I was in the right place. The amount of pool tables, foosball tables, ping pong tables, dart boards and accessories of all kinds was impressive. The service was very friendly and helpful and courteous. 

Even though I spent a little bit more than I wanted to, I got a really good set of darts. And when I used them later that night in the tournament, I played better than I played in a long time!
Great store pool tables, accessories, other games and man cave furniture and signs.

Worst service ever, bought a table there a year ago, installation was terrible, table was totally beat up and was supposed to be a demo but was just beat up. I had to fight with them pay the difference and finally change it for a new model, but had to comeback 2 times to fix small issue and the last time the installation guy was not able to fix it, so hey told me a supervisor will call me back.... They never did I had to send an email back 8 months after to do a follow up..... Long story short a year after today, I still try to get my table fix but say they cannot do it before Januray 2020 since my table is back order. Never go there go somewhere else !!! Worst service ever !

I purchased my patio furniture and parasol from them about 5 years ago. 2 of the screws of my parasol broke so I had to contact the store. They found my file right away and the manager (Jean-Pierre) was helpful. He directed me to bring the parasol to their warehouse in Lachine. I went to meet Eric and Greg. They fixed my parasol in under 15 minutes - free of charge! Very efficient, knowledgeable and kind people! Great customer service! Thank you, guys! :)
This place anything you need to make an awesome adult playroom. Even some old school pinball games. Helpful employee as well.

formatted_address: 5930 1re Ave, Québec, QC G1H 2W1, Canada
name: Bar Restaurant La Bourgeoise

reviews.text: Good price and quiet atmosphere. Affordable beer.
Fake live music
Cool
Mk
No 1

formatted_address: 3702 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2X 2V4, Canada
name: Bar Bifteck St-Laurent

reviews.text: The description says it all. Great place to bring big groups, since they have tons of space (two floors) and a lot of mobile seating. Plus, they have unlimited FREE popcorn. The servers are always attentive and polite. The beer is standard but there isn't an amazing selection.
Love George!

The server Crissie was AMAZING! She moved a bunch of tables for us, was so kind even tho she was so sick and she checked up on us so much throughout the night! Also loved the sweater Crizzie! Will definitely be back!

This is an easy going happy hour bar (at least in the winter). English is spoken ungrudgingly and the staff shares local knowledge with customers that are not from Montreal.  Locals here are friendly as well.
WE LOVE KRISSY! Nicest server ever. Promote her so that she owns the place

formatted_address: 5885 Avenue Papineau, Montréal, QC H2G 2W5, Canada
name: Grozépa restaurant microbrasserie

reviews.text:
We got there 5 min before our reservation which was at 9pm, we waited until 9:16 to get a table and there was some people who were coming after us and they get tables yet we came early to get our table on time but still we had to wait that long. 
After getting a table it took longer to get asked out orders and after we order and we got drinks on 9:47 pm after 30 ish min after ,  food came a little  late too you can tell.  But honestly after all the food was good. But if they can correct this it will be great

Nice spot, cozy, staff are fun , friendly,courteous. The manager is also very present. From checking up on guests,  making sure we're all satisfied. Food is good and a good portion for the price. DJ is nice, played a nice variety of tracks to satisfy every type of crowd. Place is clean as well. I've been twice during the holidays and yesterday for a friend birthday and definitely will go back. You have a limited space if you wanna get up and sance. Keep up the great work.

Nicely renovated place. Adequate lighting. Those who are sports fanatics will appreciate the tv's that at available. Beer selection on tap are all light beers so if you enjoy dark beers their selection will not satisfy you. Staff is friendly and professional. I would visit again to see if they could gain that extra star.

Everything was pretty good, I really liked everything we had. For 5$ the menu, you have many choices and the place is friendly. The service was quick and the waiter was always there to keep up the service. The dessert was awesome. Ive to go back for sure.

Love coming here for a late-night snack. Their pizza are so delicious! Everything is 5$ but for sure you will find extra$ a little bit everywhere in the menu. Sangria is ok but I don't recommand their cocktails... lack of alcohol. Service is average.

formatted_address: 7805 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2R 1X1, Canada
name: Le Mojito Restaurant Montreal

reviews.text: During my visit to Quebec, I enjoyed the excellent food and drinks of the restaurant "Le Mojito", the best mojitos I have ever tasted and the delicious flavor of the food, all fresh and of high quality, I will definitely return.
Tasty Cuban food!!! Mojitos are excellent, the staff super friendly 👍

Excellent choice for expending your journey with your friends or family. The services is amazing, they explain you every details and the food tastes as a real Cuban food. The prices are a little higher than others Cuban restaurants and the place is small so is better to reserve in advance.
good treatment, excellent food and a variety of drinks, exquisite cocktails and food with good flavor and just made 200% recommended
The food, the drinks, the staff, the atmosphere was amazing. Best Cuban food in Montreal. Thank you for a wonderful evening and birthday celebration. Will be back again!!!

formatted_address: 5843 Av du Parc, Montréal, QC H2V 4H4, Canada
name: Voggas Bar & Grill

reviews.text: This place is amazing, food is beyond great, with very good price, their Loukanikos is amazing a must try!
Best greek food, good portions. Souvlaki porc is amazing there and so is the loukaniko. Cheap prices

You know when there are some places you just keep going back to?  This is the place for us.  Great greek food, nice, simple, clean ambiance, great terrasse, great Greek frappé :)   And catching a game here is awesome!  You even see the old greeks playing cards in the back. Don't expect anything fancy, you wont be dissappointed!
Perfect place for a nice meal and drink! The staff make you feel at home and are always upbeat. The pork pita is a must try.
Good spot, friendly staff, service is a little slow but good.

formatted_address: 4664 Rue Jarry E, Saint-Léonard, QC H1R 1X3, Canada
name: Cafe Capo-Chino

reviews.text: Great cafe
Un merveilleux petit café ... et ce autant pour un espresso qu'une petite glace

formatted_address: 278 Rue Elgar, Verdun, QC H3E 1C9, Canada
name: La Socca

reviews.text: Local bar with great food... And awesome staff

Nice neighborhood restaurant, usually we go there for drinks and we take the fried calmars average taste. The staff is very friendly, we feel welcomed every time... the prices are reasonable, the overall atmosphere is great, thus I would recommend
The pizza was great in this place. Staff and owner were very friendly. will go back again
Food is good, service is good but no personality in the place
Tasty food..good service...will go back again

formatted_address: 3565 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2X 2T6, Canada
name: Club Rendez-Vous

reviews.text: Love every minute if my night
Dj wasnt the best
Good Beer, Good Service
Awesome place with great French music
Good experience

formatted_address: 859 Avenue Myrand, Québec, QC G1V 2V8, Canada
name: L'Gros Luxe Québec

reviews.text: Nice place, good food, good music great service.
Great food. great service. excellent beer. Small portion though
Good pub food. Affordable. Great service but quite a wait!
The food was okey and I liked the place in general.
Excellent pulled-pork J'ADORE

formatted_address: 470 Rue De La Gauchetière O, Montréal, QC H2Z 1E3, Canada
name: Fiorellino

reviews.text: One of Montreal's better pizza joints. The wood fired oven makes for some great pizzas which aren't too filling. They have a good choice between tomato based and cream based toppings and sauces which is nice. The decor and ambiance lends itself well to date nights, pizza with friends or family functions. The service has always been impeccable. My only complaint is that the non-pizza food is so-so, not bad in anyway, just not great.

Last March I was in Italy, and the food was spectacular. It is hard to find an equivalent over here. Fiorellino has very authentic Italien pizza. The pizza crust is PERFECT, and done very thin but not hard and crispy. The buffalo mozzarella was perfect - it brought me back to Tuscany!
I only wished the wait staff were a bit more attentive. I wasn't able to get a second glass of the great wine I enjoyed with the meal. I could have easily hailed a waiter,  but my mouth was full of pizza!
Still - high praise and top recommendations for Fiorellino.

We went to dinner at Fiorellino while visiting Montreal. It was a totally unplanned visit but we were pleasantly impressed. Had two pizzas between the 4 of us as we weren’t all that hungry and it was the perfect size for us. The pizzas were both very tasty. The decor was nice and cozy. For a small restaurant they had lots of people working so service was fast!  So fast that my water glass was always filled to the top (might not be a big deal for many but for me it felt like someone was always checking on our table to make sure that we had what we needed). We hope to try their other dishes in the future when we visit Montreal again.

I would strongly encourage you to disregard some of the lower rated reviews. I did not experience any of their concerns. The restaurant certainly has nothing to do with a school cafeteria, nor do any of the ingredients taste "bland". The tagliatelle was cooked perfectly "al dente", not undercooked, that's just how classic Italian pasta is cooked. The pasta was rich in flavor rather than salty and it wasn't oily at all, the oil created a wonderful sauce. As far as the pizza goes I can only compliment them on a great dough, a flavorful sauce and great cheese. I would also like to add that they used very high quality meat for their toppings. The prosciutto was directly cut off a big piece of meat and you could really taste the quality. Their food was so good that I returned the next night.
Omg, the pizza here is one of the best I've had in Montreal! Great vibes, friendly staff, authentic Italian feeling. Will come again for sure!

formatted_address: 22 QC-138, Kahnawake, QC J0L 1B0, Canada
name: Microbrasserie Kahnawake Brewing Company

reviews.text:
Very nice place, excellent service  with lots of free parking.
I went for a Christmas party in the evening so can't comment on the regular day schedule, but I liked it enough I'm planing to go back soon.
They have tours of the brewery during the day shift which I'd like to visit.
This might seem odd, but I liked the bathroom. It was unique and clean.
I added two pictures, because I didn't see any posted... 😎

Friendly staff & chill ambiance. Food is good & with a greater selection of drinks now, (not just beer),  it makes for a fun night out! 
Watch your favorite sports, sing karaoke or listen to live bands...they have it all :))
Great variety of beer for all taste. They also have basic cocktails and wine. I don't recommend going for food though - very basic options (popcorn!)
Really enjoyed my first visit. Cant wait to be back. Great beer and food. Must visit

I really enjoyed this brewpub. Beers were good (Porter, Session IPA) to great (Saison). 
Friendly, bilingual staff.
The tacos were phenomenal. Seriously, like better than some "authentic" Mexican places in the city. Fresh, flavorful and generous.
The only downside I can think of is that this place is too far from my house!

formatted_address: 6821 Rue St-Hubert, Montréal, QC H2S 2M7, Canada
name: South Beach Club de Nuit

reviews.text: Good music. Laking a little of mixing. Too much of a genre is not good. But after that, nice club. Gotta add an atm and you need to accept cards too not just cash.
Is ok the decoration but very bad organisation for events

Nothing wow! Didn't even remember I went there!
But my date will tell you how the bar service is better at your local bingo spot
Poorly organized, very expensive for what you get. Sadly it's a popular place for latino events so you don't have much of a choice to go there.
Dance floor a bit small, but the latin evening was quite enjoyable.

formatted_address: 3495 Boulevard Taschereau, Saint-Hubert, QC J4T 2G2, Canada
name: Le Célébrité

reviews.text: Gluten free options available and if you are celiac just speak to the chef or you can even bring your own stuff and he will gladly make a little something for you!

If the prices where 50% less it'd be acceptable. But the quality of food is very poor.
Service was also sub-par, I left disappointed on all fronts. I gave it 2* because my son enjoyed the spaghetti 🤷🏻‍♂️
Maybe they're better at breakfast but the cooks obviously don't know how to make dinners. Don't waste your money.
Great food and fast service

Great specials but portions are small.
Still a quaint little place and some nights they have some pretty talented singers.

We went for breakfast with our 4 month old in tow. The breakfast was great, service was great as well. Only thing i was disappointed about was the lack of a change table in the bathrooms. Sure its a resto bar, however considering they serve breakfast, they should expect people are bringing their children. I had to lay her change mat out on a chair in the outer bathroom area and change her there quite awkwardly.

formatted_address: 2X1, 8160 Rue Juliette, Lasalle, QC H8N 1W8, Canada
name: Daisy

formatted_address: 22 Rue du Quai, Sainte-Pétronille, QC G0A 4C0, Canada
name: Restaurant La Goéliche

reviews.text: Delicious poutine, quaint and lovely setting on the water.

The restaurant is by the water. The food and the service was excellent. We ordered the "Deer" which was deer meat, very tender, with king mashrooms and green beans from the garden, and the "Ravioli with beef stew" which was really good too. Unique cooking and very tasty. I would recommend both these dishes.
My husband and I had the lobster rolls here and they were amazing. Recommended Wine and local beer selection was great with our meal. Great place to have lunch while touring the island.
Great ambiance....and the food is pretty good as well.
The food was a little overpriced but okay and the view is really cool. Unfortunately our waiter was extremely unfriendly.

formatted_address: 3864 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2W 1Y2, Canada
name: Main Deli - Smoked Meat - Steak - Poutine

Main Deli - Smoked Meat - Steak - Poutine - Burgers

reviews.text: Really awesome deli! Friendly owner and the smoked meat is the best!
This place is a great alternative to waiting in line at Swartz. Ruben is super tasty! And don't forget to change up your fries to onion rings. And get the matzo ball soup!

Best Beef Liver you’ll ever eat

I visit one or twice a year after a local friend introduced me to this odd specialty - Like most people I don’t really like liver. But after trying it here (rare is better) with the spices and garlic - wow. It’s heaven every time! 

Coleslaw and pickle with the Black Cherry make it a Montreal treat. 

It’s across the street from Schwartz’s and you can laugh at all the tourists standing in line for what you can get instantly across the street. 

Highly recommend.

This place is my first choice place.  Of all restaurants I know I favor it most. I always suggests to my friends to go to that place. when  I want to go to a good meal, this is the place that comes instantly to my mind. good and all sorts of  food and a large list of dishes.helpful staff, and pleasant ambience. In addition to that, the tariff is modest. I suggest this spot with no hesitation.

Incredible Montreal-style smoked meat sandwiches and sides. No queues here. Ordered one full fat and medium fat sandwich. The soup was light and hearty. Incredible flavor and generous portions too.

All hail the underdog.

formatted_address: 1101 Rue de Bleury, Montréal, QC H2Z 1N1, Canada
name: Belon

reviews.text:
We had a reservation for Montreal à table. We got there a bit early and we were seated. The restaurant was dim and music was louder than it should be. My friends and I were seated at the "counter". They said they were full and all the upstairs was empty. Service was nice and quite fast. 
There were no more brownies, which wasn't cool. We had pavlova, which was a very small portion. All the portions were small. I know it's Mtl à table and all, but it was dinner. Portions could have been a bit bigger.
I don't usually say this, but their washrooms were very original! Very clean.

Service was outstanding. We were greeted with kind and quick service. Brendan behind the bar was extremely helpful with the menu, as we don’t speak French. I would definitely recommend eating here. A little pricey, but you get your money’s worth in quality and service. I could eat their seafood sauce by the spoonful!

Very good seafood restaurant, reasonable selection of dishes. Modern seafood cuisine. Good service, modern interiors (bar area as well as separate dishes), attentive and very friendly staff. Food is very good value for money, drinks are a bit pricey. Wine menu sufficiently large with good wines on offer. Located very closely to various main hotels.
We were 2, it was excellent services and foods. Strongly recommend to friends and family

I had an amazing dining experience here. The seafood platter was mouth-wateringly delicious. I had the squid with Israeli couscous for my main course and a delicious creme brule for my dessert. Their mixed drinks were delicious. The interior was very classy with dim lighting. I can't wait to have another fantastic dinner here.

formatted_address: 1284 Boulevard Bastien, Québec, QC G2K 1G2, Canada
name: Le Snack Branché

reviews.text: Already at the entrance it is easy to see the warm and pleasant atmosphere like urban Chic Resto. As for poutine, we are offered an infinity of choices. For conservatives there is the standard poutine very delicious, but for people who want to experience the real poutine according to your imagination. There are several choices of sauces, meats, vegetables and cheeses that you can add to your taste. I can only tell you GOOD APPETITE & good experience.
By far the best poutine in the Lebourgneuf area. The sizes are really generous and the sauces are great (favorite one is the BBQ or the Thai sauce when I want something spicy).
Awesome food, fast prepare and nice staff
Crazy good poutine for great prices. The staff also was very helpful considering i dont speak french.
Delicious poutine. Have had poutine all over Québec and this is by far the best I have had. They kick it up a notch with additions and combinations of different meats, sauces, cheese, etc..

formatted_address: 4051 Rue Saint-Dominique, Montréal, QC H2W 2A8, Canada
name: Café Central Portugais

reviews.text: Excellent 4 my expresso and short stay. Friendly place specially the staff. Quick polite service. Helpful in 3 languages! French English Portuguese . possibly more! Will return specially when I am in the vicinity.i did return Dec 2018.always busy & crowded. Male dominated. 3-4 over all t.v. stations. Soccer priority. Renewed my expresso. Same taste. On Duluth Ave. A visit is a must.staff so busy to take orders so my wish in print! Happy new 2019.

This is a great little Portuguese coffee shop. They serve authentic Portuguese espresso and even have a great selection of Portuguese brandy. There are always Portuguese tv shows and sports playing on the big screen. The staff are very friendly. It's definitely worth a stop when you are in Montreal.
Not a big place, but quite big in the heart, awesome daily specials on food too...!!
Great place to eat and watch a soccer game
Amicable !   Love the cafe.

formatted_address: 2 Rue de la Commune O, Montréal, QC H2Y 4B2, Canada
name: Riva

reviews.text:
Nice sunny terrace bar and that's all. Service is very  slow. Food is ordinary nothing crazy. 
 Waitress tells you one thing about the dish and another thing is brought to you.  I only recommend bottled beers. Cocktails and sangria not good very either. Sorry, but all you have is a very nice location in a very busy area and I'm sure the place wouldn't look busy if it wouldn't be  only for tourists that get trapped for the first time.

I stopped here because I was waiting on my husband for our night on a boat event. The terrace is very attractive on a sunny warm day. One drink turned it to several beers and an appetizer. This is not a place if you're on a budget, it is to indulge. I have to say by reading the other reviews, there's somewhat something about the speed of the service but, as a customer, you have to get noticed when you get into a place. The terrace area is quite large and there's so much surface one can keep in focus. I wouldn't purposely organized some time to come back here but I would certainly stop by if I'm in the area with some spare time.
Good place for lunch. Took the meal for 4. The pizza is very good and they have a good selection for prosecco.

The place is beautiful, but it's extremely overpriced. I guess it makes sense since it's in the old port and you're overlooking the water. I came here to eat one evening but they only told us that the kitchen was closed once we sat down.

Very nice place. The service was excellent ! Thank you Anthony you’re awesome, best server around. Love the aperitivo style with amazing pizzas ... Must try if you love pizza 🍕 Kevin the manager took care of us really nicely for our group and made sure everything was fine. If you need to be served like a VIP follow the French accent. Enjoy!

Ps : The only problem we had, was cheap customers complaining for ice cubes in their  sangria for no reasons who wanted to save on the tip cause they got surprised by the bill...
McDonald’s not far tho...

formatted_address: 1231 Avenue Lajoie, Outremont, QC H2V 1P2, Canada
name: Alma

reviews.text:
I'm on the fence about this place. It is food that goes out of my comfort zone which I like but I didn't like what I ate. Not sure if it was because it was out of my comfort zone or it was bad. 

My uncle hosted his after wedding dinner here and so we were a group of 13 people separated in two tables on the terrace. 

The service was pretty bad in my opinion, this could be because I was at the kids table and so the waitress was a bit snobbier/careless because she knew we weren't paying. She would forget our drinks and/or not listen to what we wanted. 

It was a lengthy meal, with about 5-6 services. Lots of entrees: olives, asparagus, sausage, oysters. 

I did like that they included vegan options, since two of my cousins are vegan. There was a mushroom paste toast as their main meal.
The other main meal was fish. 

I had to leave before dessert was served but it was cake. 

I would not come back.
Amazing little gem in outremont with great tapas, great service and an amazing wine list! A must for wine lovers and catalan cuisine!

What a glorious gem!! The food and wines at Alma were all spectacular, and the service was impeccable. Especially recommended if you want to try hard-to-get natural wines from Spain...their selection made my jaw drop. I can't wait to go back!
A must visit from the same people who brought you Farine. Great attention to detail, excellent food and service. Nice selection of organic wines. Chef Juan Lopez and Lindsey have delivered big time!

Alma is one of my favorite restaurants in Montreal.  The food is absolutely fresh and delicious and if you enjoy natural wines, they offer a great selection.  The owners and their staff are passionate and knowledgeable and will make you discover fabulous wines.  The restaurant is cosy and has a very beautiful terrasse to be enjoyed in good weather.  The perfect spot on a nice summer evening.  If you enjoy tasteful tapas and wine, Alma is the perfect place.  I highly recommend it!

formatted_address: 332 Rue Saint-Jacques, Lachine, QC H8R 1E2, Canada
name: Scarface Entertainment

formatted_address: 6804 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2S 3C7, Canada
name: Bar Sportivo

reviews.text: This is an important part of the Montreal, little Italy experience.  Salvitore will tell you the sweetest stories of his time in Montreal,  and takes great pride in his photo books. The coffee is great and the place has a real old school vibe. Come here if you're looking for a little experience with your cup of coffee

Love this place! It has a retro Italian vibe and great coffee. The owner is very welcoming and makes you feel like you are at home. If you are in that area you should swing by and enjoy a cafe au lait while having a chat with Salvatore!
Cozy ,very Italian,  friendly staff great coffee and tiramisu ...love it. I'll go back again:)

Don’t waste your time going to cafe Italia two doors down, this place has the most legit espresso in all of Montréal.
We had a double espresso at Cafe italia and was horrible and expensive plz don’t waste ur time 
We walked 4 meters down the road found this cafe 
And the owner was amazing omg his espresso was the best ever old classic Italian beans 

Love it.

Friendly service, quality of food and beverage not so great, however for the price you pay this was ok. This is a sports bar where you can see a ton of relics from the bar owner's past. 😀 TV screens are not huge, but if you are sitting close enough and have a good company! you are ok. 😀

formatted_address: 4854 Avenue Dornal, Montréal, QC H3W 1V8, Canada
name: Lacasa

formatted_address: 2981 Boulevard Saint-Martin O, Laval, QC H7T 2Y8, Canada
name: Restaurant Louis & Jacob

reviews.text:
We went for their all you can eat tartare special and were overall kind of disappointed. The variety of tartare was good but the quality wasn’t the best. Service was very slow, which is understandable on such a busy night. Although out waitress was very confused and kept forgetting us. 

Interesting concept & beautiful restaurant though.

I had an eye on this restaurant not too long ago, ever since I got a glimpse of a positive comment from the Montreal Blog, that I like to read from time to time. 

What stole my attention was an AYCE Tartare (only on Tuesdays for a limited time)    Fascinating!  Googled Louis & Jacob Resto Bar and captivated by what I read “Our mission is to see you again.”   ... and  ... “Il y a de fortes chances que chez Louis & Jacob vous sort de votre zone de confort”

As this IS my “zone de confort”, this was the moment I have been waiting for.   Lots of parking outside,  with a very chic and sophisticated ambiance inside.  We were seated in a chilly section inside the restaurant, and they cranked up the heat, following our request. 

There were 3 varieties of tartare, beef & sausage, fish and a seafood assortment, accompanied by a salad and fries.   These were not true tartare in the literal sense of the word, as I would not be inclined to have raw sausage.  The fish, however, would barely touch the frying pan, in my opinion.  So good!
Needless to say that this is a tartare fiesta that we kept on indulging without the fries, this time.  The tartare was a tad too salty, more so with the beef & sausage.  The one thing that stopped us from going on is as you get fuller, the saltiness became more pronounced. 

Service from Mirinda, our waitress, was impeccable.  

Overall, well worth the experience.
An amazing, cozy little place. Definitely a repeat here. Service was great and food even better.
Awesome tartar, all you can eat tartars on Tuesday and they give you a selection of four really good ones!

As a vegan it can be really hard to find a restaurant where both non vegans and vegans can enjoy themselves. Louis&Jacob is the only restaurant that offers a full vegan menu as well as a classical non vegan menu in Laval! And their food is exceptionally divine 🤤
Owners are also very sweet and polite!
Would defenetly recommend this place, whether or not you are vegan! 🥂

formatted_address: 6970 15e Avenue, Montréal, QC H2A 2T7, Canada
name: maison michel

formatted_address: 2851 Rue Allard, Montréal, QC H4E 2M1, Canada
name: Dilallo burger Original 1929

reviews.text: What can I say about this burger? It’s amazing, tender, delicious! I can go on! Price is decent, $14 for a buck burger, onion rings and a drink. On the burger comes these pickled peppers which are amazing, I’ve eaten a lot of burgers in Montreal and it seems that dillalo is one of the few spots I always return to. It’s been around since 1929 and still killing it, give this place a try!

Ordered a buck burger as a combo for takeout. The burger itself was quite small, the bread wasn't too special. I liked the handmade patty, but it wasn't seasoned enough. I really enjoyed the toppings as I haven't seen that done much. The fries were really good! The diet coke from the tap was disappointing, as if they were running low on the syrup. Overall okay place. On the pricey side.
Spicy chicken burger was really tasty and full of flavours. Service was quick and friendly.

ordered a buck burger trio. The burger was decent, pattie texture was light and fluffy, a little blend though. The fries were not so good, not crispy, very oily and damp. Restaurant environment is nice.

Loved this place the burgers and fries are super tasty! I went there with my father and they brought us our 2 burgers that we asked for, but I asked for no tomatoes in mine and they made a mistake and added tomatoes. I didn’t say anything I just started to take them out and the manger said “oh ya it’s true you didn’t want tomatoes, hold on” He came back with another burger the way I wanted it and he gave it to us for free. So all that to say the managers, staff, and service are all excellent! Great experience🍔🍟

formatted_address: 1198 Rue Sainte-Catherine O, Montréal, QC H3B 1K1, Canada
name: Mister Steer - Dejeuner - Burgers Poutine Steak - Dessert - Delivery/Livraison

reviews.text: Mr Steer is an iconic burger restaurant in Montreal. It's been around for 50 years. Their unique burger is more of a single large meatball than a burger patty which is probably why people like it so much. Their stringy curly fries are a treat as well. Decent sized dining room, very friendly servers and decent prices. There is no dedicated parking lot but meter parking in the area. Nice but outdated decor. A quaint stop for lunch or dinner. Recommend.

Friendly staff and service. Far from the best burger in the city, but certainly uses quality meets. The fries are unique, but nothing to go our of your way for. The desserts look like they taste better of the pictures. Just a cool classic Montreal spot to visit before hockey games.

Seats 200 people.  No WiFi.
What a BURGER!!!  Very well cooked and seasoned.  Coleslaw was delicious.  Suzie-Q fries are not seasoned but good.  We had The Hero burgers - this place asks how you like the meat cooked, which is awesome!  The Hero burgers is massive, half pound of meat; we went for lunch and are not having dinner because we're still full! 
 Bathrooms are clean.
The owner cares because he still works there!
Our server was fantastic!!!
Definitely recommended and would return.

Great staff. Unbelievable meat. My buddy’s brother buys patties and cooks them at home he is such a believer in the quality.  These burgers and other things on the menu such as shakes are really well done. Completely recommend. A legend of Montreal.
Been going there for over 30 years. Food is excellent, legit burgers, super Suzy Q fries, service is awesome. You can even get burger patties to go for your BBQ.

formatted_address: 10793 Ave Millen, Montréal, QC H2C 2E9, Canada
name: Bistro Bar Terminus

reviews.text: Great crowd and good atmosphere
The pizza was sooooo good. We really didn't expect much but we were so pleasantly surprised. The nachos were also good and the staff was so nice.
Correct 😳
I know the son of the boss of the bar yesser
Nice bar, awesome pizza. Make sure you try it.

formatted_address: 359 Rue Sainte-Catherine O, Montréal, QC H3B 1A4, Canada
name: Universel Déjeuners et Grillades

reviews.text:
I came here on a Sunday and it was packed! It's a big restaurant but the tables are close together so it might not be the best idea to show up without a reservation if you are a big group (Keep in mind they only seat you once everyone in your party is present). My boyfriend and I were lucky and got a nice seat next to the window. It was a lovely sunny day.

The portions are huge! I ordered a Breakfast Poutine (new on the menu) and my boyfriend got the Universel Breakfast. Everything was delicious and filling. They have an extensive breakfast and lunch menu so you will find something to your liking. Prices are more than fair considering the amount of food you will get.

Service was also quick and friendly. Our server made sure we were satisfied and was just genuinely nice. 

A very good brunch place!

The place did not look very crowded when we walked in for breakfast around 9:45am. However, after around 15 minutes, the place completely filled up. The food came a little slowly, but it was absolutely delicious! The portions are HUGE and there's various jams, as well as honey and peanut butter, to add on to your food. I'd reccomend getting a combo, which comes with 2 eggs prepared however you want along with your choice of french toast, crepes, or waffles. It also comes with toast, potatoes, and fresh fruit, so it is a lot of delicious food.

Breakfast looked amazing except the burned toasts that were replaced promptly. Service is friendly, flexible to requests, fast and efficient - even beyond the normally good service we get in Montreal. Comes with a full complement of maple syrup, ketchup, mayonnaise, tabasco.

Not five stars yet as something in this plate may have made me and my girlfriend slightly noxious an hour later although it tasted fine.  Both orange juice and coffee are watery.

Really lovely place and great food. We went there for our brunch and were right away pointed to our seats. We ordered universel breakfast from the menu. It was well done and filling. The service was excellent and the ambiance was great too. I would totally recommend this brunch place. I will go there again in the near future.

Consistently awesome. I usually hit this place up for breakfast or brunch as it's near my place of work, and I always leave happy. It's a larger place with a small dinner feel in its service. 

The price may feel a touch high for a plate available at a standard "greasy spoon" dinner, but its myriad of options and quality on all items make it certain that there will definitely something for everyone when coming as a large group.

A definite recommendation for its quality, service and location in Downtown Montreal.

formatted_address: 700 Rue Saint-Jean, Québec, QC G1R 1R1, Canada
name: Hobbit Bistro

reviews.text: Best dining experience during our entire stay in Quebec!! The wait staff were friendly, helpful and appeared to really enjoy their jobs. Despite the long wait, the food was AMAZING, and more than worth the wait time. Thank you to all the employees for making our dining experience so wonderful on our Anniversary trip to Quebec.
The dishes are all tasty. Waiter was very nice. We had duck ham, rabbit leg, fish of the day, and a cake dessert. The dessert especially was really good.
Absolutely delightful!  A lucky find.  Friendly, efficient service, and perfect food.  Highly recommended!
Nice place for lunch.  Service was great.  Food was good.  Local flavor.  Recommended.!

Excellent breakfast option with reasonable price 

Restaurant is tastefully decorated, staff generally very friendly, although our first waiter could use more smile.

We dined there twice during our short 5 days’ stay in Quebec City! The food quality was excellent, latte and bread delicious, portions adequate. 

We loved the breakfast platter, although not a fan of the pull pork (they call it ham), but staff was able to provide a substitute for it. Kids menu was also very good, our girls loved the bread!

formatted_address: 3577 Chemin du Souvenir, Laval, QC H7V 1X4, Canada
name: Beauté Etcétéra

formatted_address: 275 Boulevard de la Concorde E, Laval, QC H7G 2E5, Canada
name: Les Insulaires Microbrasseurs

reviews.text: Really nice places. The food is excellent at an acceptable prices. Not good if you need a quiet. I don't tried the 🍺 but they've a lot of home choice. That's a must return.

Nice, simple place...friendly staff.  The beers were good, the burgers were good...the chicken club was missing sauce and a little dry. But the creme brulee was not set properly and the sugar was bitter.

Very nice place! The staff is pretty cool too and I'd say I loved the music but they cut when misfits started playing and changed it to some emo pop punk mix. The beers were yummy but average and had a good mix/selection that was fairly priced. The food was good for pub grub. We had a nice time as a group and I'd go back. Solid microbrasserie!

Really nice place. The have a good craft beer selection. We really enjoyed their SMASH ! I also liked their Mac&Cheeze.  

Will go back for sure.

Finally a good craft beer bar in laval. The food is great and selections of beer was good. Their house beer is pretty good too. 

The decor is pretty amazing as well. Hopefully this place sticks around for a long time, its time for laval to step it up.

formatted_address: 3612 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2X 2V4, Canada
name: Club Peopl

reviews.text: Not a place for your older crowd  (23 years old and up )a whole bunch of teenagers and weird dj that plays a lot of french rap , and music you can't really dance to. Also their bottle service "table" is literally a section were you stand against a wall with a counter as no seats, never really seen that before.
Great crowd

If you're out of town and you don't have a reservation, They want you to pay for a bottle even though they let other local in. Claim they're filled to capacity even though the line is pretty empty at 10:30.
Nice DJ , Nice music but really small place.
Nice club in a place I didn't expect a club to be. Great music, nice attention to bottle service. Music a little too loud for my taste and place can get a little cramped though.

formatted_address: 699 3e Ave, Quebec City, QC G1L 2P5, Canada
name: Le Trèfle Limoilou

reviews.text:
Have been several times to the Trèfle. Always enjoy the service, and the food.
It has an excellent selection of craft beers. The atmosphere excellent and as always the customers are always willing to strike up a conversation. 
Go check it out.

Insane burgers so moist and soft you won't make the difference between bread and meat. Coo Ed ham is also awesome, not too salty. Many cocktail and whiskey choices. Big portions for dessert and superb service!
They should light the sign up outside. Amazing inside tho.

For me it's a shame as an established business development executive, it's a shame that he wasn't there to respond to my questions about how do they understand all Celt trads and I will thank him in person for that.
Great decor, friendly staff, good prices.

formatted_address: 106 Rue Saint-Paul O, Montréal, QC H2Y 1Z3, Canada
name: Terrasse Nelligan

reviews.text: Great atmosphere. Great quality of food and service.🙂!

Beautiful view! You’re paying a little extra for the location but totally worth it. We got the lobster rolls and they were delicious! 🦞 
Prompt service and food was out fairly quickly.

Nice little hotel restaurant accessible through Hotel Nelligan.

Food was good, but nothing extraordinary. Portions felt a bit small but that's more or less standard for restaurants such as this. Good beers on tap however, really liked the 1664 Kronenburg Blanc. Beer tasted good and was perfect for accompanying the brunch.

Few things that would make this place nicer:

More options on the menu.

A better view - the side facing the water has some plants totally blocking the view.

Great place with a nice view. Cool vibes. Music is ok but it's in the background you don't notice. The service is great they keep coming to refill our drinks. We got 2 pitchers for 4 and some finger food. It came out to a very reasonable price 33$+tip

There are heaters and umbrellas as well.

Loved the view, the place, the people and the ambiance. Bathrooms for men were difficult to find, but everything is clean. The terrasse stands atop and chic hotel. Decent service speed and fun staff. I gave 4/5 because French fries should cost over 6$, however fancy the place.

formatted_address: 6795 Rue Jarry E, Saint-Léonard, QC H1P 1W6, Canada
name: Hawgs Deli

reviews.text: I arrive at this outstanding place from time to time  as I enjoy the  special atmosphere that is exist in this place. The crew is awfuly cordial and professional. The service is very rapid. Also, the food they serve is perfect. I ate there many times and I was always satisfied. The expense is fair. I recommend this place to to everybody.
This is a nice restaurant, waitresses are friendly. They have all day breakfast and a very nice dinner menu. Really cozy and happen to be open all day long
Love this place! Just picked up their "DIY" supper package. 1 lb of smoked meat, Cole slaw, rye bread, & fries! Great idea to help out our favourite local resto!
Good ambiance for games, and parties upstairs. The food is great and the service is even better. Friendly waiters always there with a smile.
Always a reliably great club sandwich and traditional bar fare. Pretty good smoke meat as well and all day breakfast! What more can you ask for?! Try it today!

formatted_address: 8 Rue du Cul-de-Sac, Québec, QC G1K 8R1, Canada
name: Bistrot Pape Georges (Le)

reviews.text:
Food is good! Nice service.

Not a big fan of the fish and chips, but it’s still good tho. 

The duck leg is delicious, so is the sausage and egg roll in the combo plate.

We ordered the appetizer with duck rillettes, taste very good!

Definitely will come back next time

Great place to stop for drinks and appetizers. Attentive service, the one employee on shift did it all- from bartending to making our food. The fondue was delicious, great flavors and appreciate the recommendation to add a sausage to the side.

Five stars for the service and the food quality! The server here was outstandingly nice and caring, she did her job wonderfully. The atmosphere, especially in the back room, is very rustic and charming. Food is quickly prepared and tastes amazing. I would highly recommend coming here.
Beautiful atmosphere, educated staff who knew a lot about the area. Our server suggested a cheese fondue and we were not disappointed. Will be back again!
Another good little pub in a lovely old part of town. Quiet in the day with a few locals. Nice beers and not bad cheeses. Cosy little place.

formatted_address: 6821 Rue St-Hubert, Montréal, QC H2S 2M7, Canada
name: RoseWood Salle De Reception

reviews.text:
Horrible, mala ventilación. Olor a baño en todo el local y un calor tipo sauna.

Sonido espantoso, y decoración de salón comunal de  barrio de invasión.

Ambiente de puñalada bailable.

Ir solo en caso de no saber que hacer con su dinero y quiera pasar un mal rato y ganarse un problema.

Lado positivo, es cerca del metro por eso la buena calificación.

formatted_address: 4403 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2W 1Z8, Canada
name: Aldea - Portugais - Steak Seafood Tapas - Wine/Porto Bar Cocktails

reviews.text:
Amazing food 
Very good service .

I came here with my boyfriend for the first time and really enjoyed our experience! From start to finish the waiters were very friendly, welcoming and efficient. You can see the restaurant has a lot of regular clientele and there is a reason why! All their dishes were plentiful & delicious (maybe a little oily but that's why it's so tasty!) steak & seafood is their specialty, beautiful dish presentation, house wine was great. I must also mention that their washrooms were super clean. Even though we were newcomers they treated us very well. Will definitely come back.
One of the best Portugese restaurants in Montreal. Good quality food done right.  Super clean place and great staff.
Amazing experience, amazing service, amazing, food, amazing wine, the music is just perfect for the charming and cozy vibe it has to offer. A must see/eat!!

Nice cozy ambience, welcoming staff and efficient service. Misto (mixed entrees) was very good. We were a party of six and everyone enjoyed their food choices, the seafood mix platter for two was very appealing and tasty.  Tried the house wine (red) and was pleasantly surprised. Typical Portuguese deserts were all delicious.  We'll be back !

formatted_address: 2085 Rue Guy, Montréal, QC H3J 2L3, Canada
name: Mel VIPXXX

formatted_address: 380 Rue Sherbrooke Ouest, Montréal, QC H3A 0B1, Canada
name: Circos

reviews.text: Very tasty food and excellent service! We were nicely surprised to see the nice atmosphere, great management and delicious food. Don't let the other bad reviews to put you off from going there. It surpassed our expectations. The waitress, I think Marie was very friendly and attentive. We recommend it

Terrible restaurant. Hostess was dismissive and unfriendly, service was slow. Breakfast was disappointing and expensive. Dinner: burger was charred and overcooked, despite menu proclaiming a burger “cooked to perfection”. Fries were cold and greasy. Salad was overdressed.  Pizza seemed like it had been microwaved. This was actually the second time we ate dinner at the restaurant, with similar food quality and service. Hilton guests deserve better.

A hotel resto in the Hilton garden inn, on Sherbrooke at Bleury. The decor and ambiance are uninspiring, was there at happy hour, 4 á 7 without much happiness. It has a small bar and seating for roughly 50 people, beside the check-in lobby of the hotel. The appetizers were reasonable, the octopus the best of the bunch. The only saving grace here is that it has a small Terrace in front on Sherbrooke street which must be great during summer months.  I would go back for this only if I was living around this immediate vicinity. The lychee martini was very good.

We stayed for four nights at the Hilton Garden Inn in August and decided to try their restaurant a few times, which, in my opinion, is extremely mediocre.

The crepes were not evenly cooked (one half is crisp; the other is soggy and undercooked), which is horrible for a Montreal restaurant. The oatmeal is extremely bland. If you sit against a wall, you sink down into the padding (I’m six feet tall), and the tables, in turn, are too high, making eating awkward. The interior seems almost like a diner with similar quality food. 

The waiters and waitresses we had were pleasant, however.
Friendly staff & delicious food. Try their octopus, you will not regret it!

formatted_address: 1550 Boulevard Daniel-Johnson, Laval, QC H7V 3V7, Canada
name: ChoNeslya Bar Restaurant

reviews.text: Excellent Haitian food and accras de morue. Location is odd inside the market but the owner is super kind and friendly, has lots of cool Caribbean drinks on hand, and the food is cooked fresh to order. Delicious place to try creole food if you're in the area. Very fair prices as well. Not tons of veggie options however.

Not bad at all! Nice place
I would have given it  5 stars if i didn't have to wait 1h for my order to arrived.
Great/ quick service!!! Well presented food! And of course it tastes amazing! I would highly recommend this restaurant!

I went in for some rice, and i was very satisfied, the staff is very kind and generous with the portion without forgetting very timely, the rice and peas was very delicious , my girlfriend mentioned the lacking of pikliz (?) but overall superb for a decent price.
Great service and great food! Highly recommended!! 👍👍

formatted_address: 931 Boulevard Crémazie O, Montréal, QC H4N 3M5, Canada
name: Roasters Bbq Grill & Bar

reviews.text:
A typical sports bar type of place. Very spacious, clean, and even though there are lots of tv's they aren't distracting. 

It's right next to the Guzzo Cinema so very convenient for an after movie dinner. 

I ordered the chicken leg with the mac and cheese as a side. Portion was more than enough but the food quality itself was just ok. The Mac and cheese was a bit weird tasting, the chicken was a bit dry and also not seasoned, it came with a piece of hamburger bread but that was just bad, the gravy was good though. 

It's a very safe bet if you have a large group of people and the tastes differ. There's a little something for everyone.

Very friendly staff, great pricing. Had pasta dishes which were quite good. They're well priced and not stingy on the meat. Large portions. They host sports events, have many booths, a bar and televisions. Nice location and comfortable seating. Good service and great taste. Nice for a date, a quick solo outing or with a group of friends. Clean and fresh look and design. Bathrooms were also clean, but on the second floor. Not friendly for wheelchair bound people. Might have a second restroom area I'm not aware of, however. Overall nice place with quick service.
Quiet atmosphere when not busy, and still quiet when Sports Games are Live streamed. Good food and a friendly staff makes this place very enjoyable for friends and family.

It is always a pleasure to go there, good food, good prices, good customer services. It is our favorite place to go! Best calamari ever and their spicy sauce that goes with it no other restaurant can top that!

We got here for a quick bite, the service is really quick and the place was fairly crowded. The menu is simple but good. If you roasted chicken and burgers this would be a good choice, they also serve steak and the choices of sides are broad. They also have a good list of desserts.

formatted_address: 114 Avenue Laurier O, Montréal, QC H2T 2N7, Canada
name: Karisma Taco Bar

reviews.text: The brunch options are really good. We were 4 people so we decided to order different dishes and share. And I can't say which one was my favorite. Cause everything was delicious. Stuff was so friendly. Until now it's a best place for veggie brunch. I definitely recommend this place.

Go there on a sunny day, take place at the terrace and order a delicious cocktail and guacamole, lovely Mexican evening guarantee! 
Depending on which day of you week you go, you could have a combo. The tacos are serve on 2 tortillas and their is enough food to make 2 of them.
The staff and the cook are super friendly, I'll return for sure!

Great, cosy, Mexican restaurant, with really good variety of tacos and entrances.

If you want to finish with something sweet, churros are always an excellent option.

Good service and welcoming hosts make this an excellent place for a casual dinner.
I’m very picky with the service... ALL the crew super nice. Really good combination of traditional and contemporary Mexican food. Huitlacoche tacos and Elotes my favorites.
The food is so delicious and the service is amazing I really recommend this restaurant

formatted_address: 1171 Rue Sainte-Catherine E, Montréal, QC H2L 2G8, Canada
name: Club Unity

reviews.text: I'm in Montreal for the weekend, and arrived before 11PM on Saturday the 14th to gain free entry. Most of the staff was very polite, but the bartender with a beard was very rude. I tipped 20% for my first drink, and coming from Ottawa, where tipping isn't mandatory as per my experiences, I didn't tip for my second drink. The bartender tried to tell me you have to tip, but I couldn't hear him multiple times so he then proceeded to rudely demonstrate how to make my friends drink, took her 20$ and have 5$ back, pointing at the sign on the counter saying you have to tip at least 1$. My 2 friends and I simply couldn't hear, we all after reading the sign and even being rudely served tried to communicate with this bartender to tip him, but he refused to serve any of us after that and simply ignored us as he danced and sung to the music. Definitely not going back anytime soon
Large spaces with different vibes. Cost check, many bathrooms, outdoor area upstairs for smoking and patio area in summer. Cool bar! Well worth a checkout if visiting the village
Large nightclub with 2 room/floors and rooftop patio. Great view of Jacques-Cartier bridge. New lighting recently installed.

My most favourite nightclub. I come here all the way from Toronto to party. Free entry if you come early and all the staff are so friendly and talkative. I’ve made friends here and I always seem to come back here because it’s always always always an amazing time.

Love the place way too much. Went to Montréal for vacation and this was my favorite place to go to at night. The bartenders were amazing & Emmanuella/Emanuela was the best bartender ever and she brought a fantastic spirit and vibe to the place. 10/10 would recommend going to this place. We went on a Saturday night and the music was great and everyone was kind.

formatted_address: 170 Rue Prince Arthur E, Montréal, QC H2X 3B7, Canada
name: Les Deux Gamins

reviews.text: I went here with my friends for dinner and we had a good time. The baguette they serve is fresh and very tasty! We kept asking for more and they gladly gave us more. Wine is not as overpriced as most restaurants here in Montreal. The dishes are pretty good but not exceptional but we still enjoyed it. Will come back for sure!

My party and I were wonderfully surprised by this place. The food, from the appetizers to the mains were delicious. The discovery board, lamb shank, duck confit and warm goat cheese salad were highlights. Service was great and I will definitely be back. Don't hesitate, go.
Food are delicious at a reasonable price. Locate within walking king distance of our stay. Staff are nice. Bread before the appetizing are really good. Special menu for Christmas time is a bargain

I had a wonderful dinner here with friends during my recent visit to Montreal. They had great food and the staff was friendly and provided us with great recommendations. The discovery board is a must try and great to share between 2 - 3 people whilst sipping on some wine and chatting with friends. Would definitely go back next time I visit montreal.

Came here with 3 friends with a reservation we made an hour in advance. We ran into another friend when we were here so that was pretty funny! 

Food: DEFINITELY remember to check in! Can’t waste a good free dessert! We got the cream puff dessert, pretty sure it varies depending on what they have available. 

The free bread is quite fluffy and crunchy! 

I got the seasonal risotto which was quite bland if I may say so but with the help of my friend’s duck confit and pan fried steak the dish tasted a lot better. 

We also tried the Foie gras which wasn’t like great but tasted authentic nonetheless. 

Service: Service was actually kind of slow but the waiter was really nice and gave us refills of bread.

Ambiance: it’s a classy date night vibe and I loved the decorations! 

This was a nice intro to Montreal! I wouldn’t come back but I appreciated the experience.

formatted_address: 75 Rue Saint-Paul, Québec, QC G1K 3V8, Canada
name: Bistro St-Malo

reviews.text: We stumbled upon this spot while wandering around old Quebec and were very glad we stopped in for a meal. Even though we were a large group (14 in total) they managed to accommodate us and seat everyone together. A very cheery man came out to get us started with some water and it turns out he's actually the owner explained that he had bought the restaurant four months ago has been working from sunrise to sunset and loving every minute of it. He went into the kitchen and prepared all of our food by himself. Later on he came out again and thanked us and I can only say that I wish I was that happy in my job. It was very nice to see him enjoying himself so much. The food was gourmet level and very tasty, portions were very generous and my little boy fell in love with the Escargot. I'd definitely visit this place again for a wonderful meal and to see how the owner is making out. It was a very enjoyable experience overall.

We went on a whim.  Small, quaint  and warm.  Staff was attentive and genuine.   We ordered the cassoulet and beef cheek. Both were absolutely fantastic.  Good  wine list as well. It was a pleasant surprise.   We look forward to a definite return visit.

A little treasure. Every bit of our meal was delicious. The service was top notch. We left seeking a wonderful, secret ingredient that had been used in one of our meals and found it at the Grand Marché. Pictures below. Sugar kelp. Who would have thought?
Had a satisfying lunch here! Food and service are both in good quality! Highly recommended!

It was a truly amazing experience to dine here. Recently renovated and under new management since Dec 2018, we visited this place in its first 3 weeks since reopening.

The staff was very attentive and bi-lingual. We followed their recommendations and had an exciting dinner made with well-balanced ingredients.
Desserts were a true delight (see pictures for a home-made profiterole with hot chocolate sauce), and we got another dessert from the Chef personally at the end of the evening.

It was the best meal we had in a week spent in Quebec City - highly recommended!

formatted_address: 4701 Rue Wellington, Verdun, QC H4G 1X2, Canada
name: Villa Wellington

reviews.text: Discovered this place when the restaurant I was going to for my birthday turned out to be closed that night, what a happy surprise. Very flavorful food and good portions. Had a birthday churro which is the most authentic one I've had since being in southern California.
Out of all peruvian restaurants in montreal villa Wellington is my favorite. Worth the drive. Prices are great, food is always excellent! Staff is always sweet!

After living in Verdun for 5 years, my husband and I FINALLY tried Villa Wellington and I am disappointed it took us this long. The menu is really comprehensive, there is something for everyone. The food was so fresh. It came out hot and the flavors were amazing. We tend to favor places that are cheaper, but the service and quality you get for this price can't be beat. A very wholesome experience, we will be back!

Average restaurant. Salad clearly out of freezer as you could see the frozen cucumbers. Staff who comes every ten min to ask if you are finished when you are not . I wanted to try a Peruvian place and I am a bit disappointed. I hope you get better , good luck.
Really good ambience and amazing food. In need of a good price quality food? Come to Villa Wellington!

formatted_address: 1748 Rue Saint-Denis, Montréal, QC H2X 3K6, Canada
name: California Sandwiches

reviews.text: Such friendly service. We ordered one veal sandwich (most popular) and it was massive - wouldn't have been able to eat one to myself. Quite yummy but slightly bland. Worth trying though.

Amazing restaurant that offers huge portions at a decent price. Personally, I tried the Veal sandwich (their specialty) and it was delicious and tender. While the prices are high (15$ for a veal sandwich), you get what you pay for in both quantity and quality. The ingredients are fresh and while the fries are frozen, they do not bring them frozen but rather peel and cut them on their premise before freezing them. For desert, I tried their homemade Tiramisu and it was simply delicious. Will definitely return for another lunch.

Huge, filling and delicious! Everything here is extremely fresh, and you can taste the quality in every bite. The fries melt in your mouth, they're so good. I love the assortment of drinks to choose from, and the staff are super friendly and offer great service. Great music, large windows and overall cool vibe.

Super tasty veal sandwich. Really big portions as well. 
Highly recommended

Not many places in Montreal do a veal sandwich like California Sandwiches does, so I have to give it a 4 star rating. I used to work a short distance away from the original location in Toronto and while this location has some growing pains to work out, they'll get there. The sandwich itself seemed smaller than I am used to, the veal was bit tough, and not as crispy as I would have liked. These are all things that new places figure out as they open, so I am not worried... certainly since it's still a good sandwich! The location itself is on busy St-Denis street. There's a lot of seating inside and its wheelchair accessible. The menu online showed half-sandwiches being available for those with smaller appetites. 

Welcome back to Montreal California Sandwiches! We've missed you!!!

formatted_address: 4277 Rue Sainte-Catherine E, Montréal, QC H1V 1Y1, Canada
name: Panda Sushi Apportez votre vin

reviews.text: Quick delivery, fresh sushi only improvement is the rice
The best sushis are those without fish... The fish wasn’t fresh. Not experienced with big groups, the service was not steady.

Amazing sushi and presentations are incredible. All portions are very generous. Price is really good for the quality and you bring your wine ! I should have took some pictures to show you. If I'm around I would go again for sure. 
From outside the restaurant itself looks like nothing and the inside is not the fanciest ever, but everyone knows that the best restaurants are always like that.

Really liked the food there, although i didnt get to experience much..tried the soup and a few sorts of makis. The staff are quite friendly too. It was lunch time, price is good..so looking to the fact that this is not a high end sushi place it deserves between 4 and 5.
Fresh sushi!

formatted_address: 1583 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2X 2S9, Canada
name: Levant

formatted_address: 90 Rue Jean-Talon O, Montréal, QC H2R 2W7, Canada
name: Club MiCasa

reviews.text: I went by myself and it was really fun nice music and great atmosphere of course I will come with friends next time
May not be the nicest of places but the music is amazing!!!!!!!!!!! Perfect place to let loose. Inexpensive drinks.
Best dance experience ... awesome mix of merengue,  bachata,  salsa and regethon
That's the best club latíno in Montreal
Notre meilleur club latino en ville!!! 🔥🔥🔥

formatted_address: 1348 Rue Fleury E, Montréal, QC H2C 1R3, Canada
name: Le Rendez-Vous du Thé

reviews.text: Excellent restaurant. Friendly and fun atmosphere. The show topped it all! Merci et à la prochaine.
friendly staff, good food, amazing show, cozy place and amazing tea, defiantly ll go back there
Friendly staff and cozy places that offer regular shows (almost 5 days/week). Help local artists to perform while having diners. Prices are sometimes included with the meal.
Super friendly staff and service, very good food and and an outstanding Beatles show, thank you for a wonderful evening.
Nice tea house & bistro with live music

formatted_address: 1040 Boulevard Pierre-Bertrand, Québec, QC G1M 3H1, Canada
name: La Voie Maltée

reviews.text:
Fantastic beers. I was pleasantly surprised. The food is pretty good also. Went there a few times since it was accross from my hotel.
I would definitely recommend the place.
Le Malcommode beer was so awesome, i went to the grocery store to get myself a few cases.

My friend ordered 3 small burgers, what he received was the size of a timbit, cost 12$ and tasted bland (there was no side included either). We had a good laugh but in an seriousness it was ridiculous.

I've been there a couple of times and each and every time there's a problem with at least one of the beer and they can't serve it.

The beers are decent. Nothing memorable but not terrible either. The food is the same, not bad but nothing more. The price/quality ratio is certainly not there.

Overall I would say that this is an okay place to go with people that are new to craft beer, otherwise there are far better microbreweries in Quebec city.

The beer selection has always been great here. The food is also very good. The waiter had good recommendations for us and we were quite happy with our meal and the service. I know that you will have to wait until next year but the maple beer was well done. Very subtle maple taste.

Terrible place. It seems to be one of those places that people go to pretend and to show-off! Pricer are too high for the value you obtain. The food is hardly just all right but very pricy for the servings. The beer is definitely the strongest con at this place, very expensive for an unknown-nothing-special beer!   Worth spend some extra bucks and go to the restaurant just across the street.
Came here last night. Waited 10 minutes before being seated. Food was cold. Server was rushed and non-attentive. Will not come back here.

formatted_address: 1244 Rue Mackay, Montréal, QC H3G 2H4, Canada
name: Park Place

formatted_address: 3450 Rue Drummond, Montréal, QC H3A 1B1, Canada
name: Sakura

reviews.text:
Very good atmosphere. The food was of good quality. I loved their sukiyaki has the ingredients were fresh and taste on point.

Most surprisingly, they had one of the best rice I’ve ever eaten, and considering my origin, it says something!

Service was good, although not the fastest. But you have to be understanding as all the server (that I’ve seen), were older Japanese ladies, which gave this place a bit more authenticity appeal. But also slows down the speed.

As for price, I would say it’s on the pricier side, for the food that you’re eating. I would say that a reduction in price of about 10% would be great.

The sushi is fresh and responsible. The house sake is in a reasonable price. But the Pinot noir is not a good selection for a Japanese restaurant you should not ask for more. The non-convenience is the restroom. It’s far away from the restaurant. 

Tried both miso and salad but I like the eggplant 🍆 better
Quiet out of the way restaurant. Can sit and have a relaxing non hurried lunch/dinner. Service was efficient and polite.

Very authentic, humble staff, great good.
They serve soup, dessert and tea (not sure, I did not get any) with their main courses, which explains the price.
Another great, authentic, japanese restaurant! Great meals and serving sizes!

formatted_address: 291 Rue Saint-Vallier E, Québec, QC G1K 3P5, Canada
name: Scanner Bistro Multimédia

reviews.text: Rude staff. Piss poor event and venue management. I wouldn't recommend coming here for anything more than to enjoy laughing at the posers hanging outside the venue. Scammer Bistro
Nice music, almost every weekend there is a gig
Cute place tu hang out with friends
Punk rock and metal music . Good vibes, nice crowd. The staff is really cool and respectful. Theres a pool table and 2 babyfoot table. Enjoy
Very small, cute stage. Great beer

formatted_address: 1815 Avenue Laurier E, Montréal, QC H2H 1B3, Canada
name: Bistro 1815

reviews.text: Nice cozy place. The waitress was very helpful and always keeping our glass full. It has free pool and a jukebox. Great for hockey games and predrinking. Very mixed clientele but everyone is friendly

Went there with my friends who ordered a jug of beer and as I dont drink I asked the waitress if they had non alcoholic drinks like coke and her very clear reply was "Do I look like someone who does that?" I am not sure if she misunderstood me or was having a bad day but I was ataken back by such a rude reply. It was first time there and will definitely be my last. To the waitress best of luck and I hope you have a wonder life as a waitress and my apologies if I somehow inadvertently offended you.
Nice place
Fou vibe
Friendly place I loved it!

formatted_address: 2310 Ste Catherine West, Forum, Montréal, Québec, QC H3H 1M7, Canada
name: Montreal New Years XS

formatted_address: 1447 Rue Stanley, Montréal, QC H3A 1N4, Canada
name: La Boulangerie Moderne Rue Stanley - Café Dejeuner - Pizza Sandwiches Salads - Boite a Lunch Traiteur
