La Boulangerie Moderne Rue Stanley - Café Dejeuner - Pizza Sandwiches Salads - Boite a Lunch Traiteur

reviews.text:
***** a must try
If you want to have 5 star service and food in a tiny shop in downtown Montreal, and you are a fan of the many breakfast foods Montreal has to offer.
Ignore every other review you see.  I waited a day to try this place because I missed the breakfast menu the first day.
The wait was worth it!  I felt that not only have you traveled through time, but also there is a modern feel to the food, it truly makes you a lover of all things Quebec !

Can it get any better.. wow.
Great food and service, nice little cafe downtown
Quick and friendly service. The salad with feta cheese and capers was delicious. Don't you love the presentation! Culinary art.
I love this place, great quality lunch boxes, salads and breakfast. We get them to cater for work, they will do anything you need including vege or vegan lunch boxes.

Close to my job i sometimes stop by to grab a muffin. My friend made me discovered their muffins at 2.50 each and they were great. I came this morning to buy 2 and was soooo disappointed they were dry, not tasty as they were baked the day before. The service is expeditive, not friendly and the price of the rest of the food is too expensive for the quality they provide. After this experience I'm sure I will never come back I don't get how you can sell old products. They lost my trust knowing that there his at least 2 or 3 coffee shops close by...

formatted_address: 8420 Boulevard Saint-Michel, Montréal, QC H1Z 3E2, Canada
name: Bar Peaches

reviews.text: Nice atmosphere and very good service. I recommend.
Very fun place
Nice place for drinks
Good
Petit comme endroit mais confortable et agréable

formatted_address: 2700 Boulevard Laurier, Québec, QC G1V 2L8, Canada
name: La Cage

reviews.text: Great atmosphere friendly service and delish food.

Great food and ambiance for those big game nights. The ceasar salad as side dish with some menu picks is definitely superior to the main dish of salad
Great baby back ribs for a chain restaurant 
 Slight negative their onion rings are a bit saggy. Maybe waited a bit long outside the fryer until it made it's way to my table? But all in all it was great revisiting here after so many years out of Quebec even if the menu isn't the same.

It took quite some time to have a place in an almost empty restaurant. When we finally got our table for two, we were seated just next to a big noisy group.

The food we ordered was really overcooked. The chicken wings were the smallest I have seen for a long time. The drinks were ok nothing impressive. For the price, it’s not worth it.

One positive point, the service was good, quick and friendly.

Wow! We had a great time! Like, really great!
Great points: staff is courteous, beer is great, TVs everywhere and a fun place to be in small or large groups. Parking spot inside the shopping mall, so you are covered.
The not so great points: asked for french fries - they were mediocre; the person who did the reservation noted the wrong time, so better double check.
Amazing food! Our first time at this restaurant, Genevieve was our server and she was absolutely wonderful, definitely coming back here !

formatted_address: 1242 Rue de la Concorde, Lévis, QC G6W 0M7, Canada
name: Blaxton Lévis

reviews.text: Good burgers and their breakfast poutine was pretty good a little bit too much gravy but good nonetheless.

I liked my great experience here because your bar and grill has lots of foods and drinks choices, the prices is average, the quality of your cleanliness is excellent, the music played here is excellent and the personnel is very friendly, nice and welcoming.
It's a great place.  A little expensive
Good food! Prices were good. Nice people.

Over ten open tables but they couldn’t seat us? I truly find that hard to believe. I will never go there again. They have some reservations for 9 o’clock which is over two hours after our dinner would have started we don’t take two hours to eat dinner.

formatted_address: 4061 Rue Ontario E, Montréal, QC H1W 1T3, Canada
name: Madame Smith

reviews.text: Really liked this place! They have a kitchen with great food options. Vegan which is a big plus. Beers are averagely priced not super expensive or anything like that. I have a friend in the area so hes recently showed me this interesting spot. Great atmosphere and friendly staff! Thanks for the experience.

First time to be here for date night dinner before the movie, we ordered two dishes.
First, we like the burger and fries a lot. Juicy, flavourful beef patty. The second dishes is chicken karage with salad...the chicken pieces were very dry, not sure why were they. But we still finished them. Maybe I was hoping that they are juicy, tender and fresh hot deep fly like the Japanese one. The salad dressing is good. This place is more like a drinking place. So burger might be a safer option.
Lovely environment! Drinks are on points and you are able to customize! Service is very good!
Food is delicious, which is untimately what you want from a restaurant. Had the burger and fries. Not a place to dress up for. They go for more of a biker bar aesthetic.

The food and cocktails were awesome. The mushrooms tartar was a total delight. Sadly, the others at my table were all cold! Definitely a lack of heat on the restaurant part. Personally, I would go again.

formatted_address: 4560 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2T 1R3, Canada
name: Jack Rouge

reviews.text: Pretty fun spot with the right crowd. Bottle service is on point.

Unfortunately I don't have any photos to prove my existence in this place (and I usually do!) but I 100% remember the infamous red door. I also remember the comment my teeny tiny girlfriend made to the big burly bouncer, calling him cute and making him blush and smile lol. That was a great indication that this place was going to be awesome, and it was! ;)

Last December I went to the bar “La Porte Rouge” (The Red Door) and I was expecting it to be kind of a sequel to The Green Door and I was really looking forward to discover what was Behind it. Unfortunately, there was no Ivory Soap Girl named Marilyn here, only (relatively) normal people doing (relatively) normal things such as getting drunk. No midget sex or anything of the sort. I was kinda of disappointed until Santa Claus arrived around midnight and a jolly good time was had by all.
 
(Except for Joe, but no one likes Joe, not even Joe likes Joe, so that’s okay)
Now looks like an abandoned space.
Fun place, chill vibes. No complaints.

formatted_address: 4313 Rue Wellington, Verdun, QC H4G 1W3, Canada
name: Resto-Bar Pino

reviews.text: Antonio!!! Best bar in Verdun, by far. Best prices, staff, and a beautiful little ghetto outdoor patio terrace. I will be back!
A good service in a rush though 👍👍
Quiet but still enjoying the entertainment
I don't have any experience neither I want to be there . Went there to see one person and came back within couple of minutes. That's it.
Stop by for a drink or to chat with the locals or if you are feeling lucky they have some slot machines .. good prices friendly bartenders

formatted_address: 1356 Rue Sainte-Catherine O, Montréal, QC H3G 1P6, Canada
name: 3 Brasseurs Crescent

reviews.text: He proposed here! So this will hands down be one of my favorite places! We went for a late night bite after a long day. Service was great, food was surprisingly good. Only down side is that the place closes early for a pub. Everyone had to be out of there by like 12 a.m. bummer!
Nice pub atmosphere. Place was busy but service was very good. Ordered the 1/2 m flam for 2 and it was excellent - certainly enough for 2 and reasonable price. I recommend it.

Never had a bad experience at these restaurants! A little pricey but always good quality and great beers! I'd suggest the 5L of blond. Also a fan of chicken and waffles which are great there! Check for specials during the week.

Can’t complain! Vary tasty, lot of varieties of food and ofcourse beers! Have sider, wine and cocktails! Vegetarian food and delicious desserts!  Lot of booth tables which makes your stay way more private.

It was exactly what we needed on a busy day. We were looking for a place to get dinner and we had already been told we couldn't bring our 6 year old into a few of the other restaurants in the area. The pizza, poutine and beer were all good. My daughter also loved her meal.

formatted_address: 60 Rue Jean-Talon, Montréal, QC H2R 1S5, Canada
name: Kitchen Galerie

reviews.text:
very good place, we went their during the montreal en lumiere event, the menu was very good. we took the 7-course menu.
The food was very tasty and well presented.
the staff were very welcoming, smiling and very flexible.
Made my top 5 in Montreal. The cote de beuf is to die for.  It s maybe a few notch under joebeef but really worth it

It was my first time here, but the friendly staff made me feel as if I was a regular. The atmosphere is fun and lively, especially sitting at the bar, where you can see the line chefs work.
Great wine list, and the food was delicious. My expectations for this place were sky high, but they knocked it right out of the park.
Been one of my favorites for years. The staff is amazing and food incredible

They offered the Valentine's menu for $50 but both couple had to take it. We decided to pick things off the menu instead. No regrets! Everything was yummy and the playlist they had was dope. I would definitely recommend to a friend. Also would suggest to make reservations.

formatted_address: 125 Rue Saint-Vallier O, Québec, QC G1K 1J9, Canada
name: Le Renard et la Chouette

reviews.text: An enjoyable dinner service featuring classical French cuisine modernized with some Quebec touches. The dining space is welcoming that is domestic meets industrial. Our server was very courteous and patient to explain the menu in detail in English. Food delivers fully, is beautifully prepared, and tastes delicious!

We had such a good time!  If you enjoy food and talking about food, have a seat at the (comfortable) bar that overlooks directly into the kitchen space. The chef Sarah was so nice, sharing her inspirations, technique, and ingredient choices. The waitress really seemed to know her stuff when it comes to wine, and recommended a great bottle. We were told there had been a recent shift in the focus of the cuisine, being now more middle-eastern inspired, but with a twist, and local products. All in all a casual and memorable night!

We had a fantastic dinner here on our first night in Quebec. Our first course was the large mixed charcuterie platter. I have a big appetite but there is so much food in this dish that I wouldn't recommend it for a party of two but for 4 or more it would be the perfect size. Smaller version of this platter is available for half the price. All cheeses (soft and hard) are local from Quebec. Mix of terrines, pates and dry sausage were all very tasty. There was also the most amazing tasting pickles I've ever had that were served along with this platter. 

For our second course we chose two dishes from the small plates section of the menu. We ordered the clam salad and duck hearts dishes. Duck hearts were were served with mushrooms, artichokes and an amazing bone marrow sauce that was so good we decided to come back again for our last meal couple of days later.

Our second meal was equally as good with menu having slight variations. Our first meal was on a quiet week night while second on a busy Friday night. I recommend making a reservation. We sat at a table for both meals but you have an option of sitting at the bar overlooking an open kitchen watching the chef perform her magic. For our second meal we went with the smaller mixed charcuterie platter and 3 small dishes to share including once again the duck hearts. We also ordered the smoked trout over bread pudding dish which was very interesting and reminded us of a lox and cream cheese bagel. Highlight of the night was the Boudin dish which including blood sausage as well as a sausage stuffed with lobster in a spicy sauce.

Both meals were so good. This is one of the best restaurants I've had the pleasure of eating anywhere in the world.
Great food. Would come back again. Great atmosphere!

Avoid this restaurant at all costs if you are not a Millennial Hipster. They have no knowledge of what good food is or how to serve it. They easily pour a 175$ bottle of wine without changing the wine glasses or serve 3 appetizers without a change of utensils!

formatted_address: 4088 Rue Saint-Denis, Montréal, QC H2W 2M5, Canada
name: ChuChai

reviews.text: This place was pretty good. The chicken skewers were definitely a hit best peanut sauce I have ever tasted! Spring rolls were a bit bland. Patio was cute and service was also wonderful!

Chuchai is a must for vegans in Montreal! I am honestly not a fan of mock meats but I really enjoy the options here. The tofu green curry, beef in three sauces and duck are all musts of course! I enjoyed the Tom yum soup as well as a starter. Everything is tasty and the right amount of spicy. My only comment would be to work a little on the desserts - I’ve had the chocolate mousse and the coconut tapioca and I feel like both options are missing a little bit of something, can’t put my finger on it! Overall, a lovely experience in a wonderful setting. Prices are a little high but worth it in my opinion.
The food was excellent and the service too. It's a really good and warming place. The menu is really well explained and it's hard to believe that everything is vegan. I'll for sure come back.

Awesome Pad Thai, probably the best I've ever had outside of Thailand. Shrimp in a green curry and Coconut milk sauce. Can't believe it's vegan. Dessert was a truly amazing cherry cheesecake and chocolate and almond macaroons. Never thought I'd find such a delicious vegan cheesecake.

Great atmosphere. Clean. Best of all the restaurants during our 2 night stay.

I eat very good food at home and expect better of an experience when I eat out... especially for a 200$ diner for 2(no alcohol included). I chose and reserved this place for Valentine's diner after I had read a lot of reviews recommending it. A dry leaf, plain sticky white rice, a couple of boring over salted vegetables and chunks of tofu laying poorly under a liquidy peanut sauce next to extra salty seaweed. Let's not even talk about the desert. My goodness, I ate better vegan food at the mall food court earlier today! That is how bad my experience was. A big waist of my money. Good luck to them...

formatted_address: 211 Rue Notre-Dame Ouest, Montréal, QC H2Y 1T4, Canada
name: L'Assommoir Notre-Dame

reviews.text: It is a small place, but the service and the food are amazing. The waitress came several to the table to find out how we were doing.

Beautiful environment with great drinks. Bartenders are super friendly and have great suggestions for cocktails or drinks based on your taste preferences. It gets really busy on the weekends, which is not too surprising but weekdays are pretty uncrowded if you want to check this place out.

Service is amazing, very nice people and service
I love the environment I would certainly go back

Nice and cozy place. 
Foods: same as all other fancy restaurants (small portions and expensive) but delicious!
Drinks: good 

They need more waiters.
Wow best food o ever had,  congrats to chef georges keep up the good work

formatted_address: 690 Boulevard René-Lévesque O, Montréal, QC H3B 1X8, Canada
name: Vargas Restaurant

reviews.text:
Knowing that one of your biggest concerns when hiring a health plan is the accredited network, that is, places where you will be served, we at Zelas Saúde have prepared a special list of the best hospitals. See what are the specialties and which health plans to hire to access certain establishments.
It provides excellent service to the Canadian population, when the project started at the initiative of the community. It currently serves many specialties and has high-tech medical resources.
With a multidisciplinary clinical staff, it has preventive medicine programs, complex therapeutic admissions, urgent and emergency care and rehabilitation programs. In addition to practical teaching and research activities, which encourages the professional improvement of the clinical staff and consequently the attendance.
Plans that offer coverage: Chum is also found in the premium categories. If this hospital is paramount for you.

A rare combination of an excellent steak house and an equally good sushi bar. The steaks are some of the best in town, dry agreed on the premises, and sushi is definitely not just an after thought. You can tell their third generation sushi chef takes pride in his work and makes some amazing 🍣.  The menu is carried and everything I have tried has been superb.

This was the second time I was enjoying this excellent restaurant. I had lunch last year and finally enjoyed dinner . On both occasions it was top Notch.  I tried the filet mignon.  It was really good . A pleasant surprise.  Excellent wine selection and the service was simply fantastic.  You are two or four trust that you will be very pleased.

This is a fantastic restaurant and an amazing night out. The food is just magnificent. The staff are all happy and very kind. The customer service is amazing and there is nothing negative to say about this place. The food is top.
This restaurant offers fantastic service as well as delicious menu. My favourite spot in the city. The food served fast and the rates were affordable. Highly recommended.

formatted_address: 275 Rue Notre-Dame Ouest, Montréal, QC H2Y 1T8, Canada
name: Chez Delmo

reviews.text: Hubby and I visited his auntie and went for dinner to Chez Delmo. Has cocktails, appetizer, main course, wine, dessert, and coffees. We each had different items and all were fantastic. Excellent food quality, perfectly cooked, and well presented. Our server Jacob was friendly and very knowledgeable in helping us select wine. Will definitely return!

Amazingly delicious mussels, fries and calamari. If you are going go finish off dinner, order the pudding to share. Also, the service is first class and my water never went empty. This is a fine dining restaurant and dressing up is a must in my opinion.

We went here because of the lobster thermidor. The restaurant was nice but not stuffy, with an upscale casual vibe. Service was fast, responsive, and courteous. Prices are definitely high. As mentioned, we ordered the thermidor, as well as the duck confit. The thermidor was good, but not as flavorful as expected, and I was surprised to see that they had included the greyish meat around the head. That put me off a bit. The confit was sweet and flavourful, if not a little too rich. Overall good experience, not sure if I'd go there again, especially given the prices.
THE GREATEST SEAFOOD PLACE EVER! I come here every Christmas for seafood, always great. I'm not sure how expensive it is compared to other places but it's always so tasty and fantastic.

Ok location. Very good service. Tje service is attentive and fast. The fish is very fresh and the menu has a very good choice. The portions are refreshingly small. I spent $190 for two people without wine.  A bit expensive but overall a very good experience. Recommended !

formatted_address: 222 Rue Saint-Joseph E, Québec, QC G1K 3A9, Canada
name: Deux22

reviews.text: Restaurant/Store/Coffee shop this place is a small relaxing oasis of good quality food.  The place to eat is very lighted and simply decorated. They definitely care what the taste of what you eat.  Fusion of Mexican/Quebec/.... It's worth the try.  Good choice of Tequila and a couple of well balanced cocktails. Definitely a must try.

Great Mexican food at a very reasonable price. The quality, quantity and presentation were on par with the impeccable service. The chorizo taco was nicely prepared, my son had the chicken taco which was also very good. Even the tofu burrito was enjoyable! We split the taco dessert which hit the spot. You have to try the margarita!
Tacos, Tacos, Tacos! The tacos we ate were delish! So many colours, so fresh and vibrant. Neat atmosphere, nice service and great tacos😍

Delicious fresh Mexican style food! Beautiful presentation of food on plate.  Portions were a little small. I had the fish tacos which was really delicious, but there was a mango coulis on the tacos instead of the traditional mango salsa. And there was could have been a little more salad on the plate. But I still highly recommend. Will absolutely be going again to try something new next time. YUM!!!
Nice place. Cool staff. Very decent mexican food.

formatted_address: 624 Grande Allée E, Québec, QC G1R 2K5, Canada
name: L'Atelier

reviews.text: The drinks were on point and the food was quite delicious. The salmon tartar was very good and the veal short ribs melted off the bone. The atmosphere was energetic and was somewhere I could spend the whole night. To top it off our waiter, Pascal, was absolutely amazing, and would single handedly go back just to have him as our waiter again.

Went to L'atelier with my wife, place is a bit loud but the music is fantastic. the service was good, everything came out in a timely manner, and everything was on point. I had the bison Tartar, i was a bit on the fence about it! however it was incredible, would definitely go back if in town again !!!

Great atmosphere, amazing staff, signature drinks and great tasting food!! I had the pulled pork burger and the squash soup - WOW - 
A must visit while you visit beautiful historic Quebec City

Food was fantastic, great outdoor seating and a very cozy lively indoor bar area. The setting is a very eclectic look and feel with the lighting and decor.  

Staff was very friendly, courteous helpful and professional.  

The food was prepared well and portions are off adequate size.  I ordered the burger with a salad side and both were perfect.  The burger we seasoned well and the salad dressing was tasty.

Overall, this is a 3.7 star resto/bar. 

Food was lacklustre and the service was slow. That being said, the drinks are reasonably priced and there's a good vibe after 11pm.

formatted_address: 65 Rue Saint-Zotique E, Montréal, QC H2S 1K6, Canada
name: Bottega

reviews.text: I can't even believe how good the pizza from here was. I've been back home now for a month and I'm still thinking about it. I ordered the truffle pizza, expecting a pretty good pizza with some truffle oil on top. What I got was an amazing pizza with one of the best crusts I've ever had, topped with freshly shaved truffle. My group each ordered a pizza and they were all truly amazing. Next time I'm in Montréal, I'll definitely be back.

Outstanding service, very warm and welcoming. Quick serving and hot food 👍🏻👍🏻

As per the restaurant 5 people can’t be seated on the terrace which was not so good, as the inside is so loud.

The food was above average, yet it is a pizza that you can find in other places too. 

Pistachio ice-cream is a must
Best Burrata I ever tried. Amazing service. Comfy place, remind me of Italy. You deserve the 5 stars! Definitely recommend.

Very good Italian restaurant in Rosemont. With a wood burning oven, pizza is a must and a prominent part of the menu. They make fairly classic Neapolitan style pizza, with a puffy crust and thin, wet pizza. Very large wine selection. Particularly noteworthy was the gelato dessert, since it's quite hard to find good gelato in Montreal and this was really good. A must try for authentic pizza in Montreal.

The truest napolitain style pizza in town, the fried calamari are worth ordering too.

The food fire oven pizza is made with good ingredients, dough is classic napolitain style: thin, slightly elastic and chewy. I like my pizza with a bit more crunch and that's why I'm removing a star, but it's just a personal preference, and to be fair, that's how Napolitan pizza is supposed to be. 

Service is attentive.

Need a reservation.

formatted_address: 2020 Rue Crescent, Montréal, QC H3G 2B8, Canada
name: Light Ultra Club

reviews.text: We have an amazing celebration at Light Ultra Club! Brazilian's Girls you need to visit it place and have a great night with friend or find someone very incredible lol

Suuper expensive drinks, not bad if you're young, like 18 - 25, but there were a few 30+ wandering around looking very uncomfortable. Good music, just such a WEIRD mix of people. The biggest problem my friends and I found was the cover was 15$, then to check your coat was 3$, then to get any drinks the cheapest was 5$ a shot. Ridiculous.

formatted_address: 1165 18e Rue, Québec, QC G1J 0G6, Canada
name: Brasserie Générale - 18e Rue

reviews.text: We are staying at a hotel nearby and did a check on this place.  It was an OK location.  The parking was pretty easy on a friday, but could see difficult on a busy night.  From the states and first visit, so my familiarity is on a single visit.  The waitress was very friendly, and she tried her English in us.  Communication wasn't an issue.  There is a nice variety of beer to address a variety of pallets.  No wheat beer at the time of visit.  We had the nachos with pork and they were great.

Came here over lunch while performing some work for the college. Ordered the pesto pasta off the lunch menu. It came with a starter of Hummus and chips. All food was a blend of fresh ingredients and well thought out flavours.
Cozy environment, awesome bartender, even better beers.
A must go , very friendly and welcoming staff , food top notch , had lunch soup and pasta , loved it AAA
Good job Simon!

formatted_address: 540 Rue Boucher, Montréal, QC H2J 3Z6, Canada
name: Taverne Bar La Remise Inc

reviews.text: This place is epic... Karaoke, pool table a nice dive kinda place!

very nice place to have fun and to feel confortable and enjoy the night or the evening.  karaokê from Thursdays and Fridays. Good beers prices. The clerks are very nice and speak both english and french. people from any age and different places. I like very much. 3 blocks from Laurier station (Orange line).
Prices are good, there's a pool table and karaoke. All you need for a good night with your friends!
Horrible service! Rude and unwelcoming, they asked us to leave after finishing our drinks
Great place, friendly staff. Pool table and punching thingy for a dollar is great too.

formatted_address: 124 Rue Prince Arthur E, Montreal, QC H2X 1B5, Canada
name: O.Noir

reviews.text:
The experience is very unique!! I really like it.

The atmosphere: For the bar itself, it has a very comfortable atmosphere. For the dinning dark room, there is no light totally! Everything is perfect. 

The dishes: We tried the “surprise dishes”, clients can choose 2 or 3 services. The price is very reasonable. After you decide the menu, you can enter the dark room to explore the darkness. The flavor of the dish is really good. I really recommend you to have a try.

Ps. All services are bilingual. The waiter/waitress will lead you into the darkroom.( you only need to put your hands on their shoulders) . After you seat youself, they will present you the locations of your knife and forks. If you have any questions during the dinner, you can just call their name. It’s really a unique experience. That allows us to experience the life without visualization, however, other sense in the darkness will become very sensitive. If you don’t have dark phobia and claustrophobia, It’s really worth to go to this restaurant.

Fantastic food at great value. We ate on the patio, as my kids wanted to eat burgers and they're not on the menu for the "special" experience.

The beef tenderloin (shoulder) was delicious, with crispy kale and pickled cooked baby tomatoes adding so much to the dish. I asked for the crumble (which wasn't on the menu), and the waitress obliged - it was home made, healthy and tasty. I had to add a lot of salt, which was fine.

My wife didn't particularly enjoy her tofu curry, that was just OK. But my son loved his burger with emmental and smoked meat, and the fries were very good too.

Such an incredible and unique experience! Definitely recommend for everyone to try at least once! It was a little intimidating at first not being able to see but it truly heightens your other senses. My favorite item was the toffee desert from the special Christmas menu. Our waiter Maurice was fantastic and provided the most excellent service. Very impressed and enlightened by this visit and would certainly return.

My wife gifted me a dinner and this was a fantastic experience we will not forget.  We rely on our sense so much in our day to day that when we lose one, we can easily scramble to adapt. Enjoying some amazing food is such a delightful way to experience such a scary thing.

The staff is punctual, approachable and is more than happy to help with any questions or needs. They explain everything about what you will go through so you're never left guessing.  Once our great waiter helped us in the room and to our table, I was a bit freaked out for a few seconds as you literally cannot see anything.  I couldn't help but to laugh as the thought of many people around in the dark eating together seemed hilarious.  Even if it's a bit silly, I thoroughly enjoyed it and have much more awareness of the visually impaired and that's tough to buy.

The food is simply of amazing quality and even though it was a bit difficult to eat normally, that didn't stop us from truly enjoying the flavors of our dishes.  Since it's pitch black, no one will judge you if you use your fingers a bit more than usual ;).  It's also a little more difficult to share food with a friend but I found it was fun to try to find our hands and nervously pass our forks filled with deliciousness across the table.  We had quite a fun time.

In today's fast paced world, it's nice to find a place that embraces taking it's time to thoroughly enjoy something while also being different.

I would highly recommend trying this place out at least once.  We may go back when the menu changes to try a new surprise in the dark.

I included a photo of my main dish.

Dining in the dark - Most amazing, unique, unusual and memorable dining experience you’ll ever have in your life! A truly humbling experience

O.Noir is a special French-Italian restaurant and patrons are expected to eat in complete darkness while being served by legally blind waiters and waitresses (a population that experiences roughly a 70% unemployment rate). 

There are several courses available for appetizers, mains, and desserts; however, you can also opt for the 'surprise' option where you have no idea what arrives at your table. The 'surprise' option was f..delicious. The concept of the restaurant is to experience food, drink, and conversation in the dark without being able to see anything including your food, guests or even the servers (while maintaining the standards of a premium restaurant). When you sample the food without your sight your remaining senses are heightened allowing you to really savor the smell and sharpen taste of your meal like never before.

The server asked us to remove our hands from the table, lest the dishes topple over. The server is visually impaired but moving around effortlessly. Carrying & clearing dishes. Attending to everyone. Chit-chatting. All at the same time. All in pitch darkness. He was in control and knew everything that is going on. Always being there whenever the customer wants you.

The server was so friendly and playful and I guarantee you'll be laughing most of the time you're in the dark. You'll most likely end up speaking to the people next to you and it's a great way to socialize without feeling shy because you can't see each other. The friendly staff and servers made the experience an awesome one. We never felt rushed at all. This was an outstanding experience and I highly suggest that everyone tries it.

The more important was the fact you couldn't pull out your mobile phone or look at your watch. Time doesn't pass easily in places like these. Hence " conversation in the dark". In an era when we usually pass time before the food is served by scrolling through our mobile phones, these minutes proved to be quite a challenge for many people. The idea was for people to talk to each other, an art unfortunately forgotten in today's times, unfortunately.

And, If you need to go to the bathroom, someone shows you the way. Luckily you can pee with the lights on 😀

One more thing, it's the perfect place for a blind date. 😀

Thanks to our server, the owner Leonardo and all the staff for making this unique experience amazing ❤️

formatted_address: 32 Rue McGill, Montréal, QC H2Y 3W5, Canada
name: Bistro-Brasserie Les Soeurs Grises

reviews.text:
Food is not great. I got the chicken burger which was dry and not really hot. Beer was just ok also. You can have way better crafts beer in Montreal than this place.

On the upside, the decor is really nice and ambiance is pretty chill. You can rent a room if you are a bigger group and they have a private bar and washroom in that room.

Upscale Brew Pub serving good quality Crafted entrees from a limited selection menu.  Portion sizes are fairly sized and adequate. The ambiance is warm and inviting, a very trendy atmosphere but not pretentious at wall.

Their craft beer selection is good and they make some good above average beers.

Had the chicken quesadilla with fries. Fries were very good, coleslaw was very creamy as advertised and seasoned perfectly. The quesadilla didn't taste very good, no district flavors coming through. The chicken tasted like it was previously frozen and may have been otherwise processed.

Beer was great, I liked the IPA and my so Loved the sour beer. Food was ok but nothing special. Service was very friendly but the were only 2 people serving 40 takes so of course they forgot our food. The place was good overall.
Excellent food! Loved the atmosphere. Really had a great time. Highly recommended

formatted_address: 426 Rue Saint Gabriel, Montréal, QC H2Y 2Z9, Canada
name: Velvet Speakeasy

reviews.text: Very intriquete atmosphere, definitely a unique venue. The drinks were pricey though, about 11$for a mixed drink.

One server spat in my friends beer and no apology from the server staff, we had literally just sat down, perhaps because my friend was black. Another server yelled at me for not giving her enough tip for 2 shots she served with a frown. Probably the worst service I have ever experienced in Montreal. Outright disgusting, spend your money elsewhere, don't support this kind of behavior
Horrid staff, disorganized and far from  world class  this so called night club has rubbish door staff  their behavior would last 10 seconds NYC or London.  Avoid Velvet .
decent music, terrible bar service. bar man and bar maid just talking, while people wait for bad service. I gave a low tip.
Dark, Intriguing, Charming, Classy, Unpretentious, Cool underground vibe in Auberge St-Gabriel basement. 🖤🖤🖤

formatted_address: 732 Rue Saint-Joseph E, Québec, QC G1K 3C3, Canada
name: Resto-Bar LvlOp

reviews.text: Nice ambiance. Great selection of game. Great comfort food.

It's like a sports bar but for video games! They have a good selection beer and alcohol and even better food. I would reccomend the Merguez Sausages and the Gyro they were delicious. Skip the chicken nuggets, they come in a small quantity and they taste like deep friend socks
Really cool atmosphere, prices are great, perfect for gamers, alone or with friends :)

Awesome place! Plenty of room and many games available to play. Staff were very accommodating, especially given our poor French skills. Drinks were tasty and atmosphere was nice. I especially like the idea of watching eSports live, hope to see more of this in the future!
Good poutine. I ate the WWCD during the Poutine Week.

formatted_address: 71A Rue De La Gauchetière O, Montréal, QC H2Z 1C2, Canada
name: L2 Lounge

reviews.text:
A few years ago, I would have give 4 stars to this place. 

I recently went back with a few friends and it was way too f* sweet like heavily artificial glucose heavy processed sugars...

If you love taste of the concentrated syrup they put in chemical slurpy, this is your place.

If you want well balanced drinks that taste natural, avoid it at all cost

This place was upstairs of a building which I think adds a good lounge vibe and suits their name, L2 Lounge. It's a great environment for sweet drinks with friends and chit chat. Has a good selection of bubble tea and other hot/cold Asian sweet tea drinks. The lounge offers a small selection of quick-bites food choices.
We got the Thai iced tea which was delicious. It tasted like the real Thai iced tea and wasn't overly sweet. It was refreshing. It was served in a large beer mug which added to the lounge experience. The poutine here could be better although we weren't expecting much from a bubble tea shop. The fries were thin, long, and definitely not freshly cut.. Most likely frozen bought. Gravy was okay and towards the edge of being salty. Cheese curds were not real cheese curds.

This place is great! I love that you can grab drink and a meal and just sit there and play games for as long as you want. My friend and I were looking for a place to hang out and just drink and snack while we played uno and this place is perfect for that. Lots of other people come just to play games as a group. The line does get quite long but they serve you fairly quickly. 

I got the brown sugar boba and it was delicious. I also got the poutine because i just had to try it and it was decent. My friend got the fried pork chops and those I was really not a fan of. Would not re-order. 

A fan of this place!
Good atmosphere! Chill music too. I recommend the Rose Lemonade (with Lychee Jelly). Would be more fitting for summer vibes though :)

Great bubbletea and some side snack/foods ($$). If you are looking for a quiet place, this might not ideal for you, depending on when you go. Music and noise are present in this friendly atmosphere. Comfy seats, recently renovated (2019 I think).

formatted_address: 1234 Rue de la Montagne, Montréal, QC H3G 1Z1, Canada
name: Le Cinq

reviews.text: Great night in montreal at le cinq. Bottle service was great! Can't wait to return back
Company event with catered food - service was great and the atmosphere of the venue was excellent. Hosts of the venue/event were very understanding and accommodating of our requests
The ambiance at ground floor is fabulous (and must go) however, I will not recommend anyone to go in parties organized on it's first floor. It's very small, dark and passive !
Nice atmosphere with good bottle prices. Club music was the best part
Spacious place. Nice ambience. Has huge collection of Bollywood songs.

formatted_address: 5206 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2T 1S1, Canada
name: Osteria da Elda - Italian - Seafood - Wine Bar/Cocktails - Weekend Brunch

Osteria da Elda - Italian - Seafood - Wine Bar/Cocktails - Weekend Brunch

Osteria da Elda - Italian - Seafood - Wine Bar/Cocktails - Weekend Brunch

reviews.text: We did not get the chance to eat at Osteria sadly since the whole neighborhood suffered an electricity blackout at the moment of our arrival, but I give 5 stars for their warm welcome and their elegance in managing the situation. They offered us a drink on the house while we waited for an update from Hydro and the whole atmosphere was cozy and friendly. Cant wait to go back and try the food.
Excellent Brunch options. Don’t miss the waffles with fried chicken! Super nice staff. Still need to try the diner options but looks really promising!

Good service, portion size/price is adequate. I was a bit disappointed by the food, lacked flavours in my opinion but I’ll give it another try. Maybe it was just an off day. The starter was really good.
Hidden gem of delicious home-made Italian dishes!

Great place to stop eat well and have a drink.
Super friendly staff that makes you feel welcome.

formatted_address: 124 Rue Saint-Paul O, Montréal, QC H2Y 1Z3, Canada
name: Méchant Boeuf Bar-Brasserie

reviews.text:
It is a nice bar/restaurant.

The service was good and friendly.

We had the steak frites and it was good, but the French fries were way too salty.

The star of the evening were the mini hamburgers... They were amazing! Do yourself a favor if you go and order them. They are an appetizer. I don't know if they have them in full size.

Besides that, the price was reasonable and the ambiance is cozy and chic.

A great experience! Meats are delicious, with a broad choice of red wines... Friendly and efficient staff, great location in the old city, lovely place. Gluten-free and dairy free options. Worth to spend time in this exquisite restaurant during your visit of Montreal!

Such a great place to dine! Loved the atmosphere; cozy, warm, and inviting. The music was so good that our whole table starting singing the songs that were playing! I will say it is loud as the music is loud and everyone is trying to talk over it. We went during some food festival so it was a 3 course meal for a very reasonable price. The food was AMAZING! I had the beef tartare and the “cav&cheese” for dinner. YUM! Our waitress was Samantha and she was delightful. Great service.

Fantastic experience with my family. Phillip was a great server and madenour experience fun! Boozy brunch was great and the food was fabulous. Overall the restaurant is very clean and the management is organized. We will be back next time for sure. We were also served by Nicholas at the end because Phillips shift was over. He was amazing as well! Koodos to this restaurant for the service and experience!

I went for my birthday with a party of 10 and really appreciated Melissa's service. We are a lively bunch and sometimes demanding with food choices but she was so nice and patient with us. Food was also amazing! Appreciated the free cake. Me and my friend took the seafood platter and we were very pleased

formatted_address: 509 Rue de la Falaise, Lévis, QC G6W 1A4, Canada
name: SCAG scène 1

formatted_address: 1100 Boulevard René-Lévesque E, Québec, QC G1R 4P3, Canada
name: Allegro

reviews.text: By now, you've realized I have certain dietary issues. So I was needing fish for lunch but due to the lunch time hours of most places near the conference center in Quebec City, most finer fining that can cater to me food issues are closed at 2 in the afternoon or have very short selections. When I explained to the server, Hugo, at Allegro that I am celiac with a dairy intolerance and that what I was really needing was fish, he asked the chef what could be done. Good God! It was amazing for being a simple grilled salmon with a salad! Check out the before and after pictures - they're worth a thousand words!

Had breakfast here for a couple of days.  Service was generally pleasant and friendly.  Buffett breakfast does not offer a huge variety of choices.  Usual hotel fare.  The service is the reason I give it a four instead of three out of five.
Drinks were fantastic, wonderful service. Would recommend giving it a shot if you're in town.
We have breakfast buffet. Food is soso. Servers are so nice and friendly.
Best dinner I've had in a long time!

formatted_address: 8000 Boulevard Henri-Bourassa #400, Québec, QC G1G 4C7, Canada
name: SHAKER Cuisine & Mixologie

reviews.text: Tasty cocktails and miem cuisine, last time ordered one burger, dry and lacks of ingredients, flavors. Considering the price, it's not bad place to chill with friends but there are a lot better places.
Good good and fast service
Excellent service. Food was great. Must try the lobster pogo's.  Will return to this resto.
Original Putin during the Putin week
Loud, not really good service.. food was good, drinks too.. very hard to communicate when a big group

formatted_address: 1250 Avenue du Mont-Royal E, Montréal, QC H2J 1Y3, Canada
name: Pizzédélic Mont-Royal

reviews.text: The restaurant has a very moody environment, with relatively low lighting. Nice ambiance for romantic dates. They serve well-sized portions and the pizza there tastes amazing. Great ratio of ingredients altogether. The waitress was kind and had great recommendations. I would definitely go back to this place, highly recommend eating there.
I was hesitant to eat here, but the pizza was delicious. Service was quick and friendly. Sangria was good too!
wow nice atmosphere and excellent customer service 👍👏

It's an amazing place. Good food and service.
A thin crust pizza 🍕 , nice atmosphere
Highly recommended

This place has THE MOST delicious pizza! The Truffle one is to DIE for! Also the Cesar salad and bruschetta were amazing! Really friendly and efficient staff. Also really nice decor and ambiance that fits with the plateau. My boyfriend and I stopped in here randomly bc we didn’t want to cook. Best decision ever. If I didn’t care about my waistline, I would have one of their amazing looking deserts. Highly recommend! You can’t go wrong.

formatted_address: 2001 Boulevard Robert-Bourassa, Montréal, QC H3A 2A6, Canada
name: Essence

reviews.text: This restaurant is located a few steps below ground level, but it has a lot of windows. It's very nice to be there on a sunny day. The decoration is classy and the service is very attentive. My water glass was never empty. The food is good, but nothing extraordinary. It's a little pricier than your average restaurant but the location and service is worth it. I went there for lunch and I would go back.
Service was great with kind staff. Food was delicious and atmosphere was nice. The price a bit more than I would normally pay for the same items.

Very nice place, food is good, nice ambience, staff is friendly, prices are reasonable, and service was fast...
Our waitress was so very nice to our 8yrs son, so much, that he actually tip her of his own money.
Of course I will come back here.

Lobster linguine,  a must try.
Absolutely delicious. 
Wonderful atmosphere. 
Amazing customer service. 
I will go there every time i visit Montreal. 
Love it!!!!!!

The food is delicious and the staff is very friendly. I went for lunch and the service was fast and efficient. This is a great restaurant with fast service. I had the salmon and it was perfectly cooked. It melted in the mouth. 
Miammmmm!

formatted_address: 313 Rue Beaubien E, Montréal, QC H2S 1R9, Canada
name: Bruno Sport Bar

reviews.text:
I initially wanted to watch the Sweden vs England world cup at Bishop and Baggs but they were already full by 8:30am so had to quickly find somewhere else to go too. I did a quick google search and this place came up. 

I was really impressed with this place, they had lots of screens, breakfast options (even though they usually don't), and plenty of outdoor and indoor seating. 

Ordered some coffee, chocolate milk, croissants with ham and cheese, a grilled cheese with ham, and they had a panneton cake as an option for dessert otherwise they had Nutella for toast or croissants.

Will definitely come back to see the England vs Belgium match this Saturday.

Cash only.
Best bar around, very laid back, comfortable, affordable and cool. Awesome service and delicious food. Cool for a coffee and great for beer and watch the game. Love this place.
Great ambiance, very clean. The food is good for the price.

Good beer and price 
Nice place

Unassuming, unpretentious sports bar. Will cover anything from Motorsports to early morning Premier League Football.  Come for the sports, stay for the service! Best barkeeps on the strip! Serves a mean latte, too.

formatted_address: 1725 Bd Des Laurentides, Laval, QC H7M 2P5, Canada
name: Taverne Saint Martin

reviews.text: Plus un "casino" de Laval, mais un bon spot tranquille pour y boire une bière.
Pour prendre une biere tranquillement cest la place
Ce n est pas un restaurant c est un bar j y travaille
Tres belle ambiance relax et le staff offre un service cordial et chaleureux je le recommande a tour le monde
Je demeure à QUÉBEC et chaque fois que je rend visite à mon fils à LAVAL (VIMONT), je ne manque pas l'occasion d'y aller. Très belle ambiance.

formatted_address: 212 Rue Notre-Dame Ouest, Montréal, QC H2Y 1T3, Canada
name: 212 Montréal

formatted_address: 5014 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2T 1R7, Canada
name: Le Roseline - Café - Bar à Vin/Cocktails - Gin/Scotch Bar - Cuisine du Marché

Le Roseline - Café - Bar à Vin/Cocktails - Gin/Scotch Bar - Cuisine du Marché

reviews.text: Loving the atmosphere reflecting the chic and vintage French pleasant ambiance. The little details from the music to the small artwork in the place make all the differences. The customer service was impeccable!  I stayed the whole day for the coffee shop during the day, the wine in the evening and try the food for supper. I highly recommend this place!

The interior design is beautiful and the location is ideal. Still, we had a very pushy service for dinner, being asked many times if we were done even if there was still food in our plates. Upon leaving, we flagged to them an item on the menu that was charged higher, and they apologized without offering any adjustment.

What a terrible experience I had. It was the worst in fact. I wish I can give less than 1 star. They kicked me out of my seat saying they need my table and when I said all the other tables are reserved and I’d like to sit at a table, they said they want them empty for potential customers who might come to eat. “We want to have tables for people who are going to eat, not just work.” Come on, it was 3:30pm and I got a coffee. I wasn’t sitting there for free. Don’t put up a sign saying café proudly outside if you are going to say you are a restaurant. Also, what about all those other (caucasian) customers who have a drink or coffee at other tables? What a racist. How terrible. Never going back and I don’t recommend you going.
Excellent food and service.  Highly recommended.

Not a wine bar... you need to eat to order drinks.
Very uptight place, not welcoming at all.

formatted_address: 1731 Rue Saint-Denis, Montréal, QC H2X 3K4, Canada
name: Mikado Restaurant

reviews.text:
Went for the first time tonight and as an amid sushi lover I have to say this place serves the best sushi in town ! I never usually take the time to  write reviews but this place deserves a 5 star rating. From the food to the service and the very friendly staff overall everything was excellent.
Definitely recommend to all.

One of the best sushi in Montreal... Every roll/dish has in own touch and is different. Sauces are so perfectly combined with the food. It's just amazing! Everything is also so fresh... Very yummy. Always coming back :)

Great place good food - vegetarian friendly as well.  Note this location menu is not the same as the online menu, it’s quite shorter. The online menu if for the other location.  So when we got there the choices were limited as we were under the assumption that the online menu is what is being offered. 

Outside of this, the food was quite good. We enjoyed the gyozas, tempura and sushi rolls.

I tried calling a few times, they picked up once, heard background noise, then hung up, and the other calls I made were just automated messages. I was searching for sushi places whilst I was at another one to see if they had what I wanted on their menu, but seeing how rude they were to have hung up, it is a sign of poor service and under staffed. So I stayed where I was and ended up getting a better service AND they were able to make what I had wanted, off the menu. Mikado lost a customer and I will be giving the other one a 5 star.
Absolute best sushi in Montreal! Period!  Amazing specialty rolls and chefs. Long always makes amazing sushi and gives an amazing service. A+

formatted_address: 9198 Rue Sherbrooke E, Montréal, QC H1L 1E5, Canada
name: Cafe Sunset

reviews.text:
Welcoming and friendly service. 
Good place to enjoy a drink in a quiet atmosphere. For those who are not into the noisy bar scene. 
Will return soon, 🥂
Amazing bar. Great staff and good vibes.
Great place for friends to get togethe
Nice place to have a drink and play pool! Good service and ambiance!
Bonne endroit tranquille bon staff

formatted_address: 2049 Rue Saint-Denis, Montréal, QC H2X 3K8, Canada
name: Brasserie Artisanale L'Amère a Boire Inc

reviews.text: This place is absolutely great. I loved the rabbit burger, and the fish and chips was also very good. But the (obviously) best part of the place is the excellent beer selection. This place is a great example of how Quebecois beer distinguishes itself from the rest of North America - an emphasis on subtly rather than the powerful tastes of beers from the USA and other parts of Canada.

One of the city’s best spot for craft beer!
Also great atmosphere & great food (rabbit burger is a must!)  been one of my favourites for years!
Always a nice place with a terrace on St-Denis. Service is not the best, but is ok. Local / imported brewery with a Chech touch. Cerna is an ok blonde beer.
Really good craft beers. Their Czech style lagers are very good and it's worth trying them.

We stopped here as part of our 'passeport en fût' , we suggest downloading the app if you like microbreweries.
Service with a little slow getting to us, but server was nice and our beer came quick. My husband ordered the Amēre à Boite - he enjoyed the cask ale . I ordered the Montréal Hell - it was good. I enjoyed it. 
We also ordered the cod bites which were awesome!! They came with a nice little side of tartar sauce but it was more like mayonnaise with lemon taste to it. I was able to eat just one bite and be fine two bites I'm full. Still good! We liked it!  Nice patio!!!

formatted_address: 615 Boulevard Curé-Labelle, Laval, QC H7V 2T8, Canada
name: Castello Resto Lounge

reviews.text: Very cool experience. Lots of amazing choices to pick from. Always packed. Staff is pretty cool.

Extremely disappointed.
I've been there since the opening and the service got worst and worst...
I wait min 20min no one comes to serve us and when we order we don't receive our order and we had to remind them again.
Its bad that the more they come popular the worst the service is. It's not normal I have to get up to find a server 
Also the shisha is very bad they put less flavor after 5min it was burned and we had to give back and they didn't even do anything and we end up paying.
Don't recommend anyone going for sure us we will never go back.

Went there for the first time this weekend and to be honest, it's overrated. The place itself is nice and modern, but unfortunately, the service is not on the same level. It took 10 mins for someone to come see us for the order and then, another 25 mins to get the sisha. The staff seemed kinda lost and unorganized.
I want just know how much cost the shisha and anything else i didn’t try it yet but it’s looks fine !! I will wait till you guys answer thank you !

I went there on Saturday for a quick bite and sheesha.

Sheehaa was perfect and food was amazing.

Their were quick and professional and very affordable.

formatted_address: 210 Rue Sainte-Catherine, Saint-Constant, QC J5A 2J4, Canada
name: Brasserie Monchamp

reviews.text: This place knows how to please their clients. Consistently with a very welcoming attitude. The food is fairly priced, regularly tasty and clean.

We went there after the  St-jean-batiste party. Rude staff and bad drinks. We got charged 75$ for 2 pitchers of a drink that doesn't even seems to have alcohol on it. It was the first time and last time I go there.
Good
Très agréable pour discuter chanté et dansé le personnels et les propriétaires sont très accueillants .
Très bon bar tranquille avec de très bon propriétaires !

formatted_address: 295 Rue Saint Paul Est, Montréal, QC H2Y 1H1, Canada
name: Restaurant Modena

reviews.text: Food was awesome! So tasty, not heavy like a lot of Italian food. We actually ordered seconds on the brie app. Erich, our waiter, was so nice!!! Great place!!!

My family and I went to Modena tonight for dinner and it was absolutely amazing! The service was great - our waiter was friendly, attentive, and made sure we had everything we needed.

The food is DELICIOUS. The portions are quite large and we were expecting to have leftovers, but we all cleared our plates since it tasted so good...

I will be returning here next time I am in Montreal!
This place offers amazing service as well as delightful food. The best spot ever. The food arrived quickly and the rates were fair. Highly recommended.

On vacation in Montreal and Quebec City. The whole family agreed this was the best food we had all trip. 

I love a good vodka sauce and this place nailed it!

Fantastic service, first and foremost. The space is gorgeous and worth a visit for that alone. The real reason I recommend Modena, is their food. I've had pasta, I've had pizza, I've had salad and I haven't had enough. I've also had Moretti (on tap), which I love!

I hope to visit again soon.

formatted_address: 2825 Rue Victoria, Lachine, QC H8S 1Z3, Canada
name: Bacaro Pizzeria

reviews.text: First time ordering for delivery from the location in Lachine and we were not disappointed!! The pizza was excellent, made with fresh ingredients and delicious...The person taking my order was very courteous as was the driver. We'll be recommending Bacaro to our friends!
Honestly, I was super good. And its very to be serve by one of the owners with so much respect! Going back for sure. 😊

I sent my friends to this restaurant with my highest recommendations. I  go to this restaurant often. I get very good feedback from my friends. The meals are fantastic and the team is welcoming and cooperative. Whenever we eat in this place we have a pleasant evening.  warmly recommended.

Great pizza, family friendly.  
I would just stick to the pizza in my opinion!
Perfect for pickup or sit down when you want to get out!
We've never been disappointed in the pizza.

I have to give 5 stars! This place was nice and food was delicious. The staff were attentive and really took good care of us. It was our first time trying it out and it definitely won't be our last. The ambiance is really nice and cozy. Perfect for a happy hour, family supper or date night! The food! Wow! The calamari were perfect! Pasta was delicious and so was the pizza but you gotta try the nutella donuts. They tasted like heaven, I think I heard angels sing when all the goodness touched my lips. Seriously! 5 stars and thank you for an amazing experience.

formatted_address: 89 Rue de la Commune E, Montréal, QC H2Y 1J1, Canada
name: Taverne Gaspar

reviews.text: Really beautiful and cozy restaurant. The atmosphere was very pleasant and the staff impeccable and friendly. The food was perfect and the drinks originals. The music was also really good if you like trendy EDM! Enjoyed it very much.

I'm so glad I discovered this place! I went for brunch with my friends on a Sunday. We walked in and were seated immediately. Our server was so nice and helpful when it came to hospitality and food choice. I ordered the vegetarian omelette which was absolutely delicious and savoury. As I have a gluten allergy, I couldn't have the roasted potatoes. I was very happy that our server notified me of this at the time I was ordering. On the plus side, they do have gluten free bread. My meal also came with fresh fruit. Great dining experience--our group was extremely satisfied.I absolutely recommend it for small and larger groups  (6-10 people).

Old port restaurant is having special promotion for brunch this feb igloo fest season. Worth to try it out. 
Good portion of meals
Friendly service provided by host and staff.

A fantastic place to grab a bite to eat and a cocktail to drink in downtown Montreal. Had a great Duck Confit Poutine and Montreal Old Fashioned, both made quite quickly and tasted delicious. The price is also very competitive for the area. Service was also good!

Great service, enormous portion good price. Ambiance is good, light could be a bit more dimmed but nothing to loose a star.
Great spot in old Montréal.

The roof top terrace is Phenomenal,

formatted_address: 438 Rue McGill, Montréal, QC H2Y 2G1, Canada
name: Helena

reviews.text:
Portuguese restaurant in the Old Port, nice ambiance, friendly staff and great location.
We went on a MTL a table festival, when the restaurant offers set menus.
The suggested menu had interesting offerings from the regular menu, however, it did made all of the dishes feel like they were made on a production line, served not especially hot and without really allowing some delay between appetizer, mains and desert.

Good environment. Very good service (the waitress is super cool and knowledgeable). The food is amazing. Please order the asparagus salad l - it’s to die for. All the songs selections are Brazilian. Feel home (I’m Brazilian btw). Highly recommend it. I’m still having the tapas and writing this review ;)

Helena is AMAZING.  This is my go-to spot for lunch because they have a table d'hote that changes daily and it's all super fresh food. The presentation is beautiful, decor is nice, and it's not too loud to have a nice conversation with your companions.

Very good and high quality food. Very good place to go for a business chat or to simply go with friends. The wine card is very varied and goes well with the different dishes they offer. Recommended place!

You will find what you are looking to make your special occasion/ romantic dinner fabulous. One of the best service I’ve ever had, great food, and Charming seafood menu selection. Comfy seatings, not loud, beautiful decor, Had the lobster tail and the grilled codfish.

formatted_address: 1031 Rue du Marché Central, Montréal, QC H4N 1J8, Canada
name: Casey's

reviews.text: It's ok... The food's good though but the service could be better. My friend and I went for a bite before a movie and we ordered four different appetizers . They were all good, the plates are big enough to share. It's a bit on the expensive side. Would I go back? If it's near somewhere I have to go but I will not make a detour to go back.

What  is a great find....we ordered Bloody Cesar's which were generous and are on the happy hour offers.  The place was very busy lots of families.  My steak sandwich was delicious and onion ring were one of the best  I have tasted. My dinner partner thoroughly enjoyed his hamburger with tomato sauce and cheese. Great find will definatly go back. Surprised by there low rating.

First, the ambiance was really nice and cozy as soon as we stepped in. There's a nice fireplace in the middle, and the decor really enhances the cozy feel. 
We ordered 2 different sangrias, which were made with actual fruit puree and came in a decent sized glass. The food itself was made with fresh ingredients, and was absolutely delicious. Their home-made sauces and recipes have creative combinations that make even the most regular dishes a new and interesting experience.
Clean place. Nicely decorated for Christmas. Good food. Reasonably priced. EXCELLENT service! LOVE their fireplace!

Alright, so before even going to this restaurant  I did look at the reviews. 3.5 * / 5. The reviews left prior to mine were taken into consideration, however I still wanted to give it a try and went ahead. I went to this restaurant to celebrate a friend's birthday. From the second we stepped inside, everything in the reviews came to reality. The food wasn't great at all, we were given the appetizers with our main course, both at the same time. Took a long time getting the food ready. The waiters weren't really customer friendly. No smile. Really straight forward, didn't feel welcomed at all. The service was not the best as well. Lighting inside was really low, poor visibility     (had a hard time seeing what was on my plate or on the table). As for the food, I ordered Chicken Parmigiano, it was cold and really bland, the meat was hard to cut. It is my first online review ever, I really had to make this known, because I really didn't like the service nor the the food. I really got disappointed. The prices don't match up to the food quality at all.

formatted_address: 1600 Rue Robinson, Laval, QC H7W 2W4, Canada
name: Rose Ange Night Club Laval

reviews.text: Super fun bar to go dancing! Lots of space and friendly staff. A friend of mine use to bartend there a while back and introduced me to this cool spot.
Good chilling spot low key. Lots of available woman and affordable drinks and bottle service  girls love this place cause they dance

Since the owner asked for more informations on my 1 star : please see my friend Katherine Camiré's comment from 2 months ago, I was with her and witness the bartender stuffing a napkin in her mouth WHILE SHE WAS TALKING. You need any more details ? One bad apple but that was too much.
Found they are very disrespectful  and want 50 percent tip  pluss drinks are not mixed properly
Awesome club , nice crowd

formatted_address: 3031 Boulevard Laurier, Québec, QC G1V 2M2, Canada
name: Ginger

reviews.text:
Great food. Good portion. Fast service. 
Manager David was the best, great manner and very respectful.

Ginger is beautifully decorated and has a very nice atmosphere. I stopped by for lunch and the restaurant was full of conference attendees. I was afraid it might take a while but I was able to flag a busy waitress down to be seated. It was clear that they were understandably occupied but I was served fairly quickly and my soup and salad was delicious.

Consistently interesting menu items. Sometimes there’s (loud) live music. Monday thru Fri there are specials. Wednesdays it’s 50% off pizzas, a great deal. I’ve always been pleased with everything I tasted here. Will go back, hopefully on a night with no live music.

We are staying at the hotel where the Ginger is located.  We just finished our dinner and due to the management must give restaurant one star.  Server friendly but never asked what we would like to drink.  2 of 6 meals came out.  Then 5 min later 1 more meal arrived but was not what was ordered so sent back.  Another 5 or so minutes passed and 2 more meals arrived, still missing 1 meal.  We waited to eat.  Another 15 minutes passed as kitchen cooking final meal.  We could then finally eat together.  No manager came to apologize nor was any portion comped nor any free drink or dessert offered.  The food was ok, not sensational, veal tasty but not tender.  We were all just amazed at overall lack of oversight.
Experienced a great casual atmosphere with fantastic food. Chris looked after us with professional attention and friendly service. Well done!!

formatted_address: 7786 Bd Newman, LaSalle, QC H8N 1X8, Canada
name: Cafe Intervallo Bistro-Bar

reviews.text: Very nice people working there and always well served
Nice people, good place! Always feel at home there!
Great coffee and great atmosphere

I don't know what Steven W's problem was but I had the most pleasant and wonderful experience being served by the bartender with the glasses. He was funny, charming and delightful. He catered to my every need and even offered me a tea, a real doll. I definetly recommend Intervallo Bistro Bar for an evening out.

The peoples in this place made my weekend. I was here last Sunday with a few friends and I had an amazing time.
The owner was cool, kind, generous, very friendly. Awesome dude.
You own a beautiful place Sir.
Thank you for everything.

The bartenter, the cute blondie mention in one of the reviews... Wow... a lady of gentle manners and kindness, she was lot of fun. 
Thankyou for the soft drink too.

formatted_address: 2687 Rue Wellington, Montréal, QC H3K 1X8, Canada
name: Capri Bar-Série

reviews.text: Decent food but not as goid as it used to  be when on St Patrick, waitress didnt pay attention as well
Decent for a beer and to watch a game with the guys
Belle ambiance pour le hockey des Soirée Yvon Lambert
Belle place !! Hockey bar ! Et la bouffe est bonne et pas chère
Un jolie bar pour prendre un verre entre amis

formatted_address: 671 Rue des Rocailles, Québec, QC G2J 1A9, Canada
name: Pub Le Corail

reviews.text: Best true biker bar in town!!
Great food   great  Rock  bands
No 1
Good food
Mix crowd: younger and older, bikers to business, bands...

formatted_address: 1425 Rue Stanley, Montréal, QC H3A 1P4, Canada
name: Deville Dinerbar

reviews.text: What a great way I'll remember Montreal.  The food is decadent diner style.  The restaurant is super retro pop.  The server had a great sense of humor and really seemed to enjoy his job.  My party of 5 guys really liked items like the bacon wrapped meatloaf and the macaroni wantons.  The artwork is very nice too.  I highly recommend!

This is a great little diner in the middle of downtown. Cozy interior with plenty of spots available on two levels. The food is upper scale diner style with plenty of options to choose from. Pricing is mid tier and the dishes are of good size and freshness. We had a Philly  cheese steak and Tuna tacos with were fantastic. I would return to this place if I was in the mood for diner food. Greek owners which translates into tasty dishes and plates on the larger side. I recommend this place for a great diner option!

This is a fun diner style eatery. The food looks good in general. I ordered roasted chicken, which came on mountain of rice. It tasted good but I felt I could have had a store bought roasted chicken for 1/3 of the price and have the same flavor. I will order something else next time.

Amazing  place. Was greeted right away with a smile. Very friendly staff. And dishes were incredible.  Plates were big enough to share. The food was great and dessert  was even  better will definitely  come again.

Love this place. Friendly staff and great quick service. Whether you're out with friends or on a quick company lunch trip, I do recommend this spot. Great burgers with a fancy modern diner vybe. Awesome milkshakes and innovative menu choices. LOOOVED my braised beef rib burger. Getting hungry again just thinking about it. Also, the fries are to die for. 😍👌

formatted_address: 7001 Rue St-Hubert, Montréal, QC H2S 2N1, Canada
name: Omega Bar Billard

reviews.text: I won at pool!
Fun pool hall!
Great .. it's quiet . 👍👍
Great ambiance, but they only accept cash!!
Heyyouceo

formatted_address: 1494 Rue Ontario E, Montréal, QC H2L 1S3, Canada
name: Station Ho.st

reviews.text: It wasn't busy when I went there, but the server was just amazing,  super friendly, fun and welcoming.
I loved the experience! I had a komboocha, I met other people who are also interested in German. We watched a German movie and afterwards we spoke in German. The place is nice and relaxing.
I love this microbrewery. Lovely ambiance, great service, good beer and not expensive. I went for brunch and had a delicious meal!

This was the best bar we went to in Montreal. Very queer-friendly atmosphere where you can get a quality drink and talk politics with people who know what they’re talking about and aren’t pretentious.
Great selection of tap beers from abroad. L'hermitage is a must try for white beer lovers. Their burgers are delicious and the terrace during summer is enjoyable. They also accept Debit cards!

formatted_address: 6015 Rue St-Hubert, Montréal, QC H2S 2L8, Canada
name: La Bêtise

reviews.text: Good tapas style restaurant on St. Hubert street. They offer 1$ oysters which is the reason why I went in the first place and have returned several times after. They are good and fresh and the kind depends on the season and arrival. The rest of the menu is pretty good, especially the salmon tartare. However, keep in mind that the portions are pretty small so different items need to be ordered in order to get a full meal. They also make good cocktails based on classic recipes with a twist. Overall, I would recommend la Bêtise!
Loved it.  Went Monday night for the $1 oysters. Also got beef tartar (yummy). Cocktails were good. Atmosphere was great; loved the music which was mainly hip hop.

Small portions, but everything we had was exceptionally good! The 1$ oysters can't be missed and the beef tartar was also quite yummy. They had a good selection of wines, though it was mostly by the bottle. Only issue was that the St-Hubert location was quite chilly, as the door was covered only by a thick drape. Probably much more comfortable in the summer time.

The service was great, the food was delicious. I went there for the poutine week and had the bibimbap poutine which was amazing. But I was expecting a little more in terms of quantity for the price. Anyway I would definitely go back there.

$$ it's a bit expensive but it's well worth it we had almost half of the menu and everything was so good

Everything is sharable the meal size are really nice if u want people to try

Their poutine game is strong they have made a new poutine for poutine week and I would suggest it's like a poutine presented as like a bibimbap it was crazy and delicious wow

formatted_address: 4293 Rue Notre-Dame Ouest, Montréal, QC H4C 1R7, Canada
name: PIKEOS MTL

reviews.text: Mixed feelings about this one. Great food and ambiance. Kind service. Tapas place with prices between 10 and 15 $ per plate. Two frustrations took away a star. First: A kitchen mix up had me getting a sesame filled plate after clearly stating my allergy. This happens, I knows and I do appreciate the apology and sincerity from the waitress. Second: if you are serving pints of beer especially for 10$ make sure you are not serving them with half an inch of head. The rest of the night was quite pleasant.

Came for Montreal en Lumiere, they offered us this tasting platter that was quite delicious, with a scallop ceviche, fried chicken and some kind of potato stew with rice. All 3 component were great! Special mention to our waitress Lory who took the time to give us an excellent services despite that  the place was packed.
Ok place with ok food and service . In general fast table service.  Drinks are good. Verdict : give it a try.

Amazing peruvian restaurant, we went for brunch and we were not disappointed. The place is trendy, the service is really good. The food is to really tasty. We will definitely be back for the supper menu. The choices for brunch are somewhat limited but what they serve is on point.
The food was excellent. Nice presentation. Decor was nice as well! Thank you Sean!

formatted_address: 7700 12e Avenue, Montréal, QC H2A 2Y7, Canada
name: L'Orage club

reviews.text: Took the wife there in November/2019 and had a great time together. The place was a little small and could have used some more lighting but the staff was very polite and they enforced the rules when we took out our cell phone to check the time they were on me right away saying "No cell phone please". The best part was that the wife and I were there just to have a good time together and do our thing as a couple and nobody interfered. The staff and the other club members all left us to ourselves and let us do our thing(which of course was in accordance to the club's rules). It would have been nice if other club members engaged us in conversation when we were at the bar/dancefloor area but they may have had their own thing going on as well or may have been a little shy as we were. I would also suggest to the club who is now at a new and bigger location, In my humble opinion, please make the dance floor/bar area of the new club bigger. Thanks for allowing us to have are fun together and we will be returning soon to check out the new club.

Clean Place! 
*The new place is much better than the old one, it’s cleaner and bigger.

A friend of mine played a joke on me thinking I'd have a good time there since he told me there would be a live jazz band playing great hits. When I got there I still thought it was possible but once I entered I knew I wasn't at the right spot.
From the glimpse I got, nice decor, lovely ambiance but show up with the intention to have a good evening dancing horizontally and not vertically.

First time at a club like this. Staff were helpful and friendly. Went on a Saturday which is supposed to be best for couples and wasn’t disappointed. The diversity of the clientele was phenomenal from 25-55 and all ethnicities. We watched for a couple hours before partaking in the activities themselves and everyone was kind and respectful. Witness staff changing sheets frequently and the place felt clean overall. It’s probably too expensive but the only things I would change include better quality drinks and revamping the dated facility. Will definitely return next time in Montreal!

Super friendly staff, very nice place to have fun! 
Highly recommended!

formatted_address: Central Gastronomique Montréal, 30 Rue Sainte-Catherine O, Montréal, QC H2X 3V4, Canada
name: GASPESIE BISTRO GOURMAND

reviews.text: Went to try the Gaspesie Bistro gourmand at Le Central; I had for supper the salad  deluxe Gaspesien , it has five different seafood with greens; delicious and very light, loved it!

Bien j'ai essayé la poutine au crabe des neiges. Petit problème, pas de crabe dans le plat -ou  a peine perceptible.  Quelques crevettes ici et là. Bon goût, original comme concept. On m'a admis que le fruits de mer venaient directement de la Gaspésie. Mais qu'ils sont surgelé et mis sou-vide. Bonne chance pour la suite.  Soyez un peu plus généreux. Car 32$ une poultine et un coke, TX et pourboires ...ouch. M.

La nourriture de la Gaspésie à l'honneur avec des crevettes  délicieuses en burgers, en cornet ou en salades. Ces artisans de la bouffe de rue offrent un festin à prix acceptable pour un repas agréable. Toujours servi avec un sourire et une bonhomie débordante.

formatted_address: 900 Avenue du Mont-Royal E, Montréal, QC H2J 1X2, Canada
name: Notre-Boeuf-De-Grâce

reviews.text:
The burgers are delicious. I love the idea of making your own and they have a good choice of ingredients.

Moreover you can replace any pattie by a beyond meat one.

They use home made buns ; you can taste and feel the difference compared to factory ones.

Last but not least, their sauce. It add so much more to their burger, so much flavours.

A great place to get an amazing burger.

Love the place! Good food, good music, good ambiance. Burgers here are really good! I recommend asking for the burger of the month if you plan to come here. The brunch menu is pretty interesting and its word a try.

Great food, and you can customize any order to your liking. Not to mention, most of their sodas and sauces are made from their own house recipes, adding some uniqueness to the place. The ambiance is very welcoming and the servers go out of their way to give you a good experience. Would recommend!

Went for a late lunch yesterday and ordered the Eternal Salad. It was a huge portion and really delicious. My friend loved the Biblical Brie and sweet potato fries. We indulged in a banana split for dessert. Lots of food options for vegetarians as well. Loved the ambience and the service was attentive. A great addition to the Plateau!
Absolutely the best restaurant in The Plateau. This is a menu to die for. Christoper cooking up spectacular, sumptuous, creations - there is something for everyone - even the kiddos. 6 Stars!

formatted_address: 5540 Boulevard des Gradins, Québec, QC G2J 1A1, Canada
name: La Cage - Brasserie sportive

reviews.text: Lots of TV’s. Literally a wall-of-tv. Fun atmosphere English menu available. Good food and service.
Lots of tv. Decent pub style food. Better assortment of craft beers on tap.
Great birthday
