Service was good considering we were almost 60 people. Only complaint is that when one of the 11 year olds ordered chicken fingers they gave him the adult portion without confirming with the parents.
Its Aaaaaaaawesome and hockey on the BIIIIIIIG SCREEN ...sweeeet

formatted_address: 6225 Boulevard Léger, Montréal-Nord, QC H1G 3P3, Canada
name: Cafe-Bar La Citta

reviews.text: Impolitesse
Ce bar est un lieux bien tranquille pour boire quelques bières en relaxant ou pour les gens qui aiment jouer aux machines de Loto Québec, c'est très bien comme place.
tres bon staff et le café est magique
Tres gentil le staff
La place pour gagné au machine yeah man

formatted_address: 4536 Rue Saint-Denis, Montreal, QC H2J 2L3, Montreal, QC H2J 2L1, Canada
name: Bistro De Paris

reviews.text: My friend and I discovered this little gem while visiting Montreal on Sunday night. The beer shcooners were cheap and delicious! Our lovely bartender provided excellent service and excellent tunes for the evening! All the hits! we didnt get a chance to get her name but she was working Sunday evening Oct 21st. There is a pool table in the back, clean washrooms, great ambiance for a non-pretentious pub. We wish we can come back soon and recommend this place to anyone! Thank you!

A montreal staple with fair service and sound.  We're really lucky to have show bars which cater to smaller groups and performances.  The downside to this is you never know who's playing so best to research the acts before showing up.
Cool dive bar, pool table in the back and cheap beer
Good to have a good nigth
Nice place, good people!

formatted_address: 333 Avenue Taniata, Saint-Romuald, QC G6W 5M6, Canada
name: Bar L'Extase

reviews.text: Not your "classy" kind of gentlemen's club let's say. It's clean and all but the ambience is lacking and the girls that were there...
avis d'une danseuse: staff extraordinaire! surtout le gérant et le dj. Bonne clientèle, majoritairement respectueux et Bar très propre.

C’est vraiment dommage, cela fait deux ans que je viens ASSEZ régulièrement, aujourd’hui ils ne me laissent pas rentrer car on présente un copie informatique d’un seul et unique  passeport en règle (la seul personne sans passeport avait 20ans, et ce genre de copies sont tolérées lors de contrôles routier et mêmes pour des papiers gouvernementaux)sur 6 personnes présentes !
6 clients de perdu à tout a jamais !
J’espère que tu est fière👏🏾👏🏾👏🏾👏🏾👏🏾
Tu fait ton travail à merveille 👍🏾
door man violant sans aucune bonne raison
Belle place tranquille pour un 4 à 7

formatted_address: 5830 Rue Bélanger, Saint-Léonard, QC H1T 1G6, Canada
name: Resto Corona

reviews.text: Grear decor and friendly staff.
Decent priced beer but the barmaid on site when I visited the place could have been friendlier
Best bar in the east end of town. Especially friday nights. Went on a Saturday morning and got outstanding service from the bartender frankie.
its not a restaurant but cafe bar ... friendly people and decent prices
Great atmosphere, Very friendly bar tender, clean Establishment.

formatted_address: 199 Rue Jean-Talon, Montréal, QC H2R 1S8, Canada
name: Restaurant Alep

reviews.text:
The flavours!! 

Just go and let the flavours slowly travel from your tongue to whichever part of the brain processes them. You will absolutely want to go again. 

We had the vegetarian platter and it was magic. 

We lucked out and got a table, but reserving ahead is a good idea.

Very good food, best is to ask the waiter to propose a menu. Food is excellent, wine list is impressive and desert menu does not disappoint. Staff are very nice and helpful, and prices are simply good. I would come again and again

A new special find for me! Definitely one of the most delicious food I had in the past years.

Expect excellent food at high prices (25$ for low priced meals, 30-40$ for regular priced meals)

If you'd like an authentic taste of Syria in Montreal, you must try Alep. They offer a tasting menu that is wonderful for first timers and prices are reasonable. You will most likely need a reservation: it's a rather trendy spot and gets full quickly. Also a wonderful spot for a date: their wine list is extensive and they have a sommelier that is extremely well-informed. Staff is professional, and service is wonderful. That said: if you expect a quick bite, this place might not be for you. If you go to Alep, you should take your time, and experience the food.

just incredible. service was fantastic, really appreciated the fact that they can deconstruct plates, so you get to taste a bit of everything that you want.. great quality-price ratio, and I'm planning to go back. the kind of place you want all your friends to go taste.

formatted_address: 4483 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2W 1Z8, Canada
name: Le Belmont

reviews.text: Intimate show venue in the Plateau. This venue creates a nice environment for smaller shows but it’s size can make it feel packed and hard to move around as there can be a few things that block your view especially from upstairs on the balcony. Overall, good spot! Service at the bar and table service were great even if it was busy!

Got meet and greet tickets and an email saying to arrive at 7:00 the show was supposed to start at 8. The doors only opened at 8:00pm for those with meet and greet tickets. The line up had 30+ people in it and only 5 of us were allowed in until 8:30.
Best underground place to discover up and comers artist from the dubstep scene

They have an awful system where the line to scan your tickets is the same one for the coat check. This is especially troublesome for the winter (half of the year). It's utter chaos! Make sure you arrive as early as possible for a show and be prepared to wait a few hours because these people have no sense of organization and crowd management.
This place is terrible, overpriced, and I could not request music when no one was there. Do not recommend.

formatted_address: 5460 Chemin de la Côte-des-Neiges, Montréal, QC H3T 1Y7, Canada
name: Alcove

reviews.text: Alcove took over this site from NDB BURGER, the food is top notch, great burgers and poutine. The onion rings are a must. The beef is always fresh and the burgers are innovative. You definitely get your moneys worth big quality portions. Did not make it to dessert this time, no room left for that. The staff is attentive and super friendly.

🤤 Had the Veg burger w/ sweet potato fries which were to die for. Love that the burger is made with goats cheese which is a favorite of mine. They're drinks are worth their price. Good sizes. Had good service, having nothing to complain about. Also good location.
Wow, the fries and calamari are exquisite. Definitely give this place a try, you won't regret it. Here's some pics to convince you!
Nice space with great service. Fries and poutine were really good but the onion rings were average. Unfortunately all of our burgers were really dry but still very tasty.

We came here while we were visiting from out of town. Loved the food and excellent service. Had some AMAZING burgers. Fair prices, great taste and quality. We were very impressed! Also a really nice atmosphere in the restaurant with the decor.

formatted_address: 1155 Rue Metcalfe, Montréal, QC H3B 2V6, Canada
name: Peroni

reviews.text:
Perfect date night spot!
Enjoy some dinner and then catch a comedy show at your same table!
I had the best time here!
I will definitely be coming back!

The poutine burger is always to die for. Best poutine in Montreal I've tried. Always good. I've had a mix up in my order but the waitress was kind and understood the mistake and corrected it in a timely manner.

If you are looking for an amazing Italian restaurant in downtown Montreal, you should definitely give a try at this lovely place. Fast service, courteous staff and delicious food at reasonable prices - all adds to how wonderful this place is. I went there with group of friends and everyone was happy with their services. We got to sit in a room which looks like a meeting room (with screen). Didn't ask though but seems like one can book rooms for casual meeting and enjoy the food at this place :D.
Start with a nice meal, something to drink by the time the stand-up comedy starts you are continuously smiling and laughing of so much joy. nice Ambience, Good service. No need to say more. Go visit.

Went to see a comedy show. Price was reasonable and parking was validated. Clear instructions were given. We were greeted by friendly and helpful staff. We were able to have a fun night and they made it so easy for us. Will definitely do again.

formatted_address: 153 Rue Saint-Amable, Montréal, QC H2Y 1E7, Canada
name: Perché Bar Terrasse

reviews.text: Food is good, great atmosphere. Hostess was friendly and welcoming. But service was slow and needs improvement.

Beautiful classy place in old Montreal :).   We just walked up from the street without any expectations .   And it's one terrific find :) 

Good service excellent food offerings .   Love the service by Madeline. 

Good vibe. Beautiful views :)

Incredible view & a nice ambiance! The salmon tartare was incredibly good! For sure, it has to be the best one I’ve had so far. However, I did not give it a 5 star because the music was a bit too loud & the sangria was really disappointing. It barely tasted like anything & for the price of that drink I expected more. Overall, I recommend & will go back next summer !
Amazing views and reasonable prices--head here on a sunny day babayyyy
The best terrasse of down town Montreal, in my opinion.

formatted_address: 3185 Hochelaga, Montréal, QC H1W 1G4, Canada
name: VPN Privacy Services

formatted_address: 107 Rue Saint-Charles Ouest, Longueuil, QC J4H 1C7, Canada
name: Bistro Du Vieux-Longueuil

reviews.text: Played a small gig there a couple weeks ago and I had a blast.. Cool place for small shows...
Love this bar. Good music friendly staff .

Excellent moment !
Des cocktails frais qui sont préparés en live !! 🤗
Musique idéale et une cabane à jeux 🤪
Belle ambiance  , beau staff et du gros fin!!!
Beaucoup trop petit, vieux, dans un mauvais état. Aurait besoin de sérieuses rénovations

formatted_address: 3777 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2W 1X8, Canada
name: Yat's Playground

reviews.text: Nice! The owner is thoughtful
Great nightclub !

formatted_address: 30 Rue Sainte-Catherine O, Montréal, QC H2X 3V4, Canada
name: Pintxo Tapas Bar

reviews.text: A delicious, peaceful haven of deliciousness, generous drinks, interesting wines, fresh food served with great attention to detail. Curteous, efficient and friendly service. Great pre-show experience. Highly recommended! Great value for $$!

Supper @ pintxo; I had the marinated olives, tortilla potato and sardines, all delicious! Had white wine too. The price is affordable for the quality food I had. The cook very friendly, had a small chat! For sure going back!

We were delighted. Great value for money... Quite good tapas (duck, scallops, and tuna) for under $20! Our server was pleasant and it was a calm meal compared to the "time out" complex downtown, which is also going after the "premium food court" idea. This is a great concept... I wish the best to Le centrale and pintxo!
Execellent derive, food and wine. Trust the owner and chefs to deliver a fa tasting degustation menu.
The tapas are amazing. Good quality for the price, good wine selection. We loved the atmosphere and will go back for sure!

formatted_address: 378 Boulevard Curé-Labelle, Laval, QC H7V 2S3, Canada
name: Wyte

reviews.text: Nice place to chill and catch up with some friends, good service, good music, good shisha! Dont expect anyone to dance before 1am tho
Very nice place to enjoy a meal, get a drink, go out with friends and enjoy good music ! Parking space included and guaranteed fun
Nice chill spot,  good environment

Ok I tried to reach it... when I came I found part of the door close and the other part hiding with cage ... so I thought it is closed ... I Reported it closed on Google map... then I kept looking for the location till I find it behinde the cage .. anyway I came .. Seats were not clean ... I keep update so far nothing special to give 5 star
I really liked this place. Food is delicious and waiters are always there to help. The ambiance is so nice as well.  I will come back for sure with more friends.

formatted_address: 97 Rue de la Commune E, Montréal, QC H2Y 1J1, Canada
name: Terrasse Sur L'Auberge

reviews.text: Very Nice terrace with view over the river and the Old Port . Food is ok and drinks are so so. I would give ** (2) stars for food & drinks although the location compensate  for the rest. Get a beer if you want to be safe. Cocktails are hit & miss.

Amazing food and great drinks and service. The cheesecake, I have to say, was the highlight! Perfect level of sweetness and a light whipped texture drizzled with a blueberry sauce, to die for! This place offers a good view of old Montreal but it really depends which side you get seated in, so keep that in mind if that's something important to you.
Beautiful place to spend time with your friends. The best in the Old Port.
Nice views with decent drinks menu. Good to enjoy on a sunny day
Excellent sangria. Food was great. View was awesome.

formatted_address: 3453 Boulevard Saint-Martin O, Laval, QC H7T 1A2, Canada
name: Univers Ristorante Bar

reviews.text: Please yourself and go there! Pleasant staff, atmosphere, very delicious food and drinks. They made out night! And Music was just great! Thank u! Kitchen was open late too which always is a plus
Nothing has changed in over a decade. So I guess that could be a positive thing if you want a flashback to 2006. Makes you feel young again.
Everyone loved their food!!! The calamars were quite good. Loved the Fettucini Toscana with chicken but slightly too greasy. Loved the tiramisu! The service was okay.

Nice enviance good music food was mediocre had the beef bavett  little hard and chewy wife had the same  hers as well , but all in all was a good experience there staff was very attentive and helpful with our needs

I've been here a few times and loved my experience, always great music playing !
However I tried to make a reservation for my birthday for about 20-25 people and it's been a week and I haven't heard back .I've called multiple times and made a reservation online as well and I haven't recieved an answer or a confirmation. The ambiance of the place is nice but I am not pleased with the service.

formatted_address: 5834 Av du Parc, Montréal, QC H2V 4H3, Canada
name: Mezcaleros Tapas & Cocktails

reviews.text: Went there last night with a friend whom recommended it and I was not disappointed!! The cocktails are great and they have a lot of options. They really care about good service, all the staff was helpful and friendly! On top of that the vibe is very comfortable, chill place. Will come back to try the food!

Amazing food! amazing service, amazing cocktails. The owners are welcoming and love what they do. Very nice place situated in a quaint area. Go check it out! will not be disappointed. Tacos are so good!!!! Fresh guacamole, Taco Tuesdays, Brunch and so much more great tasting items!
Hidden gem. First time at Mezcaleros. The waiter was very responsive and nice. The food was just delicious and the drinks generous and well served. I'd definitely go back. Fair prices.

I liked the variety of cocktail and they put actual alcohol in the drink compared to a lot of places in Montreal where you pay for mostly sugar. The taste of the food is good. Sadly, I feel like that ratio of price to quantity is way too high. We shared two plates and would've taken maybe 1-2 more but felt like 12-13$ for bites was to expensive and decided not to take more. 

Would probably be worth a try to take around 6-7 plates for 4 people and split the bill.

Attempt number 3 to eat here, after coming to closed doors twice.
Verdict: good choice of drinks, delicious tacos, good old school reggae music and a nice vibe. What more do you need?

formatted_address: 1755 Rue Saint-Denis, Montréal, QC H2X 3K4, Canada
name: Club L'axe

reviews.text:
I was scared to go because of the bad reviews. Last sunday I came out of the bar next door and gave it a try. I met the black hair bartender can't remember her name was super nice and the bouncer in the black suit was pretty nice. Took dance with Jessica. I had fun with my boys. 

Seems like the club really changed :)
The typical tourist scammy place. Very unusual in a place like Montreal. Ambiance wasn't professional either. Don't waste your money or time. Have a 100 bucks? Better donate it than going here.
3 desperate old strippers. It was very disappointing. Had to get my own drinks.

This club is beautiful there is beautiful lady’s and the barmaid Sabrina is the best I saw. For dances ask for Jane or summer they are both ginger hair girl with amazing personality. They are so sweet and they dance so well better than any other club I’ve been to
Don’t know how to deal with customer personaly recomend u to not go there the manager is so rude and doesn’t know the way of talking

formatted_address: 1871 Rue Centre, Montréal, QC H3K 1J1, Canada
name: Knox

reviews.text: Delicious. Second time here. Great service, friendly staff. Well-balanced menu offering great plates at a reasonable price. Will return.

Very good modern pub. Atmosphere is always great as is the service. Good selection of beer and cocktails. They have all the classics but a few of their own making which a very good. Food is good, my expectations were low because its a pub but I was very surprised. Some classics like burgers but some original recipes too. Always good quality and made fresh. One of my go to places.
Bustling venue with local clientele. Excellent service and incredible food. The cavatelli might just be some of the best I've ever had.
The vibe is cozy and intimate on weeknights but definitely more energetic on weekends. Although their menu is quite short, everything is always super tasty. Love it!

What a cool little neighborhood spot. Simple and delicious menu for snacks and full dinner. Awesome drinks from carefully selected beers to world class cocktails. The staff is amazing and super attentive. Especially that tall dude Brynley! What an absolute legend!!!

formatted_address: 5487 Boulevard Décarie, Montréal, QC H3W 3C6, Canada
name: Café Solaris

reviews.text: Friendly and family atmosphere. Great customer service. Authentic food and clean space. My new favourite place. I felt so welcomed and comfortable here. Giovanni is fantastic!

Went yesterday after not having gone for a while. Always great service from Gio and Rob. I brought a family member who is in a wheelchair so yes, Solaris is wheelchair accessible.  Food was great as usual.  We shared a bacon pizza and fries. Sorry for the "after" pic but I guarantee it was delicious!

Loved this place! 
Nothing to look at from the outside, but the food was good and the customer service was exceptional.  
I ordered the cheeseburger,  and my daughter ordered the tuna melt. 
They had a large selection of beer and other beverages. 
Next time I go I will get one of their salads. The people next to us all got salads and they looked delicious!
I don't remember our servers name, but we went on Wednesday at 6 and she was super pleasant and efficient. Nothing but nice things to say about her.
Looking forward to going back.
Waitress was really nice and the vibe is fun and light! It's a small bar that feels homey, would definitely go back again.

Lived in the neighborhood a while before deciding to stop by, and had a weird experience here. The waitress was friendly, but then disappeared to talk to the James-Bond-Villain-Thugs that seem to hang out at the bar. Ordered a salad which was fine but totally different than the description in the menu (said spicy - it was not spicy at all). The kitchen staff seems nice too. It just seems to attract a sketchy crowd of regulars and the waitress will forget about you if she's deep in conversation with Boris.

formatted_address: 6004 Rue Sherbrooke Ouest, Montréal, QC H4A 1X9, Canada
name: Club K-9

reviews.text: Super friendly amazing staff amazing grooming and an amazing array of products for your cat or your dog toys beds raw food and excellent quality food I highly recommend

claire and the staff are very knowledgeable and friendly and want only the best for the furry friends. they're always ready to give me great advice and won't ever rush me out. they're extremely personable. just wish the hours were a bit better when I have no dog food and it's an emergency!!

I almost didn't go to this store after reading so many bad reviews, however this is one of the very few that still sell the food I give my dog —which I found a few years ago, after weeks of research, to be one of the best quality at an affordable price— the company that produces this food will not translate their info to French and that (stupid reason from my point of view) is why most stores in this province won't sell it anymore. The three people at the store were super kind, and the owner told me this brand is in fact really good and they won't stop selling it even if it means they will have to personally print the info in French and paste it on the bags! Now, if that's not caring for your customers, I don't know what that is. I will most definitely return to this place!

Owner is  snobby and rude. She lacks people and customer skills. She thinks she knows it all and acts as she is superior. If you ask her  a question and you don’t agree or like her response she will get irritated.  I won't reward rudeness with my business, lots of better choices with excellent customer service around!. Never again!
love it.  the stuff is very friendly.  my puppy has allergies on some of the food and they helped me to choose right food.  Plus all balls and toys and treats they have is awesome!!! Love the $$

formatted_address: 9440 Boulevard de l'Acadie, Montréal, QC H4N 1L7, Canada
name: Klondike Smokehouse

reviews.text: One of the best steaks house in the town. I went to this place and I was shocked because of the food taste, the cleansing of the place it’s self, the customer service, everything about this place is great. One of the best restaurants in town. Consider visit with your family.

Edit. Second time I went was not as good. If you can't cook a steak use a thermometer. It's supposed to be a smokehouse but they desperately want to be a Greek restaurant. If you order fish you will get a perfect dish but if you order beef or pork they have no idea what temperatures or seasonings. Cuts are not consistent. The place is empty. The owner, also the cook, tried to make me uncomfortable for ordering a medium rare steak. 

An amazing experience. The food was absolutely delicious, we enjoyed every bites. The salted churritos was an unique entrée, it's perfect for sharing with friends. The place have a beautiful interior, modern and upscale. I ordered a simple fish and chips. It was rich, sophisticated and plated beautifully. Portions are generous and prices affordable. Some of the staff are courteous and welcoming. The highlight of the meal was the desert. Smatchitsos with home made caramel and chocolate served with a perfect cup of coffee.
Food was delicious and seasoned to perfect. One of the best Filet Mignon I’ve had in a long time. Kudos guys!!!!
Excellent service and wonderful food. Staff went way beyond the call of duty and made us feel welcome. Delicious food with quality ingredients for a decent price, would reccomend to everyone.

Really nice restaurant, staff is friendly and the filet mignon.... amazing, great steak, would of gave 5 stars but the sidings we're kind of ordinary, boiled veggies... but yes definetly great restaurant you need to go there!!! Wifey and I loved it.

formatted_address: 554 Rue Saint Pierre, Terrebonne, QC J6W 1C4, Canada
name: Taverne Des Sportifs

reviews.text: Endroits super ambiance chaleureuse table de pool 1$ par partie j'adore 😁👌

formatted_address: 4372 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2W 1Z5, Canada
name: Balattou Club

reviews.text: Went to a show there last night. Amazing music, good vibe venue, very intimate with good site-lines and acoustics through the room. Only downside was drinks were a little pricey for the quality, but whatever, you go for the music and ambience. Cool place.

Went to a gig here tonight - obligatory $2 coat check upon entry, so beware. Drinks did not look appealing - expensive and not a great range. Bar area looked dingy and the whole place is old school... I suppose that could be charming were they not an ominous crackling of electricity and hisses of smoke coming from the sound booth we were seated behind! I went to ask for a glass of water halfway through the evening and was told that unless I bought alcohol then I wasn’t allowed unless I paid for bottled water instead. Isn’t it illegal not to have free tap water readily available in all drinking establishments?

It was shocking! Not as advertised. Money grab soon as you walk in, they say you get a drink with the $10 entrance fee but bartender still asked for 3.50 each and then demanded a tip. Me and my gf are 28 and we felt like we were the youngest people in the place. It was a packed Saturday night crowd but everyone was 40+ and creepy af. Bartender was rude! Good african music and decent guys at the door still.
Only place I know other than my own living room where the music is kickass! Love it all!!

very good club for Haitian-african music 
best music ever 
wow

formatted_address: 837 Rue Clemenceau, Québec, QC G1C 2K6, Canada
name: La Cage - Brasserie sportive

reviews.text: Very friendly staff. Fantastic burgers. Poutine was OK. I’m not a Poutine lover anyway. Atmosphere is nice. Cool sport bar.

This place is amazing! Drinks: Peach daiquiri and bloody caesar are delicious! Food was perfectly cooked: salmon and beef tartare are worth trying! Poutine with pulled pork was very good! Don’t forget to leave some room for their homemade desserts ❤️

I have been once before to a different “La cage” and it was great. My experience at this one wasn’t the best. My server was ok got us everything we needed. The food however isn’t the best. It was good tasting but for the prices it wasn’t worth it. What bothered me the most is our server Marie at the end when we paid our bill we gave her around 8$ tip and instead of a thank you we got “just to let you know your usually supposed to leave 15% of your bill towards tip” this was rude in my opinion instead of a thank you and have a good night. I will no longer be going to this location and don’t recommend this location either.
Great sports bar with wide open floor plan and many TVs to watch your favorite sports team. Large menu with something for everyone. Great wings and steak tartar was fantastic!

from burgers to poke bowls to desserts made in heaven. first time but not the last time we visit this establishment. they do have many vegetarian options including a beyond meat veggie burger and a tofu poke bowl

formatted_address: 4560 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2T 1R3, Canada
name: Jack Rouge

formatted_address: 369 Rue Saint-Paul, Québec, QC G1K 3X3, Canada
name: Pub irlandais Claddagh

reviews.text: Love this bar! Great IPA selection! Service was fantastic! And the food was yummy
Good price on pitchers. Cozy atmosphere. Barkeep wore kilts.
Very personable staff. Met my wife's dietary needs and had the BEST poutine ever. Good selection of local Quebec craft beers.
Excellent service in a fantastic true Irish pub.  Cheers
Good service but the food wasn't what we had hoped

formatted_address: 2687 Rue Wellington, Montréal, QC H3K 1X8, Canada
name: Brasserie Capri

reviews.text: Loved the Capri when it was on St Patrick. The new place (old St Charles Pub/ Pall Mall) is nice. God vibes. BUT.... Where's the Corned Beef??? It was the best thing on the menu. The Pigs knuckles are very good, but come on... Bring back the Corned Beef..( Not Smoked Meat) Cheers!
Great screens. Decent bar food and more. Friendly hard working bar staff  and a busy place when the Canadiens are playing.
Good ol'neighborhood bar. Great tavern menu... try anything with smoked meat. Staff is awesome!
Great ambiance for a sports bar/restaurant.
Great local joint, good food, cold beer and awesome service!

formatted_address: 1241 Rue St-Hubert, Montréal, QC H2L 3Y8, Canada
name: Bistro Au Vieux St Hubert

reviews.text:
Absolutely a hilarious and entertaining experience to see this place on a random Monday night. There was karaoke going . It is a popular spot for students. The price deals are excellent 4 shots and a pitcher for 20$ ---say whaaaat...?) or 10 shots for 20$, amazing.
Really a great vibe and fun place to chill with friends or significant others.

This is, hands down, the best karaoke spot in Montreal.

They have a special that is 20$ for a pitcher of beer and 4 shots which is perfect to get you proper drunk or to share with a friend.

Celebrating a birthday?? Then get the 10 shots for 20$! 

The downsides to this bar is that they only take cash (they have an ATM) and that it is pretty small, therefore, gets packed pretty easily. The trick is either to call in advance to get a reservation or to get there before 10 since that's when the karaoke starts!

Nice place to sing with friends.
Does not accept payment by card, there's an ATM inside.
got my heart broken here once. pretty good deal on drinks. 1/5 would go again.
Good bar Karaoke is fun. They decorated well

formatted_address: 800 Pl Leigh-Capreol, Dorval, QC H4Y 0A4, Canada
name: Bijou Resto I Bar

reviews.text: We had a fantastic experience here this evening. My wife and I dined here late at night on our way to our vacation, and our server Alex was full of great conversation and recommendations. The food was filling, and we had some wonderful drinks. Definitely recommend for the great staff and service!

Great upscale hotel and restaurant that will provide exactly what you need. I was here for a working lunch and enjoyed the soup of the day and lobster mac & cheese for substantially less than what it could be priced at for an airport hotel. The bartender Daniel was extremely professional, courteous and had great knowledge of the menu. The staff in this restaurant were incredible, two nights in the hotel and we felt like we knew them all. Their service was quick, attentive and always with a smile. The food is great for snacks or fine dining.

Easy reservation process (Thank you,  Ms. Emily & Ms. Flavia!) Warm welcome. Great service (Thank you, Mr. Vince). Excellent experience, beautiful views, delicious, and well presented food: We were welcomed with a basket of warm bread varieties (sour dough, and mini olive ciabatta with butter spheres) as we were informed of the locally produced beer. We tried the blonde "Matante" and the rouge beer. From the Table d'hôte, we ordered the creamy parmesan risotto with peices of Nordique shrimp and shallots. For the main course our party tried 1. the tender beef shoulder with naturally sweet roasted peppers, crunchy asparagus,  and flavourful potato puree (see photo) ; 2. The grilled trout with quinoa salad; and 3. The creamy sea shell pasta with chorizo salad. The dessert was a divine surprise! A delectable frozen pistachio pâté over raspberry confit, chocolate & pistachio crumble, and fresh raspberries. A first time experience tasting such a dessert. I devoured it before thinking to photograph it--my only regret. It was such a delicious piece of art! It's got me planning my return to Bijou Restaurant at The Marriot YUL. And, parking is validated after you dine. Really memorable experience!

The meal I had at Bijou was one of the best meal I had in a while. The cheese plate was delicious, the steak good, but a little more cooked than asked, the dessert was excellent. Service was good. This restaurant is so good I wish I had to pick someone up at the airport weekly.

The best restaurant option at the airport both before or after security if you have enough time before your flight! The ambience is relaxing and the food quite good. The meat was perfectly grilled and really tasty. The service is fast (in and out in 50m) and very friendly!

formatted_address: 2131 Rue Sainte-Catherine E, Montréal, QC H2K 2H9, Canada
name: Restaurant Abruzzo

reviews.text: Our visit was fantastic from start to finish. The welcoming ambience, mood music charming and outstanding service and delicious food were a great start. But the custom cocktails, attention to detail, views of the cartier bridge and the outright perfection of the evening left us so satisfied. We are just visitors to montreal and luck brought us to a perfect spot for our evening!!! Try the Sara cocktail, its sublime
Nice restaurant, good food, good vibe. Very satisfied! Highly recommend
Hidden gem in MTL. Everything we ate was aeesome
Great restaurant! Had a great time with some friends for a birthday! Great food and cool cocktails. Honestly a small but welcoming and fantastic restaurant! Highly recommend!
A restaurant that makes you feel like home. Great food must try!!

formatted_address: 1476 Rue Crescent, Montréal, QC H3G 2B6, Canada
name: Club Electric Avenue

reviews.text:
I was expecting a mixed experience and I had one.... they play fancy without being it. Staff could be nicer, with less attitude, horrible to not be able to seat when most tables are empty, but reserved for bottle service. 
Dance floor really nice though and the patrons were fun, surprisingly.

I wouldn’t come back, although the music wasn’t bad either... The arrogant condescending vibe of the stuff is a definite turn off.
such a fun place! and their staff is amazing. will definitely be back

We had our wedding after party here and had booked the VIP booths with bottle service. We had the best time!! The staff was amazing and attentive. We didn't have to go looking for anyone or ask for anything! Couldn't have had a better ending to such a magical day! Thanks again!!

The music was great however don't try to get a glass of water. They will only sell you bottled water for $2! This is taking advantage of those who don't drink or are designated drivers. I had to argue to convince the bartender which is so unnecessary. This is highly illegal to not serve water. It also contributes to the plastic bottle waste epidemic. Never had this happen before. I will not be going back here unless I get an apology and know that water will be really available. Shame on you!!!

Amazing! Thanks to my bff Jackson for bringing me here! Music and dance floor bouncing. Friendly and personable staff (love you Stephanie 😘) and great music! Brought my son and his gf here for 2020 New Years for their first club experience too! They had a BLAST!!!Doormen always friendly and keeping there eyes on things! Yes, no seats unless you’re a vip but was too busy dancing and having a blast to care the few times I’ve been. Will definitely be back!

formatted_address: 55 Rue Saint-Jacques 8e étage, Montréal, QC H2Y 3X2, Canada
name: Terrasse Place D'Armes

reviews.text: Staying at the hotel we stopped for a drink, drink was good, service impersonal.  Went back for a bite to eat another evening sitting at the bar, 5 minutes,  no hello, no drink order, mess in front us from the last patrons, 3 people behind the bar...we left and it's too bad because it's a great location with a ton of potential, just give a s?!#
The view is really nice & i ordered a salmon tartare that was delicious. However, our drinks took a while to come because the waitress had forgotten about them.
Lovely little roof top bar. Delicious drinks, nice staff. If you like gin, the gingin was spectacular.really nice views of old Montreal

Great staff and service.  The kitchen was running behind for our burgers, but the server brought us some olives and nuts to hold us over without us even asking.  We had our dinner in 30 minutes, which was not a bad wait anyway.
Great terrasse for a drink. Beautiful view of the old port and Notre-Dame church. I would however not recommend to eat there. Better options elsewhere.

formatted_address: 6631 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2S 3C5, Canada
name: Vices & Versa

reviews.text: The veggie burger was amazing. And I like that you can do half fries, half salad. The waiter recommended a good beer. Nice patio atmosphere.

We were super happy to come across this little gem online. They have a large beer selection, and the food was filling. We sat in their cute patio area out back and it was perfect. We also had a great waitress who helped us plan out some fun places to go in the area once we were done. She was from Paris, but forget her name. Overall, high recommended!!
A nice quaint brewery away from the craziness of downtown. Lovely outdoor seating. A very impressive tap list and they are happy to help pick a beer for your tastebuds for you!

Vices is very good. I wish less people went there, because I don't like busy places and this place is always busy. I thought about leaving a bad review, in a effort to make sure people don't go here, so I could have it all to myself. But then I thought that that's a betrayal of the trust that godgle has put in us, the reviewers.

Nice pub specializing in local area craft beers with 40 on tap and a decent bottle selection to compliment their drafts.  

The ambiance is very warm and welcoming with a traditional pub style decor and feel.  The bar top is the focal point with plenty of seating.  

The staff here are friendly, courteous, professional and willing to assist in describing the beer profiles they have on draft..  

The food is well crafted and their menus items should appeal too many palates.  They have excellent french fries here and they are cooked/fried to perfection.

formatted_address: 5050 Boulevard Wilfrid-Hamel, Québec, QC G2E 5X5, Canada
name: Le Rascal

reviews.text: Great experience! Service was good, the waitress was very nice and quick. Placed our order and bread was brought to the table right away. The food was very good! It was nicely accompanied by either potatoes or rice, or veggies or coleslaw. Portions were reasonable for the price and left feeling full and happy to return again if in the area!
Feeling like a great tender steak? This is the place. Highly recommended their new york strip loins!
Very good grill. The raw meat is perfect. Try the tataki entree ( is like a full meal) enjoy!!!

Excellent service. Wait time was short. Took advantage of the bar. I had a filet mignon and scallops combo with mashed potatoes, rice pilaf and coleslaw. My lady had a half rack of ribs with onion rings, french fries and coleslaw. Food was delicious. We had icecream for desert with a coffee. Lovely place. I will certainly return if I am back in the area.

I tried this restaurant as it was close to the hotel I was staying in. It was the most amazing place I have been to in last 1 week of visiting Quebec city. I am eating out every meal and must have tried 10-12 different restaurants and this by far the best place I have eaten. I have now already been there couple of times in just 2 days and planning to visit again tomorrow. 
Food here is amazing, tastes great. The presentation is top and prices are reasonable. The restaurant ambiance is nice and staff is very attentive and friendly. I am going to miss the food after going back to Vancouver.

formatted_address: 1095 Rue Saint-Jean, Québec, QC G1R 4H2, Canada
name: Chez Murphy's Irish Pub

reviews.text: Well worth visiting. Delicious food and really interesting options on the menu. Apple, cheese, walnut and honey pizza was delicious. Spinach and artichoke dip was also really delicious. Great selection of vegetarian food. Good serving sizes. Extensive drinks menu. Live music gave a great atmosphere. Staff friendly and accommodating to customers with limited French.  Happy to give 5 stars!

This is a nice place to hangout and if you want a good bar this is your place. They have good choices of drinks and the drinks served are good. They do not allow you to take outside food or drinks. I ordered a veggie burger and it was not upto my expectations. The bread seemed like it was old but the salad they gave with it was amazing. I got a chance to get a quick bite of salmon salad from my friend and that was good as well.
Super friendly staff. Great prices on drink promotions. Best hang out spot in Quebec.

Nice place,  very busy but that probably is because the food is so good.  They have menus in English which was very helpful considering I don't speak French and all of the staff that I came into contact with was friendly, helpful and bilingual. Great atmosphere as well!
Best bet for an Irish pub in the old city. Good food. Usually live music at night. Big place but have yet to see it empty. Typically a good sign.

formatted_address: 3751 Rue Saint-Urbain, Montréal, QC H2W 1T4, Canada
name: Station Berlin - German Street Food - Craft Beer - Döner Kebab Poutine - Delivery

html_attributions: Station Berlin - German Street Food - Craft Beer - Döner Kebab Poutine - Delivery
Station Berlin - German Street Food - Craft Beer - Döner Kebab Poutine - Delivery
Station Berlin - German Street Food - Craft Beer - Döner Kebab Poutine - Delivery
Station Berlin - German Street Food - Craft Beer - Döner Kebab Poutine - Delivery
Station Berlin - German Street Food - Craft Beer - Döner Kebab Poutine - Delivery

reviews.text: I frequent this outstanding restaurant often because I like the good air that is unique to this restaurant. The staff is exceptionally loyal and professional. The service is extremely efficient. Not to mention, the food you eat is magnificent. I have been there more than once and I was never disappointed. The pay is honest. I highly recommend this restaurant to my friends and family.

Very delicious food. Must visit if you wanna try something original and authentic. Been here many times and i just love it. 5 stars for everything. Staff is really good and service is quick. Great overall experience. Must try if you are new in montreal and looking for something new.
This place gives fantastic service as well as yummy food. One of the best spot in the city. The food and drinks came out fast and the rates were affordable. Recommended.

The owner is from Germany so the food is legit!
The place was super clean, the staff was super friendly. The place did give me a little of the Berlin vibe all they are missing is some graffitis in the bathroom.
I had the Schnitzel and it was sooo good, I also had a side dish of Halloumi Sticks they were yummy.
I would definitely recommend this place!
Absolutely amazing!!! I loved everything! Friendly staff and supper affordable price!! Highly recommend!

formatted_address: 209 Boulevard des Laurentides, Laval, QC H7G 2T7, Canada
name: Bistro La Coquille

reviews.text: We went to the restaurant like at 1am on a Saturday. We were the only ones there. There was a live DJ. The music was good. The service was not the best. The gentlemen that served us did not ask us if we wanted drinks. He just bought a pitcher of water to the table. He lost a potential upsell of alcoholic or non alcoholic beverages. The food was okay. I really wanted fried fish but they say they dont fry fish.🙁  the lambi/conch portion was super small and didnt taste to my liking. I wasnt a fan of the rice and beans flavor either. The chicken appeared dry as well. Effort made, but all in all it didnt quite make the cut. The food was fair to say the least. Maybe someone else will have better luck. The pro was that it was open  super late at night and the music was good.

This place is amazing. I was really impressed. Very clean, and the food was amazing.
The guy who served us was really nice.
9/10👌👍

Had fish dinner with rice, plantation and salad. portion size is right. 
The price is very reasonable and I enjoyed the food, 
The staff is very friendly, language French, English and Creole, there is DJ on Fridays and Saturday nights.
Highly recommend this Bistro.
Very great Haitian food! Not too oily and fat and very nicely plated. The soup was my favourite. Not much parking around but big selection of meats : Lambi, Griot and cabri
The place is super clean, food 👌🏾

formatted_address: 2019 Boulevard Taschereau, Longueuil, QC J4K 2Y1, Canada
name: Motel Royal Labarre

reviews.text: Good service, cheap, has a free car parking. Good for you if you are not very picky about your neighbours.

It was okay, the room had cobwebs and looked somewhat clean.  The water pressure and temperature was horrible, you either got boiling hot water or ice cold and maybe 60 seconds of average temperature. We paid more than we usually do for a hotel/motel and the price/service just don't cut it.  I've stayed downtown MTL for less or slightly more for better (Chrome, Delta, some hostels etc).
Was clean but a run down hotel.. tiles on bathroom floor were broken and paint off the walls.. hallways were dirty
Good place great customer service from the front desk price are reasonable and rooms are cleans
Very pleasant staff who accommodated with bigger than required room. Service was on point despite last minute booking. Will recommend to others to stay.

formatted_address: 7295 Avenue Bloomfield, Montréal, QC H3N 2H1, Canada
name: Acropolis Cafe Bar

reviews.text: Very good
Great coffee
Old Greek gents place
Petit café très sympathique. Clientèle d'habitués. La télévision diffuse les infos grecques.

formatted_address: 2641 Chemin Saint-Charles, Terrebonne, QC J6W 5Y1, Canada
name: Bar Le cozzy

reviews.text: VERY NICE  BAR
Why do I get a toss up between diarrhea or vomiting after eating here?
Beau p'tit bar!!!!service impec!!
Jarrive avec des amis la barmaid ferme les lumiere sort et nous dit que sa ferme a 8 heur ...bar de marde
Bien

formatted_address: 244 Rue Racine, Québec, QC G2B 1E6, Canada
name: Pub Mephisto

reviews.text: Very welcoming environment with a classic bar atmosphere!
A neighbourhood bar, don't expect much else
Its awsome yo
Ok
Felt like we didn't belong there. The were the usual customers and there were us. Waitress was weird...

formatted_address: 4631 Rue Wellington, Verdun, QC H4G 1X1, Canada
name: Bombay Grill- RBG - Indian Restaurant - Delivery

reviews.text: We were in Montreal and need a decent Indian eatery. Called a companion of mine who lives in Montreal and he suggested this eatery"Bombay grill". My companion had considered the proprietor and educated him that we were coming. The eatery has an extraordinary vibe. The stylistic layout is conventional Indian. The staff is amicable and inviting. The costs are sensible and the nourishment is delectable.  The best commendation I can give and Indian restaurant's is that they cook veritable Indian nourishment. What's more, this spot prepares veritable Indian nourishment. Everybody in Montreal or visiting Montreal should attempt this restaurant.

Had a quality time at the restaurant. Received exceptional service from chef to the manager of the restaurant. When it comes to the food, there were all mouth-Watering dishes at very affordable price. Everything was arranged in perfect order. I did not have to wait for long to get my ordered food. A lot of options available for the foodie persons based on his taste. I will recommend others to do give a visit if get a chance to go Montreal.
I went to this location couple of times, I really like there food and service. One of the best restaurant in Montreal,hope they will continue there service like this. Thank you for such a nice treat.

I visited here with my family and it was our first time in Montreal. Due to a lot of cold we wanted something hot to eat, we checked some restaurants and we found this one. The service was so fast and the food was amazing.
They took care for us like a family and they offered free drinks to children, that was so nice of them. we recommend everyone to go there and the next time when we will go to  Montreal for sure we will go to rbg again.
I ordered butter chicken with garlic nan and lassi. The food was really amazing and the prices are affordable as well. I recommend this place for best Indian food.

formatted_address: 5430 Rue de Caen, Québec, QC G1P 4K9, Canada
name: A M A Q Productions

reviews.text: Mes parents ont fait affaire avec eux pour mon party de fête et j'ai Capoter et adorée ses sur que nous allons refaire affaire avec AMAQ pour une autre fête.
J'ai eu un party de bureau. Je les est pris et c'était super!

formatted_address: 732 Rue Sainte-Catherine O, Montréal, QC H3B 1B9, Canada
name: 3 Brasseurs McGill

reviews.text: Every summer I come to 3 Brasseurs because of it’s food quality. It’s delicious never disappointed. Reasonable pricing and good portion. Also has good specials during the weekdays and weekends. Absolutely amazing place with a good service.

Great service, our server Pierre was very friendly! Being out of towners I was a bit nervous about trying a sit down meal given the fact that I don't speak French very well however they accommodated us with an English version of the menu. He was very friendly yet professional, the food and beer was fantastic, and the menu even recommended a beer to pair with each meal which was neat!  The pricing was very reasonable! Will return if ever in Montreal!!

Had a nice meal here. My partner and I shared the sausage and mac and cheese (I forget the official name for it on the menu) and it was really nice, the sausage is cooked in a nice sauce of beef stock, wine, onions and more and the flavour is quite nice!

I had the Georgia mocktail which tasted just like a fuzzy peach. My partner had the sampler of four beers which weren't his favourite but everyone has different tastes when it comes to beers. It's very cool that they make their own.

Overall the atmosphere was great, the food was great, the drinks were mixed opinions, and the service was mostly great (a little slow in the end).

Food and service were awesome, but we specifically came in to watch the raptors game , we ordered lots of food and they said we could stay until it was over. We finished eating long before 1 am so I guess they thought we were done and  they shut the TV's off about 10 min before 1am and with 3 min to go in a tight game. Don't have an issue people with wanting to go home after working a long day , but then why tell us we could stay until it was over? Don't come here if you're planning on watching any late games on a weekday . Not coming back here when I'm in town again.

Always busy and a good beer selections. The food is not my favourite but generally I’d only stop in for a beer. I would say - there are much better places with a better vibe and better drink options and food. The staff are generally friendly but I do often see a wait.

formatted_address: 5001 Rue Notre-Dame Ouest, Montréal, QC H4C 1T2, Canada
name: Loïc

reviews.text: Great service! Delicious food. Get the meat pie! And cute ambiance. The cocktail menu could use some sprucing up.
Really underestimated this place for a long time because I thought it was just a bar. But the food and the service with Katrina were amazing

Absolutely amazing service, food, and atmosphere. Highly recommend the jerk cauliflower. It's got a spicy kick but it's delicious. The pasta was fresh and perfectly seasoned. The service was beyond phenomenal with a personal touch. Very cool building too.
I have had cocktails there but it's the first time I ate there. The cauliflower was just wow. The meals were well executed. I really enjoyed the service and the entire experience. Great date place.
Good ambiance, good wine. The vegetarian options are a little greasy and heavy but still very good. I would recommend this place mostly for the ambiance and the wine.

formatted_address: 3911 Rue Jean-Talon, Montréal, QC H2A 1Y9, Canada
name: Resto Pizza Barbès

reviews.text: You have a Choice for healthy Méditerranéen Meals and Pizza to eat into this Little bistro or just to take out.Here are not offering alcohol drinks
Good

Un endroit agréable, sans prétention, calme et sympathique.  Le personnel est extra avec les clients.  Le proprio ne manque pas de saluer tout le monde et d'avoir un rapport de proximité et aidant avec la clientèle.  Un homme gentil et poli.  Les sandwiches de Nabil sont top niveau!
Un  lieu chaleureux bonne bouffe aussi barbes est un bon gars juste quand tu sors tout tes vêtements sente la nourriture
Resto café conviviale typiquement Kabyle(berbère) avec différents  plats algérien des cigarettes a l unité et de la chema ( tabac a chique 😁(    un lieu pour se ressourcer

formatted_address: 8933 Rue Hochelaga, Montréal, QC H1L 2N4, Canada
name: Bar Romana

reviews.text: Tranquille pour relaxez et prendre un verre
Tranqile relax la paix loll
Tranquille comme bar
depuis chui jeune voulait aller la... quanf jai pogner 18ans aller la depuis jai vais ses vraiment fun tjr .. table de pool a 1$ 5 machine.. pichet juste la molson et le reste :)
Ambiance de taverne normal

formatted_address: 1455 Rue Crescent, Montréal, QC H3G 2B2, Canada
name: Sir Winston Churchill Pub

reviews.text: Always a classic for their happy hour which includes 2 for 1 drinks and a free snack buffet. There is always a good atmosphere. Beautiful terrace in the summer. It's a bit of an older crowd, which is nice. They have live music sometimes.
Service was good, food was below average. I would not eat here again but perhaps for drinks it would be ok... Clean bathrooms and kind staff.
Nice place. The drinks are very affordable and not as expansive than regular bars. They have special promos on certain days. I recommend to go there for a first date, or a friendly gathering.

Went in with a mixed group of five after a business dinner - the interior bouncers were cool. It was a Tuesday night, and was not busy at all.

We sat out on the covered patio - no servers came (even after the busboy saw us), so I went in to the first bar on the lower right. Bartender was chatting and laughing with the busboy that saw us, saw me, and didn't walk over, so I walked over to the middle bar.

Bought a bottle of wine and some other drinks, but one in my party wanted coffee, so I was told I needed to go upstairs.

I did. The bartender on the 2nd floor was incredible. Acknowledged me once I came to the bar, said she'd be with me soon, was smiling and friendly. Her name was Adele.

My group and I went to the 2nd floor to get service from Adele and walk back down to the patio the rest of the night.

Adele's service was 5 STAR and saved this rating. It was a 1 star otherwise.

Terrible experience. Went in with a small group for dinner, the very polite front of house seated us immediately but we were consistently ignored by the waitress for almost 30 minutes. The hostess who seated us even pulled our waitress aside and told her that we were still waiting to order. When we politely tried to flag down our waitress after waiting she very rudely replied “I’m too busy working right now.” Got up and left immediately. Too bad, because the live music was excellent.

formatted_address: 1250 Rue de Bleury, Montréal, QC H3B 2W4, Canada
name: NYKS

reviews.text:
Pretty cool spot, the French onion soup was very good. The duck poutine is very good but pretty heavy as you'd expect so I'd suggest sharing it.

Good atmosphere and service. I'd recommend

Great food and service. Mussels were delicious and warm brie and pear appetizer was exquisite. Creme brulee was delish as well. Would definitely go back. Love the Greyhound picture on menu. Great atmosphere .
Just a cool place to grab a quick lunch. Quick, taste and really great poutine!  Fish and chips are not bad either.  Just can a bit cramped in the winter, but lately, tons of space

This is a pretty small and cozy place, so depending on the time you arrive you may have a 20-40 minutes.  Once we got seated, we were told that they are out of burgers, chickens, and some of the other menu items.  But we were able to find something that we liked. I got the fish and chips, which comes with a side salad.  The food was fresh and good tasting.  The waiters are very friendly.

Cozy and friendly place for a pint and a bite to eat.  Nyla was very close to my hotel but I made a point to return a second night for the French onion soup and a pint of cider.  Everyone insides seemed to enjoy themselves and the draft selection was solid.

formatted_address: 5414 Avenue Gatineau, Montréal, QC H3T 1X5, Canada
name: Saint-Houblon Côte-des-Neiges

reviews.text: Great place for groups or a girls night out or even a date! Their duck poutine was great, a lot of duck on top of the poutine! I couldn't finish it! Friendly staff, it's not too loud which is a bonus for me.
This place is great! Huge craft beer selection and the food is very good. Fries are simply amazing! Bonus point: they use ingredients from their own farm!

Nice selection of beers. They change their menu every couple of months. Honestly the food used to be very good and portions were generous for the price. The two last menus are more expensive/less interesting. Burgers shrunk in size and taste. Hope you vo back to better food soon. Also they usually only have one choice of cider.

So happy to see that Saint Houblon was still open for delivery given the numerous shut downs. We ordered one of the meal combos for two and it was enough for 4 meals! We chose the wings, peking duck bread, chicken burger, and chicken curry. Everything was delicious, filling and kept fairly well for takeout. And their sourdough loaf with the maple miso butter is excellent!
Ok pub with small terrace to enjoy nice sunny days in the summer. Amazing fast service. Food is ordinary but this is not a place where I go for food. Great variety of beers .

formatted_address: 9 Avenue Duluth E, Montréal, QC H2W 1G7, Canada
name: Réservoir

reviews.text: Réservoir is a true gem in the city. A great brunch spot especially when everything in the area fills up fast.  The food is not only beautiful but delicious. The wait staff are friendly and. helpful. The restaurant is also in a super cute bohemian-y area with a lot of shops and cute cafes near by.

Heard these were the hotel Herman refugees and since we loved that place on our last trip, had to go here. Great ideas and great flavors!  Loved the sweetbreads and mushroom!  Great selection of beers. Really enjoyed the smoked herring!  Great service.  Just a fun energy and great food. A must do.
Not so busy on a Friday afternoon. Got a seat right away.  Great service. Great selections for beers on tap. Ordered Toast Herring and it was amazing! Highly recommended.
Service was lovely. Happy hour is great deal with popular cocktails such as mojito, April spritz and negronis, etc

Late entry: Enjoyed the beer, the bay shrimp fennel rolls were tasty. I didn't expect the carrots to be raw and only halved for its price, lacked seasoning. Would go back to give it another chance to get 5 stars.

formatted_address: 6371 Boulevard Robert, Saint-Léonard, QC H1P 1N2, Canada
name: St Leonard Sports Bar

reviews.text: Great ambiance, friendly service and cool owner. Very social dude!
Great place to hang out with friends
Great espressos

formatted_address: 5412 Chemin de la Côte-des-Neiges, Montréal, QC H3T 1Y5, Canada
name: L2 Lounge Côte-des-Neiges

reviews.text:
Judging from the current Google photos, this place looked a bit small and cramped to me. I like to see seating options and get the general vibe of a place before visiting, but I was very pleasantly surprised when I came in yesterday! This spot was spacious with a lot of available seating! Some booths, some table and chairs next to large windows, good music was playing, lots of younger people hanging out... overall it seemed like a great hangout/study spot for people of all ages (but maybe moreso for college aged folks).

 L2 Lounge was very clean and welcoming, and the staff were friendly and seemed to enjoy their jobs! This being my first time here, I was a little overwhelmed by the menu and it's many choices/combinations so I just ordered a milk tea with grass jelly. Service was fast, the drink was delicious, and I'm already excited about my next visit here. :) Keep it up! You have a new regular customer. 😁

It's a nice modern place with a good vibe to it. There's a sandwich place right next to it (inside the same building) so you can eat something and get bubble tea. The cleanliness is a bit lacking from time to time though but the drinks make up for it. Overall, it's  a good place👍.
drinks always fresh, wait time is little, customer service is 100%
It's a great place to go to and hangout with friends. They also have a seperate room where you can go study. The drinks also taste amazing.

Great spot to get some bubble tea!
Place can be packed in the evening but that is to be expected.
Staff is very friendly and love their recommendations :)

formatted_address: 175 18e Ave, Lachine, QC H8S 3P6, Canada
name: Au coin du feu Bar & Lounge

reviews.text: Bad place ... not clean
Nice
Good place for drink Beer.
Very nice bar.
An ok bar for the locals living nearby

formatted_address: 1626 Boulevard Taschereau, LeMoyne, QC J4P 3M9, Canada
name: Club 300 Longueuil Bowling Quilles & Karaoké

reviews.text:
Don't be in a hurry to sing karaoke. 

It was not very busy on a Saturday night at midnight and I put in my name in with 2 songs. I was called one hour later at 1:00AM following a couple of regulars who got multiple songs plus the standard group singing nonsense. Time to sit down and order a 3rd beer. Multiple repeat singers later... KJ sings 3 duets... and it's last call at 3:00AM. 

Tally: 1 song... 3 hours... 5 beers...

We need more places to sing.
Great ambiance,friendly manager! Great experience!

We were able to reserve 2 lanes for celebration of an adult friend’s birthday, the type of bowling is the one with small ball only, there are about 32 lanes available to play in two story building, place was adequate for the celebration, food is available to a reasonable price, fast food type with hot dogs, burguers, French fries, sandwich, non alcoholic beverages and beer is part of menu as well, next to the bowling is a karaoke bar that you can visit as well, it still open until late night (after 12am), parking lot is available and free, conveniently located in south shore, cleanliness is well maintained at least during our visit.
Best bowling / club place. I will definitely be back for more next time I am in canada. Everyone was so nice and friendly.

AWSOME!!
It's a small place and wasn't sure what to expect.  My family and I went around the Christmas holidays ( 6 adults& 2 children &1 toddler) there was only one guy working and he was super nice. He helped us set the rank for my little cousin and seemed genuinely happy to help us. We bothered him about 4 or 5 times with food, different shoes sizes , and more people joining us. 
Because its a small place calling ahead is a good idea. There is a bar for adults , but its completely cut of the bowling area, kids and parents will be comfortable. 

I would recommend this place to anyone! children, kids , seniors and teens! Will go again!!

formatted_address: 72 Boulevard Champlain, Québec, QC G1K 4H7, Canada
name: Terroir - Vins et Compagnie

reviews.text: We stumbled into this wonderful place....just to warm up a bit with a glass of wine....we ended up staying for the rest of the afternoon...YES !  ...was that good and the staff was so welcoming!  The service was exceptional...the tapas and wine pairings were  sublime.   Annick 😘 Jerome ....hope to see you again soon!
Amazing service, excellent selection of gin cocktails(give a one-word description, and it will be tailored to your mood!)
They were immediately very welcoming and helpful. The poutine was fantastic! The staff provided great service and seemed passionate about their work and the restaurant. I look forward to returning.

Came here with my wife today.2 girls are really awesome (anick and Valerie) they are very friendly and talkative.they gave us some suggestion about what to do.anick made very tasty hot vine and the food was tasty.thanks ladies see u in June.
Brilliant place.  Courteous and friendly staff who are passionate about their work and proud of their restaurant.  Highly recommended.

formatted_address: 35 Avenue Bégin, Lévis, QC G6V 4B8, Canada
name: Restaurant L'Intimiste

reviews.text: Great place with an amazing veal dish!
A local gem if one likes true French cuisine. Exquisite preparation, presentation and service. Unforgettable even after 2 months.
Really love this place. Each time that I am visiting Levis, we have to go to L'Intimiste. The food is excellent and the staff always very nice. If you are visiting the area, this is the place to go.

Really good and elaborate food, excellent service, nice place, it's just the wine that is too expensive according to me. They are private importers so they offer wines you won't find a the SAQ, the horrendous public company that has monopole on alcools in Québec... you'll have to pay the price for this selection, the pill is hard to swallow when you're from Europe but the quality of the food helps a lot!
Amazing.  Everything is so good!

formatted_address: 512 Rue Beaubien E, Montréal, QC H2S 1S5, Canada
name: Café Bar Danny

reviews.text: Ok
Amazing place, Nice service ans people

bel endroit, des gens adorables, ma première destination si je veux gagner beaucoup de l'argent

nice place, lovely people, my first destination if i want to win make some extra cash

formatted_address: 1567 Rue Saint-Denis, Montréal, QC H2X 3K3, Canada
name: Saint-Houblon Quartier Latin

reviews.text: A nice little craft brewery/gastro pub in the Latin Quarter.  From what I saw this one of the better choices.  The menus are only in French but the waitresses are used to explaining and translating for patrons.  They are very friendly and happy to help.  They have a list goes of 24 beers on the menu that they produce.  While we were there 3 beers ran out and they added 3 new ones.  The new ones were clearly marked.  The Brisket & Beef burger was very good.  While you are able to carry on a conversation without yelling it is a loud restaurant.  As the night gets later the music gets louder.  That said while we were there they had a great selection of music.

We came here when we visited Montreal a few years ago and liked it so much that when we were in town for just one night this time we booked a hotel within walking distance. The ambiance is lively and charming. There's a great beer selection and helpful, friendly staff, who all spoke English very well. The food menu (available in English) is creative and everything we tried was very good. Vegetarian and vegan selections are clearly marked. We especially enjoyed the kimchi. If you are debating about where to go debate no more. You've found it.
What a great experience. The staff, especially my waitress Karine, was so helpful. The beer was great. The food was even better. I had the canard pekin poutine. You should do the same.

It's an all you can eat brunch place. You pay around 35$ for Mimosa, beer, food. The food was really cheap and cold, it wasn't tasty. You have 2 options : vegan and non-veg. If you choose non-veg, you just have one kind of meat which is pork. A brunch place to avoid if you  are looking for food quality. You have better food for the same price elsewhere.

Place was full on a tuesday... You know what that means.

I don't think they were honest.

I think they gave a steak that was more valuable than what I paid for. My friend and I stopped talking, we were too busy eating, it was THAT good.

We had New England IPA, was fruity, I recommend it if you like fruity beer, wasnt as sweet as you'd think.

Service was on point. It's not too big of a pub so servers come back to you regularly. The wait line was short.

Can't wait to take a date there. Real cozy. But I'd probably be in a better relationship with the food/beer than the date. Yeaaaaaaaaaa im coming back.

formatted_address: 1616 Rue Sainte-Catherine O, Montréal, QC H3H 1L9, Canada
name: Kampai Garden

reviews.text: Nice place to get together! Delicious too! Cocktail are super original. Service impeccable. You can get the rear part fully private for special parties!

Can only comment on the night life. I was here with a group of 5 for a weekend trip. We arrived around 1130pm and the line was huge! However, we talked to the bouncers at the front and for some reason they let us in. Always try! Once inside, it was a lot of fun! Multi-level bar which made it so easy to get a drink (never had to wait). Shots were $5 and compared to Toronto, this is a great price. Also, the dance floor is huge. The DJ played top 40/hip hop. It was a great bar and perfect for those who want to dance but not go to a typical "club".

Nice restaurant at noon and becomes a decent bar/club at night. It tends to get overcrowded at night. The food in this place is pretty good, but it’s mostly finger foods and you’ll find yourself digging pretty deep into your wallet if you go there planning to drink and eat till you are full. If I remember correctly they also have a pool table (that is obviously never free) and some arcade games (not sure if that’s still there).

I would give this place a one star. 
Booked a reservation for 9:30pm. I was running late due to the size of the group (9) so asked to move it to 9:45pm to the manager. Then a got a call from them and told them i asked the manager to move my reservation for 9:45pm - 10pm because they were asking where I was. They said that was fine. Mind you the girl i was speaking to on the phone was extremely rude. There is no communication between the manager and the rest of the staff. Got inside only at 10pm because the bouncer was giving my group a hard time to get in. I had one friend come later and the bouncer refused to let her in until someone spoke to him in french and finally was able to let her in. The hostess was extremely rude all but one gave us some decent service and got us the table near the bar. The waitress was nice and she did serve my group well. The bouncer needs to get fired. Every time my group walked by him, he would say no like we weren't already in the building. When I left, i literally had to yell at him that I needed to change my shoes because he was rushing my whole group out the door. The peach/ ginger beer drink had way too many flowers in it and didn't taste like peach at all. Also the music was absolute garbage that night. Over and over again it was throwbacks that you couldn't really dance to. Overall this is my first and last time coming here.

Good food, great friendly service. We ordered several dishes but they all came out way to quickly and although they were good, they did not blow me away. There is better tasting food for the price. Not sure if I would come back for dinner, but will be back for drinks at the bar :)

formatted_address: 4418 Rue Saint-Denis, Montréal, QC H2J 2L1, Canada
name: Le Colonel Moutarde

reviews.text:
Excellent concept.  Great way to spend an evening and satisfy your inner gamer.  
Huge selection of games for all.  From quick two player party games to the longer drawn out strategy games.
The game concierge are extremely knowledgeable, approachable and friendly.  The food and drink selection was surprisingly good.  The staff was warm and often checked in. 
Highly recommended for a evening with friends or even just a 2 person outing.

Amazing little bar with a huge selection of games. The staff is knowledgeable and recommended excellent games for 2 people.

The drinks are well made and affordable. There is also a game fee but it’s reasonable.

Would definitely recommend for a chill evening with friends.

The game master gets 5 stars. Incredibly knowledgeable, friendly and funny.  Suggested a new game, taught it to us and checked on us.  

The menu is a bit strange. Popcorn, cookies and milk, a taco, pizza.  The drinks are interesting but a bit too sweet. Order without honey or just a tiny bit of it.  

The server was friendly but absolutely terrible.  She forgot to put in an order two different times. One, we never received.  Though she was the only server for the entire cafe, she spent much of the time on her phone and had to be waived over to reorder drinks or food.  I would have spent more money if she had been the least bit attentive.

Went there on a whim on a Friday night.

We got there me, my wife and my 14 yo daughter. We loved the fact that we could bring my daughter unlike at the Randolph where it is considered a bar.

It was pretty full, but got a spot at the bar. We ordered food and cidre and played a simple game at the bar.

The food was amazing. The staff was super nice and helped us find a game to play at the bar while we waited.

Then we got a spot at a table and played for a little while. The atmosphere wasn't too loud to play games.

I highly recommend this great place for a good time with friends or your teens.

This is more like a 3.5 stars because it's a ton of fun and the food offer as well as the drinks are adequate, which is ok considering the main attraction is the board games. 

The .5 less is because the seating is straight up awful if you intend to stay longer than an hour or so. Which you should! But I could not recommend for people like myself with fickle posteriors. But please visit with your friends! It is totally worth it.

formatted_address: 1226 Avenue Van Horne, Outremont, QC H2V 1K3, Canada
name: Les Fillettes

reviews.text:
We went for brunch and had a great experience. The yogurt with pear seemed simple, but the dish was very flavorful and very well balanced. The salad was just the right acidity and the roasted bacon with potato gratin extrenmy rich.

Will definitely try their dinner menu.

I would like to take the time to acknowledge the « Service Impeccable » that I have received from Thomas - yesterday evening! This gentleman was so knowledgeable and courteous! One of the nicest waiters I have ever seen! He took the time to explain the menu, make amazing recommendations based on what WE LIKE not the most expensive dishes (like many waiters do) he was so authentic and genuine and made us all feel very welcomed, respected and that our business is appreciated! Merci THOMAS DU QUEBEC! Tu es merveilleux! 
In addition the food was super good, it’s high end cuisine but it is so tasty it makes you think tht 200$ for 3 people with mains, appetizers and drinks was so worth it!!! So the ratio quality/price is very good and not expensive!!!
This restaurant would be great for a romantic dinner or for corporate events! I will attach some pictures for your convenience. They also have private parking on the side and a very cozy and charming atmosphere! I highly recommend LES FILLETES RESTAURANT, it’s staff especially THOMAS as one of my best culinary experiences in Montreal and Canada. 
Regards,
MARIA EL CHABABI

Excellent experience on a sunday morning brunch. Quiet, quaint venue. Clean. The waitress was very pleasant and answered our many questions. Brunch menu rotates every week end or so. Food was delicious and in ample amount. The brunch menu isn't too large (6-7 items). Would highly recommend.
Creative plates with plenty of flavors. Everything was so good! Expect a few hours for a meal, don't be in a rush. Gives u time to chat with friends or date

Underrated restaurant in Outremont! I have been several times and it's become one of my go-tos for a reliably delicious, creative, seasonal dinner or brunch. The pricing is great considering the quality of ingredients and overall atmosphere: it's a great place for a date or dinner with friends. And make sure to check out their gorgeous terrasse during the summer

formatted_address: 1658 Rue Saint-Denis, Montréal, QC H2X 3K6, Canada
name: 3 Brasseurs Saint-Denis

reviews.text:
Good friendly service from our favorite brewing franchise from France, solid well crafted round flavoured beer with character and sparkling spirit.
Dishes is what you'd expect from a quality restaurant with a nice twist offering truly "local" brews by "quartier" from their master Brewer.
Did is hearty and tasty.
What a great restaurant!  Warm atmosphere and we were close to the big TV to watch the game. Food was hot and very flavorful. Make sure to get the pudding chômeur, it does not disappoint!!

Such a cozy atmosphere at the location on st Denis! 
They were open quite early on the first day of the year while all the other places were closed. 
We were truly impressed how delicious their Beyond meat burger was - a must try item on the menu. Together with their coffees with alcohol. (We have tried one with a maple whiskey - mind blowing!)
They also have a particular kind of fries, beer buttered ones.. It was rather a no for us. 
Overall a very nice experience.

I was visiting Montreal with a friend over the  weekend. We ran into this wonderful restaurant. The 3 brasseurs burger was tantalizing to my palate. Service was also great !! I will be coming back on my next  trip to Montreal !!
Great beer and food. Staff was very friendly. Burgers took a bit long to come out though. Overall still very good.

formatted_address: 65 Rue Saint-Joseph O, Québec, QC G1K 1W8, Canada
name: Taverne Jos Dion

reviews.text: Best authentic bar in Québec! Cold beer. Friendly locals. Nothing fancy and everything Québec!
A locals place. Like it. Couple of large screens traditional seating
Best place for beer in Quebec City, bar none.
We're from Toronto and stopped in for a drink. Cozy, friendly little place. Very nice bartender. Thanks for making us feel welcome.
Cheap drinks in oldest bar in 🇨🇦

formatted_address: 89 Rue Jean-Talon, Montréal, QC H2R 1S6, Canada
name: Restaurant 2K Fusion

reviews.text: A really nice neighborhood take-out place. I appreciate the big portions and everything is well seasoned and always fresh ingredients.

This is the absolute worst Chinese food I have ever had. I ordered the cashew chicken and it just wasn't cashew chicken. It was extremely bland, disgusting boiled chicken and vegetables. Not worth the price. I only ordered because it was the only option late at night on Uber eats besides McDonald's, which I should have gone for.
Great experience with Restaurant 2K Fusion. Vietnamese food was very good. very original flavors. Great atmosphere and service was excellent. I recommend them.

Ordered via a food delivery app. Absolutely horrendous food. The Szechuan chicken tasted like someone just tossed some cooked chicken, raw peppers and raw onions in sugar syrup for 1 minute and served it. Zero seasoning. The General Tao chicken was inedible after 15 minutes, it became so tough and chewy. I'm just sad how they can treat customers like this.
Awesome restaurant for when you get the munchies past midnight! 😂 Really love their combos and entrées!

formatted_address: Boutique en ligne seulement, 2577 Rue Saint-Émile, Montréal, QC H1L 5N2, Canada
name: Objets promotionnels

reviews.text: Très bon service

formatted_address: 2055 Rue Peel, Montréal, QC H3A 1T5, Canada
name: Universel Déjeuners et Grillades

reviews.text: I ate here twice, both times for breakfast.  Service was very good, quick, courteous.  I like the fact the waiter checked my table for being “wobbly” and then adjusted it with some serviettes to ensure it was stable.  Little things like this impressed me.  The range of choices also was very good.  They don’t know how to make a decent “cappuccino” (nor do most North Americans), so I stayed with filtered coffee after that.   Great place, would come back, great service great food.
