Stopped here for breakfast. Love that you can get breakfast even later in the day. I also love that I could get a combo of both a crepe or waffle and eggs. This was the best of both worlds. The food was amazing.

The food is awesome. I love how the outdoor setting is heated, so you can look out to the busy street without freezing. Portions are generous, the prices fair and the wait staff are friendly. Would definitely come back. Pictures are of the Universal Breakfast and the Universal Waffle (which was quite indulgent).

We had a great time to catch up. Staffs are friendly. We were here on Saturday, lucky we made an reservation. They were packed about 11am already. The food and coffee is quite fast serving. But not really hot like just came out from the fried pan. The coffee is good, we ordered latte and Mocha. Tasty.

The portion is huge. Fill you up until the late afternoon.
Friendly staff, nice place. We ate on the patio, it gets hot in the sun!  The food was pricey, city?, but delicious. The sangria was refreshing. The mussels  were plump and delicious!

formatted_address: 436 Place Jacques-Cartier, Montréal, QC H2Y 3B3, Canada
name: Jacopo

reviews.text:
Good place for tourists.  Great food and ambience atmosphere.  Great service (place was almost empty - near end of brunch)

If you drive, give yourself some time if you reserved. 

Highly recommend coming to the area by foot.  Depending on time and day, finding a spot to park on the street can be nerve racking.

My wife and I had dinner here our last night in Montreal and we were not disappointed.  I had ravioli and my wife had octopus.  The price of our dinner was very reasonable and the food was delicious.

We were also pleased with the ambience and the service.  We don't like loud places.  You can hear yourself talk in this restaurant even though it may be busy.

Conveniently located in the heart of old Montreal, we highly recommend this restaurant for dinner.

Went there a couple times with friends, we sat at the bar every time and lucky us, were taken care of by Charles. He made us custom cocktails that were nothing like we tasted before. He even created cocktails on the fly based off our favourite movies... Amazing! Food and wine are really good too. Definitely worth a visit!

Food was excellent service was professional with excellent waiters very friendly and social . I had the ravioli with butter but squash with butter and toasted almonds it's was freshly made and the taste was devine. I also had their odd dessert made with olive oil it's was delicious better then I expected. I recommend this place for anyone that's going either on a date or a casual hangout with friends

😍 Wow, food was delicious! You can’t beat the $22 lunch special. We both had the salad which had fresh tomatoes and basil (yum), then the rainbow trout and steak were both delicious. Lastly the cannolis were the perfect finish. Will be back next time I’m in the area. Definitely NOT a tourist trap, it was truly a quality meal.

formatted_address: 50 Boulevard René-Lévesque O, Montréal, QC H2Z 1A2, Canada
name: Restaurant Branzino

reviews.text: This was the first meal we had while visiting Montreal and it was a nice start to our vacation. My favorite thing about this place was the atmosphere. The purple lighting and beautiful bar were really awesome to look at and experience. We were seated right by the window and got to watch the hustle and bustle of the city from the cozy restaurant. The music was awesome! We heard everything from Green Day, to opera, to Sum 41, to Johnny Cash. Really cool experience. The menu is a little small but they have a lot of difference between each item. We ordered the Branzino pizza and the buffalo wings and they did a wonderful job on the flavor of both. My only complaint was that the pizza was pretty greasy so we had to fold it, and the wings were not as crispy as I would have liked. But they really nailed the buffalo sauce, which I was pleasantly surprised by since I'm from that area!! Also worth mentioning, this restaurant is located on level M in the Travelodge hotel.
Ambience was good. The food was not. If I only knew, wouldn't have spent $40 here. It was like eating something from the convenience store.

Excellent food and superb service. We went there for a late dinner and ordered the Lamb shrank, lobster pasta and grilled wild salmon. The wait was long for the food to show up but it was absolutely worthy.  We really enjoyed the meal and had a wonderful time.

Best night ever! We had our family dinner after our civil wedding ceremony at Atty Mona Salehi's office. Gabriel and his team are approachable and very accommodating. One text or email and you will get a response! They made sure it was perfect. The food was beyond amazing! Our families enjoyed it. We wouldn't have it anywhere else!

This restaurant was exquisite. Each dish was a work of art in presentation and matched in taste.   You could tell the amount of great deal of work that goes in to each dish. Had the radicchio and goat cheese fig salad, tuna and watermelon as entrees.  Snapper and duck as main.  And capped with a great dessert. All phenomenal. Menu was limited but that is how a good restaurant should do it.  Will be back soon.

formatted_address: 76 A Route du Président-Kennedy, Lévis, QC G6V 6C9, Canada
name: SHAKER Cuisine & Mixologie

reviews.text: Top place with great service and top notch tucker

Great restaurant. Bilingual staff, and menu. Great prices on alchohol and food. Bathroom was accessible. Definitely a place that I would recomend. We has the El Nachos Carne and a beautiful brownie for dessert.

Since they first opened a location in Montreal. I ve been interested. And hats off whoever takes their pictures for the food because, it forsure gets people in the door. Unfortunately the taste will make it so I dont ever go back. Now I only had an amuse Bouche of tartare. And that two bites is literally the only reason this place is getting two stars. Because the burger was horrendous. Way too sweet and I can bet my house on it, the patty wasnt cooked to order, There's no way. The shoestring fries were decent. But I mean a fried patoto is nothing to write home about. I'm sure theres some good cocktails going on. And seemed to have some good beer specials (with different daily specials to entice people to get you in the door.) But I can't wrap my head around the overly expensive cocktail trend that's going on. The food was really expensive too. I mean it's not even prime location as far as restaurants go. Anyways fail in my book. Decent tartare gets it 2 stars.

Decent restaurant. The place is a kind of typical in the genre (it's also a chain resto / bar) like top 40 music, tv with sports playing etc, nothing really exeptional. But it's fine, the food and the drinks are good but again a bit typical for that kind of place, there is a special after 10pm on cocktail & beers. The place is confortable, relatively clean, the service is good too.
My complaint would be about the rice of the poke bowl which is kinda cold and dry (they make the rice bowsl way too long in advance and with minute rice) so it ruins the fun of a poke bowl. its over all kind of pricey for what it is.. i went there four or five times, i probably will go again eventually, its a cool place if you want to have a late night snack and a drink. over all good but nothing really special. i give 3 stars  because two would not be enough, think of it as a solid 2.5 stars..

The food is good but the cocktails are the best. Virgin or with alcohol, they really are excellent. Nice place too, the staff is polite and efficient. I went there with a large group of people and we had a very good experience.

formatted_address: 1446 Rue Peel, Montréal, QC H3A 1S8, Canada
name: Ferreira Café

reviews.text:
Great Portuguese Restaurant. Went for a family Lunch. They have a 2 meals Lunch menu starting at 25$. Usually go for dinner, but this time decided to try the Lunch Menu. The food is very good and Carlos Ferreira was there having lunch. Both the appetizer and main were delicious. The staff is professional, attentive and friendly. Mr. Ferreira knows how to run his business.
It worth to have a Lunch, Dinner or a glass at the bar.

Also Mr. Ferreira has his own wine and Olive oil from his Quinta in the Douro. The products are available at his restaurant.

Absolutely amazing! While visiting Montreal my wife and I made a friend who is from Portugal during one of those pub crawls. We decided to get dinner and he suggested this place. It was absolutely delicious.

First the staff and service was fantastic. Very professional and helpful. Even the manager came over to ensure we were having a good meal.  We occupied the table for a couple hours and not once did I ever feel rushed.

The food was indescribable. Everything was incredibly fresh and cooked perfectly. It is pricey, but you get what you pay for. It's very authentic and cooked to perfection.

Phenomenal food, setting, and service! The place looks great, very classy and lots of little details. I had the best sea bass of my life, but I ordered rice (which is free) and it came a few minutes late. They responded by giving us a huge platter of free dessert and tea completely on their own, without so much as a complaint from us. Very friendly staff, everyone is smiling and ready to provide great service. Kind of expensive but that’s price of quality! Worth every penny. I would definitely recommend.

It was a fancy restaurant but I had high expectations that were not met. The decor is renovated and modern, with an open kitchen which is reassuring and a fun concept. The service was great, the waiter knew the description of each dish very well, and the manager was supervising each table making sure everything was served chronologically. They even put the napkins on our lap. The menu was limited, but still had options. It’s on the pricier side: ~20$ for appetizers and ~40-55$ for mains. I took their specialty, the black cod for $55. It was delicious, but maybe not worth the price. The size of the mains were quite filling so a meal can be shared if you aren’t a big quantity eater. My friends all enjoyed their dishes and the appetizers. The desserts: the natas were the best choice! The chocolate mousse was too rich, even if shared amongst 4 people. 
Overall a good experience!

SIX STARS! That is what this place deserves.  The service level at this place was second to none.  My colleague ordered a medium well steak; it came medium rare.  The waiter swooped in as soon as it was cut to fix the problem.  Don't even know where he came from.  Amazing. The food was lights out good.  The waiter went out of his way to make sure I had the whisky I liked bringing me multiple bottles to ensure.  The decor and ambiance was true Montreal. Relaxed, cool and modern.  I do apologize to the Francophone staff for making them speak English.  Sorry.  Best place I have been in a long time. Wonderous!

formatted_address: 2019 Boulevard Taschereau, Longueuil, QC J4K 3E7, Canada
name: Le White Rabbit

reviews.text: Great atmosphere! I went there 2 years in a row for my brother's birthday and always had a good time. There was a live performer playing acoustic guitar, the music was just perfect not too loud so we could understand each other when talking. The food was good and service also. There's a bar next to the restaurant so if you want you just need to transfer to the other room if you plan to have a little more fun!
Great food (try the waffle BLT) and a helpful staff that can prepare fantastic cocktails await you. Highly recommended.
Schedule is inaccurate. Open on Thursday 9:00pm, but it's closed. (19-06-20)
Inexpensive place with fun atmosphere. You can catch the Habs game here too. Food is decent.
Great for a family or party dinner

formatted_address: 1478 Rue Sainte-Catherine E, Montréal, QC H2L 2J1, Canada
name: Complexe Sky

reviews.text:
Worst club ever. 
Terrible music. Awful crowd. Scary, unfriendly security staff. I can’t believe this is in the village. 
The only reason to go there is the cheap drinks. And if that’s good enough for you then maybe that’s all you deserve. 
I’d avoid it at all cost. 
I’m sorry for the staff that work there 🤷‍♂️
This club is okay. People are getting in after 12. The fees are fine. A good place to spend the night and make friends

First time in Montreal. I asked around where to go for nightlife. I was told Sky. I come and security checks me. I proceed upstairs and before entering I'm told I have to check in my coat. Never have I ever been told I HAVE TO check in my coat? Of course there's a fee. Then I'm told I have to check in my scarf. I tell them I rather keep it on. Then I'm told ok if you're asked to check it in there'll be another coat fee. IT'S A SCARF!  It was ridiculous.
This bar is really fun has 3 different music rooms you can dancing for, drink also not expensive, strongly recommend!!!!!!
Service is ATROCIOUS! The place is a dive! BUT, the music is really good on the top floor! I just go to drink and dance only!E the clientele looks all sketchy.

formatted_address: 407 Rue McGill #100a, Montréal, QC H2Y 2G3, Canada
name: Holder

reviews.text:
Nice restaurant-bar. Place is spacious, yet welcoming.

The staff is very courteous and professional. Fits with the vibe the restaurant gives out.

The menu is diversified with a bit of everything for everyone. During lunch, service is quick and efficient. They have a nice rotating menu of the day. Each plate is well executed, from flavor to plating.

So good... the food was amazing.  While it offered a lively atmosphere,  it wad a bit too big and noisy.  While the environment may not have been my favorite,  the food mite than made up for it.  I thoroughly enjoyed every bite.

My favourite restaurant in Montreal, I always visit at least twice when in town! The food is amazing and they have delicious cocktails as well (I loved the French 75 and the Vesper). The duck confit and braised beef cheek are superb. I had a delicious strawberry shortcake for dessert (which was made with local Quebec strawberries) that was a perfect balance of sweetness and tart, with amazing ripe strawberries. Super convenient location and very nice and clean inside the restaurant. Best part is the amazing service. Every time I've been at Holder, I have been greeted by staff at the door and feel welcome instantly. The servers are all very polite, quick, and attentive. If you're in Montreal you need to visit Holder!!
This spot provides amazing service and delightful menu. The best restaurant ever. The food came out rapidly and the rates are reasonable. Highly recommended.

Came here for a dinner gathering with gf's friends and had a wonderful time.  Service and food is exceptional!  

The best Onion Soup I've ever had in my left - will keep trying others as this place is now the top spot in my heart and stomach for Onion Soup :).  

Everything was so good that we came back for brunch the next day.  The brunch menu is also fantastic - will definitely come back for more next time we're in town.

formatted_address: Rue Martigny, 20 Rue Martigny, Repentigny, QC J6A 3N9, Canada
name: Gallerie Mur-Mur

formatted_address: 1218 Rue Drummond, Montréal, QC H3G 1V7, Canada
name: La Medusa

reviews.text: Wonderful dinner! Outstanding service. Would highly recommend for authentic Italian.  Thank you for a fantastic evening.

Excellent dinner.  Pasta and Chicken parmigiana was perfect.  Had to ask for wine refill and had to refill my own water all night.  After they brought out meal, no one followed up and checked on me.  Finally when my wine and water were empty for 10 min plus, I flagged down the waitress and left.  I would have liked dessert and another wine, but was disappointed with service so I left.
We had a work event here in the Lower level. Had the veg risotto- was superb and authentic. Service was on point. Thanks for a great night.

Fine italian cuisine on Bishop street owned by two brothers in a cozy decor. Extensive wine list, pasta and pizza their specialty, private room available...the perfect address for a business or romantic dinner. There is also an outdoor terrace.
Amazing food, service and ambience. For authentic Italian cuisine, highly recommend

formatted_address: 405 Rue Saint-Philippe, Montréal, QC H4C 2T9, Canada
name: Kate place montreal

reviews.text: Kate Place Montreal had a splendid breakfast option and warm atmosphere. Excellent service and quality television programs for your Saturday morning routines - Mike Tyson Mysteries. Breakfast included Aunt Jemima pancakes, home-made apple syrup straight from The Kate's REAL place AND pan fried bacon with tomato! The DJ is excellent and plays fire tracks all day. Make sure to buzz 407 at the door to get in quickly.
Amazing! The customer service, the atmosphere, the hospitality, all amazing. Would definitely recommend to any lucky passerby would stumbles by.
Great place for trailer park boys marathon

formatted_address: 1426 Rue Bishop, Montréal, QC H3G 2E6, Canada
name: McKibbin’s

reviews.text: Not just a pub, it's a home away from home. Nice to be greeted by friendly staff who know your name, what you like and what you can't eat. Feeling so welcome makes an otherwise good pub experience amazing. Thank you and happy holidays!

Great pub, multiple floors. Plenty of room for dancing, multiple different bars to buy drinks. Great music all the time and almost always filled with students or young adults. Great stop during the nightlife of Montreal and always leads to good times! Highly recommend as a stop for a drinking tour
Awesome vibes. The staff here are great and friendly. Service is fast & professional. Authentic live music and nice selection of beers.The prices are fair. I think is Not proper for large group.
Great pub, with a vibrant atmosphere, very busy and noisy. Has 2 levels, I visited the speakeasy downstairs which, personally seemed like a more fun setting. Great staff. Definetely recommend.

Great overall feel. Our server was very nice and chatted with us which is really nice. They had live music (Irish instruments) that was something I had never seen in an Irish pub. I dont think they were hired, I think they were just there doing their own thing. Would be back for sure. Just a great atmosphere

formatted_address: 2912 Rue Remembrance, Lachine, QC H8S 1X8, Canada
name: Québérac Deli Barg

reviews.text: Very good comfort food, calm ambiance and good prices. Service is great and it's a nice breakfast place. I recommend this place

Super rack Deli bar here in Galilee machine I give it a 0.5 * I do not suggest to anybody to come here they have nobody that knows how to cut the smoke me properly it's not even steamed right the pricing on the food is wrong the fries are frozen fries that are not even done properly it's not good service here at all I definitely suggest to everybody if you coming to Missoula Sheen don't even bother wasting your time coming by this dresser
Good food and service.
The waitress is great. But Chinese people should stick to Chinese food only . They don't make good food at all.
Good food and cheap price .

formatted_address: 725 Boulevard Charest E, Québec, QC G1K 3J6, Canada
name: Pub Petit Boulevard

reviews.text: Amazon bar with immersive experience. Loved locals and bar itself is very nice. Recommended for people who are running away from tourists
Super belle soirée, Merci au propriétaire Richard et Suzie
Bien servi avec tina la barmande
Sta malade. En plus c est à coté des produits ecologique Lemieux en vrac. Quoi demander de plus apres une tite frette???
Belle ambiances ,bons musiciens chanteur l’es Jeudi,Vendredi,Samedi et Dimanche, bon service de Bar,Barbade dévouée et serviable  Ps, pour la nourriture je n’y ai pas encore mangé,

formatted_address: 438 Place Jacques-Cartier, Montréal, QC H2Y 3B3, Canada
name: Chez Eric - Bar Spectacle - Bar a Vin Cocktails - Fruit de Mer Homard

reviews.text: Lobster season ~ super cute place outside but there’s no AC. Food tastes good , I had lamb plate and the meat is sooo well cooked.
Stopped here for a drink while strolling through Old Port. Service was good and sangria perfectly refreshing!
Best restaurant in Montreal, the host is really funny and sweet! We had a great meal, fresh ingredients and amazing taste. Definitely recommend!

Mussels I ordered were disgusting. Some of them were not cleaned thoroughly enough. Sauce was way too salty. Altogether taste was very bad. 
My friend ordered lobster salad and she only could feel taste of the sauce which was all vinegar.
We waited for our food for almost an hour. Do not recommend this place to anyone

Experienced food poisoning, do not recommend eating here. Both mussels and snails were not fresh. Service was poor— servers were not knowledgeable regarding menu items (we asked if poutine was available, and another server had to be consulted).

formatted_address: 263 Rue Saint-Vallier E, Québec, QC G1K 3P4, Canada
name: Les Salons d'Edgar

reviews.text: Always excellent cocktails and a great ambiance, especially if you can grab the spot facing the fire place 🔥

We'we visited this restaurant on a few occasions and every time was similar. The decor is classy and the ambiance is unique: a sort of 1920-30s retro lounge charm. It's tastefully appointed and you do get the impression that you're not in just any other restaurant. Service has always been very good, wether the place was full or almost empty. Their wine and beer list is not huge but well balanced and prices are reasonable.

We were a good group to go to dinner there. It was a first and not a last. The service was shy at first, but very good all the same. The decor is both modern and kitsch, large space high ceiling, I love it! Looking at the menu I could not get a price, a great menu at a good price. I chose the duck breast served with potatoes Dauphinoises and very beautiful vegetables well grilled. My cooking was absolutely perfect, it's my best breast. I loved it and it cost me less than $ 40. To return certainly and especially to advise abundantly!
Drinks are what you find in every bar around. The diffference- many really good pool tables and thursday swing nights 😁😁
Very cozy. I like the pool tables. Staff is nice and ambience is great.

formatted_address: 1425 Boulevard René-Lévesque O, Montréal, QC H3G 1T7, Canada
name: Birreria ITALI.CO

reviews.text:
Would not recommend the poutine or the burgers. This place is for pizza.

Service is great, the restaurant itself is really nice and comfortable, it's great for groups, and it's relatively affordable. 

I've only had the pizza margarita but I really enjoyed it. And I'm usually not a fan of pizza. 

Their poutine and burgers are just very lacklustre. The fries, gravy, and cheese curds in the poutine taste very bland? if that's even possible to say. I also found their burgers cold/unappetizing/tasteless. So that was a bummer.

I'd only come back here if a party was hosted. I wouldn't come back on my own or suggest it.
Great service! Awesome selection of beers.  5pm Friday was a great time to go.  By 7 the place was completely full up.  Great crowd, excellent service.
Fantastic service and large, delicious meals with great drinks. The ambiance and heating was fantastic on such a rainy day. One of the best places to eat in Montreal!
I had excellent service here. Prices were reasonable and had a decent selection of beer. I very much enjoyed.

The food was really amazing and the portions were very big for the price. Well worth the stomachache I got from eating too much!

The mason jar drinks are in BIG mason jars, not the regular sized ones. Make sure you're very thirsty!

formatted_address: 1576 Voie Camillien-Houde, Montréal, QC H2W 1S8, Canada
name: Mont Royal

formatted_address: 2425 Boulevard Bastien, Québec, QC G2B 1B3, Canada
name: Dooly's Neuchâtel

reviews.text: Nice place to play pool and drink beer!
Nice.   Belle place
Unforgettable moments that you might actually forget the same night guaranteed! 😂
dooooly's isnt doll
Nice ambiance and food.

formatted_address: 2233 Rue Pitt, Montréal, QC H4E 4H2, Canada
name: Messorem Bracitorium

reviews.text: Amazing beer. Really great NEIPAs and sours from what I have tried. I've been to Messorem Bracitorium on two separate occasions. If you're into good craft beer...this is your brewery to check out!

A great start
- 3 good beers , can't wait to see the rest.
- Nice terrace,  can't wait to see next year with the green rope. 

Cool spot. Only the future will tell how the brewery will grow. This place have a lot of potential. Can't wait to see the rest. Good jobs.

Cute place, when I arrived they were trying to add an ice rink. They mostly serve Dipas here, so I wasn't psyched, but I was definitely impressed. It was a Sunday afternoon and my first time here, the couple  behind us got the last 4 cans of whatever they were making rare/limited available. I wish the bar staff would have told me! It's a really comfortable place, seems poppin' all weekend long and a great brewery. I grabbed a sweater and a glass because their skull logo is is quirky and definitely my style. I'm not looking forward to waiting in line early for a beer release next week.

Very good NEIPAs. Not much else though and it's relatively expensive. No table service and they always seem understaffed so getting a beer can be very long. WAY too many kids. Dogs are allowed indoors.

Stumble on this brewery while wandering around Montreal. Very glad we did. Really Cool spot and the beer is amazing. If you're a beer nerd and you're in our planning a trip to Montreal this must be on your list. Everything we tried was fantastic. Get there!

formatted_address: 1583 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2X 2S9, Canada
name: Event rental(see Bar Pamplemouse)

formatted_address: 2600 Avenue St Jean Baptiste #190, Québec, QC G2E 6J5, Canada
name: Dooly's

reviews.text: This is a new doolys. Nothing like before.  The nachos were the best i had for a while. Try it
i mean i just go for gambling so 5 stars
Love the spot. Great value and clean. Best place for a fun night!

This was my first time to this place, the service wasn’t exceptional and the food was below average. The reason why they are getting one star instead of three was because the waitress complained about tipping and basically kick us out of the joint and it was only midnight. Never coming back this place again.
Great place but they close the kitchen too early on sundays

formatted_address: 2300 Rue Holt, Montréal, QC H2G 1Y4, Canada
name: MABRASSERIE - Coop brassicole de Montréal

reviews.text: This was a great discovery for me. Pretty big place with a huge selection of house beers. Good ambiance. Ok service (the beer was poured a bit unprofessionaly). Decent prices. Good experience all in all.

Decent selection of craft beer just not that many that appealed to my palate and liking. 

The venue is nice and the is plenty of seating up at the bar top and in the tasting room area.  They serve food here as well.
Bartenders were amazing! Gave us recommendations for places to go in Montreal! We had such a nice time!
Beer is good, but food and service left a lot to desire.  The hamburger meat was too salty and the bread was old and hard.
Been there since inception, still nice and relaxing on the terrasse! A nice picture of Rosemont crowd!

formatted_address: 270 Rue Saint-Antoine O, Montréal, QC H2Z 1H5, Canada
name: gaZette

reviews.text:
Comparing to other hotels, buffet had a good price $CA 26. 
A la cart was also good. Delicious breakfast. The beet juice was hard to drink. It tasted strong and sour thanks for the ginger juice. Service was great.
Overall,  very good!
Great service, large portions, and great price for a Downtown hotel restaurant. They had a good selection of beer on tap and lots of different menu items to choose from.

In montreal for the autoshow. I took my clients there for dinner we were a table of 8. I did make a reservation prior. The food was excellent the service not so much especially the first hour. I made  our server aware when I paid the bill that the service was poor for an upscale restaurant but still tipped her 20%. I just wanted her to know.

Edited 2018 summer: it went from 5 stars to 2. This place used to be good, but the last 2 times we went,the food was bland and gross. The cut of meat was obviously cooked from a frozen cut rather than fresh. The other platters were forgettable. We were reimbursed for it since we didn't eat it. 

Fall 2017 review:
Underrated! This place has amazing flavors without the pretentious feeling. I love how the menu also changes for seasonal flavors.  I would recommend this place over Toqué any day for food lovers who actually want real portions.

Great food! We're exhausted from the busy Formula One weekend and decided to eat in the hotel. We're surprised at how delicious the dishes are here. The mushroom appetizer was flavorful. It had a well balanced earthiness. My main dish with scallops, mussels, and crab was good. Nothing too exciting but this dish was flavored well. Service is slow so be patient.

formatted_address: 3615 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2X 1V5, Canada
name: Maestro SVP - Oyster Bar - Seafood/Fish - Cocktails - Wine - Tapas Tartar

html_attributions: Maestro SVP - Oyster Bar - Seafood/Fish - Cocktails - Wine - Tapas Tartar
Maestro SVP - Oyster Bar - Seafood/Fish - Cocktails - Wine - Tapas Tartar
Maestro SVP - Oyster Bar - Seafood/Fish - Cocktails - Wine - Tapas Tartar

Maestro SVP - Oyster Bar - Seafood/Fish - Cocktails - Wine - Tapas Tartar
Maestro SVP - Oyster Bar - Seafood/Fish - Cocktails - Wine - Tapas Tartar

reviews.text: Really nice Oyster Bar. Great service! Pretty good selection of wines at a fair price. Went here for oyster happy hour and was not disappointed. Haven't tried all their other sea food dishes, but definitely will be back to do so.

The happy hour deal is pretty good.  A dozen oysters for $22(cad).
Not too hard to piece together that the happy hour deal is how they clean out their inventory.    2 of the dozen had that tang you dont want to taste when having oysters, they weren't bad, but were not far from it.
The drinks were reasonable and service was good if a little slow.
Excellent oyster selection and helpful, knowledgeable service. The seafood pasta main was exceptional, also. Highly recommended, and worth the relatively high price

Loved it!!! We were only in town for a couple nights and  decided to try the oysters here. They were fantastic! Great selection and taste. The cocktails were amazing ... especially the oyster shooters. Our server Enrique was super efficient and courteous.  Over all great experience :)

Run ,run ,run from this place, especially if you are a  visitor. I went there with my partner and we ordered the Louisiana seafood and they brought us only oysters and shrimp nothing else...then when we were paying we left the waitress (with the blond curly and the glasses) a tip and she kept telling us since we came from out of town that we should tip her more than we gave her. She kept persisting...she was a very shameless woman. I would not recommend this place to my worst enemy.

formatted_address: 418 Rue de la Gauchetière E, Montréal, QC H2L 2M5, Canada
name: Boyhaus

reviews.text: Haven't been in awhile, but it used to be a cool spot... Only problem was it smelled like farts
Best party house in MTL Downtown
oh yeah.
Best place in town

Beaucoup de queues se trouvent à ce véritable "hotspot" montréalais. Par conséquent, beaucoup de jeunes puces et de cocottes s'y retrouvent, souvent malgrè les avertissements de leur congénaires. Car au Boyhaus, nous ne sommes pas là pour un "long time", mais plutôt pour un "good time"!💦😇🤗💦

formatted_address: 552 Rue Sainte-Catherine E, Montréal, QC H2L 2E1, Canada
name: L'Escalier

reviews.text: Delicious vegetarian/vegan food and drinks. Very reasonable priced. Nice staff and hipster ambient. Highly recommended!

This place is a wonderful combination of vegetarian food, drinks and live music. It is artsy and alternative, with that Paris and Barcelona air of a place where anything is possible. It is a wonderful way to experience the European atmosphere without leaving Canada. The food is over the top. I had the minestrone soup and the special burger. All vegetarian, you will not find meat here, what is wonderful for me. The dishes had a strong presentation, following the French cuisine stella. The burger, cooked with black beans, had a sweet and elegant taste, and the bun was baguette type, crunchy and fresh. And the music was really good. A young couple with a vocalist and a guitar player played beautiful songs. Her voice was deep and powerful. Then a jazz band, with young players, helped us travel to far away places. A magical night. I highly recommend it.

Great cozy relaxed loungy bar, convenient central location, reasonably priced drinks, attentive staff, YUMMY food with student specials, interesting decor, perfect atmosphere for this type of place. I will definitely recommend it and come back

This was one of my favorite lunch spots in Montreal ;they have a great innovative menu and specials for students: all the products are fresh and delicious from the ramen soup to the fabulous vegan brownies (to be found on the counter if you're lucky!). Staff is friendly and very helpful. Ambiance is casual and cosy. Great place to go with friends or alone to work!

Love the vibe of this place. Every piece is unique and comes together to create an atmosphere like no other. Whether you’re here for live music or a quieter lunch the food is delectable and well-priced!

formatted_address: 4167 Rue Saint-Denis, Montréal, QC H2W 2M7, Canada
name: La Binerie Mont-Royal

html_attributions: La Binerie Mont-Royal - Dejeuner/Brunch - Smoked Meat/Burgers/Poutine - Cocktails/Bière Artisanale
