reviews.text: Simple and delicious food. Tastes like grandma's cooking. Looking at the menu I could come back to this place at least 5 times and not get bored of the menu. Everything is feels like typical Quebecoise food, not being a local I can't say for sure but it sure felt homely. The service was great and the restaurant's mood is very relaxed. I will try to go back before leaving the city.

The historical original cute little place relocated to this newly renovated spacious, bright yet warm 'sugar shack in town'.  Tasty,  reasonable price,  friendly staff, convienet location on St Denis Street.  Highly 😊  Bon appétit !

This is by far the best breakfast place in Montreal. Not only that but you can have lunch or even supper here. I cannot think of a more authentic Quebec place to eat. New location on St Denis is very nice and unique.
Typically Quebec dinner.  Correct food but not extraordinary. Nice environment and atmosphere, with amazing music. Good service. Affordable prices.

This was my first visit to their new location on Saint-Denis; it was wonderful. They've done an amazing job maintaining the feel of their former location with the added benefit of more space and new menu items - which include vegan options and cocktails. I'm looking forward to bringing my vegan friend and trying a Montreal Mule next visit!

formatted_address: 5002 Chemin de la Côte-des-Neiges, Montréal, QC H3V 1G6, Canada
name: Duc de Lorraine

reviews.text: This is a higher end patisserie, so don't complain about the higher prices. You get what you pay for. The interior is beautifully decorated, the food is great, and the staff is very well mannered. Many of them also speak very good French which I find impressive. The location is prime, and I love the ambiance.

Beautiful little place with excellent pastry and very classy service. I have not had a meal here but I really enjoyed the coffee and desserts. They have a good variety of classic French pastries. The ambiance is lovely and as mentioned, the service is very good. A great place to stop if you are visiting St.Joseph's Oratory.

Absolute best coffee/hot chocolate + cake spot in the city. Their dark hot chocolate hits all kinds of spots. Service is also excellent! A friend forgot his bag at our table as we left, and the waiter brought it out on a serving pan to hand it to him outside! 10/10.
Top notch experience. Just walking in the doors and magically you're in a Parisian cafe. Love this place.

The food was great but the service was terrible. The waiter we got was rude and disrespectful. It was my friend's birthday so we asked him discreetly to bring her a little cake. He came to the table trying to sell us a whole 50$ cake and telling us that it was 4$ just for the candle right in front of my friend. Then he told another waiter ''they need to leave'' while pointing at our table. Finally, when we were just about to leave he put ''reserved'' signs on our table in a very brutal way to incite us to leave. Then, when we got up he removed them right away. I have never been treated this bad in a restaurant.

formatted_address: 6839 Rue St-Hubert, Montréal, QC H2S 2M7, Canada
name: La Cale - pub zéro déchet

reviews.text:
A nice place. Good atmosphere, great poutine, a nice choose of beer and polite employees. Fun event nights too.

I wish they had a better substitute for a coke though (no waste and all).
Good music, not loud. Perfect to take a drink and speak. Good cocktail. But not great choice of beer and the food is minimalist for the prive
The place is pretty. The beer selection is not that great but I'll give it time. I'm a bit disappointed by the food menu though, not much and mostly vegan or vegetarian meals.
Vegan options! YAY! AND : zero waste. 😎
Good place, good music, good staffs

formatted_address: 995 Rue Saint-Jacques door 1a, Montréal, QC H3C 1K1, Canada
name: Time Supper Club

reviews.text: I didn't pay so I can't comment on the pricing but the food was great and came quickly. Very professional service. Solid choice for organized events.
People's working were very nice and very organized.
Was here for our company Christmas party. The venue was cool and the food was really delicious.
CUPE BC and Alberta had a social night here after the day's National Convention 2019 business and it was a great event. The staff, food, and DJ were awesome. Thank you for a memorable evening.
Wonderful place to host a party. Elegant, multi purpose space for a large party or gathering

formatted_address: 4055 Rue Sainte-Catherine O, Westmount, QC H3Z 3J8, Canada
name: Persian DJ

reviews.text: We had him for a wedding, awesome hits, great mix, nice guy, 100% would recommend.
Love it

formatted_address: 1371 Av Dollard, LaSalle, QC H8N 1T3, Canada
name: Café Bistro Il Piceno

reviews.text: Its samll cafe reminiscent of what you would experience  in most parts of Europe.
Great lil Italian bar
Incredible Italian coffee. Authentic people. Great conversation, if you want it.  Gem!
Best caps in town worth the visit
It smelled like an ashtray's ashtray and they only accept cash. I'm sure they make great drinks but i never made it that far

formatted_address: 2360 Ch Ste-Foy, Québec, QC G1V 4H2, Canada
name: SHAKER Cuisine & Mixologie

reviews.text: Lovely place for meeting with friends.  Amazing place for non alcoholic and alcoholic beverages.  Food is very good. Burgers are the best. We had tatare salmon which was excellent.  The ribs were good but not out of this world. The waitress was fantastic and tending to our needs.

Went for a business lunch and was not disappointed! The cream of vegetable soup was tasty and the tuna tartar was good. Our group was content with all their meals. Our waitress was efficient and courteous. The vibe was good but it was a little loud. Definitely a great place for a university crowd. Lunch was enjoyable. We will be back!
Atmosphere is pretty good. Food and the staff are adorable. So they well deserve 5 star.

Too salty general tao meal. Loud music preventing you from understanding your friends at the very same table as you. Service pressuring you to get alcohol even when you state you are only there for food. But not either a terrible meal. I guess it depends on the date and who is cooking.

The waiting time for the food, can make you go through 3 glass of water if you're really hungry, but it's eventually worth the wait, and the all the waitress are really nice, they explain the menu and ask the good questions to make us have a wonderful time there, so thanks again for the treat!!!

formatted_address: 1388 Boulevard de Maisonneuve O, Montréal, QC H3G 1M6, Canada
name: Notre-Boeuf-de-Grâce

reviews.text:
Delicious burgers! 
I love how you can customize your own. It reminded me a lot of Burger Royal because you could choose the size and the burgers don't come with the fries. 

The meat is juicy and tasty. I made my burger with avocado and it was so goooooooood. Fresh and well presented. I just wish they had a mac and cheese burger :P

Seating is ample and comfortable. Service is fast and people are friendly. 
Honestly, a really great burger place.

Went there last night for a friend's birthday. Service was not great, yet the food was good. Also, my friends and I split the birthday girl's bill. Her "birthday brownie" was charged to our bills. This is the first time I am charged in a restaurant for a birthday cake. Perhaps this happens more often than I thought?

[In response to the owner's comment]: 
Of course you charge for desserts, every place does. What many places don't do is charge for birthday cakes (which depends on the restaurant, but it's usually a smaller piece of cake of any kind). The point is that it is fine that we got charged for a birthday cake. However, I would have appreciated if the waitress told us. She simply gave us options, we ordered the cake and she charged us without telling us "by the way, you will be charged for it".
Diner type breakfast at this burger joint. Very regular place. Pleasant service and reasonable prices.

I’ve had the mushroom burger, I was dry.. the fries were just okay. It’s my third time here, the first experience was great. The service was great, the place is well located but they need to improve the quality of the food.

Summary: Great service, excellent food and ambience. Highly recommended.

Service:
We were met with friendly service that provided great recommendations for what food to order. They constantly looked out for us which is much appreciated. 

Food:
I got the "Thou Shalt Bacon Cheeseburger SR (2x 6 oz patties)". On the side, we shared the $5 Tater Tots and an Oreo milkshake.

The cheeseburger was stacked with two juicy patties and slices of cheese. It was accompanied by a few strips of bacon and a small amount of condiments. It was all that was needed because the burger tasted superb on its own. The tater tots are value for your buck, albeit probably a little too much value. They provided plentiful of tater tots that we didn't end up finishing because it was way more than the typical fries that would accompany the burgers. The milkshake is as expected of a milkshake - refreshing. 

The ambience was very chill and comfortable. It was definitely a place that I relaxed in after a long day.

formatted_address: 1004 Rue Sainte-Catherine E, Montréal, QC H2L 2G2, Canada
name: Celebration 2016 new years eve olympia montreal

reviews.text: Francisco perez

formatted_address: 145 Promenade Du Centropolis, Laval, QC H7T 0B3, Canada
name: Sukho Thai Centropolis - private rooms - karaoke

reviews.text: 3.5 stars would be the most appropriate rating. While the food is good, that may be the only positive. The food presentation and flavour is great - nothing exceptional for your standard Thai fare, but all 6 dishes I tasted were tasty, satisfying and portions were generous. The decor was nice, but it's clear the space has not been updated in some time. There's a lot of clutter and junk laying around (when you walk in the front entrance there are boxes of junk, folders with papers everywhere, tools and hardware laying around), it looks like they stopped trying to make it look good. Service was not very good; fairly slow, not very attentive, and forgetful. Based on all of this the value was not great. Prices would be fair IF the service and the atmosphere/decor were better - the EFFORT just wasn't there. It seems like this place was once great, and just stopped trying.

What a bad place! My daughter had a plastic in her food and after telling the waiter or the busboy he was laughing at the situation. Too many staff came to us and ask if we were done. We felt we needed to go and that's what we did but before we order desert (cream brulé) They made a mistake the put salt instead of sugar!!!! What a bad experience...we kept calm and ask to speak with the floor manager. He said sorry and said to us he will take care of bill. We were about to leave and comes back to us with a 15% discount. It cost us 165$. I strongly recommend a different restaurant. I had the best experience at Sterling Restaurant last time and food was much better quality.

We rented the VIP room upstairs for a private party. The planning stage was mostly done via email, but the manager for the private rooms responded quickly. Upon arrival, tables were set properly and our requests were met.
It is awesome to have access to a karaoke system with 3 wireless mics and TVs everywhere. Guests were able to sing without getting off their chairs.
The food and service were great as well!
It was our first time going and it won’t be our last.

The service was really poor. We did not get a menu for over 30 minutes. Even when we got the attention of the waiters, they told us they would come and never brought menus. The food arrived 2 hours after being ordered. No one checked on us for drinks or water. The servers were busy setting up for another party and talking amongst themselves. They were so involved in their conversation, that they did not even look in our direction. The food was good but definitely not worth waiting and the service go go with it. Nice decor and ambiance, it's a shame.
Nice decor but the food could be better. Good service. Overpriced.

formatted_address: 643 Rue Saint-Joseph E, Québec, QC G1K 3C1, Canada
name: Tequila Lounge

reviews.text: The owner is really nice and caring, we had our office christmas party over there and everyone liked it a lot! The homemade tortillas and the jalapeno poppers are sooo good!
Good place for Mexican food
Great Mexican food with great ingredients. The owner is amazingly kind

We went into this place with high expectations because we’d stupidly looked at the photos instead of reading the reviews. Read the reviews, they are spot on! 
The service was great and our waitress was very nice but unfortunately, The food didn’t taste as good as it looked online. It was pretty tasteless and deep fried... not great. It was VERY expensive for the low quality food. The nachos were good but it’s hard to mess up nachos, I wouldn’t go back for them. 
I wouldn’t recommend coming here to eat however, I do think it’s be a nice place maybe for a drink with a big group of friends? It really is best as a bar or lounge. 
One star for good service and one star for the nachos.
Good food and good tequila cocktail but a little bit on the expensive side.

formatted_address: 3562A Rue Aylmer, Montréal, QC H2X 2B8, Canada
name: The Cow Farm

reviews.text: Incredible atmosphere, great staff. Would recommend.
Great Irish club/bar. Would definitely order a Johnnie Walker Blue again.
An upstanding establishment. Great times, great friends, great laughs. Great bartender named Charles Jacques who makes a mean playlist. Only complaint would be the milk stench.
Service is great great drinking fun ppl. Yay. Yeet.
Great after hours place with super friendly staff! Their milk cocktails are sooo good. My only complaint is the one guy Bryan who works there seems a bit off.

formatted_address: 2299 Avenue Charland, Montréal, QC H1Z 1B5, Canada
name: Bistro Bar MC

reviews.text: There's better places to spend your money lol
Personnel très sympathique, mais locaux un peu vieillots

formatted_address: 1455 Rue Crescent, Montréal, QC H3G 2B2, Canada
name: Winnie's Bar Restaurant

reviews.text: This place is Ok and the service was a bit slow at first. The food is not that great, but it is good enough when you are hungry. The only thing that made me lower the rating is the bathroom which was a bit filthy and made me really uncomfortable after getting in. The place is huge though and I think that it could be a good destination for some drinks.
Had a great time, relaxed lounge experience two bars. Great staff and a really good happy hour! On the list for every visit!

We came over to have a quick drink after shopping, and had such an awesome barmaid so ended up staying!!! Caroline is Super on the ball, personable, and just loved her company all together. Merci Caro, you made our night, we’ll be back to see you soon! 😊
I was here in the restaurant couple times and each time food was fresh and tasty. Service was fast and girl was smiling
Onion rings and sweet potatoes fries were the best. Along with few drinks. Great place to hang out with friends.

formatted_address: 441 Rue du Parvis, Québec, QC G1K 9L6, Canada
name: Midnight blue discotheque

reviews.text:
The experience was good, enjoyed the 80s, the waitress brought my drink and I paid from my chair 

A place to go back but go with your company

Super place! La musique est génial! Le thème du bar est super original! 
Le service au bar est rapide ! Un must de la ville pour sortir!
Bel ambiance! Boîte de nuit comme dans le temps! Les gens arrivent plus vers 22h30. Personnel sympathique. Il y a aussi un chansonnier en haut.

Très belle endroit! Le service des barmaids est tout simplement incroyable, personnel sympathique et compétent. Bonne musique pour danser. De l'espace pour bouger et se déplacer sans se marcher dessus. Grande salle de bains. Je recommande, apprécié de tous! Bravo pour ce nouveau bar 👌

Ce sont mes années préférées, mais malheureusement je ne pourrai m'y rendre, ce n'est pas accessible aux gens en fauteuil roulant, faute d'escaliers.

Pour répondre à la propriétaire, j'ai donné un "1" parce google maps ne me donnait pas l'option de ne pas en mettre du tout. Je sais qu'il y a le phoenix, mais ce n'est pas là que j'aurais aimé aller. Ce genre de commentaire revient à dire " ouains, mais au moins tu as ça". Ce n'est plus une répondre acceptable en 2020.

formatted_address: 1749 Rue Saint-Denis, Montréal, QC H2X 3K4, Canada
name: Le Saint Bock

reviews.text: Great selection of beer. The staff is always helpful too when it comes to selecting your perfect beer. The menu is constantly changing with amazing beers. 100% would recommend for any beer lover.

A cool spot for craft beer lovers. A HUGE menu of beer (all online) - we enjoyed their Malediction Stout and Milk Stout but their Donut Stout was a little too much. Great nachos featuring pulled pork and BBQ sauce featuring their Malediction Stout.  Great, friendly service and a cool vibe. We will be back on our next trip to Montreal.

Finally got to take my kids to Montréal and the first stop we took was here! Fantastic service and as my eldest daughter said “wonderful vibes”. I had the pulled pork poutine which was to die for and also pictured is their homemade sausage corn dogs! They make everything fresh in house, have everything under the sun on tap, and make the drink menu easily accessible (right on your phone). So, if you’re trying to decide where to eat, definitely come here. It’s a bit pricey but the food quality lives up to its cost.

Came here for craft beers and was not disappointed at all.  Plenty of news of their own on tap (19) and able another 25 of other local and US craft beers on tap. All complimented by a huge bottle selection that will have any beer connoisseurs mouth watering. 

The ambiance here is very warm and welcoming. There is plenty of starting up at the bar top or in the dining area.  Good is also served here.
If you like really good beer, this is the place. All kinds of great sours, stouts, and more. The staff were friendly and attentive both times I visited.

formatted_address: 775 Avenue Honoré-Mercier, Québec, QC G1R 6A5, Canada
name: Hôtel Palace Royal

reviews.text: Very nice hotel. Beautiful atrium with pool and hot tub. Try and get a room with a balcony facing the atrium. Bed was so-so. Shower was fine. Rooms are beautiful. Can't beat the location. Would definitely stay here again

Great place to stay while visiting beautiful historic Quebec City.  Pleasant and friendly staff, clean room, very quiet, indoor pool and sauna, indoor parking, safe hotel, bar, restaurant, indoor access to dépanner (convenience store).
Centrally located to great restaurants, bistros and historic sites.  
I highly recommend as a stay in Quebec City.

Pretty good hotel overall and I would stay here again. Helpful and polite staff. It has all the conveniences that you need: parking garage, restaurant, bar, and great location. My only complaints are the base/free WiFi is painfully slow unless you are only checking emails or reading articles.

Also there were a few broken things in my room including the light switch on one lamp and one of the phones in the room. Those things aren't huge but seem like something they should notice if they pay attention to details. They did at least notice and fix our slightly messed up shower head which was good.

The room we had was good, came with lots of pillows but not so many blankets. The shower was good. The mini fridge and microwave were also good. The coffee maker seemed to not be able to make clean hot water without a tinge of coffee in it which was annoying. The TV didn't have a great selection, particularly when it comes to English content. The courtyard inside was pretty nice.
The only thing that could have been better was either make pool area warmer (it was chilly just sitting there.  Or make pool water warmer.  Otherwise,  great place!
Beautiful spacious rooms in a very convenient location. The view from top floors is amazing. Will be back on my next visit to Quebec

formatted_address: 444 Chemin Bord-du-Lac, Dorval, QC H9S 2A6, Canada
name: Pub Le vieux dorval

reviews.text: Excellent lunch with members of the Crown Jewels of Canada Society!! Fun time, good food, drink, laughter and service!!

I think this is the bar that all alcoholics who stay at bars all day go to... Because I went with my parents to watch a hockey game and was literally deserted except maybe 2 people looking cozy with their drinks at the bar.. and my mom ordered a coffee and was told to go across the street to the couche tard..
Nice
The pizza is good
A decent local pub

formatted_address: 100 Rue Grand Chef Thonnakona, Wendake, QC G0A 4V0, Canada
name: Restaurant Yahwatsira

reviews.text: Excellent Restaurant! Je le recommande 💖

formatted_address: 5152 Rue Jarry E, Saint-Léonard, QC H1R 1Y4, Canada
name: Ristorante La Storia

reviews.text: A truly wonderful experience!  Great food, friendly staff, and a relaxing atmosphere.  I highly recommend an outing to La Storia.  You will not be disappointed.  In fact, you will enjoy it so that you will return where you shall be greeted by Leonardo.  ++++

Great menu! Fantastic presentation. We went on a Wednesday night and had a fantastic time, good music and nice decor.. the waitress was respectful and kind. Great restaurant in Saint-léonard. Will be going back, not expensive. Hats off to the chief! Highly recommended.
Went on a Friday night around 6:30. Quick service and delicious food. Very reasonable pricing. I found it surprising that the restaurant was empty though...
Excellent service and food
Delicious food and great service.  Really enjoyed it. Celebrated my daughter’s Sweet 16 party here.

formatted_address: 1140 Boulevard de Maisonneuve O, Montréal, QC H3A 1M8, Canada
name: Dahlia Bar Sante

formatted_address: 4602 Boul St-Laurent 2ème étage, Montréal, QC H2T 1R3, Canada
name: La Vitrola

reviews.text: I always enjoy seeing shows here. The sound is good and there's a warm atmosphere. AND that being said - enough with the plastic cups! It is ridiculous and wasteful. Recycling isn't an excuse AT ALL. No dishwasher, no permanent staff blah blah blah. Not an excuse. Do better.
Nice staff . Politely helpful
Quain lil spot. Had me a bless time.

This small venue can be hard to find, but is worth it. Up a flight of stairs at a door where the bar's name is easy to miss you'll find a small room (I'd wager it could hold about 100 people) with a good sound system.

The vibe is pretty good, the space , while small, allows for a very intimate show. The drinks are priced around what you would expect.
A little hard to find, but nice enough!

formatted_address: 5500 Rue Hochelaga local 150, Montréal, QC H1N 3L7, Canada
name: Brasserie Jukebox

formatted_address: 519 Rue Faillon E, Montréal, QC H2R 1L6, Canada
name: Daou

reviews.text: My absolute all-time favourite restaurant. I've been going since I was a kid to this location in particular, although I now visit both locations. Friendly service. Visited with my brother and his family who were visiting from Indonesia, where he now lives. The staff (possibly the owners) were so kind to my 1 year old nephew, holding him, playing with him, even giving him a tour of the kitchen. They took pictures of the family for us. Wonderful people and delicious food.

Very disappointing. Food at best average and overpriced. The place seems to live from past days,  kind of run down.  The service was actually ridiculous. They forgot our appetizer and then also forgot  the fries for the main dish, which then came almost 10 minutes later then the meat. Still don't really understand how that is even possible 🤨
Disappointed with the service, the food seems like the were old not fresh, the taste is terrible, and overpriced as well. What a total waste and a total shame.
Excelent lebanese cuisine, very nice ambience, good selection of wine. Plenty of platters to share and great pics of Celine Dion.

Love it. The quality and freshness is excellent.
This is higher end, lebanese home style food. If you catch a glimpse of the cooking staff, they are experienced ladies pouring thier passion into what they cook

formatted_address: 1639 Boulevard de l'Avenir, Laval, QC H7S 2N5, Canada
name: House of Jazz Laval

reviews.text: I believe it’s extremely odd that a receptionist of a well known restaurant and attraction spot pretends that she does not understand English and continues to ask details about the booking in French. I am fully aware it’s a French speaking province, but for tourists like myself, it is important to make sure staff is capable of communicating properly regardless of their personal opinions/beliefs. I do not live here and hence do not speak/understand French. She clearly understood every world I said, yet insisted on communicating in French. I haven’t tried the place yet I’m disappointed already.

I honestly loved my experience!! I invited my friend for his birthday and I really don’t regret my choice. Amazing restaurant. Food is delicious!!! The steak is miamyy. Decorating is awesome.. with the lighting, just wow. 

We were downstairs close to the singers. Very nice ambiance, nice music, service was a bit long but tolerable. I didn’t buy Groupon tickets, and honestly it’s not that expensive. It’s the same price than the other GOOD restaurants. Plus you have the show. Really worth it !!! 
Can’t wait to go back
Music was the only positive. Worst service I ever had - very long and unpleasant. We left before the end of the 4-cource dinner. Meals look great but are not so delicious

We came here with a Groupon for a meal for 2 during a weeknight. The place was far from busy which was nice. The food was tasty and nicely presented. We were seated as close to the band as possible and the music was fantastic all through the evening. Unfortunately the same cannot be said for the service. We were seated before 3 other couples nearby but our orders were taken last and we received our drinks and food a good 15 minutes after all the others. The band saved the evening and made it all worth it in the end but I'm not sure I will return.
The food is regularly well prepared and yummy, staff members hands over great service. I like how neat it is and character. Will come visit again.

formatted_address: 421 R. Saint-Vincent 8e étage, Montréal, QC H2Y 3A6, Canada
name: Terrasse William Gray

reviews.text: It's all about the view.  Place to see and be  seen so dress up a little. Food was good and well presented. Could you more micro brews. Make a reservation or expect to wait.
This restaurant has a beautiful view! Food was pretty good, I had the beef tataki, but it was pretty expensive. Overall a good experience
Ideal rooftop if you want to have a nice view of the Old Port. Their cocktails are ok but you don't have too many options for food. Guess the overprice is for the view... :)

Perched on the 8th floor of the chic William Gray hotel with a gorgeous view of Old Port. We went for lunch on a rainy day. There's a retractable roof so we were still able to enjoy it. We had Korean Beef Tartar, Ungava Gin Melons and the Chefs Garden Salad with Chicken. All were good. Throw in a glass of Chablis and life is good! We would definitely go back!
The terrasse is very nice with a great view but service isn't the greatest.

formatted_address: 9 Rue Sainte-Catherine E, Montréal, QC H2X 1K3, Canada
name: Mon Loft Privé - event loft

reviews.text: Great lofts for private parties and dance events. Excellent location. Literally at the corner of St-Laurent and St-Catherine. The lofts are also fully equipped with sound equipments, furniture and liquor license which makes event organization so much simpler.

formatted_address: 1071 Boul St-Laurent 2e étage, Montréal, QC H2Z 1J6, Canada
name: Poincaré Chinatown

reviews.text:
Awesome discovery! You must taste their sauer fries, it's the best I ever had. A bit chewy and crispy at the same time, with an addictive salty taste. You'll never get enough of one of that dish.

Poincaré is also a very cool place for a having a quick bite and drink in the downtown area. Very cool staff!

What a hidden gem! 

Tucked unassuming my on a second story off St-Laurent in Chinatown, this craft-beer and good eats place is an ode to fermented foods. The menu features an assortment of always available canned goods, a section devoted to pickled goods, and cooked to order favourites that are oh-so-juicy and tangy due to a perfect brine.

The place has a great selection of craft beers on tap, including a house bitter. For those more adventurous, there is a wall of appetizing bottles waiting to catch your eye.

If your into cocktails, there's a many interesting spins of classics.

Want wine? Well there's a full page on the menu devoted to fermented grape for your to delight in.

Price wise, this place had excellent value for money. Very affordable and such great food and drink for price.
This place has the potential to become the best craft beer bar in the city. So tastefully arranged on the upper floor overlook St. Laurent.

Amazing place for dates or just get-togethers with friends! The food is great, the alcohol selection is ample and the staff is very friendly. It can get quite noisy at times but would still strongly recommend this place!
Terrific venue! Great friendly staff and excellent selection of beer, or whatever you’re looking for!

formatted_address: 6440 Rue Beaubien E, Montréal, QC H1M 1A9, Canada
name: Pub Ste-Marie

reviews.text:
Nice local pub. Has variety on Friday nights. Sometimes Karaoke, sometimes live duet.
Summer Fridays Happy Hour includes Complimentary Burger BBQ
À cozy small place, nothing too special about it. You'll get a good coffee there!

Great events, went there on a house event 6 djs, place was packed great service. The interior decore of the place looked like it belonged on crescent! I would suggest you find the dates when they do events and book in advance, no more entry after midnite due to capacity...
Great people
The waitress is awesome!

formatted_address: 4719 Boulevard Lavoisier, Saint-Léonard, QC H1R 3E9, Canada
name: Cafe Nada Bar & Grill

reviews.text: Great coffee and staff. Ambiance friendly for one or couple.
Used to be great but a now its just okay.
Best place ever
Good coffee and lunch.

Le bar porte bien son nom ... C'est Nada !
Pas d'enseigne pour trouver le commerce, pas d'accueil et l'endroit est louche pour une femme seule. Je pensais venir ici pour prendre un verre, c'est clairement un repère pour des gars crades.

formatted_address: 1255 Rue Crescent, Montréal, QC H3G 2B1, Canada
name: Gyu-Kaku Japanese BBQ

reviews.text: The place was clean but service was not that quick. The beef was a decent quality. But my only comment is that the marinades they use on the beef are too sweet compares to other places i tried. Because at some point you feel like your eating candy and not beef. I think theyre better off for them to leave the beef to stand out and not to overdo the marinades and i think my experience will be better to be honest. Other than that its a very clean and sanitary institution.

I came here earlier last year around April and my experience was awesome! The staff was super friendly, the food was delicious! The meat was nicely marinated and they had Japanese side dishes.
It was a good idea to bring japanese newcomers to a Japanese restaurant. They said it was pretty similar to how it is there.
We came in a group of 5 & I think you must reserve ahead of time if you want the closed off room. The price was reasonable when you split the bill.

Great Japanese BBQ place! Fair prices and the lunch/happy hour specials are generous. I actually think I enjoy this restaurant more than the ones in Connecticut! Would love to come back/ find a location near me! Give it a shot!

Food was good. The only down fall is? When cooking something with good fat. You can only cook 2 at a time here in Montreal.  In Calgary it does not matter on how much you put on. Other than that! Food was good
Fist time dinning here. Had a few apps with a noodle and rice bowl. Food was tasty and perfect portions for sharing. Not too expensive and quick service. Would recommend

formatted_address: 6101 Avenue de Montmagny, Montréal, QC H4E 2V6, Canada
name: Pente À Neige

reviews.text:
Good initiative making skiing more accessible.

However, I did not like that they keep taking and posting photos without people's consent on their social medias and promotional material. After failing to get my pictures removed from the posts, I started asking photographers to not shoot me, one of them replied "Why not, you look very pretty" and wouldn't take my request seriously. 

I also saw another photographer putting himself on the run, to take "better" pics of skiiers trying (and sometimes falling) to avoid running into him. Quite dangerous.

I am surprised and satisfied by the variety of winter activities provided within Montreal at a reasonable price. The facilities are good and suitable for the beginners and the people are kind and friendly. My kid really enjoyed the time spent there. Recommend.

Amazing to have this kind of attraction in the city. There is ski, snowpark and tube sliding. Practice slopes as well. The logistics was not figured out when I went. I have a bad feeling for when there will be snow and lots of people. To be continued.

What an amazing time there! Great staff and organization. Make sure you get there early when you rent equipment though (they said 60mins in the reminder e-mail). We did have to wait for the fitting but in the end they attended us in time for the class. 
Great staff and great instructors. The kids loved their first snowboard lesson with Lucas, can't wait for the next ones !

The ski instructor (Benjamin) was great! I thought he had no chance with the kids; they did not look interested.
But I recommend taking the $45 test course. We signed our 2 sons up for 6-week courses & our youngest did NOT like it. Pente À Neige just said "🤷🏻‍♂️ F.U. no refunds!". Considering we have an older son who probably would have been a repeat customer, I find it to be very poor customer service. There are LOADS of arrangements that could have been made for the funds even though refunds are not given (example exchange only at stores). Because of this, I'll never give them a single dollar more.

formatted_address: 900 Rue Notre Dame, Lachine, QC H8S 2B9, Canada
name: Bar L'Hôtel-de-ville

reviews.text: Interesting place, not a lot of nightlife going on In the specific area. But this bar seems to be hopping. Nicely kept clean inside, regularly priced drinks and the night I was there good DJ. Couldnt ask for anything else keep it up!

Great cocktails.  But lacks a better ambiance.
Haven't been in the summer.  Maybe it's a little different.

Apparently trying to be a downtown club instead of an actual upscale bar on Friday nights. Once again disappointed in this place and I truly want to enjoy the place as it has a nice look too it and looks like it could have nice charm to it. Redeeming factors are the staff they are good at checking up on you and getting your order even though it's super loud. Although at the end of the day they are probably catering to their patrons so who am I to judge I'll just keep going elsewhere I guess.
I just like their dishes. I always get excellent service here. The place is neat and the staff members are always super friendly. I highly recommend this place.
This is a gem... Awesome staff; awesome wine selection and awesome menu.  Love the bar!  The atmosphere is welcome g and a step above the day to day.  Will definitely go back.

formatted_address: 34 Rue Saint Louis, Québec, QC G1R 4P3, Canada
name: Aux Anciens Canadiens

reviews.text: Super old building. gorgeous from the outside. Lots of pictures to be taken before you go in! On the inside this place has a modern bar and an old feeling type dining area. I went for lunch for the amazing $22.95 lunch time deal. You get wine or a beer, a starter, main and dessert. Amazing value! And amazing food also. I imagine for dinner this place is super romantic.

I loved this restaurant.  They have set menus for day (22.95) or evening (49.95), on which you can add the more expensive items for additional fee. Good value and plenty of choice. Staff helpful and welcoming. Beautiful old building.

Let me start by saying that this was one of the best food menu items I had in Quebec. The price was pretty good. Given that we were on an early happy hour. Rate and the combo included entree main course and dessert and on top of that a free glass of wine.

The atmosphere was great. The food was good but not great and the price was fair. I would go back if I visited all the restaurants I wanted to see in a visit. But I wasn't blown away enough to go back twice in a visit. Especially when out of town. Review is only based off of the dishes eaten by myself and a date.

My family enjoyed a hearty Quebecois dinner at Aux Anciens Canadiens between Christmas and New Years 2019-2020.  It is situated in an old structure creating a very intimate atmosphere.  The cuisine is very simple and endearing.  Would definitely return and recommend.

formatted_address: 1155 Rue de la Chevrotière, Québec, QC G1R 3J6, Canada
name: Jack Saloon

reviews.text: The food was good. Definitely different. The table behind us was super loud. They served water warm but did bring ice when we asked.
Good service. Went out of their way to serve some food and seat us even if we arrived when they were understaffed at night. Staff are really nice and beer/cocktails are good
Go! Enjoy! Unique menu, great service, and amazing food!  The atmosphere and music are top notch. One of my favorite spots.

All you can eat wings on Sunday & ribs on Wednesdays! I wish there where more places like this around!
If you don't like this place, your an idiot.

Great atmosphere.  Menu had plenty to choose from. Our server was very attentive and answered many questions about the menu and local area for us.  My wife had a Krispy Kreme burger. It's your typical burger with Krispy Kreme donuts substituted in for the buns. Fun addition to the menu!  One warning:. If you cannot read french make sure you have Google translate on your phone.  No English menus (don't let that stop you from going though).

formatted_address: 71 Rue Saint-Pierre, Québec, QC G1K 4A5, Canada
name: Matto

reviews.text:
Randomly came in here on a Tuesday night, absolutely packed and lively.  The host/manager was wonderfully accommodating and friendly. The staff overall are excellent, great to see a small kitchen staff bustling away hard at work to churn out excellent and fresh food.  

The Calamari was very fresh and a perfect portion to start the meal off.  The linguini with seafood (cream sauce) was superb, very fresh.  The Veal Limone was absolutely delightful with a bright and wonderful sauce, the mushroom tagliatelle on the side (definitely ask for it - also available as a main dish) was insanely delicious.  

A must try!
A nice place to have a drink, they have a very nice cellar. I had a wonderful girls' night under the sign of champagne.🍾🍾💃💃

We have traveled to many wonderful restaurants all over the world. This is not one of them. I called last night for a reservation this evening and was told that we could have a one hour block as they were full. I accepted knowing that we could be efficient. Upon arrival a few minutes early the sour hostess handed us menus and told us we could not order any meat as we had to leave within and hour. In all my years I have never, ever had any wait staff say such a thing. When I pressed, indicating that my husband has a severe gluten allergy she said he could have the veal scallopini only. I ordered nothing. She pushed to get the veal, which I do not eat and I declined. The food, absent one pizza was inedible. The pasta carbonara was ordered by two in our party and was truly tasteless and overcooked. The wait staff never smiled nor acknowledged pur thank yous. I would give zero stars for the first time in my life should such an option be available. I would not send anyone to this place of business.

Tried it for breakfast and it was OK... nothing special but good enough. A bit on the expensive side for what you get. If you are staying at the hotel, almost anything on the menu has a supplement.
Funny note, this is an Italian restaurant but the big picture on the wall is from Barcelona in Spain :)

We had an awesome night here. The service, food and atmosphere were all great, and we ended up spending ~3 hours at dinner.

To give you an idea of the food quality, there are a handful or so of dishes that are still made by the owners mother and brought in each day. Meatballs are on that list and are a must.

formatted_address: 1826 Rue Panet, Montréal, QC H2L 2Z9, Canada
name: Chez Tonton

formatted_address: 115 Rue Saint Paul Est, Montréal, QC H2Y 1G7, Canada
name: La Sauvagine

reviews.text: First time in Montréal, I tried this place based off reviews on google map. They were okay. The food was neither good or bad. I feel like I should’ve ordered something more savory but I’ll give them another try for sure. They just didn’t impress me the first time.

The main meal was good. The skills of uncorking and pouring wine were not some you would expect of a professional. Orange sorbet tasted like plastic, try to avoid it.  We were quite unsatisfied with the behavior of the staff. When we selected to give a 10% tip, they insisted 15% being passive aggressive about it. We would not recommend this restaurant, although the meat was prepared quite well.

We had two streak et frites with a kids meal, all was perfect. We got plenty of home made bread buns and butter. Our waiter Michael was genuinely friendly and very keen on our comfort and giving us a great experience. We totally recommend it to discover authentic bistro style French cuisine in the heart of Old Montreal

Our second night in Vieux-Port, Old Montreal, and looking for a uniquely Quebecois/French dining experience.  We had viewed the menu earlier in the day and eschewing the more touristy haunts, entered La Sauvagine on Rue St. Paul.  The setting is cozy, the service impeccable, and an amazing menu selection combining uniquely Quebec cuisine, including a variety of game meats, with French bistro overtones.  Additionally, there is a substantial wine and spirits selection. This is a hidden gem, not yet discovered by the masses, and well worth a visit.
Loved it! Great food, nice staff. The dessert was very interesting and was very good, too. Will come back next time.

formatted_address: 4460 Ave Christophe-Colomb, Montreal, QC H2J 3G5, Canada
name: reBOOT Hostel

reviews.text: Very rude owner and the house is pretty messy and dirty
Good Area but Expensive!!

The guy in charge was disorganized. Didn’t know we were coming and didn’t match booking site’s price, claimed I owed home more money, also claimed that we booked two beds not three. Papers in his office everywhere. Don’t believe photos: the common spaces a mess. Don’t pay him until You check your conditions. We left the second night and booked a hotel because we had no working heat in our room. Space heater for the cat in living room was warmer than our room’s space heater. You could see your exhale in our bedroom. The bathroom was disgusting: went to wash my hands and stepped on a sogging wet towel that took up half the floor. The other half was taken up by a space heater. Only bright spot was the really sweet kid who changed the sheets and brought us towels, and the bedroom sheets and towels seemed clean. Ugh. Worst night of accommodations ever. Woke up so tired. I want a refund. 🤒

Also got scammed like a few others. Don't stay here.

Booked the twin room and ended up being almost double charged for my booking due to admin errors. My $100 room ended up costing me $160. Still waiting on my refund.

Upon arrival, they couldn't find the key for our actual room, had to wait almost an hour for them to find.

Until they sort out my refund, I can't really recommend this place.

Would not recommend at all. The host can be disturbingly rude and disrespectful. Wifi was off a couple of hours/days. More often than not there is not a hint of hot water to shower. Heating is pretty bad and the room gets cold very often. But my issue was mostly with the host's disrespectful attitude.

formatted_address: 1965 Rue Jean-Talon, Montréal, QC H2E 1T9, Canada
name: Café Sportif Colosseo

reviews.text: The owner is very nice and the bar is clean
Nice place
Bon café, barrista sympathique
. Vraiment. Il serve. Du bon café. Expresso
Lugubre

formatted_address: 68 Route du Président-Kennedy, Lévis, QC G6V 6C6, Canada
name: Pacini

reviews.text: Amazing food..I totally recommend it..

It is surprising to know that you can have breakfast at Pacini's. I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of my breakfast starting with a verrine of fresh yoghurt and berries that comes with the breakfasts. I also enjoyed the bread grill to make toast for our taste! It's hard to rate a restaurant from a "2 eggs-sausage-coffee", but I would say the experience was more than that. The waitress was smiling, helpful and friendly throughout our meal. Although she was alone on the floor, the service did not suffer. I recommend the Pacini for your breakfast!
Good food, containing a lot of italian dishes and the famous bread bar. Service is good and the restaurant looks super modern. All in all great experience.
The food is good but it can take a long time to get it

The waitress explained that she did not speak very good English but she did a great job. Food took a while to get to the table but it was tasty. The bread bar was interesting, basically toast with different butters.

formatted_address: 129 Rue Beaubien O, Montréal, QC H2V 1C3, Canada
name: Le Diplomate

reviews.text: We enjoyed the food but it was not worth waiting two hours for. We were still hungry when we left as the portions are quite small. I recommend going out for dinner somewhere else then visit this place later for their great selection of wines.

I went to this restaurant during F1 weekend. They were busy and understaffed which made the service pretty slow.
Once the food arrived, it was well worth the wait. Simple and very well executed. Delicious without being pretentious.
We ended up trying most of the menu and no dish disappointing. The people behind the counter are knowledgeable and devoted and it is great what they achieve in such a small space.
I recommend this place 100%, but maybe avoid going on very busy weekends to enjoy the experience even more!

Great stuff, Merci!

These guys are amazing. They cook, they make drinks, they serve and still find the time to have a short conversation with customers. The dishes we were brought kept being better and better. Brussels sprouts, which I am personally not a big fan of, were exquisite! Thank you, gentlemen! If I ever come back to Montreal, I'll be back!

The space itself is very cozy but bright and clean. We all enjoyed the music throughout the night and the service is very good. Very friendly and informative staff. I tried 4 of the 5 cocktails (all but the one with egg whites) and they were all super. They all had something unique so I can't say I've had the same ones before anywhere else. Other friends had wine from their vast (and somewhat eclectic) list.

Now for the food: it was really awesome. Not overdone, original, well balanced, and despite these buzzwords, really not pretentious. Each plate had a distinct taste and highlighted unique ingredients, all the way through desert. Everything dish worked with the others and they were great for sharing, too. Many dishes are vegetarian or pescatarian so there should be something for almost everyone. If you're a larger group, I suggest getting a reservation just in case.

I will definitely be back!

(I apologize for the amateur photos but I wanted to capture what we ate).

Fantastic food, creative menu, brilliant service...we were able to sample a wine which was nice but we preferred a red.  Asked what we liked in a wine the waiter came back with exactly what was wanted....and there was an extensive range of orange wines and cocktails.  The cocktails we had were excellent.  This is a wonderful place to experience a relaxed but wonderful dining experience.  If you are near Beaubien definitely worth a visit....5 star...

formatted_address: 7000 Boulevard LaSalle, Verdun, QC H4H 2T1, Canada
name: Parc à Verdun

formatted_address: 3415 Boulevard de la Concorde E, Laval, QC H7E 2C3, Canada
name: Les Champagne Restaurant Bar Inc

reviews.text: I got to say. This place is amazing. The atmosphere is like a 5 star restaurant. Even though it doesn't run like one, this is awesome. The food is like a bite of heaven. Keep in mind I'm visiting Canada. I'm from the US of A. I'd recommend this for any of my friends. Haitian or not.

This place is a treasure waiting to be discovered!
we walked in this very cozy restaurant and were greeted warmly by the staff.  I am familiar with Griot so I was looking to discover something new, one of the owners suggested I try the queue de boeuf (beef tail) and it was a revelation for me!
Fall off the bone tender, juicy and an explosion of flavor!  Accompanied by riz colle (rice and beans) plantains and the magical spicy pikliz (veg relish)  made my dinner experience a total success. 
I will be going back for sure and I do recommend this place to anyone that is looking for a new culinary experience and to those already familiar with Haitian food to consider this place.

Ennio

Very good. Tasty food
 But portion is small!

So we moved in the area not long ago and after passing by this place many times, we’ve decided to go in and Give it a try.  We probably had the best Griot EVER. The service was fast and the food was fresh (amazing not to say). I would recommend it to anyone who enjoys haitian food. Can’t wait to go back!
It's the perfect place to take your girlfriend.... Not your wife

formatted_address: 145 Boulevard Curé-Labelle, Laval, QC H7V 2R7, Canada
name: Al Sultan

reviews.text: Very nice welcome food is v good family ambiance Singer Basim Dib is great DJ has variety songs recommend
Great place, great employees but if only the they would smile and be more friendly. But overall a nice place with good food.
Great food & service. Belly dancer was also very talented.

Worst experience EVER ! The food was disgusting and the staff very rude. They charge you for things you didn’t buy (8$ for soft drinks which we didn’t have). Plus there wasn’t many appetizers and the taste was awful. At the end each one of us got a very cheap small piece of cake which was tasteless. If you wanna enjoy your meal (many choices and so delicious) and spend an amazing time go to LORDIA !  Trust me LORDIA is wayyyyyyy better !
I loved the place!!! Delicious meal and good vibe. I recommend it

formatted_address: 400 Rue du Platine #3, Québec, QC G2N 2G6, Canada
name: Brasserie Générale

reviews.text: Beer was nothing special, waited for ever to be served and it was as though because i knew little french i was served last. felt very out of place and made sure to leave fast. The beer wasn't awful but i would classify it as average like a stepped up domestic lager from a big company.
Great little brewpub, the staff is friendly, the beer good.
Great beer strait at the microbrewery.
Bonne biere et selection tres original

Cette place est un salon de dégustation. Très accueillant, la serveuse qui est là connais toutes ses bières parfaitement autant en terme de gout que le processus complet de fabrication (d’ailleurs elle connais aussi très bien les produits des autres micros ce qui en fait une personne de choix pour converser et échanger). Je recommande chaudement cette place à tous les amateurs de bière et je vous invite a essayer leurs créations spéciales qui peuvent être très innovantes.

formatted_address: 1028 Rue Saint-Zotique E, Montréal, QC H2S 1N2, Canada
name: Le Jurançon

reviews.text: They were able to accommodate a large group at very short notice, the service was very attentive and they helped translate the menu for all of our English speakers. The food was very good and a great price for the quality.

Great little French cuisine with good wine and beer selection. The entree and the main dish were excellent. But I find the lamb shank was lacking a bit flavor. In addition the duck was a little too chewery, perhaps undercooked?

I would definitely rate this a 5 stars, but I didn't like the creme brulee and the dessert either.
My go-to restaurant for a decadent (yet not too expensive) French feast. The charismatic waiter always knows exactly which wine to recommend, and the cassoulet is to die for.
Neighbourhood restaurant offering classic french cuisine. Friendly service reasonable prices
Went here for a wedding. Great food great service and great wine

formatted_address: 5401 Boulevard des Galeries Local # 107, Quebec City, QC G2K 1N4, Canada
name: 3 Brasseurs La Capitale

reviews.text: I love this place! Great choice of beers, children friendly, you can have a place without the reservation even at noon.... Thx guys see you soon!

Overall really liked popping in here to eat. The food was pretty good. The design of the place was nice and we felt very comfortable. Overall I didn't think the beer they brewed was amazing, but it was fine. For a chain it was definitely a good experience and i would stop back in again to eat.
I return everytime I travel back to QC and Quebec City. Excellent place for a meal with friends. Their beer  choice is excellent.

It is always a pleasure to visit the 3 brewers, we always go there in Ontario. First time on Quebec city but it was a very pleasant experience, food tastes great, Matthew the waiter was a great and cheerful guy and the atmosphere was just a wow. 
We ordered Salmon, the famous 1/2 meter pizza, Toulouse sausage, Maui salad, fish and chips and the beer fries. Everything tasted fantastic. 
And of course the beer 😉
Wonderful food and service

formatted_address: 361 Rue Saint Paul Est, Montréal, QC H2Y 1H2, Canada
name: Le Bremner

reviews.text: Very delicious.  Food, drinks, service, and ambiance were all top notch.  Casual and unpretentious.  The only thing that I can think of as a negative is that there was 0 carbohydrates offered for the main course.  We made up for it in bread and dessert.  Recommended!

Tasty food served quick and with friendly service. Lots of ambiance and you feel like you are immersed in a cozy pub with foodie caliber bites. The veal tartare shawarma is incredible. Pancakes are a must to finish off the meal. Sitting at the bar was comfortable and it felt like a team is serving you.

Another spot recommended by locals and a true gem of a culinary experience in a very touristy part of Old Montreal. Easy to overlook the entrance to this secluded restaurant but once inside, a super cosy atmosphere awaits you for a memorable dining sojourn. Delicious food selections from a carefully created menu with wonderful wine pairings curated by the knowledgeable staff.
5 stars just doesn't seem like enough. Food top notch, team table service exceptional. Eat family style it's such an awesome experience. Bravo to the kitchen !
Amazing service. Deliciously simple dishes with complex flavors and quality ingredients. Everything I look for in a night out.

formatted_address: 4718 Rue Wellington, Verdun, QC H4G 1X3, Canada
name: Le Trèfle

reviews.text:
This is a great little bar with down to Earth pricing on the drinks. Your meal choices will run a little on the expensive side, but well worth it for the quality and quantity food that you will receive.

I also very much appreciate that the music is often kept at a very reasonable level, and that you will be able to hear the people you are going to be talking to. 

They can also boast of having a very friendly and eager to please staff.

These points are the reason why Le Trèfle became the go to drinking establishment amongst my friend group. May it stay this way forever.

Great selection of beer. Great selection of whisk(e)y / scotch / bourbon / rye. The service was great and assorted with a smile.
One of the best "old fashioned" I have ever tasted.

Great place to go after work and grab a great meal and drink. Staff is pleasant and food is great! Their salmon tartar plate was amazing and so was the Irish stew! Definitely recommend checking out. Great place in verdun!

The food was really good. Ambiance, top noch. A bit loud if there’s a large group occupying the room. Professional staff, knows what they are selling. A bit slow on the service, but very satisfied on what was coming. Reasonably priced. I would come back and recommend.

Good for pub crawl/regular tavern fair, music is at a nice volume so I can hear the conversation were having. It died down surprisingly quickly on a Saturday night. I would rate it four stars but when we went they were out of quite a few different drinks on their menu, and when they brought the bills they were all wrong, so we had to spend an extra 15-30 minutes getting our bills corrected - and they were still incorrect. We just ended up paying and leaving after that. Otherwise good place.

formatted_address: Durocher St, Montréal, QC H2X 2C9, Canada
name: Simon Maestro music studio singer-musician video clip protector.DJ music

formatted_address: 1699 Rue Saint-Denis, Montréal, QC H2X 3K4, Canada
name: Café Hookah Lounge

reviews.text:
I visited the place 2 times this week. It's good.
But the light was too bright the 2nd time and the music wasn't very suitable for a place like that.
Nice oriental cafe. Good food and mostly North African clients.

Food was good overall but the service was long and pretty bad..
Spend 2 hours there and they took 35 min to have our drink order (Tea and a pitcher )food was longer.
The tea was so bad and tasted nothing but water.
In our 2 hours no one once came check on us .
I don't recommend this place to drink and/or to smoke hookah
But if you like 20$ pull pork nachos and 10$ for 1 single potatoe cut in slices
Sweet spot to grab a beer and enjoy the Shisha after a day at work! Friendly staff, Paco & Felix are the reason why I come back every time; give those man a raise already! 😁
Services is quite long and I never paid a latte that much but the ambiance was fine...

formatted_address: 7275 Rue Sherbrooke E, Montréal, QC H1N 1E9, Canada
name: La Cage - Brasserie Sportive

reviews.text: Spacious, clean and polite servers. Tasty appetizers, food and desserts. Unlimited coffee and soda refills. Nice atmosphere. Free external parking as well underground ones. Connected to the mall for easy shopping or haircut.

If you're wondering how the tartare is, it's pretty boring. I took the meal plate: with salad (water dressing but apparently it's ranch), fries (best thing on the plate) and the crackers it comes with, not edible at all. I think they were like weeks old and they hurt my teeth they were so hard! However, they did renovate recently so the place is very nice itself but service was still quite long and it was a regular night.

First time to be here for lunch, it is very spacious place actually. And television is every where, definitely it's a good place to watch sport. The food is amazing. We ordered fish burger, fish and chips and fish tacos. We just love fish 😆. The portion is great, lunch menu comes with fizzy drinks or coffee or tea. We will come again. Saw another ppl order the rib and chip looking good. Might come back for that
Cold delicious beer and awesome bartenders! The food fantastic! Can't wait to return!
Great customer service. The food is delicious. My highest recommendation.

formatted_address: 777 Avenue Lajoie, Dorval, QC H9P 1G7, Canada
name: Brasserie Louks Brewery

reviews.text: Great local beers on tap and to purchase. The Porter is amazing with a hint of coffee and chocolate flavour. Great spot to chill and play board games with friends. Owners are super friendly and happy to chat!
Small but mighty, the beers on tap are delicious, and the guys are friendly too. They have games to play and just chill. I'll be back.

Everyone must go here! Great local brewery with amazing beers. The Porter is out of this world! You are missing out if you don't stop by here and try the beers! Super friendly and great place to drink and play board games! You must go!!!!
Great place cosy good beer what more do you want? Best part is the owners are to local brothers how cool is that?
Awesome microbrewery tucked away in dorval near airport. Small, but great beer!!

formatted_address: 66 Rue Saint Louis, Québec, QC G1R 3Z3, Canada
name: Café De Paris

reviews.text: What a great place after walking around in the wet snow and cold rain. Was very quiet and service was a bit slow but it was well worth it. The gentleman's humour was hilarious and he treated us very well. Cracked a few great jokes and he had on some classic french music which set the ambiance. We will be sure to come back.

What a find! Great folks gave us a warm teasing as only the French can, then singing us American songs and capping it off with an after dinner drink on the house. But first we started off sharing a bottle of Saint Preignan Merlot and an order of delicious escargots (snails), yummy and scallops. Our main course was veal scallapini. We couldn't have been more happy. Our server was attentive, courteous and friendly. We passed on desert deciding the night was early and we would walk the streets and find a different dessert location. Can't beleive we made it to French Quebec! Viva le Canada. Our total bill came to $ 185 CAD ($ 138 USD).  Couldn't have been any happier!

The food tasted good. The soft bread was also dry. The service is nice and they are really friendly. This is the kind of place that will take time to prepare your food, so you should know this. The ambience of the place is very rustic and charming. Overall you can give this place a try!

The atmosphere stimulates the travelling feeling.
 Vol au vent aux fruits de mer is delicious.
Cidre de Quebec is marvellous.

Stumbled upon this place after a long day of traveling with 2 crabby and hungry teenagers. Staff was so helpful and friendly, offering hot cocoa and being extra kind when my kids were being less than decisive about what they wanted to eat. The blond, ponytailed bartender was very engaging and chatted with us about making music. The owner was also very outgoing and sweet to me, a mom who'd been up since 4 am. (Wish I'd asked for names, or taken pictures.)  The food was delicious and arrived quickly, especially considering we'd taken a long time to order. All in all, this was a great start to our very brief trip to Quebec, and helped  my kids become the open-minded and adventurous travellers I knew they could be. Thanks for being part of our Quebec memories!

formatted_address: 5 Route du Président-Kennedy, Lévis, QC G6V 6C1, Canada
name: Bistro Le Clip

reviews.text: Decent little dive bar.  Good live entertainment
Unassumed kitsch
Belle emplancement
Ok
5,50$ pour une bière plus 2,50$ pour retirer de l'argent car il ne prennent que l'argent liquide. Plus le tip, la bière coûte trop chère pour un troup.

formatted_address: 1001 Rue Saint-Jean, Québec, QC G1R 1S4, Canada
name: Sapristi

reviews.text: It’s right at the gate of the old town. Location is convenient and food / service is great. We ordered a few dishes and the portions were just about right. It was packed since it’s a Saturday night in July. Good price and great food. Worth visiting. Recommended.

This is the best meal we've had in Canada. Our waiter was amazing (I wish I had got his name so I could mention him). He made us feel welcome from the moment we sat down. We mentioned we were trying to speak as much French as possible so he spoke French to us and helped us learn words. Above and beyond service! On top, the food was delicious! Everything was delicious, hot and full of flavour. A pleasure to give 5 stars! It gets really busy (we couldn't get in on Sat night so we made a reservation for Sun night) so definitely make a reservation so you don't miss out.
Really nice Italian restaurant just inside the wall of old Quebec.  Excellent flavors, reasonable prices and friendly staff.  French onion soup was one of the best I've tasted.
The service was great. Our server, Pascal, took good care of us. Very friendly. Food was very quick to our table, and tasted awesome. Perfectly sized portions. Highly recommended.

Loved the environment. Menu is full of tasty rich options. Pizzas are plate size, so make sure to get your own. Pastas are amazing. The salmon tartare on the essentials menu is great for sharing! The decor is cool to look at and the servers are a lot of fun and very stylish!

formatted_address: 317 Boulevard Cartier O, Laval, QC H7N 2J3, Canada
name: Dallas Bar & Bouffe

reviews.text: Wow great ambiance service top notch and amazing karaoke nights Friday and Saturday with ladies night on top of that great find!!!
So the dj has a huge list of tunes.  The staff are pleasant, and the ambiance is chill.  Pooltables and foosball top it all off for a great evening.
Cool karaoke but discusting food

Most of the staff is simply awesome!
The new kitchen is great, the cook is amaizing and the food is great!
They have a great menu with reasonnable pricing and the drinks are cheap.
Ambiance is great too, there are pool tables, kareoke nights and some shows!
Great sports bar excellent decor.  Also awesome prices

formatted_address: 362 Avenue Fairmount O, Montréal, QC H2V 2G5, Canada
name: Faros Restaurant - Resto Grecque - Seafood/Poisson Lobster - Wine/Cocktails

Faros Restaurant - Resto Grecque - Seafood/Poisson Lobster - Wine/Cocktails
Faros Restaurant - Resto Grecque - Seafood/Poisson Lobster - Wine/Cocktails
Faros Restaurant - Resto Grecque - Seafood/Poisson Lobster - Wine/Cocktails
Faros Restaurant - Resto Grecque - Seafood/Poisson Lobster - Wine/Cocktails
Faros Restaurant - Resto Grecque - Seafood/Poisson Lobster - Wine/Cocktails

reviews.text: One of the best Greek restaurants I’ve ever tried! I usually don’t like octopus or squid due to the chewy rubbery texture but this place makes their octopus sooooo tender and great fresh flavour! Greek salad with Bulgarian feta was bomb, fried zucchini and eggplant with tzaiki is another level!  Mediterranean Sea bass was nice and tender.

We met with friends at this place for lunch. This place was recommended to us by a friend.  Well, it was very nice. we were warmly welcomed by the staff  and we felt good. The meal was great. We had a great time and we will definitely return to this restaurant. Highly recommended.

Absolutely the best Greek restaurant in town. We had the chance to meet the owner and he treated us like family, the service and  the food was impeccable.

We will definitely recommend this restaurant for anyone that is looking for a 5star dinning experience .

The restaurant is fabulous. The food could not be better. The service could not be better. Warm and friendly. If there were more than five stars to rate it, without doubt I would give it a ten. They also have valet parking which makes it so easy.
Food service are waiter was all fantastic great night with friends and great restaurant.

formatted_address: 2053 Boulevard Décarie, Montréal, QC H4A 3J2, Canada
name: Rami’s massage place

formatted_address: 6705 Rue St-Hubert, Montréal, QC H2S 2M6, Canada
name: Le Roi du Smoked Meat

reviews.text: Got the smoked meat sandwich meal (medium fatty) was very juicy and on par with many similar diners. Got a side of gravy for the fries as well. Went on the weekend so the price was inflated versus the weekday lunch special.

This place was once my go to restaurant, for lunch and supper, prices were affordable until the restaurant was sold to new "GREEDY" owners.  Typical of new owners raising their prices again, maybe they need more money to spend at the Casino. $22.99 +tax  for a LB of smoked meat, bread, and 2 choices of salad, a real "RIP-OFF"!!!  Would like to know how many people are buying this so-called special, maybe "ZERO". At $16.99 +tax,  I'm sure they would be selling more of this special than at $22.99+tax. nothing but "GREED"
Always fresh, always delicious and the staff is wonderful !! Prices have gone up quite considerably in the past couple of years, but the food is still the best, so it’s okay :)
Been here for years, always a pleasure to have a nice decent meal
Smoked meat sandwich was pretty good, not the best in the city. Service was good though.

formatted_address: 571 Boulevard Lebeau Suite 220, Saint-Laurent, QC H4N 1S2, Canada
name: JTS pos

reviews.text: Excellent service
Excellent service et équipement de qualité

formatted_address: 3459 Rue Notre-Dame Ouest, Montréal, QC H4C 1P3, Canada
name: Rasoï

reviews.text: Very good restaurant. The bill would go up fast though considering the portions are really small. But everything was good, tasty and with some original tasty twist. The kefta was very clove tasty but in a good way, delicious. The curries were good although very small. The service was good and the atmosphere relax and pleasant.

Beautiful decoration, staff very friendly, impeccable service. This is a tapas restaurant, depending on how hungry you are you might need to order between 2 or 3 tapas. The choices are: an appetizer, a curry dish or a vegetarian dish and a side dish like rice, nan or others. 
I did not see many spicy dishes on their menu. Food tastes ok, but I prefer other places to eat Indian cuisine. But if you go with friends, this place has a great ambiance, you are going to have a pleasant evening. Children or teenagers under 18 years old are not allowed.

Great food, amazing service. Loved everything we ordered. For a picky bunch and foodies, we enjoyed our experience. Would definitely return. The portions were small compared to other Indian restaurants. However, the flavours and atmosphere made up for the portion size.

Tiny  inadequate dishes with expensive price.  Goat is made of bones and potatoes and a few tiny pieces of meat  and a lot of curry  Rice and salad are going separately with additional price  It’s dark there so that it’s not possible to see what they put in  I don’t understand why people put 4 or 5 stars.  Don’t go there   I don’t recommend
I prefer this restaurant very much. there is a nice atmosphere. The kitcen is good. the service is powerful and the crew is friendly. The cost is reasonable. truly recommend.

formatted_address: 4030 Rue Masson, Montréal, QC H1X 1T8, Canada
name: Cafe Sport Alex

reviews.text: Bon pour une bière et jouer aux videopoker
qu'avez vous fait a chez la mere!!! honte!!!

formatted_address: 1803 Boulevard Saint-Martin O, Laval, QC H7S 1N2, Canada
name: Mirage New York - Breakfast - Smoked Meat - Steak - Burgers Pizza Poutine - Wine Beer Cocktails

html_attributions: Mirage New York - Breakfast - Smoked Meat - Steak - Burgers Pizza Poutine - Wine Beer Cocktails
Mirage New York - Breakfast - Smoked Meat - Steak - Burgers Pizza Poutine - Wine Beer Cocktails

reviews.text: Was happy it was open for Christmas. Used to go there as a teenagers some 20 years ago...food is okay but a bit uninspired. It does the trick on Christmas day when nothing is open but...its not the same as I remembered it unfortunately. Staff is friendly and hospitable. Soup (homemade chicken soup) was good tho.
Convenient location. Lots of parking. Comfortable seating. Attentive service and great food. Definitely deserves a return visit.

Love these Greek style restaurants - good food with great choices for the whole family. Been there for a while - the new version is nice and relaxing - makes you feel like hanging out longer than you should. 

 I keep going back - I like it . I read the paper - you have guy food - girl food -kid food - a nice atmosphere. These types of restaurants are important to the local residents - can't keep going to one type of food restos. 

Give it a try when you want something the wife doesn't want to eat then you offer up Mirage New York and its a win win. They offer almost everything - its like having your cake and eating it too.

I just miss the oversized deserts from the Disco era - lol- big cheese cake, big coconut pie, huge lemon meringue pie, oh and the black forest cake - that was a winner.

Kind of disappointed, came here 2 years ago and did not like it. I came back to give it a try and i had the same experience. We did not get a proper greeting, didn’t get any water, 15mins later we get our appetizer and still no water! I didn’t know we had to ask for water now? No costumer service.. i get it was busy but not that busy, i work in a restaurant too and no matter what your costumer service is the most important thing. Thank you

Clean place, friendly staff, and resonable prices on their menu. Had eaten their Hamburger Steak, and Smoke Meat sandwich and both are very good and highly recommend it. Great place to also watch hockey.

formatted_address: 401 R. Saint-Vincent, Montréal, QC H2Y 3A4, Canada
name: Labaraque Resto-Bar-Cafe - Breakfast, Smoked Meat Sandwiches, Poutine, Burgers, Steak, Salads

reviews.text: Food was pretty good here. Came here for the poutine as it's a Montreal kind of thing. Service was ok, but not completely sure I'd be back.
If you’re looking for the most overpriced restaurant in Montreal, look no further... this place is a tourist trap and a total rip off.
Had their classic poutine at the bar. The owner was extremely friendly and will make you feel right at home the moment you stepped in.

I would rate this one star cause the food was not good, but our server was nice and we got our food pretty quick too. The poutine here is not good at all and I would not come back here. Also, they have some kind of problem with their tap water so you are kind of forced to buy a bottle of water if you want water.

Their hours are of service are wrong. Google says one thing, but the manager (I presume) says "Sometimes we will open these days, but sometimes we don't." Why bother having your hours outside of the restaurant, and in Google if you do what you are pleased? Why bother having a business?

formatted_address: 321 Place Jacques-Cartier, Montréal, QC H2Y 3A9, Canada
name: La Grande Terrasse

reviews.text: The place was OK, but not worth coming back again. The poutine was fine, but a little bit salty and the fries were soggy. Not sure if this is what it's supposed to be. The burger was well done (it's the law in Canada😐) and not really seasoned. The drinks came in McDonald's cups and there were no refills. The staff was very friendly.

I want to share my bad experience in this restaurant. 
  Last month (to be exact it was October 15) I went with my wife to this place to eat something.
  Ask the waiter to give us a table in the patio, as there was more than one available.
  The waiter denied us entrance to the patio, making the comment that the patio was about to close (this happened at approximately 1:00 pm).
  I saw a person eating at that time in the courtyard but I understood that they were going to close.
  Honestly, my wife and I wanted to get to the patio, and we better look for another place very close there.
  The big problem was when I went to another restaurant, almost next to this restaurant (La Grande Terrasse).  And I saw that other clients arrive and they provide them with a table in the patio.
  It was my annoyance here and I decided to go back to the restaurant (La Grande Terrasse) to know what the manager knew.
  When I saw a new waiter I asked for the manager and I said he was at the Bar.
  While in the BAR I ASKED FOR THE MANAGER, AND THE MANAGER WAS THE SAME THAT I HAD DENIED THE ENTRANCE TO THE PATIO.  I don't know if it was because of racism or I really don't know what the reason was.
  But I DO NOT recommend this place at all.
  TERRIBLE SERVICE.

We figured we would stop in for a quick lunch and skip reading too much into reviews. Wish we took 5 minutes to find something else. Seems like a great spot to have a few beers outside. That's about it. Save your French onion stomach for another place. Bruchetta was good though.
Food was good. Staff quick and super nice. Prices provide a good value for what you get

Waited 15mins for someone to serve us. Ordered the classic burger and it was absolutely terrible. Any fast food  burger I've ever eaten in my life, has better flavour than this did and doesn't cost $16. Helen Keller could've made a tastier burger. Avoid this place at all costs.

formatted_address: 2019 Boulevard Taschereau, Longueuil, QC J4K 2Y1, Canada
name: Le White Rabbit-Resto Bar de Quartier Longueuil

reviews.text: Très bon et bonne ambiance. Les prix sont bien raisonnable.

formatted_address: 1454 Rue Peel, Montréal, QC H3A 1S8, Canada
name: Chez Alexandre

reviews.text:
Cozy and nice environment, great choice of drinks and food, excellent customer service, most of all the music was the best, played Celine Dion songs all evening. People sitting there singing the songs, enjoyed listening to them. Such a nice decorated place!
No wheelchair access WC.
Excellent service, good food, classy ambiance. We went during the Montreal a table festival and had the 33$ dinner special. The 3 courses were all good.

Reasonable option in the heart of Montreal CBD. While food is good, service can be hit and miss, starting out friendly and attentive, but ending poorly - good luck if you want dessert or another drink!

This place got me believing I was back in Paris for a moment. They understand what a steak saignant means, the baguette is lovely and the fries are homemade awesome. Top that with a good French wine by the glass at very reasonable prices for downtown. Service was also more European style.

A traditional French cuisine place with a "steak frites" you'll remember for a long time. The place is a bit old and needs some updating, but it has an 80s charm to it.

Food is really well made. You will not regret eating here, unless you're looking for innovative cuisine. This is not haute cuisine, it's basic French cuisine, but it's delicious.

formatted_address: 185 Rue Saint-Paul O, Montréal, QC H2Y 1Z5, Canada
name: Tokyo Sushi Bar

reviews.text: The place offers a vast range of delicious food. I like eating here. Staff members are always kind, prices are fair and the place is always well organised.
Their rolls tasted very clean and fresh. Service was great and everyone was super friendly. The place was also bery clean and beautiful. Great experience overall
Very good sushi. Good quality and not too expensive. Definitely going back next weekend.

I randomly checked out this place when I was visiting Montreal in the summer. Their options are good and the prices are decent as well. The view by the window isn't bad as you get to look at Old Montreal. There wasn't really any music or anything like that though so if you're dining alone you may want to be mindful of that.

im just visiting montreal..and looking for sushi. 
google reccommend and its great.. i think similiar taste with kyo japonaise.. which makes me think that its how sushi taste here.. (kyo setting is more hip, while here is for family)
anyway the place open at 5pm and they were super nice.. i orderded three types of sushi.. bazooka scalop and something with salmon. posted the picture.. it was great..its not like really original but its fresh and tasty.. i sat by the window and really enjoyed the view of tourists walking by
