formatted_address: 105 Rue Saint-Paul O, Montréal, QC H2Y 1Z5, Canada
name: Mangiafoco

reviews.text: What a beautiful lunch spot! Menu has handcrafted pizzas and pastas and such a nice little atmosphere and view out the window. Our pizza was literally the best I've ever had too. Highly recommend a visit, especially for their discounted lunch menu.
A nice cosy place with amazing food! The Calamari is a must.. The service was prompt and the attendant very polite and helpful. Highly recommended

Had great service from Alain. He was super attentive and offered great food/drink recommendations. 

Food was okay, the pizza was a little too doughy. The octopus was good but the portion size was very small. 

It was a very nice and quiet evening and you don't have to worry about finding a spot for your jacket.

Went for the first time on Valentines Day, they were busy but super well organized; coat check for free in the front, and gaves us a prefered table per request. The food was to die for; savoury, hot, and well portioned. A little on the pricey side, but absolutely worth it! Tip: call to make a reservation a few days in advance.
Superior food with excellent service. The wine list is incredible. The flavors are exceptional. Highly recommended.

formatted_address: 8 Rue Queen, Montréal, QC H3C 2N5, Canada
name: 8 Queen Sid Lee

formatted_address: 949 Boulevard d'Auteuil, Laval, QC H7E 5J7, Canada
name: Taglio di Roma

reviews.text: Absolutely one of the best pizza!  Its has everything you want. Crunch, flavor and toppings. Highly recommend stopping here to eat if your in town.
The real Italian slices that taste like the ones in Rome. They have some many choices. Friendly staff, great atmosphere. On top of all, it's not expensive.

Excellent, The best pizza I had in the last 10 years. Authentic Italian.
Very good service. 
Thank you Fernando !!
Authentic pizza its been a long time since i had a good pizza like that. Tasty good portion and good price. I recommend this place for fans of pizza

It's all in the crust..Period.  A pizza is nothing without its crust and Taglio di Roma has perfected it into an artform. To top it off, the pairing of the ingredients  complements the crust with perfection. This place is busy and the pizzas just keep rolling out.  Be patient..you won't regret it.

formatted_address: 511 Rue Villeray, Montréal, QC H2R 1H5, Canada
name: Tapeo

reviews.text: Cannot recommend this place highly enough! Stopped in with three friends and all but one of the eight plates we got to share were flavourful and unbelievably tasty. Definitely try the cod fritters and Spanish tortilla. The only one we didn’t like was the mixed salad. Our female server was friendly and genuine, and explained each dish well in English and French. Each person only paid $24 and we all left pleasantly full (no drinks). You can’t beat that price.

One of the most memorable dinners I had in a while. All dishes were super tasty. I highly recommend octopus and shrimp tapas. Wine selection and the service is also impeccable. A breath of fresh air in Montreal’s restaurant scene.

This restaurant will always be on my list! I recently went to Spain and this restaurant did not disappoint! The dishes are similar to what many Spanish restaurants offered in the country. Also, this is a great restaurant for a gathering because the ambience is very nice! I recommend it! :)

We had great night here. All the dishes made with seafood are great. The dishes include octopus with sweet potato, "Gin Tonic" scallops, marinated swordfish, veal flank and paella. Recommend from high to low paella, octopus, swordfish, then scallops. Relatively, veal flank is not that good. The service is great. Five dishes are enough for 2.
Super cute restaurant , they have many option for tapas~

formatted_address: 8868 Boul Langelier, Saint-Léonard, QC H1P 3C8, Canada
name: Ciociaro Sport Bar

reviews.text: Amazing food and great Atmosphere! Best sandwiches I have ever had hands down!
The unexpectedly great place to dine.
Fantastic food, great service and a really amazing atmosphere. The sandwiches are all very good. The restaurant is also children friendly which helps a lot!
So good! Run don't walk there!
Very good food, very quick service and awesome atmosphere.

formatted_address: 1642 Rue Notre-Dame Ouest, Montréal, QC H3J 1M1, Canada
name: Le Bureau Bar Tapas

reviews.text:
Great ambiance 
 If you are hungry that's not the place to go and to get your belly full. Food is good but the quantity is very small since they only have tapas
Good food, nice place. Great for get together since booth can have around 8 people. Good service. Comfy

When it opened this place was great, now under new management it’s just not that great. Ordered calamari and received 4-5 rings. I get it’s tapas size but come on! Don’t take your customers for fools. Le bureau no more.

In general the place is nice. It is located in a nice area. The reason I’m giving one star is because of my experience. I went with some friends and one of them ordered a double gin & tonic for me. The cost of the double gin & tonic was 27 dollars!!! (See picture). The price of the double gin a tonic was done by just adding a whole gin cost twice. I understand it is a double gin & tonic but it is definitely not reasonable a basic drink for 27 dollars, and that we did not receive any warning. When we politely told the waitress we were surprised  she just said: well this is Griffintown, this is the common price of things here.

Went there with few friends after a long day at work. It's a great place to catch up with friends while enjoying a few drinks and eating some delicious food. They have quite a few selections of tapas, great for sharing with friends. They also have a 35$ taster menu which consist of 4 courses of various tapas. They have quite a large selection of alcohol to choose from as well. All in all, pretty cool place with a nice vibe and atmosphere, would recommend checking out. And price wise, is very reasonable for what you are getting. We were quite a large group and everyone seemed to enjoy the food.

formatted_address: 595 Grande Allée E, Québec, QC G1R 2K5, Canada
name: Copas

reviews.text:
Dinner for 5 was excellent and a great end to our Carnaval 2020 experience. 
Steak was done to perfection. Paella, just exquisite. Seafood pasta was creamy and rich. The kids meals were a hit too. The pasta sauce tasted so fresh and the ribs were too good to share, so must take her word that they were "delicious". 

The staff was friendly and accomodating for our non-french speaking family. And the atmosphere was warm and inviting despite the cold outside.
Thank you for a wonderful dining experience!

A woman called us over to tell us about the menu as we walked past, and it sounded good to us. (I should note 3 of 4 of us are Spanish speakers, and everyone in the group has traveled extensively in the Spanish speaking world.) The woman told us the staff inside spoke Spanish, which clearly wasn't true because the waiter couldn't understand a basic question in Spanish. We ordered in English, after which the waiter asked if we knew what "albóndigas" were. What? We were the ones speaking Spanish. The tapas were very basic, but well prepared. After the meal we wanted to pay with cash, and told the waiter we wanted change, holding on to the cash for the tip to give him later. He walks back and snidely asks if we understand tipping. Again, what? We're American--we overtip all over the world! We didn't even have our jackets on. I don't know what was going on with the waiter, but his attitude made it hard for us to recommend the place.

I had a gazpacho with a seafood paella. The gazpacho was good, was missing a little olive oil, but good. The paella was cooked good, its not easy to make a good paella... Rice was cooked just right. The shrimps, scallops and mussels were good, but I found the lobster tail a bit small. Service was ok, I sat at the counter. Overall experience was good.

We were walking trying to find somewhere to eat, when a lady the (hostess) started explaining their menue she made everything sound so good, at first we walked on but then decided to go back. I had the bbq ribs and Fries and a side salad, my husband had a seafood Pasta dish which was great, too. Everything we ordered was great. The service was good also. Our friends also loved everything they ate. The portion sized were very large, we walked away very pleased that we had gone back. None of us drink so it was nice to be seated away from the bar. The atmosphere was quiet and we started talking to the couple at the next table, which was from Argentina, They were very nice and were enjoying the food there as well.

This is the second time we visited this place and we found the food and service to be exceptional.  The dish we ordered had plenty of seafood which was filling.  Copas is one of my favorite restaurant to visit when I am in Quebec City.

formatted_address: 711 Côte de la Place d'Armes, Montréal, QC H2Y 2X6, Canada
name: Kyo Bar Japonais

reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised to find such an amazing Japanese restaurant in Montreal! The food was delicious, made fresh, with attention to detail and well balanced flavors/texture. The ambiance was upscale but relaxed. Our waiter Jess was attentive, considerate, and friendly. He made great suggestions and seemed very knowledgeable in regards to the food and drink menus. Making a stop at Kyo is definitely a must when in Montreal!

It was my first time in Montreal and at Kyo. My server was Jess, very attentive to detailed, and welcoming. He was very knowledgeable about what food and drinks to suggest. I now know a bit better about the process of making sake thanks to him. he suggested a great sample of them. My soup was delayed in the kitchen, and he removed it from the bill. The quality of food is good, and the ambiance was ideal, but the service was the catch for me to come back.

Great service from the moment we called to book a reservation all through the service everything was perfect.  Staff was polite, inviting and took the time to go through the menu.  Once we were done, they did not rush us with the bill.  Kept bringing us water even after having paid our bill (very rare in restaurants nowadays).  The place itself was cozy (lighting is just right, not too dark that you can't see around but not too bright as to create an ambiance of intimacy).  Great place to bring a date or a group of friends.

Overall a great experience.  Keep it up guys, you have a great team!!!

So happy to have spontaneously ended up in Kyo while wandering through Montreal. The food is absolutely delicious (we LOVED the Kimono roll), and the service is amazing (shout-out to our awesome waiter Jess!)

Highly recommend!

A friend and I were in the area and googled for something close so we decided to hit up this place on a lark. My evening there was just lovely! Stylish, not snobby. The food was extremely well prepared and bursting with flavor. Def will return sometime.

formatted_address: 7225 Rue St-Hubert, Montréal, QC H2R 2N2, Canada
name: Disco Bar Tu Casa De Nacho

reviews.text: Easygoing. You don't feel judged ... You just dance with the Latin beat. Great dance lessons on Fridays starting at 9h30. The party continues after. No pressure
Une bonne endroit ou ons peu danser la bonne latine . merengue.bachata.reggeaton.cumbia

formatted_address: 7985 Avenue Marco Polo, Montréal, QC H1E 1N8, Canada
name: Resto Pub Marco Polo

reviews.text:
Pleasant ambiance. Comfy place. Good food. Sweet tasty sauce.

Friendly Staff. Convivial clients. I definitely come back to try other dishes.

It's a nice little pub perfect for lunch and having a beer with your business co-workers on Friday afternoon. It also has ok food. Quesadillas are really good I totally recommend trying it. People working there felt a bit rushed and nervous for some reason but other than that cool place. Wouldn't go if it wasn't for my 5@7 or lunch with coworkers though.
We had our Group,Xmas supper very good food great atmosphere .service very good and friendly staff! I recommend.  Reasonable price.
yummy food and great service!
The ambiance was great but music was to loud couldn't hear our conversation around the table

formatted_address: 9675 Avenue Papineau local 205, Montréal, QC H2B 3C8, Canada
name: Location Gymnase Hockey cosom

formatted_address: 5675 Rue Saint-Denis, Montréal, QC H2S 3R2, Canada
name: Technomage-Animation

formatted_address: 1200 Rue Saint-Jean, Québec, QC G1R 1S8, Canada
name: Pub St-Patrick

reviews.text: Liked it so much that we had two dinners in a row here. Nice atmosphere and views when seated at the windows. Friendly service. Wife loved her veggie burger (and mountain of sweet potato fries). My Cobb salad was excellent. Really enjoyed this establishment.

First time visiting this restaurant and I was not disappointed. Great atmosphere. there service while a little slow was still good and the food was amazing. it is a little pricey about 70$ with tip for two people. However I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a nice place to eat.

I can't even recall how many times I've been to this pub... I worked as a your guide for a company in Montreal and, basically, this was our go-to location. Great food, reasonable prices, a nice ambiance, there's just so many nice things about St-Patrick that listing them would be boring. Funnily enough, the single time so far I've been to their main floor was the one depicted in my pic - because of the group sizes we used to bring in, we always stayed at their lower level, which by the way you should visit, because it gives off this very European-style pub, what with it being underground and all.

We made a reservation for Saturday night at 6:30 for 4 people. When we showed there was a line out the door and nobody helped us for 10 minutes. When we finally spoke to the hostess we were told they didn’t have a reservation. I showed them the email confirming our reservation and they ended up just sending us to the basement and seemed irritated about us being there. when we sat down, we picked out what we wanted from the menu but nobody came for 15 minutes. We gave up and decided we would eat elsewhere. We stood up and got our coats on and a server brought over a bottle of water. The same server who had been talking with a bunch of other staff while we were sitting and waiting to at least order an over priced draft beer. When I went to get my 3 month old daughters snow suit on, I used an empty table to lay her on and I was told to take my child off the table. It was absolutely the worst dining experience we have ever had and we didn’t even get to dine. I’d avoid this place at all costs.

It was open in the snowstorm, the manager constantly cleared the windows so we could people watch outside (the weather was crazy!) And the staff awesome but not heckling. The beer was (almost) to die for. So good after trudging through that weather!

formatted_address: 965 Boulevard Curé-Labelle, Laval, QC H7V 2V7, Canada
name: Le Skratch

reviews.text: Nice and relaxing spot. Didn't go for the pool or the slot machines but rather the bar food. The poutine with the cracked pepper and the sauce was amazingly good. The steak grilled cheese was good, could of used some sort of sauce to keep the meat moist, but was still good. The coleslaw was very good... ambiance was very casual and felt good. Would visit again. Guys the only reason I took a star off was because no desert... I know that's harsh but the food was that good, was looking forward to a desert to finish it off but everything else was 5☆... thanks.
Had a fun time playing pool and the service at the bar was really good
It is far from being the best billard place in the region, the billard tables are not well maintained and they seem to be very old, i found it a bit expensive as well, they charge almost 12$ per hour

Pretty decent bar. I can’t say much about the pool hall, because I’ve only been there to watch Basketball games. Sometimes they would play the audio for those games, but hockey trumps all sports in Quebec needless to say. I would go back again next time I’m in Laval. The staff at the bar seemed okay so I have no complaints about them.
Nice atmosphere, but the waiters and bartenders obviously don't wanna make money, otherwise they'd serve things you order.

formatted_address: 2485 Boulevard Sainte-Anne, Québec, QC G1J 2G4, Canada
name: Star Zone

reviews.text: Trop bon service, belle ambiance je vous le recommande 😁

formatted_address: 1495 Boulevard du Souvenir, Laval, QC H7N 5X1, Canada
name: Restaurant Chez Vaness

reviews.text:
excellent chicken, generous portion! the chicken is perfect and not salty like a lot of place. the salad is very authentic and different from other shawarma place.Highly recommended + the owner was very friendly. 

they have an alcohol license as well
The food is totally delicious and fresh! The staff is really friendly. Would recommend 10/10! 👌
The food there is amzing and the services is so welcoming i loved it i go there daily and zouz ma fi metlak! Haha
Amazing food, amazing staff 100% recommend

Tastiest shawarma in the world
Friendly staff
You should try it

formatted_address: 365 Avenue Dorval, Dorval, QC H9S 3H6, Canada
name: Jockey Taverne Racée

reviews.text: We love hanging out. Yesterday we  visited this delicious place which we didn’t know before. We passed a beautiful evening there with delicious meal and a courteous team and a distinguished cook. We put this place in our phone list  and we shall surely go again soon. We highly recommend.
I would not recommend this place in the evening.  This bar attracts a lot of sketchy people so you should avoid!

Bar is clean and staff is friendly drinks are nice and cheap you can get huge pitchers of beer. Also they have horse racing machine and tons of slot machines. The locals that hang around the bar are something to be desired keep that in mind especially on the weekends. Keep up the good work you cant bar people from coming but I also cant give it a higher rating. Still would recommend for a quick drink if your in the area.

A good place to have lunch or dinner,  enjoy a beer, watch various sporting events or try your hand at betting on some horse racing. The  majority of patrons are over 40. The atmosphere is relaxing with music set at a volume that allows for comfortable conversation. Weekdays are fairly quiet but weekends are more busy. Staff members are friendly and engaging. The menu is reasonably priced and the food is decent but keep in mind that the kitchen is closed on Mondays. Fully renovated / updated in early 2018.
Food was good. The ambiance is ok

formatted_address: 3515 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2X 2T6, Canada
name: Mckibbins Irish Pub

reviews.text:
I've always loved McKibbin's from the first time I visited it. Food is really good and the service is great...
But, personally, my best experience was during the 3 years I lived in Montreal and had a group of friends and customers with whom I used to go every Wednesday for their karaoke day. It was a total blast, and Dan, the man behind the karaoke controls, is lots of fun and a really good sport. I totally miss those days, so if you happened by this review and have a chance to visit this awesome pub on a Wednesday, please say hi to everyone for me! 😅

Green is the color. A typical Irish bar decorated authentic! Try it and re-visit if you like. Across the famous cinema. ..great location specially when the sun shines on the few tables located on the edge of the sidewalk. Menu classic.  Prices reasonable but no McDonald level. OK I guess everyone has his profession! Enjoy the look and passers-by. ..great location. And if Irish or Irish holy day you will feel green for a day!smile no candid camera around!
Simple fun pub. The isn't fancy in any way but tasty and goes well with a few pints. The sweet potato fries are great however!

A great place to watch sports or just meet with friends. The menu offers the classic Irish pub food and a few local variations. The beer selection will please most people, good and fresh. The service is nice and quick. Great location!
I get to eat here a lot since I work in the area. I must say the service is always excellent and they keep the place well kept constantly. Pricing is affordable and they serve big portions.

formatted_address: 398 Chemin Bord-du-Lac, Dorval, QC H9S 2A6, Canada
name: T & M Sushi Bar

reviews.text: I adore this restaurant a lot. there is a nice spirit. The kitcen is splendid. the service is dynamic and the waiters are courteous. The price is satisfactory. profoundly recommend.

Great hole in the wall sushi place! Make sure to order well in advance of when you want to eat if its around dinner time, they are quite popular so there may be a wait time. Friendly service and fresh and delicious sushi.
Certainly a spot worth visiting, the food is awesome and well prepared, the prices are fair and it is always clean in here. 5 stars.
A great little local place. Everything made to order.
Excellent sushi restaurant. It's a very small counter with very bright light. There are only a few tables. Most customers choose to take out. The edamame are excellent.

formatted_address: 1600 Boulevard le Corbusier, Laval, QC H7S 1Y9, Canada
name: Jack Saloon

reviews.text: The food ribs ( cotes levees) all you can eat where so tender and good, and the service was great. Nice place to eat and discuss, good 80- 90's music but not too loud. Can be causy for a romantic dinner or entertaining if you wish.

I would give this place a 3.5.
The service was ok. Our waitress was super nice but it took a while for us to get our food, especially given this place was only maybe 3/4 full.
We ordered the blue sangria. It was a bit watery but ok for the price (32$), I've had much better. My husband had the ribs with a chili poutine which was good. I had the fried chicken and waffles with the mac & cheese. I am a huge fan of mac & cheese and try it everywhere I go- this one was ok. (The sauce was kinda lumpy and sweet, not my thing.) The chicken was a bit overcooked but the plate itself was very good. I had been to the Jack Saloon in the old port and found their food, decor at atmosphere much better. Keeping this is mind, and considering the amount our dinner cost, I give this place a 3.5.

Nice decor and pleasant staff. 
However they made a mistakes during our reservation and rather than admitting it they eventually placed us on 2 tables.
Wife ordered a Mac&Cheese and even a home made kraft dinner is better than what she was served. I ordered the smoked chicken and at least 60% of it was just bones. (Thankfully at least it tasted good)
Music was too loud and even standing next to each other after 10min talking I was loosing my voice.
Some clients though it would also be funny to throw their coasters across the bar at each other’s and the staff didn’t seem bothered.

In the end it was a very mixed experience and I probably won’t go back.
We were impressed with the place! Food was good and excellent service.

Had lunch here last week. The decor was good, but the food was excellent! Loved the salad, very different. Burger was good, fries good and the dipping sauce, well, I ate my wife's leftovers! We will be going back for supper sometime soon.

formatted_address: 146 Route du Président-Kennedy, Lévis, QC G6V 6C9, Canada
name: Délice Resto Lounge

reviews.text: Big American style pub/dinner with fried stuff. Quite noisy and average food. Good service though.

Opulence is the first word coming to mind when I think of Délice. Different terraces and levels cater for almost any appetite. Service is friendly and the place is a buzz of people having a good time. We did not stay to enjoy the club as we were a day before the finals at a world championship, but I would love to go back there again to experience this out of this world experience. I have very good memories of Délice. If you are not from Canada you have to have the Poutine (traditional dish - potato and gravy). There are a lot of variations but you have to try it.

This is Levis' best spot.  Rooftop terrace is pleasant this time of year.  Staff is friendly and very professional.  I only went there for drinks and snacks, but this week I took my family for a meal.  Very pleasantly surprised.  Impeccable presentation, quality ingredients, creative recipes.  Bravo Delice!

This place have a pretty good vibe. The design is modern and with different styles. Frequently there are live bands performance. Excellent menu selection presented very well. The taste is really great. The people are nice and helpful. Good selection of international food at a high quality with fair price. Everything looks clean. Every time the restaurant is full of customers.
Really extraordinary decoration.. Thai style. Food is excellent, very good service nice music... Chic place

formatted_address: 207 Rte, Kahnawake, QC J0L 1B0, Canada
name: Two O Seven Grill & Bar

reviews.text: I like this restaurant a lot. It has a friendly mood. The kitcen is great. the service is powerful and the waiters are trained. The price is decent. deeply recommend.
Wow what a fantastic experience! The handsome bartender was my favourite. I think his name rhymes with licholas.

This is my go-to place for a great and inexpensive breakfast! They have full plates of breakfast for only 5$. My boyfriend likes their big breakfast which is 22$ and includes steak. Huge plates, impossible to finish. Recommend!

Wow, what an atmosphere. Fireplaces, great terrace and plenty of room.  
The last time I was there, I had the 20 oz rib steak with baked potato. the steak was cooked perfectly ( medium rare ). We go there sometimes for breakfast on the weekends. Huge parking lot and only 13 minutes from NDG.
Good prices, excellent food and service and very reasonably priced.

formatted_address: 552 Rue Jarry E, Montréal, QC H2P 1V5, Canada
name: Taverne Jarry

reviews.text: Best place to watch the game
Beer ok
Bon spot pour regarder le hockey. Popcorn gratuit et des grosses bières vintage!! Un service toujours courtois.
Tres cool

Lieu exceptionnel car versatile . Entre café et delicatessen, la carte est à la fois traditionnelle et mise au goût du jour. Le vendredi, la taverne organise des concerts , des évènements qui attirent bien plus que le quartier. Ce «  vieil » établissement tout rénové participe activement à la dynamique de Villeray et au renouveau de la rue Jarry.

formatted_address: 230 Boulevard des Étudiants, Québec, QC G2A 1P7, Canada
name: Disco-Bar Parent Ltee

reviews.text: Best karaoké in town!
Karaoké et promo 🍻👍🎤
Très belle ambiance 😁

Serveuse très désagréable manque de service et professionalisme assurément ! Elles montre leur grosse Boulle et donne un bon service au jeune mais ceux un peu plus âgé aucun respect !!! Faite un tour ailleur si vous avez la chance !!
Le service est pas parfait!

formatted_address: 1250, Boulevard Robert-Bourassa, Street Level, Montréal, QC H3B 3B8, Canada
name: East Pan Asiatique Cuisine et Bar

reviews.text:
Tasty Asian inspired cuisine. Knowledgeable & friendly bar staff that can make good classic cocktails as well as some really interesting new creations.

Nice atmosphere. 

Worth a visit.

I love this place and it's very, very good for a hotel restaurant. It always seems packed for business lunches, and I've enjoyed a variety of different dishes.

My wife has allergies and they were able to accommodate her as well. Definitely recommended.
Delicious and great ambiance! Table d'hôte is a steal! Loved the cocktail! Located downtown, it's  nested between busy  Ste Catherine, shopping malls and Gare Centrale💖

The Singapore Noodles were amazing but the Chocolate Lava cake was absolutely delicious. Being vegetarians, we didn't have an issue finding dishes that were varied and filling. Definitely worth going, specially for the choco lava cake !!

Ambiance is super nice, and service was at par, there could of been a little more attentiveness about the water. The dim sum was really good/with the sauce that was served. I had the chicken dish which I was not that impressed with. I thought the “general Tao” type chicken was over cooked. Pricing is not reasonable for lunch as the food didn’t taste luxury/blow my mind. I would go again but most likely wouldn’t recommend it for out of Towners as a must.

formatted_address: 5201 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2T 1S4, Canada
name: Lawrence

reviews.text: We did the tasting menu and everything was delicious.  Pictures posted of each dish.  Started with sushi - even though it wasn't cut with sushi knife, it was still sushi grade.  They could open just a sushi restaurant if they wanted.  Next was sardine with bacon on toast.  The cabbage can out simultaneously.  Then came a ravioli dish and then to the goose. Another salad of cucumber and radish was served with the goose. I wasn't a big fan of the beer called jet lag.  For dessert we had apple bread which was amazing and the tart.

The service was good, though it’s not very clear where the host’s podium is and I was confused about who to talk to about the reservation I had. Other than that, the menu has a good variety of things but we were informed that for dinner, everything is a “tapas style, meant to be shared” which is really interesting but my boyfriend and I don’t have the same diet. He can usually only eat chicken or seafood and there were zero options with chicken on the menu. I think there was only one vegetarian option too. That’s okay, the vibe was really nice and everything and the staff were super kind. I just had no idea that the menu was a shared type of thing as nothing indicated that on the menu itself, or the website and no reviews said anything about it either.

If you can, make reservation because the restaurant is small and is very popular. Also the tables are close together so it might be tough for big crowd. We had about 1hour of wait time which we then walked around the neighborhood and explored. 

We had pancake, English breakfast, And scone. The scone is out of the world!!! The clotted cream was amazing. The sausage, beans, potato and cabbage were all amazing in the English breakfast. Great brunch experience. I wish we get to go to dinner! Maybe next visit.

My wife and I arrived around 5:00 PM on a Saturday. We were sat relatively quickly although the table was small. The service was prompt although a little cool and impersonal. Our meal was fine, but not memorable. Presentation could have been more inspired.  I realize this is just my opinion.  I am by no means a food critic. Overall, our Lawrence experience was nice, but warmer service and more curated presentation would have prompted me to give more stars.

Came here for brunch with some friends for the first time and wasn't disappointed. Surprisingly not too crowded on a saturday morning, even though we had to wait for a 4 people table. But if you're 2, seating is super quick. 

I did remove one star because the meals don't include mini breakfast potatoes and that's what makes a brunch for me. Also their hash browns are good but they aren't traditional. 

I ordered the egg and sausage sandwich and it was devine. I would absolutely recommend. Also the scones, they are so buttery!

formatted_address: 4854 Avenue Dornal, Montréal, QC H3W 1V8, Canada
name: Lacasavibes

formatted_address: 5064 Avenue Papineau, Montréal, QC H2H 1V8, Canada
name: Plein Sud

reviews.text: Great food and ambiance. A touch of romance added courtesy of a live singer on an acoustic guitar. Beware the portions are large but succulence is the only term than can be used to describe the unique blends of flavors you will experience.

Why does this place have a good rating?? Food was edible but far from enjoyable (beet puree with rubbery scallops, dry pork, dry trout, chocolate cake I wouldn't eat if it were free...), and the service was awful - asked for a glass of wine 3 times, never got it, server was curt and had to chase her down to pay. I wouldn't typically penalize just for service because perhaps they were just having a bad day - but it was such a disappointment on every point that it merits 1 star.

This spot is the one I like best. I eat in a lot of restaurants but to this one I go the most. The team is very helpful and the food they offer is so appetizing. I never decline to have a good dinner in this restaurant. I highly recommend this place.

The food was pretty good, but I'd say a bit ordinary for the price. All the fresh and really well-chosen ingredients, it's a pretty solid cooking, but if you're looking for something interesting, it's not the place. 
Service was great, it's a nice experience overall
Food was delicious and portions were delicious. Good service. We went for mtl a table.

formatted_address: 1101 Boul. de Maisonneuve E, Montréal, QC H2L 1Z6, Canada
name: Le Blossom Bar

reviews.text: Super casual and not authentic. That’s not an issue itself. But our plate took really long to come and the fish was poorly cut (slices sticking to one another). Also, I ordered the “special” and was given the most basic slices of sashimi. The food didn’t taste bad and the cocktails were decently nice.

Went for brunch last weekend. The beef tartare was a bit underseasoned, but the accompanying taro and lotus root chips were light and crunchy, a nice touch. The best dish, roasted duck breast benedict on a fried rice pancake with a mushroom and soy-based jus, was spot-on. The matcha 'soufflé' pancake was more American-style and denser than a Japanese soufflé pancake; the appropriately bitter green tea flavour could've been balanced with a sweeter and richer sauce; perhaps either chocolate or red bean coulis? 

Host initially gave us two bar seats that were nearest to the front door when there were at least 2 tables and 5 other bar seats open. Table service was beyond courteous, as they made us a new duck plate after finding some plastic wrapping and took it off our bill.  Would return to try their evening service.

Absolutely delicious! Loved the sushi platter to share for Tuesday’s couples’ night and especially the gyoza!
The only downside is that it took about 45min for the sushi to arrive, when the place wasn’t booming/full...
Excellent sushi and cocktails with a surprisingly elegant decor.

The Bad :Slow service, small portion high prices. The good : hands down the best sake selection est side  of Canada. And th quality of the food is pure culinary art.. But bring your check book because this one will hurt $$$$

formatted_address: 2025 Rue Drummond, Montréal, QC H3G 1W6, Canada
name: TABOO Cuisine Rebelle Centre-Ville Montréal

reviews.text: Had dinner here last night. Sat at the bar since we didn't have a reservation. So get that. Saw online that the beef sliders were highly recommended, so we got four beef and one chicken. Chicken was the best. Ambiance is really good. Service was delayed because there were many groups but the staff was very good. It came down to about 26$/person but value for money was less. Fries were far from spicy.

Great sliders! We had the classic beef sliders, a chicken and avocado slider, and the lettuce wrapped sliders (gluten free option) were shrimp. They went nicely with our mojitos. Desserts were great. Their serving of fries is quite large, so 1 order can be shared (we ordered 2 and could not finish among the 3 of us). Great service!
Great selection of sliders and poutine. My e selections were awesome. Fries  perfect. Dipping sauces great. Wine tasty. No complaints.

A really fun place to go eat with friends. Their menu is extensive and has something for everyone. I was really excited to try the sliders and wasn't disappointed. 

I've tried the regular and parmesan truffle fries, the ribs, decadent, and mozza burger, the beef and salmon tartar original. Everything has been good and it's a good quantity of food for the price. 

I though the tartare was just ok but I think it's normal since it's just one of the things they do and it's not their main dish. Their sliders are really good and the highlight of the restaurant. 

Both times I went for dinner and it was pretty empty so no need for a reservation but you can make one if you want a specific table or have a big group. Service is friendly and on time.
One of the most amazing food places I had tried at my stay in Montreal. Sliders were FANTASTIC, drinks were amazing! Staff was courteous and kind.

formatted_address: 4710 Rue De Lanaudière, Montréal, QC H2J 3P7, Canada
name: Le Chien Fumant

reviews.text:
A very nice local restaurant. Waiter was very nice and professional. Made food explanation so well, Food was amazing. They have tasting menu, ranging from 20$-100$ per person. We did have a lot of food. 
was very full by the end.

My friend made a reservation for 4 people (plus a baby) on a random winter Tuesday night. Even on a weekday night, it was grooving with people so make sure to have a reservation! Our table was ready once we got there and it was very nice of them to accomodate us with our infant in her car seat. Unfortunately, its not a kid friendly restaurant. However, the service was impeccable and the food delicious. We had the 50$ tasting menu and there were good sized sharing plates for 4. It's a nice place to go with friends but not in large groups (4-6 is perfect) as its a very cozy restaurant. I would go back again for their tasting menu at a different price point. It's also located in a residential area so parking might be a challenge.
The best meal I had in Montreal 😍 the chef's special $50/person course was enough for a  group of 4. Every dish that came out was amazing! Will be coming back here for sure!

Best food in Montreal. Don't miss this opportunity. I went with 5 person and everything was well made and succulent. The waiter was very attentive and patience with us. We had the tasting menu at 60$ each and we had plenty of food for left over.
I had the best ever brunch here. I can't believe the price point being so low or the large serving sizes. The service was even great. The chef is going places. Come here while you can.

formatted_address: 355 Rue Saint-Jacques, Montréal, QC H2Y 1N9, Canada
name: JAMES Le Restaurant (formerly XO Le Restaurant)

reviews.text: Had the pleasure of dining at James Le Restaurant with my colleagues & clients last night (party of 5). The decor/ambiance is exquisite, the food was carefully/passionately presented, the flavors were very well balanced & the staff was very attentive.  I ordered the 12oz aged rib steak which was flavorful, juicy & very tender. Compliments to the chef.  Everyone had a great experience... thank you & keep up the great work/quality!
Dinner here was SO fantastic!  Very uniquely prepared entrees. Excellent service as well. Truly a feast for the senses. It’s a less known gem. We highly recommend it.
Stunning dining experience! Waiters are very friendly, knowledgeable and professional. Quite & fancy atmosphere, definitely should dress up a little.
Pricey, but delicious. The restaurant is very fancy and the food quality is amazing!
Sub par dining - We had scallops and fresh pasta with “truffle” - dishes were very bland. Scallop meal offered two scallops for 44.. that were over lemoned. Don’t recommend. Service was good.

formatted_address: 201 Place d'Youville, Montréal, QC H2Y 2B3, Canada
name: Porto Mar Restaurant

reviews.text:
We went there for Valentine's lunch and we wanted seafood. 
The food was amazing. We had swordfish and mahi mahi as main dish and grilled sardines and salad as side.
What was as good, if not better than the food, was their hospitality. Our waitress was really nice and treated us like close friends.
Will definitely go back.

Visiting this area for the first time and it's such a nice place. The food was wonderful and came out so fresh and hot. Took a little longer to get the food but worth every minute. You can tell it was made fresh and nothing was warmed up. The service was great and everyone was very friendly. Amazing food and I will definitely be going back.
Excellent cuisine served by attentive, friendly, professional staff. Wonderful atmosphere. Could not ask for better service - highly recommend.

Great experience! Delicious full-course dinner, with a reasonable price, friendly service and cozy restaurant with authentic decor. We could feel the tasty Portuguese style and we loved the ambience since we are getting ready to visit Portugal soon! :-))) We totally recommend.
Beautiful ambiance. Incredible food. Wonderful service.

formatted_address: 24 Avenue du Mont-Royal O, Montréal, QC H2T 2S2, Canada
name: Addydanse

formatted_address: bdl St Laurent, Montreal, QC H2T 2R9, Canada
name: 5 Days Resto Bar evening hours

formatted_address: 1111 Rue Sainte-Catherine E, Montréal, QC H2L 2G6, Canada
name: Campus Strip Bar

reviews.text:
One of my go to when I'm in Montreal. Nice dancers and affordable place. The drinks used to be cheaper but now around 7$ a bottle. Friendly bartenders and receptionist. So many clubs close by to hop. The cost check is 4$ - not expensive. 
Come here for a fun night.
Great male strippers. Good drinks, a wee pricey for non alcoholic drinks. 5.50 for a coke is a bit too much. But the strippers make up for it.

Because of the Covid pandemic, there were barely any people even on a Saturday night.  But I had such a great time!  The staff were polite and professional, at no time have I felt pressure to keep buying drinks or get a private dance with the guys I didn't like.  The dancers were *hot*.  I must say, the dancers were more "permissive" than I'm used to, which I certainly didn't mind.  I think they were just grateful that people even showed up.  I ended up spending more than I thought, but man, it was worth it!! 😅
Your dancers expect the customers to pursue them. I was expecting the reverse. Waiter pursued me instead. Bartender excellent.
It is a very cool bar with handsome dancers and a very good vibe where we can spend  a very great time.

formatted_address: 273 Rue Bernard O, Montréal, QC H2V 1T5, Canada
name: Helm Microbrasserie

reviews.text: Popular beer spot, a good selection of beers and your typical pub food. Always popping on Friday’s and Saturday’s. My servers have always been lovely, the ambience is very nice with indoor plants. Can get a bit loud, but after a beer I don’t mind it.

The ambience of place , and quality of beers they provide makes it a unique place in neighbourhood. 
We went there with the group , and the server helped me with the type of beer I would like to have. 
Moreover, their decoration which gives a feeling of mix between old style and new decor is worth experiencing.

Nice place, great beers with correct prices. It can be a little noisy when crowded.
They organize Musical Quizzes once a month on Tuesday (check their Facebook for the schedule).
I will go again for sure.

We really enjoyed everything about this restaurant. Our waiter was very friendly and helpful. Good beer selection, some brands I haven't really seen anywhere else. Food was excellent and not overly expensive, although portions (burger and side salad) left us wanting a bit more. Very satisfied with the experience and would recommend.

First time experience, and we're new to Montréal on top of that.  Had an amazing night at Helm with excellent IPA brews and a really delicious burger and fries.  What made it really special was great live music that was going on for Nuit Blanche festival and the customer service at Helm was truly exceptional.  Highly recommend.

formatted_address: 98 Avenue Laurier O, Montréal, QC H2T 2N4, Canada
name: Bar Datcha

reviews.text: Cool bar in the Mile End. The decor is nice and I liked the vibe. The drinks were on the pricier side but that’s expected. Gets very crowded on the weekend which makes it kind of hard to walk around, but I’ve seen worse. If you want to sit down and grab a drink though I would suggest you to come before midnight as it gets pretty festive after that (music gets louder and a lot of people dancing). The bar next door is also very cute but was way too crowded. We were stepping on each other’s feet as it was tiny. One bartender was a bit rude.
Nice small place with ok music and good drinks.

I've been to the Jazz and Tarot Thursday twice now and it's always pretty fun. There's an interesting speakeasy atmosphere with live Jazz music, drinks are pretty good and not that expensive ($12-14 for a cocktail) and the service is intimate and friendly. The personalized tarot card readings also give a sort of mystical vibe to the place which is pretty nice.
nice drinks and atmos. the small bar becomes a nightclub later. Different themes and music every weekend.
Datcha is my personal favorite nightclub in Montreal, Great cocktails and fun times

formatted_address: 168 Avenue Mariale, Laval, QC H7N 3L5, Canada
name: Le château du Roé

reviews.text:
TOUJOURS TRÈS PERFORMANT 
MILLE WATTS ET PLUS

formatted_address: Bell Centre, 1280 Avenue des Canadiens-de-Montréal, Montréal, QC H3B 5G0, Canada
name: Taverne 1909 signé St-Hubert

reviews.text: Great place to watch the game and other sports. Fantastic view of the screen from the top floor. Good food and good service. Reminded me of Real sports in Toronto if that helps for a reference.

Service was great! At upstairs way from the huge center near the patio. Server was great! Only knocked it down 1 star because the chicken wings were the smallest I've ever seen. To me, the wings tasted and were cooked amazing, but were just small.

I'd definitely recommend to come early before a major sporting event to get a good seat!

Wow, how times have change for this place. The food here is good. I gotten give them that. With friendly staff. 
But it gotten very expensive here in the last year and half. 
I loved coming here after a game or after a show or watching the big UFC/boxing fight on there big screen tv. I loved their 10 after $10 special. 
Back in May of 2018 I came here to watch the Champions League final and order a fish and chips and at that time it was 17$ plus tax. And now soon after the start of the NHL 2019/20 ( early October ) season and there new partnership with St-Hubert, everything has gone up in price including the fish and chips which is now 24$. A 40% jump in price just for the fish and chips. I know that the cost of food has gone up in the last year but a 40% increase is just WOW. And during the summer of 2019 they removed there special 10 after $10. I really miss them, it was a great place to get a late night snack. 
I don’t know who in charge in 1909 price menu but they need to re-evaluate everything and make them a bit more affordable because normal people like myself can not afford the huge price spike that they have now.

Do not waste your money and time. This place must be trying to collect the city's worst wait staff, because I have never seen so many people so so little in one space. If you're lucky enough to flag one down - because they will not be coming to you - be prepared for the attitude of a 16 year old hormonal raging teen who will be so offended you would address them directly. And good luck waiting for your beer. Might arrive, might not.... but it'll definitely be on your bill. This is the summary of my two experiences here. You've been warned!
Very fast and efficient service and the food tasted very good! Would definitely recommend

formatted_address: 2020 Boulevard des Laurentides, Vimont, QC H7M 2R4, Canada
name: Café Bar Azzuri

reviews.text: It's because a friendly atmosphere everyone is a friend you can bring your family there nice place
Friendly, clean
Excellent Italian Sport Bar,  great coffee and friendly staff!
5 star coffee
Good espresso.... Italian taste!!!

formatted_address: 3699 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2X 2V7, Canada
name: Oasis Bar & Grill

formatted_address: 1812 Rue Sainte-Catherine E, Montréal, QC H2K 2H3, Canada
name: Bar Le Stud

reviews.text: Really nice place. You can meet people from all walks of the life. Generally very friendly place and customers. Best part is bartenders know you and remember your choice of drinks. Also they are nice people in general. Two pool tables. Now they even have a small food corner. Saturday nights are total hit. Give it a try, you wont regret.
2 floors, 2 sounds. Great music and lighting. Big bar with multiple entrances. Pool and slot machines. Generally older clientele.

Very nice bar and the new restaurant insid6is very nice. I was surprised how delicious the food was and the price is very cheap as well
The stuff are very friendly and nice

Great dance bar. Inexpensive prices and comfortable atmosphere. Come back here. Promotions are often held here, if you sign up for 909gay,com and create a profile, you can get a free private room for 2 hours and a free cocktail.
Favorite place to go in the village, friendly crowd and always nice to go dance on the weekends. Reasonably priced for alcohol and bartenders usually welcoming.

formatted_address: 105 Rue Saint Paul Est, Montréal, QC H2Y 1G7, Canada
name: 3 Brasseurs Saint-Paul (FERMÉ POUR RÉNOVATION JUSQU'À FIN MARS)

html_attributions: 3 Brasseurs Saint-Paul (FERMÉ POUR RÉNOVATION JUSQU'À FIN MARS)
3 Brasseurs Saint-Paul (FERMÉ POUR RÉNOVATION JUSQU'À FIN MARS)
3 Brasseurs Saint-Paul (FERMÉ POUR RÉNOVATION JUSQU'À FIN MARS)

reviews.text: Great location. The food was great. Service was also good. Our server was nice. We got there in time before the rush. Does fill fast but was amazing food. Well worth the wait in  line if you did have to wait.

It was great time having dinner at this place with friends. The beers are awesome, my favourite is IPA and white. Food options are good. I had New Delhi pizza must try they have Indian flavours to it. chicken wings were tasty too. I totally recommend this place and I will be going here more now.

Went here with my family for late drinks and food. The service was exceptional and the food was delicious. The beer was super cold and tasty, which we really appreciated in a hot summer night. We had an amazing experience.

I always love this place. Very much a sports bar, they have great food andbeer, and a really friendly staff. My order of choice is usually onion soup, as I find that they prepare it with the perfect blend of spices. Simple, but always delicious.

Ambient, music, great location and different beers to taste make the perfect spot to eat and enjoy. The menu is different and excellent taste (not to mention the great big !! 🥰🥰🐷) I love the place and the brown beer. Taste it is Great!!

formatted_address: 1280 Avenue des Canadiens-de-Montréal, Montréal, QC H3G 5G0, Canada
name: Bazarette

reviews.text: We went here a bit after a place opened and they had a really good tasting food. So we got what we paid for. But going here again recently and quality of food unfortunately drastically dropped. And the price didn't match the taste. If you looking for a place to spend good amount for a good and tasty evening then it's not the place

I would recommend coming here for a drink however discourage ordering food. We ordered beef tartar, octopus, carrots and brussel sprouts. The beef and brussel sprouts were drenched in overpowering, heavy cream-based sauces and the octopus lacked flavor. The carrots were seasoned with so much cumin and other spices they were not edible. The service was lack luster and the vibe of the waiters did not match the aesthetic of the restaurant.
Nice little place! Good beer selection.
Poor quality of service for the prices you are paying on drinks and food

Super service et très bons conseils pour le vin.
La nourriture était également excellente!
Endroit géniale pour un 5 à 7 ou un souper entre amis.

formatted_address: 3632 Rue Clark, Montréal, QC H2X 2S2, Canada
name: The Jaguar’s Den

formatted_address: 310 Rue Saint-Roch, Québec, QC G1K 6S2, Canada
name: La Barberie

reviews.text: Im happy to have been able to visit an old establishment and even got to try their craft beers. La Barberie is said to be the oldest microbrewery in Quebec. The beers are amazing both the classic styles and the new trendy flavors of beers. The staff and regulars are very nice which leaves a friendly welcoming environment. 10/10 would recommend.

Very quiet on an early Sunday February afternoon. Ordered a flight which had the first 8 items on their menu. A nice variety. 5 minutes walk from the via station, so it’s a convenient way to wait for your train. The playlist they had on was amazing. Some Indian music, shadowy men on a shadowy planet, moderat, it was great and diverse. Server was nice!
Pros: they have plenty of high quality beers; lots of space, with nooks; eclectic and barberic. Cons: a bit off under a dark highway; somewhat outdated setup. Decent.

Went in on a cold, rainy day. My fiancee and I were warmly greeted and welcomed. I had a hefeweizen that was perfectly crisp, and is comparable to those I've had in Germany. Overall great atmosphere and great beer. Would recommend to anyone looking to explore the local brewing scene

Very cozy local brewery, great selection of different types of beer. Slightly out of the way but very close to other breweries in the area. Not many people there in the afternoon, but it started to pick up around 1:30, definitely worth a visit

formatted_address: 417 Rue Saint-Pierre, Montréal, QC H2Y 2M4, Canada
name: Flyjin

reviews.text: Nice place. Food is decent and it transforms into a nightclub after 11 pm. Enjoy @ 2 in 1 in an "underground" location in the Old Port of Montreal. This hidden gem  will steal your heart.

This place is really great the ambiance is warm and trendy. The food and drinks were amazing although it was expensive. I shared tapas with a friend we had a papaya salad, salmon sashimi and a plate of cod (I think). It was all delicious and I would gladly go eat there again!

Possibly the worst place in I've gone to party in Montreal. Service was terrible and the servers try to force you to tip over the normal 15%. If you want to go somewhere that's worth it's price go to anywhere else.

Stopped in for an early evening drink, wound up eating dinner. Out bartender/server was super helpful and very patient. They didn't have a few of the menu items available at the time, but the marinated steak and salmon sashimi we ordered was fantastic.
Japanese fusion izakaya with 2 dinner sittings that turns into a trendy after-hours club with DJs.

formatted_address: 1220 Rue Yves-Blais, Terrebonne, QC J6V 1P7, Canada
name: Sapporo Sushi Bar

reviews.text: I was impressed by this place. The food is super delicious and fresh. I went for lunch time. 14.99$ per person all you can eat. A lot of choice and variety. Will definetly be coming back for the supper menu. Pricing is good!

Happy to be referred to this restaurant. It is just like the one in my hometown, you order what you want and eat as much as you want for a set price. But be careful, if you order too much and cannot finish eating the rest there is a charge for it.
There are a lot of variety of small plates, sushi, sashimi, Thai, noodle dishes, and finger foods. Good selection of desserts too. Look forward to going back. 👍
good price, fresh yummy food

Not bad. The table was sticky, I had to ask for a napkin, no wasabi nor pickled ginger is served. I got only one glass of water. Otherwise, the tempura was great, the eel was good as were the chicken wings, the spicy Salmon was meh... The chicken udon noodle was made with dark meat and added much needed flavor to an otherwise bland stock, the salad was dressed with a commercial sweet and spicy dipping sauce. On a positive note, the food came quickly and was served piping hot.
Very good sushi!  It’s Worth going out for dinner!

formatted_address: 1142 Avenue Van Horne, Outremont, QC H2V 1J8, Canada
name: Provisions Bar à Vin

reviews.text: I am a food and wine expert. I have been in the best, across the world. Montreal has some great places to offer but the biggest issue in Montreal is service and this new place is no exception. At provisions bar a vin I would rate the service at 0 and the food at 2. The service is cold, unpleasant and borderline disrespectful. We had oysters which were good, the black cod, octopus, Frito misto all were all pretty average. I respect servers for their Jobs and I expect they do the same to me but I do expect them to fulfill their job description in an indiscriminate fashion. It was not the case at provisions. On the Thursday night we went, we interacted with Caroline and Alexandra and unfortunately these interactions were far from being pleasant. I hope the service will be adjusted. Wine and bites for 2 come to over $280 so people are bound to have expectations.

First discovered Provisions as a butcher shop with hands down the best aged steak I’ve ever had...two years later and my father still talks about it! So when they decided to expand and open the Bar à vin, I had an inkling that it might be pretty good. I stand corrected, it was AMAZING! Atmosphere was quite nice and intimate with only 30 or so seats. Food was creative and made with quality ingredients. Staff was good and our waitress very knowledgeable, we gave her a price range and she chose the wine and a great selection is was....last but not least, the playlist that night was on 🔥 🔥 🔥!!!
Can't stress enough how great this place is. Incredible food, more than awesome staff, perfect atmosphere... I would be there every day if I could!
The butcher shop is the best kept secret place for amazing brisket, burger and sandwiches !
The vibe is excellent and the service is great especially the wine list where they serve mostly if not only natural wines. The food is amazing, great little place in the heart of Outremont.

formatted_address: 8780 Boulevard Guillaume-Couture, Lévis, QC G6V 9G9, Canada
name: Corsaire Microbrasserie

reviews.text: Cool place with a big patio. Great beers

Some of the best beers around. The brewers are great and keep creating amazing new beers.

There's something new on the taps almost every time i go. It's worth the detour.
I biked out of here from the ferry. All the beers I had were very well done. This brewery knows it's stuff.

Pleasant surprise. They have 2 locations, the more "touristic" next to the ferry station and the "real deal", here.

The beer is really of good quality, and they offer tasting menus. The bar man is really cool and talkative and really into beer appreciation.

The bar is metal music oriented and low key. Even on a Saturday, the clients were a bunch of regulars except us.

Will definitely come back and  will also try to find their products in Montreal
This place would receive a 6/5 stars if I could. Fantastic booze, great ambiance, outstanding music selection  and fair price. If you are the DD, their coffees are simply outstanding.

formatted_address: 6518 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2S 3C6, Canada
name: Douro

reviews.text: Beautiful atmosphere, fantastic food and service! We had a great time!
The best portugese restaurant in town! Me and my husband we always celebrate our best moments there. Friendly people, great food and delicious wines!

Excellent Portuguese restaurant. Among the best in Montreal! Food is really good and is prepared with high quality ingredients! It is on the high end side and the prices follow, however it is really worth if you like Portuguese cuisine. Ambience is also very nice and the service super efficient.
Love the place. That ginger waiter is the best, his name is Bruno. Caring and warm. Good food and service. The cream shrimp is to die for.
Favorite place! Amazing food .. great wine selection. They’re homemade prosciutto is DELICIOUS !

formatted_address: Édifice Henry F. Hall, Boulevard de Maisonneuve O 13th floor, Montréal, QC H3G 1M8, Canada
name: Concordia Greenhouse

reviews.text: It is a green house on the roof of Concordia university, in downtown Montreal. They sell plants and teach classes on how to make creams and soaps, all organic and natural.
Nice ambiance in middle of city and good classes.
I love this place Fr study but they should make some silent spaces but still I love 😘💐
Love it. Applying there.
Unexpected great place to be.

formatted_address: 184 Rue Jean-Talon, Montréal, QC H2R 1S7, Canada
name: Le Pourvoyeur

reviews.text: Really good gin selection. Food is a bit pricey but can be good. Last time we went they served us overcooked, dried out duck burgers but we brought it to the waiters attention (something we never, ever do) and they apologized and promptly served up fresh ones that were stellar! Decent brunch here too.

First time trying public Karaoke! 
This place has a DJ (if you want to call him that) and so you just tell him the song you want to sing and he puts it on the list. You present yourself to the mic when it starts. 

It's cheaper than a private room and if you get there early enough, you have it all to yourself so it's almost like a private room.

The karaoke is on the second floor and it's quite spacious and comes with lots of 5$ deals (all entrees and basic calamari, as well as a 5$ gin and tonic loaded with gin so definitely worth the price). 
They open the second floor at 8pm and the guy comes in at 8:30pm to start playing songs.   

Once more people show up, it does drag on a bit because there are more songs to go through before it's your turn. Also, if you're shy there's a bigger audience.

Loved my time here so much! They had great deals, the food was delicious (much better than you'd expect, I ordered the fried chicken and pogo's), and the service was fast.

I'd go back with friends in a heartbeat! 

Visited on 27th of September 2017

Great place to eat, have a drink and spend time with friends around Jean Talon Market. The staffs are very friendly and motivated. And work fast. Food is a little bit expensive but worth it. Quality and taste are great. Quantity is friendly. I took a burger with salad. Very simple. Salad was fresh and the sauce is good. Burger was amazing.
Great quality/price brunch! You can have a brunch as cheap as 9$ during the weekend. The menu is quite simple but tasty.
Had a beer  . Fast service and nice location. In the afternoon, you can enjoy the sun on the small terrace they have on Jean-Talon street. Le menu est quand même variée.

formatted_address: 226 1 2, Rue Saint-Joseph E, Québec, QC G1K 3A9, Canada
name: SHAKER Cuisine & Mixologie

reviews.text: Great food, great drinks, great service. What more can you ask for.

Simply put, the best array of cocktails I've ever had! Would absolutely return next time I'm in Quebec. Excellent service and the food was fantastic. I really enjoyed the ribs but others in my group spoke highly of the tartares and tatakis. Highly recommended establishment.
Visited on a trip to Quebec City and loved it - lots of delicious food and drink options, and very friendly staff! I wish there was a location closer to home.

Good place. Drinks and cocktails are good. Saturdays in Quebec City there’s latino night for dancing. Food is good, the Tartares are a good option but quite small. For groups or a birthday it’s a nice place.
Very slow service. And way overpriced for a regular hamburger they consider  Gourmet.

formatted_address: 1900 Rue le Ber, Montréal, QC H3K 2A4, Canada
name: Les Sans-Taverne - Coop et Brasserie Artisanale

reviews.text: Great beer and good service. Employees are friendly. Unfortunately if you’re in a suit or somewhat dressed in business wear you’ll be frowned upon. My boyfriend and I both work around there and we’re immediately judged by what we were wearing as it wasn’t fitting into their “norm”. Would have loved to be welcomed based on who we were as people and not based on our clothing. However, if you’re looking for good beer at descent price, this is a good place to go.
Loved this place. Great beer and service
We had some really good beer and a fantastic coffee.  Great location and friendly staff.
Great beer. Limited food menu.
Cool beer. Cool food. Good hang out spot

formatted_address: 5440 Rue Jean-Talon, Saint-Léonard, QC H1S 1L6, Canada
name: Bar Cafe Sorrento Inc

reviews.text: Coffee is always good, prices are good, draft beer is nice in the chilled mug
Best cold coffee I have ever had
I think you guys don't go out often
Vip place
JulY I

formatted_address: 1115 Rue Sainte-Catherine E, Montréal, QC H2L 2G2, Canada
name: Cabaret Mado

reviews.text: It's the must go to place in the Montreal Village! Mado is the best place in town overall anyway. Great night, entertainment and people for sure. Music is awesome after the show too. Drag Queens here are the best in Canada!

It was my first time in Montreal and someone recommended going to Cabaret Mado. I'm so glad we did! The show did not disappoint!! The queens were amazing. Tracy Trash shone bright like a diamond! Great music and atmosphere. Highly recommend to anyone visiting the city.

The show is good,  had an amazing time. But they need seatings as mostly all seats where for reserving and if you wanna watch the complete show you will be at least standing 2 hours 

I feel.bad for the bartender, they were only 2 for ALL the people. Getting a drink is crazy. Long wait 

I think Cabaret Mado is relying to much in their "fame".

Ok. This review is mostly for American visitors who may get something from it. While the website says shows are in English and French, that’s not the case. We went to a show last night and it was 100% French. And if you don’t speak French, it’s not very enjoyable. 

The artist and her dancers clearly took a lot of time in preparing and did an excellent job. However unlike most shows, the drag queen did ONE ARTIST FOR 2 HOURS. It was more like a drag concert. It was enjoyable for the first song, then it felt like it was on repeat for the next 2 hours. 

It’s touts itself as “1920’s cabaret”... it’s a bar. Nothing bad, but nothing that screams 1920’s era at all. It’s just any other bar. 

Coat check is “obligatory” and is a disaster. Not only are you forced to pay, when you leave , there is a line out the door because there are people coming in for the next show and everyone is trying to leave and it’s one person working. Took 20+ minutes just to get our coat. 

Overall it was fine, but unlike any drag show I’ve ever seen anywhere in the world. If you don’t speak French or know the artist being impersonated, i would seriously reconsider this.  Make sure you know what you’re in for. It could be a long 2 hours!
So that was just wonderful

formatted_address: 1076 Rue de Bleury, Montréal, QC H2Z 1N2, Canada
name: Tiradito

reviews.text: Cannot rave highly enough of this place. It was our favourite meal of our whole trip. The atmosphere was amazing. Seating AROUND the kitchen and bar. The cocktails were lovely. The calamari was the best I've had in my life. But, everything was perfect. Great, friendly staff. Just excellently executed on all fronts. Kudos!🙌🏼

absolutely excellent! there was a variety of food, all a bit smaller portions (I would recommend 3 plates for 2 people) but I appreciate that, so I can try more things. the cocktails were a thing of beauty and the bartenders know how to show off their skills. the ambiance wasnt too elaborate with a huge neon red sign of their logo (which cast an interesting vibe) and the majority of seating at the bar. I was told there is also a bar downstairs with the same owners as well. I will be back!

Great decor, it looks like a Latino bar with tapas-style food

Context: I went to this restaurant after a recommendation. We were four people. They have high chairs, and the tables are not very wide, but this is okay.

Food quality: this is honestly very good, I will give a 5/5 overall since I feel it was a food experience. Nothing was over or undercooked, and the composition was successfully made.

Service: it was a 3/5. The server tried hard, and I guess it was not her day, but she made two mistakes in my orders, which impacted my patience and my appreciation of the experience.

Drinks?
Must try

Would I go back?
YES

What does it take to reach 5/5?
Stellar service since the price point is not cheap.

Nice, cosy and informal place. Good cocktails and great sharable dishes. Very pleasant waiters, who knew what they were talking about. We came on a Wednesday at 6pm, and it was almost full, so make reservations ahead.
We had three shared dishes plus a desert and four cocktails which totalled $120 incl. tax and tips.
Recommendable😊😊😊

Excellent service with a truly inviting atmosphere.   I think the set up and configuration was done really well.  Thank you for the wonderful food, absolutely delicious. We will be back.  We highly recommended this restaurant to anyone looking for some fine cuisine.  Truly an amazing spot. Thank you.

formatted_address: 1228 Rue Sherbrooke Ouest, Montréal, QC H3G 1H6, Canada
name: Palm Court

formatted_address: 1391 Boulevard de Maisonneuve O, Montréal, QC QC H3G, Canada
name: NewHaūs

reviews.text: Came here with a few friends and we had an absolute blast. Staff were courteous and the lights how was absolutely insane... Highly recommend
Nightclub with a secret entrance, house music, laser lights, and excellent service. Would recommend!

Never thought that this kind of management with such bad attitude could even exist in an industry where courtesy is the less you can do. Funniest thing is that they don’t even pay their DJs after tricking them into playing. Good luck for staying in the business.

Tiny hidden venue with small DJ booth. You need to know how to enter and a password is required. This place has a lot of potential however we found the sound to be so loud and squeaky that we could not stay more than 15 minutes. Maybe you should invest in speakers that are more adapted for smaller spaces because our ears hurt so much from it! :(

I cam with a few friends, we decided to buy a couple bottles and reserve a table. We were not dissapointed at all, great service, really fun atmosphere and we were all amazed by the crazy green lasers omg! great music too!

formatted_address: 3723 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2X 2V7, Canada
name: Bowhead Pub - 100% Plant Based - Vegan Vegetarian - Wine Bar Cocktails Craft Beer - Karaoke

html_attributions: Bowhead Pub - 100% Plant Based - Vegan Vegetarian - Wine Bar Cocktails Craft Beer - Karaoke
Bowhead Pub - 100% Plant Based - Vegan Vegetarian - Wine Bar Cocktails Craft Beer - Karaoke
Bowhead Pub - 100% Plant Based - Vegan Vegetarian - Wine Bar Cocktails Craft Beer - Karaoke

reviews.text: Delicious food! We had the Po' Boy and the Honey groove burger and they were amazing! Really happy to have a pub in Montreal that serves good beer and food that is not only delicious but also healthy! There is also plenty of room to host big groups. Overall, great!

An absolutely fantastic experience!! We went there on a Saturday night and karaoke night was so much fun! The service was nothing but spectacular and it made our entire evening so memorable!
We had the animal fries and it had so much flavor which I loved! Definitely coming back here again

Absolutely, hands down the best tasting food I have EVER had in my life. The animal fries are a must have, life changing I tell ya. We also tasted the monster burger (incredible) and chicken burger, chilli hot dog and ice cream cookie sandwich for dessert. The most wonderful experience we have ever had and worth every penny. If you are in Montreal goooo here! My meat eating boyfriend was also in heaven. The only downfall is that our trip is now over and we are left with forever craving this place :( I hope you guys blow up and come to Winnipeg!

Overall, great place! The food was good, the staff was extremely friendly, but since they are new, they are still working out their drink menu & balancing  upkeep with customer service  (eg. No soap or hand towels in the washroom). I will continue supporting this place, and I can't wait to see what it grows into!!

Extremely disappointing experience. Newly vegan and was excited to finally eat out on a Friday night. Service was terrible. Took 25 minutes for anyone to even come see us at our table. Once we ordered our drinks took another 25 mins to arrive and all of our food (appetizer and main course) came out at the same time. No forks were given, no napkins, no water and no one came to see if everything was to our taste. Luckily the food was tasty though. Would recommend if someone has 4-5 hours time to eat.

formatted_address: 4727 Rue Saint-Denis, Montréal, QC H2J 2L5, Canada
name: Mamaia Resto Lounge Bar

reviews.text:
I am from Moldova, which shares food and culture with Romania.

The food is amazing.  It is authentic and really well done.  The ambience is great.  If you are from the region, you would enjoy the food you are used to.  If not, you would still enjoy great food and atmosphere.

Amazing food! We ate to our hearts desire. Price was good for all the food. Very kind staff, always observant about the quality of service they were providing. The fresh food came with everything a traditionally Romanian dish would come with and surprisingly even more than we anticipated. The "Tuica" was fantastic. And same goes for the overall experience. 

Very recommended Romanian restaurant, and will definitely come back! 
Check it out, and don't listen to the bad reviews, they are just angry Mamaia makes better food than they could ever make themselves. 

-Catalin

Coming from a Romanian gal, trust me when I tell you that the food here is fantastic and authentic. The stuffed cabbage tastes just like my mom’s, the pork tenderloin was tender and seasoned really well, the mici (Romanian sausage) were scrumptious and the fries were fresh and delicious. Two thumbs up!
Perfect Romanian food for anyone. Average prices and very good services.
Been here multiple times with my Romanian girlfriend. The food is extremely delicious and authentic.

formatted_address: 8 Rue Sherbrooke Ouest, Montréal, QC H2X 4C9, Canada
name: Café Origine

reviews.text: The staff was friendly to introduce the real breakfast samples to us at first. It’s really helpful to have a choice quickly. Every time I pass by I think the mural and plant decorating are so beautiful. It’s really enjoyable to come here and have a weekend breakfast in the morning. We had hot latte and cappuccino. The quality of coffee is great as well as sandwich’s. Love the ambience.

This cafe has a very nice interior and the coffee is great. The service, however, wasn’t the greatest. The barista barely spoke to us, and definitely looked like he didn’t want to be there. If I’m paying $4-$5 for a latte, at least pretend to be half decent.
It is a very big space. The staff is great, the apetizer was nice. The decoration is gorgeous. I loved the details in the walls and bathrooms.

Love this place. I live in southern California but spent the summer in Montreal, and this quickly became a favorite. Great coffee (killer almond milk matcha latte), fabulous staff, great owner, unexpectedly good food.

Great place for a coffee, sandwich, drink ... but also amazing place to relax, read a book, really cool decoration and colors, nice area to work and perfect location. This cafe looks like an oasis in the corner of St Laurent & Sherbrooke streets!

formatted_address: 111 Rue Saint Paul Est, Montréal, QC H2Y 1G7, Canada
name: Restaurant Solmar

reviews.text: This is a Portuguese restaurant. I was here maybe 4 years ago.The service was excellent. The food was good. I would prefer more light in the restaurant. It didn't cost too much.

I ordered the special sampler for 60$, 2 appetizers 1 main dish and dessert. The main dish I was served was a frozen chunk of fish, uncooked.  Not cold, but **frozen** with icicles.  I sent it back without making a fuzz. Since my partner order a cod/egg/rice mix that had no cod I sent that back also, and asked for both dishes to be served simultaneously.  Of course they were not..... and when it came 20 min after mine the cod was burnt.  Never got the dessert that was included in the special, waited 35 min, asked three times, and gave up.  Service were trying hard to help, but our specific server (a tall older male) was terrible and even offensive. In the end we did not pay the bill, but only after a few back and forth with the maitre and the hostess.  Any respectable restaurant would cancel the bill on the **first incident alone**.   On the positive, appetizers were good to very good. House wine really good. Ambience really good.  Too bad they spoiled our night. Shameful.

It was our first night in Montreal and it was our anniversary yesterday, so we wanted to go for a special dinner. This restaurant serves good Portuguese food. My husband said the food tasted like his mother makes. We both had the set menu. You get 4 courses for a reasonable price. The service was a bit slow, but it allowed for a leisurely dinner experience. Overall, a great introduction to Montreal.

Place is clean and food is delicious. Wine we chose was very good. When we were there we find time to chat with Anthony, maitre d'hotel. He is a very kind person and has a great repertoire of memories and interesting hobbies. I definitely recommend this place. You will enjoy the decorations, food and wine as well as excellent service.

Wow! What great little place we stumbled upon in old Montreal.  Fantastic food and service in an authentic Portuguese restaurant that's been here for a long time with beautiful kitschy decor that still works after all these years! Very kid friendly to boot! A+

formatted_address: 936 Rue St-Alexandre, Montréal, QC H3B 3H5, Canada
name: Stationnement Robert

formatted_address: 44 Route du Président-Kennedy (entrée rue Pie X), Lévis, QC G6V 6C5, Canada
name: Boule-O-Drome

reviews.text: Bowling time
Nice place for bowling

Du troubles avec les nouvelles technologies implimenté au allée (iPad interactif) 
A part sa, l'ambiance est super!

Un des salons de bowling le mieux tenue dans la province de Québec
Une propriétaire au petit soin pour sa clientèle 
Magnifique salon rénové et très propre.
Merci Annie Vachon propriétaire.
Ben l'fun mais je trouves que c'est rendu $$$ jouer aux quilles... Mettons 🤨

formatted_address: 917 Rue Sainte-Catherine E, Montréal, QC H2L 3N5, Canada
name: Circus Afterhours

reviews.text: I love coming to Circus!  Came for two Trance Unity’s so far and it always a great atmosphere, great crowd and never over sold like most other clubs today.  Definitely be back!
I found self awareness from this place, was sooo much in trance that I went all out expressing my self awareness with my dance moves....
Good club but not the best !
Was the perfect place to regroup and recover on the new year
Horrible noise and vibrations in the surrounding shops early in the morning.

formatted_address: 572 Rue Empire, Greenfield Park, QC J4V 1W2, Canada
name: Emmali

formatted_address: 840 Avenue Myrand, Québec, QC G1V 2V5, Canada
name: La Cuisine Ludique

reviews.text: Old consoles! Board games! Great beer and an awesome Mac & Cheese Selection 😍😍
Noice

Super cool art deco, late 70s style. Food is always fantastic. Short menu, Great soups, all meals fresh. Always out of chilli so no idea if it's good. Not enough waiters service can be slow. Definitely recommend.
There's N64s with all the games. 10/10.
Interesting and cozy

formatted_address: 2381 Rue Beaubien E, Montréal, QC H2G 1N3, Canada
name: Le Elsdale Buvette de Quartier

reviews.text: My adult daughter and I popped in the Elsdale for a light lunch on Sunday. I'm so glad we decided to go here!  The café had such a lovely vibe.
