The staff are extra friendly and obviously love their work. The food selection is not extensive but is varied. It's also delicious! I was impressed with the wine list. Will definitely be going back there.
Great gluten free soup. I am celiac and so many times there's nothing I can have😑😥😣Delicious. Very friendly service. Extremely popular place. Very homey

Service could be better. The girl at the bar working on the coffee machine is great but one of the waiters was too busy socializing with his friends, and trying to be funny to provide good service. If you have to call upon your waiter multiple times, it means he isn't being attentive enough.
Brunch was beyond expectations. Very delicious options on the menu.
Good place for coffee.  Large selection.  Pleasant atmosphere.  Convenient stop if you are going for a walk or cinema.

formatted_address: 1225 Rue Crescent, Montréal, QC H3G 2B1, Canada
name: Hurley's Irish Pub

reviews.text: Had a great experience, really loved the atmosphere. Felt like I was in an real Irish pub. Food was on point no complaints. Staff was fast and friendly and they had a ton of great beer on tap. I've been a few times but would definitely go back again.

I went here during a pub crawl with some friends while visiting Montreal for a few days, and it was by far the favourite place we went to. Really nice atmosphere and very strong drinks which is always good! Live music was playing as well which just made the atmosphere even better. We also received a performance of traditional Irish folk songs from such actual Irish folks, which I'm sure doesn't come with the bar but made the experience that much better! Loved it!

This place is a great time especially after a late night dinner on a cold winter day. It is a cozy pub with great live music on two floors and a good selection of beers. It's a perfect place to gather with friends for intimate conversations or to party and celebrate an event. When I want to go to a warm, friendly place for a good time, Hurley's immediately comes to mind.

Club kids off.

Best place ever, who’d expect going in without server handing in a menu and instead, ordered me a Long Island straight. 
A happy spot in town, a higher level country club vibe. Age range 30+.
Personally love Dave on Monday nights! 
Jazz country funk rock and all that are around all week💕

Ps their fries is the worst. But they are really kind to allow you order things from outside!

Anyway, endlessly love.

It is always a cozy feeling in there. Service is always fast, friendly & professional. For the first time I tried lamb stew, it was amazing, very flavorful & generous portion. Also for the first time, I tried hot toddy there, I liked their recipe. Cheers!!!!

formatted_address: 4388 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2W 1Z5, Canada
name: Club Espagnol de Québec - Steak Seafood Tapas - Bar Spectacle Bar Sportif - Cocktail/Wine Bar

reviews.text: Nice option to try typical Spanish food, the atmosphere is relaxed, informal.  The place is spacious, but needs renovations.  The service is excellent, and the prices seemed reasonable.  I will go again to try other dishes.  The only negative point is that they ONLY accept cash and we didn't know it.
Everything is great! The service, the food, the music and especially the ambiance. Really good croquetas de bacalao 😋😋😋

Great place to eat traditionnal spanish dishes. Lot of choices in the menu. The waiters are nice and friendly. The place is clean and the environment is nice. I only give 4 stars because we have to wait one hour to get our food. The portions are large and the price is correct.
One fun place, authentic Spanish bar food...delicious!
We had a wonderful meal on the outside patio.  Food was delicious as well as the house wine.  We had salad and tapas: eggplant, veal and pork dishes.  All were excellent!

formatted_address: 6300 Boulevard de l'Ormière, Québec, QC G1P 1K7, Canada
name: Sporalie Pro Billiard

reviews.text: Cozy place for a few drinks. Lots of quality pool tables and dart boards.
Nice place good metal and rock music most of the time
Wow
Awesome!
Vraiment une belle place pour le billard et pour prendre un drink. Super spectacle aussi cette soirée là.

formatted_address: 1210 Rue Peel, Montréal, QC H3B 2T6, Canada
name: McLean's Pub

reviews.text: Good Irish pub. Food is ok and ambience as well. Veggie burger was quite good and they have a big selection of beer and alcohols. Nice little terrace at the front.

I rarely get to Montreal for a visit and a hockey game, but this is one of my favourite go-to places. The service is always fast and friendly and the overall atmosphere of the place is truly welcoming. If you're in Montreal and (if you're a Habs fan) there's simply no better pub to watch a game and eat some classic, tasty grub.
One of the best pubs in town. Either to just eat or party with your friends. They always play the big sports events. No cover.
I want to say how awesome the staff were to me and my friends the last time I visited. They stopped us from getting pickpocketed. The live music was great too
Good beer selection and a great place to watch football. The burgers  and buns were a little over cooked but they might have been busy. We will go back for a second chance soon.

formatted_address: 2501 Rue Notre-Dame Ouest, Montréal, QC H3J 1N6, Canada
name: Liverpool House

reviews.text: Menu doesn't have English so if you can't read French it can be hard to order. Service is good. Selection on the menu is good with no bad choices. Food is very delicious, cooked perfectly. Dishes are creative and the flavours of the ingridients really come through to treat your pallet. Nothing is wasted. Lighting is a little too dim.

Service was amazing! The wine recommendation was spot on for the dishes we ordered. Surprisingly our favourite dish of the night was the raw fish and not the lobster spaghetti. The freshness of the fish (tuna) was apparent in every bite. The beef tartare was average. Overall a great experience!

Hands down the best food experience during my bachelorette trip to Montreal. And that's saying a lot because we had a lot of great meals during our stay. We were a party of 10 and had a set menu that we all shared family style. Portions were generous and plates continued to come out of the kitchen in such a way that we thought we had finished our meal just after the apps! We sat out on their back patio which was super cute and lighting was great for pictures. The weather was great that night minus a light sprinkle of rain but that didn't bother us! The staff quickly cranked out the awning so we would be covered. The apps and mains were amazing and mind blowing but the desserts were a slight let down compared to the other courses. The garden vegetables were so fresh and crisp, the asparagus with morels and (veal?) sauce was amazing, and the chicken and fish mains were my favorite. My only small complaint was that when it started raining, my seat at the end of the table was not covered under the awning that was rolled out - i thought no biggie, I can just move to the other end, but as I was moving 2 different servers walked by and didn't offer to help me move my chair, place setting, or wine glass. Overall still a great time!

Such a popular spot on Friday night! Had to wait for our table for a bit even though I made reservations, but there isn't much space to wait with coats taking up the bench. Point being, make reservations, I saw several people being turned away because they were so packed. Ambiance is great, cozy, warm, nice hum of others enjoying their meal. Wait staff was super helpful with app and wine recos. Wish I could have that terrine again, absolutely fabulous!

Well, this was the last of our restaurant adventures and it easily rates high with the others.  The service was exceptional and personal.  Our server listened to what we might want and made excellent recommendations.  The food arrived timely and was prepared to perfection.   Drink recommendations were also spot on.  This visit we enjoyed lobster spaghetti and a herb chicken.  We also had an assortment of oysters. Recommended. Apologies for the dark photos,  I didn't want to disturb the other diners with flash.

formatted_address: 1476 Rue Crescent, Montréal, QC H3G 2B6, Canada
name: Mambo Supper Club

formatted_address: 5942 Rue Sherbrooke Ouest, Montréal, QC H4A 1X7, Canada
name: L'Gros Luxe NDG

reviews.text: Not impressed with this restaurant. Walked in waited for a table of 6. No problem there being a Friday night. Once seated by the manager waited for over 20min before getting our menus By ourselves. Had a great interaction with the waitress and ordered the food and drinks. We then waited over one hour before the staff realized they our food was not ordered. The manager and waitress came over to apologize and offered to get us something while still waiting. She came over with a small portion of Doritos (12 chips)to compensate for the delay. Hugh miss by the manager. She seemed to occupied with the bar and not the restaurant. Hugh miss

It's a pretty nice place. I had the lobster bisque poutine. The sauce was really good. I was not sure how I would feel about sweet potato fries but it was actually delicious. They also have really good fried pickles and fried avocado. It was not too busy the night we were there. My only complaint was that service was a tiny bit slow towards the end. Our waiter was great though. I think they were just trying to give us plenty of time to talk and catch up.

Fantastic attention to detail on menu creation and staff who are knowledgeable of the ingredients. The major dishes can be had in vegetarian, or full vegan alternatives, and damn tasty to boot.

The cocktails on the other hand aren't the greatest and definitely have room for improvement. They are reasonably priced however, and the rest of the experience more than makes up for it.

Lovely decor, and friendly staff really set the bar here for what a chic casual resto/bar should feel like.

Can't emphasize how much respect I have for the menu flexibility to accommodate dietary restrictions without alienating other customers, or, and perhaps more importantly, sacrificing taste.

Highly recommended for any evening out.
Great drinks, fancy coffee's. The best Mac n Cheese. Super friendly waiter Jerome😊All the staff were nice.

I am very dissapointed with my last experience. poutinehere. Used to love their poutine, a bit pricey but portions were generous. Or that used to be the case. 

I have both eaten at the restaurant and ordered through 3rd party delivery services in the past. 

Today among this whole COVID-19 mess I decided to order some food and try to support the restaurant, only to receive a portion that is half of what it usually is. I paid 18 dollars + tax and delivery only to get a very very small poutine. 

I feel robbed and this is not way to treat costumers that are trying to support your business in a complicated time. 

This is jot the way to save money, and if you do decide to cut on the size of your portios it should be made clear to the customer. Greedy tactics that take advantage of unknowing customers.

formatted_address: 445 Chemin Bord-du-Lac, Dorval, QC H9S 2A7, Canada
name: Burger Town

reviews.text:
Fantastic Burgers! People come from miles to have one of the best Burgers.
They also have a delicious local speciality, Poutine! Now serving meatless vegan burgers and an option of a lettuce wrap to become gluten free. Submarines and salads! 
A super little bar, excellent drinks and TV for watching sporting events. Outside patio.
Absolutely fantastic food. Family business and the service is always friendly and fast. Highly recommend their burgers and fries!!!! Signature taste and quality!

Best Burger place ever! I go there every now and then when I have a burger craving and I always end up satisfied. Even their fries are amazing! The staff is friendly and the whole place feels like a family dinner. Try it once and you'll be hooked!
Good food, good service, affordable prices. It was a little crowded at dinner time on a Thursday night.

I definitely recommend this place. The burgers were awesome.I ordered hot and spice and it was good.
The prices are not too expensive, from 13 to 17CAD.Keep cooking super tasty french fries and burgers. I'm so glad that it's not a chain fast food place.

formatted_address: 1061 Boulevard Pierre-Bertrand, Québec, QC G1M 2E8, Canada
name: Cecile et Ramone

reviews.text: Nice place to celebrate and have some fun moments. Foods and drinks are good as well.
This is like a hardrock cafe with out the screens. Good food for a reasonable price .

Really nice spot to go out for a dinner or for a great evening!
If you like rock band live, go there in the evening!
The food here is very characteristic and delicious.
Such an incredible place to eat. Incredible food with alot of the ingredients made in house. Friendly and prompt service. The in house made pickles and smoked meat are phenomenal! Will be back.

formatted_address: 654 Rue Jean-Talon O, Montréal, QC H3N 1R7, Canada
name: Village Grec Souvlaki

reviews.text:
Great restaurant for your Greek craving. The Gyro are made with actual lamb that are well seasoned and perfectly grilled. Every bite, you taste that crisped exterior with the soft and juicy interior.

This is a must go for any Greek food lover.

Feel of the restaurant is very warm and welcoming.
Food was absolutely delicious, very large proportions and a very good value! Service was very good, all around well liked and will come back.

Exellent, real authentique Greek food.
The  Giro plater was amazing!!!! TRY FOR YOURSELF!😋

Had a pita souvlaki, home fries and we shared a greek salad. The pita was very supple, the tzatziki was super yummy and the fries, so crunchy and made to perfection! Service was quick, efficient and friendly! Time well spent and will definitely be returning.

I ordered a plate of 2x souvlaki sticks on skip the dishes. It was 15.75$ + taxes + 2$ tip was a total of 20.11$.

Delivery was quite fast (30min). Food was good but was expecting better for the price. Might be better when eating at the restaurant.

formatted_address: 6075 Rue Bélanger, Saint-Léonard, QC H1T 3T4, Canada
name: Cafe QVS

reviews.text: no longer Cafe QVS and couldnt be happier. old bar felt like a place to get drugs and didnt look like the kind of place to grab a beer. but now named Sachas i think. Really clean and a very nice bartender whiling to help u out any way possible. went for the UFC fight they let me order food there and were so polite. Still mising a couple things only reason why i gave 3 stars and not 4
Great place to chill.
Good times!!!
Cozy and good ambience

Café à changé de propriétaire et de personnel. Une pratique bizarre du nouveau propriétaire : toujours fermé et on ouvre que lorsqu'on voit le client à la porte! On dirait qu'on ouvre à la tête du client. Pourtant, il est souvent vide.

formatted_address: 801 Chemin de la Canardière, Québec, QC G1J 2B8, Canada
name: La Souche

reviews.text: Beer, beer and beer. The variety was wonderful. Indulged in a nice dark cafe’ lager. Went wonderful with my scrumptious smoked salmon pizza. Great service all around. Waitress was so helpful. I advise all to enjoy in this small hidden gem of Quebec.

Great food and service. Unique décor. Curb appeal is a little lacking but don't let that fool you. You need to visit to really appreciate it. Great craft beers. Would return again if I come back to Quebec.

Local is great. Not in the tourist buzz and a welcoming experience to sit between locals and have a scrumptious meal from a very compact menu. You need to speak French here to understand the locals but sign language worked very well for me and a bit of broken English (from some locals) made me connect very easily in this warm friendly atmosphere.  Jan 2020 - I miss La Souche...

Finally got a chance to check this brewpub out, it has a great rep but it's a bit out of the way. 
Very homey feel and decor, it's a great neighborhood pub.
Service was great, our waitress knew her beers and gave us good suggestions. The beers were frankly excellent. The surprise for us was the quality of the food. The chilli, horse meat lasagna (!), everything was delicious.
A well worth it detour in Limoilou, easily the best all-around brewpub in the Quebec City area.
Great Bar, the beer selections were top-notch, staff super friendly. The menu was well rounded and the Chef’s Nachos are to DIE for. Will be coming here again when I’m in this area.

formatted_address: 450 Rue Saint-Vallier O, Québec, QC G1K 1K8, Canada
name: Diner Saint-Sauveur

reviews.text: Went out of our way to hit this spot and we were disappointed. Tried the Diner burger, chicken and waffles, poutine, and cheesecake. Everything was delicious. Staff was super friendly and the decor/vibe is very laid-back and cool.

Space is quite small so you won't be able to come with a big group. Some tables don't have much room for the legs either.
Their chicken waffles is nice but I wish I had more.
Brunch is nice though the selection is quite restricted.
Loved the ambience and the food. Really good, fair price. The waitress was nice and explained me the menu options and helped me chose some good meal. I'll return for sure!
Wonderful comfort food. If you enjoy shepherds pie, you have got to try their take on the classic dish. Other favourites include the Mac n Cheese, and of course the poutines.

A nice spot in Saint Sauveur. This place offers many of the classic retro dinner meals. Staff is very friendly. The menu have many options for lunch. For vegetarians there is the Guedille végé, Mac’n Cheese, Spag tomate. Beer, wine and cocktails are also part of the menu. 
Food could time to be served, if you are in a hurry this might not be the place for you. But the wait is worth it! If nothing in the menu tempted you, there is the option of creating your own dish.

formatted_address: 1839 Rue Ontario E, Montréal, QC H2K 1T6, Canada
name: Château de la Princesse Sophia

formatted_address: 6206 Rue St-Hubert, Montréal, QC H2S 2M2, Canada
name: Ninkasi Simple Malt Montréal

reviews.text: Very friendly and cozy. Excellent Gourmand burger. Fast service and a good selection of beers
Do not order Gin Martini! Their interpretation of this classic drink is utterly sweet and floral. They only carry Quebec-made Gin, nd not anything in Dry Gin class.
Nice (but a tad basic) ambient room with lots of beer.
Nice ambiance, good beer. Not extraordinary food, but good service.
I was there to see a show upstairs and the staff there was cool

formatted_address: 4670 Rue Saint-Denis, Montréal, QC H2J 2L3, Canada
name: Taverne Magpie

reviews.text: Great new spot - wonderful to have a second Magpie location. The waitstaff were super friendly and efficient. Good vibe, good taps, and great pizza. We’ll be back.
Nice ambience, great service and really good food. A lot of choice for beer as well. Highly Recommended!

Phenomenal staff, courteous and friendly 
Food is simply the best !
Great selection of local and import beers, met owner Peter and Boris, great guys !!!
Very nice ambiance! Friendly staff and great location. Had the poutine, very highly recommended, and loved the vox populi beer (very bitter)
Great food and drink list, friendly and generous staff. Would highly recommend for both pizza or pub food.

formatted_address: Place Bell, 1950 Rue Claude-Gagné, Laval, QC H7N 5H9, Canada
name: Taverne 1909 signé St-Hubert

reviews.text: Very good food and great and fast service.  Went here twice and I had wonderful service. The recent time was the Laval Rocket home opener after the game. With a nearly full house I Got to my seat less then 2 minutes and got served less then 5 minutes and my food less then 10 minutes. I order the cheeseburger and it was very good. One of the best restaurant burger I had in a long time. The other time I had the fish and chips and it was very good as well.  The only negative thing I can say is they need to update their website more often because the menu prices on website is not the same in the restaurant. The other which it not there fault but worth mentioning is the parking, very hard to find one if your planing to eat here when it game time. The parking will be full.  Overall it a great place to eat and will come back again for sure.

My boyfriend and I went to Taverne 1909 on Friday Jan 3rd after a hockey game, when we arrived, there were only about 6 people inside, so we took a seat at the bar thinking we would skip the traffic of getting out of Place Bell and have a beer and nachos in the meantime.. 
So we pick a table and sit down..... and waited.....and waited....and waited for about 20 minutes before some waitress came to see us, only to give us menus and leave without waiting to take at least a drink order.
We waited about 20 minutes for her to come back and take our drink order and when asked if we wanted food, she brought us a menu and walked away for another 20 minutes!!!
When she finally came back, we asked for nachos only to be told they RAN OUT!!!!!!!!!!
We waited over an hour to place an order when we were one of the first clients to arrive!!!
By this time, everyone around us who came in after us was served and almost done eating!!
Meanwhile the bartender was not doing anything except flirting with other clients and didnt appear to be working at all.
After we were told that there were no more nachos, we asked for our bill (which cost us a whopping 33$ for 2 small drinks!!!)....and as we walked out the door, we spotted a group that came in after us.... WITH NACHOS ON THEIR TABLE!!!!!!!!!
WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER, EXPENSIVE FOR NOTHING, DO NOT RECOMMEND AND WILL NEVER GO BACK!!!!

Place is nice but the clients are rude and selfish. I had my kid in my arms waiting in line and not two but four males in their 50 cut me off, pushed my 6 year old against the door to pass and then 2 other males push me while I was standing waiting to be sitted with kid in my arms. Horrible crowd. Otherwise food and service excellent.
Expensive beer pitcher, stuff from the ceiling was preventing me to see the scoreboard on tv. Food was between bad and ok. Staff was nice.

Edited Post - 4 1/2 instead of 2 stars. My original review was poor due to the poor experience we had during the first World Cup game we watched. The second time around the service was great, friendly and fast.

Food is mediocre - it does the job. Nachos are almost without salsa sauce, you need to ask for additional dressing / ketchup / mayonnaise when you order burgers or fries.

formatted_address: 269 Rue Saint-Jean, Québec, QC G1R 1N8, Canada
name: Brasserie la Faucheuse

reviews.text: You would normally pass this Bar by as a dive, but it's actually very friendly, great hard rock music, very cheap and food is amazing if your looking for snacks served until 3am...mostly fried pub style.... Will keep returning.. Look for the Reaper and youll not be dissapointed ..
Nice beer, nice music
Great place, great people.

This place is not easy to find. It is in a row of old houses on rue Saint-Jean. Plus it opens usually late - at 7 P. M. But since the opening, there is a great happy hour - some pints (0,5 l) are for 4$ until 10 P. M.!!! I haven't found a better price yet. 

The bar will be appreciated by rock, punk and metal fans. Their playlist is full of good tunes. They serve some small meals as a good accomplishment for the beer. A little inconvenience is that it is a cash only place. But you can withdraw your money from the ATM in the bar. To be honest, it is my favourite bar in Québec city, so I admit my overview might be little less objective :-)

Nice bar eoth a good ambiance, the smell of the snacks they serve will definitely open up your appetite. There are 2 arcade racing machine you can play with a friend and a dance floor that seems to have people dancing no matter the music selection!

formatted_address: 5500 Rue Hochelaga Local 150, Montréal, QC H1N 3L7, Canada
name: Avant-Garde Artisans Brasseurs

reviews.text: Awesome brewery just outside of Downtown montreal. Stop in for the great atmosphere.
These are truly legit. They make a wide variety of different beers for craft beer lovers. I can t believe this place used to be a bingo. Nice design touches and a cozy modern atmosphere.

Amazing beer and great staff. 
The ambiance and decor is very comfortable and great for groups. 
Our staff party was a big hit!

Really nice place, love the tasting option, I'm not a fan of beer but was able to find a favorite one and event bought some for at home. The only negative thing was the service,  don't know if  is always like that but didn't really have a service,   we were only 3 tables total of approximately 10 people and 4 at the bar. The girl working was behind the bsr doing nothing and iy took her a lot of time to come and see us. Will sure go back, hoping service will be better, since for me it's something important.

Fun place with there home made beer!
Will come for sure for fun event!

formatted_address: 60 Rue Saint-Jacques, Montréal, QC H2Y 1L2, Canada
name: Rosewood

reviews.text: Nice décor with an energetic vibe. The food was really good and inspired with proper portions. Fairly priced drinks round out the offer. Make sure to reserve ahead of time and expect it to be loud (people and music). Recommended.

We had a reservation for 8 people for brunch and our table was ready on time. Food was good and our waitress (Claudia) was outstanding! However music was a bit loud and the table next to us were super loud so we couldn't hear each other speak. It's a very young vibe, not kid friendly. I had smoked salmon avocado toast - the portion was just enough for me. My friend had a mushroom crepe and it was huge - she enjoyed it also. Mimosa was good - trust me, its not your average diluted mimosa :p

Bottomless Mimosas, need I say more? I will! The food was delicious, and the service was amazing. Your drink was just under half and they were filling your glass again. And at no point did I feel rushed out the door. We sat and enjoyed out 2h time limit in comfort. The next time I'm in Montreal I'm going to make a reservation

Went for brunch with some friend and we all loved it.
The atmosphere is nice and they have bottomless mimosas for 25$ ! 
The waitress was also super patient with us (some of our guests were late).
As for the food , the portions were good and I ordered the mushroom crêpe and was satisfied.

Easily one of the best restaurants I’ve had the chance to try in Montreal!

I tried this place on two different occasions, first was a dinner party and second was for a brunch. Dinner was succulent and we had an amazing time. A bit pricey for dinner, but the quality of the food and the quality of the service makes up for it!

As for the brunch, I’ll definitely be back! We had a great time, the server was very nice and the food was delicious. Fancy, unique and tasty.

formatted_address: 438 Rue du Parvis, Québec, QC G1K 6H8, Canada
name: Noctem Artisans Brasseurs

reviews.text: Excellent beers, good food, great vibes. Amongst the best of the craft beer scene that I've found in Quebec city and easily the best in the Saint Roch district in regards to venue, service, food and most importantly the beer. Great stuff guys!
Awesome space and beers to match! Haven’t tried the food but it looks delicious. Staff was friendly and attentive. Of course my wife loved the cat themes.

We wanted to go get something to drink for the night and this pub was just walking distance from our hotel.

It was pretty busy on a Sunday night. The patio was packed when we get there.

We tried their beer samples, some of it were really good, but we got 2-3 samples of ciders instead.

We ordered their meat platter for appetizers and it was delicious. We were just a little disappointed that our waitress didn’t explain the food to us. We don’t have any clue what’s on the platter and we just ended up assuming and figuring it out ourselves.

Great beer and great food! I tried the spicy stout and it was very unique and delicious. The vegetarian burger was delicious and stayed together much better than most veggie burgers. Overall a great stop!
Good beer and good food. I recommend the catnip beer if they have it. Had a salmon salad and loved it; fancy and delicious.

formatted_address: 370 Rue Saint-Vallier O, Québec, QC G1K 1K6, Canada
name: Chez Girard's Pub

reviews.text: This is a local place, does not have a variety of exciting taps, but is very homey and lovely.
Very homy feeling
Belle gang
Ok la bière pas cher !! Soir du super bowl annonce la pizza à volonté mais fausse joie. Pas vrai du tout, manque de pizza!!
Nice petit bar sportif de quartier

formatted_address: 988 Rue Ottawa, Montréal, QC H3C 1S3, Canada
name: Mano Cornuto

reviews.text: Lively and fun. There is a great choice of food for any meal or appetite. Lots of care put into the ingredients in the dishes and preparation. Fantastic wine list. Not a huge fan of the coffee roast, a bit bitter to my taste but I’m sure is great in a latte.

They have got a good thing going on over here. Great coffee and local beer selection. The sandwiches are delicious (mine had truffle honey...need I say more?) And the service is over the moon friendly. Its on the small side in terms of seating giving it an intimate Italian-style cafe, which is something I'm always searching for on my side of town. Plus its in a spot of town that's lacking an authentic-feeling cafe with great service. I'm looking forward to trying everything on the menu 👍
Cute little Italian place, with nice staff and delicious food. All sandwiches are served on fresh homemade focaccia bread! Separate menus for lunch and dinner and everything looks good.

Great little place with good and simple Italian food and a nice wine and cocktail list. Pasta, crudo, everything was solid.
Brunch is also really good.
There are no words to describe the adventures that my tastes buds  experienced. The layers of flavors and textures are delicate yet so pronounced. Great ambiance!

formatted_address: 176 Saint Viateur West Street, QC 2L3, Saint- Viateur St W, Montreal, QC H2T 2L3, Canada
name: Île Flottante

reviews.text: A lovely evening celebrating fellow neighbourhood restaurants. The food was good and beautifully plated. Service was very good too however the entire experience didn’t blow us away. Maybe our expectations were higher especially considering the price? Don’t get me wrong, everything was good. Absolutely no complaints.

If there were more stars to give I would be giving them. This place is an experience. The food (which changes every 3 months) is both delicious and a work of art. Previously named “les Deux singes” the chef has stayed the same and the decor is even more exquisite. The service is second to none and you will be coming back for more. They offer a 3,5 or 7 course tasting menu. They have a wine expert on site who will walk you through the best wine for your meal. They adapt to all food restrictions and also offer vegetarian options for you. Really this is an amazing place that you won’t easily forget.

Beautiful place in one of the best places in Montreal. I'm an avid meat eater, and even I love this mostly vegetarian place! Totally worth it! Came on a Saturday first service, and it wasn't terribly crowded, but the place definitely picked up later in the evening. Make reservations. Service is quick and professional.

We had a delightful birthday dinner here, soaking up the youthful energy in the room and delighted by the creative and delicious dishes.  The inspiration for the meal that evening was the neighborhood and the long-standing, diverse restaurants there. Our 5 + 1 plates artfully riffed on themes from Italian, Japanese, Polish, Middle Eastern, Vietnamese dishes and the oldest bagel bakery in Montreal next door.  The flavors, textures and presentation of the dishes were a bit familiar yet startlingly fresh. And the paired wines fit the dishes perfectly.  Loved the emphasis on vegetables!  After the meal we asked for a menu with the dishes described, so we could remember them later. There was no menu available but the lovely waiter, wrote the whole menu out by hand and gave it to us with the bill.  That was a crowning touch!
My sweet friend took me here in August 2019. It was one of the most beautiful and delicious meals of my life. Cocktails were outstanding. I would go back in a heartbeak.

formatted_address: 4869 Av du Parc, Montréal, QC H2V 4E7, Canada
name: Buvette Chez Simone

reviews.text:
Awesome vibes and very easy to have conversations. The restaurant does have awkward seating on some of their bigger tables but it does enable you to bring a bigger group of people, I'd say like up to 6. 

Food is good, we had the full chicken with a few sliders. Be ready to use your hands!

They have a great wine list with tons of options.

We love coming to Buvette Chez Simone,for the atmosphere,the quaint terrace, and the different menu. However, recently we've noticed that their portions keep shrinking. I've included a photo of what we were served a couple of nights ago. This used to be a portion of 2 choices,now it's for 4 choices. I'm not sure why, but I think to keep regular customers going, you need to be consistent. Still, a great place with a great atmosphere for a couple's night out.
Very clean and convenient restaurant. They provide large meals and for fair prices. We enjoyed the meals very much and the staff members were super amiable and explanatory. Highly recommended.

Such a buzz on Monday!  A packed house on a usual slow night. Friendly service. Great wines to try. And lovely duck rillettes!  Get the full portion!  Had a great time here and first dinner of this trip to Montreal was a delight. May have to come back before leaving town.
Fabulous food, great atmosphere & very helpful people who explained the menu to us in English as our French is so elementary

formatted_address: Place Lasalle, 7852 Boulevard Champlain, LaSalle, QC H8P 1B3, Canada
name: Brasserie des Rapides

reviews.text: Had a great time! The service is fast and very friendly staff. The southern comfort burger was sooo good. Our server Alex was extremely helpful and went out of her way to accommodate us. Would absolutely come back here.
Alexia ♡ the best WAITRESS i ever had! Went above and beyond. Food was A 1 ! Will definitely be back! Great price and quality food. Thank you

Great for breakfast, lunch, and supper. The brass is always adapting its menu and mood to fit the moment. The only good place to hang out within a 2 kilometre square. It’s always a pleasure to be served by Vanessa, especially during Karaoke Thursdays.

Wanted to leave a compliment for Vanessa she was very pleasant and checked on our table regularly during karaoke night. Kind, friendly, patient, good work ethic and over all a sweet human being really happy she was one of our waitresses tonight. Keep up the great job and happy holidays to everyone at the BDR :D

Food is OK and a very good atmosphere to be with friends for watching some sport events! However, I won’t come here just for the food because its not worth it and it is nothing really to compliment about

formatted_address: 1 Rue Saint-Paul O, Montréal, QC H2L 1Y6, Canada
name: Bistro Mondale

formatted_address: 3333 Rue du Carrefour, Québec, QC G1C 5R9, Canada
name: Les Maltcommodes

reviews.text:
Wow! AMAZING Food fresh and very delicous and the home beers are to die for! The atmosphere heree is Awsome! The Service is excellent!
 Came 2 times now and will be returning! Had the Bisson Tartar first time and it was perfection! Second time we had the ribs and Nachos and wow wow they were tender and juicy and very tasty! 
Definately a must! Did i say they have a Menu to please everyone! One of my new Favorite places in Quebec City! Was so good i forgot to take a picture of my food but managed to get one of this dessert! The cheesecake!

Disappointed with the service provided by a young staff (Rosemarie) who could careless about your order, or else.  The g/f and I went in last evening (Thur. Oct 24th) for a quick bite to eat.   We got our order taken-in by Rosemarie, who didn't bother writing anything down.  We later got our orders to our tabke (table #54).  I then asked for some ketchup, which I didn't get and never got my side of Ceasar salad either.  So, when the bill came, we asked her how she remembered any order and she pointed to her head. (Oh really?!)  When we told that she had forgot to bring the ketchup and side salad, she replied: "Ooh I'm so sorry!  I was in a rush, you know?  So, sorry!"  But, she never mentioned the fact that while we were waiting for anything to come our way, she was having a glass of red wine at the bar with a couple.  Plenty of time to drink, but no time to serve the customers what they asked for.  Needless to say, it was my first... and last visit there!  For the price we pay our food nowadays, one would expect some sort of accuracy and accountablilty for mistakes and/or lack of professionalism of staff or management.

Amazing, wonderful, delicious, great staff, beautiful decoration and meal presentation, great taste. Beer choice is as great as the meat one. Vegetarians : avoid this place (but they will find a way to serve you rice and vegetable). A little bit too expensive for the quantity.
Good food nice setup.
Loved my experience there, and the music is nice.

formatted_address: 1050 Av Victoria, LeMoyne, QC J4R 1P5, Canada
name: Dépanneur Du Coin

formatted_address: 5563 Rue Fullum, Montréal, QC H2G 2Z4, Canada
name: Gutsy Kombucha

reviews.text:
Gutsy is definitely a brand you can get behind. They care about their product, their customer, and the environment. I love that you can purchase on tap. It's a great model. Their cans are pretty sweet looking too. 
Lastly, their ginger-raspberry kombucha is some of the best I have ever tried.

Je pense que tous les éléments de ces kombuchas sont excellents et, surtout, les saveurs comme hisbiscus me plaisent. Je trouve simplement qu'il y a trop de goût de sucre dans les breuvages. Si vous trouvez votre source en fût, alors ils sont vraiment abordable.
Très bon produit je recommande

Fui visitar a Fábrica sem avisar, mesmo sem falar o idioma local, não falo nem inglês e nem francês rsrs mesmo sem entender muito o que eu falava, a funcionária me atendeu gentilmente, buscou falar espanhol e abriu o Google tradutor. Foi muito gentil e atenciosa 😊 também me presenteou com Kombucha, a minha predileta é a sabor Verbena 🌸 Maravilhosa 😋 o proprietário da Gutsy gentilmente respondeu mensagens sobre a empresa e realmente fiquei surpresa pela gentileza de toda equipe. Obrigada Gutsy Kombucha, a minha experiência foi muito positiva.

formatted_address: 2050 Rue Mansfield, Montréal, QC H3A 1Y9, Canada
name: Hôtel Le Germain Montréal - NOW OPEN

reviews.text:
Really nice property, with very unique atmosphere and great rooms (functional and comfortable). 

Doorman waiting outside to welcome, very courteous.

Front desk clerks were smiling and welcoming, sorry, forgot the names.

Paul at the lobby bar was great with conversation, and a good laugh.

Michele the doorman in the morning was very helpful and courteous.

The restaurant menu was quite interesting, but if you're not a frogs legs, bone marrow type of eater, there aren't many vegetarian, and almost zero vegan options. And the portion for price wasn't very good either - had to ask for bread to fill up.

The restaurant service seemed a bit snotty (the gentleman that seated us).

If not for the restaurant, would have been 5 stars.

The outstanding design of the hotel rooms creates a fun and relaxing atmosphere during your stay. There is an overall attention to detail that most other hotels lack. Room rate also includes both breakfast (which was great) and wifi. The staff was friendly, highly attentive and courteous. You’ll be glad you decided to book here.
Friendly and helpful staff, clean, well appointed room, comfortable bar with creative cocktails. Will definitely stay again.
Great Hotel.  Comfortable, clean, good size room.  Good service.
We went their for happy hour and drinks are good , as for the food they have a fancy different menu to try!

formatted_address: 1405 Ch Ste-Foy, Québec, QC G1S 2N7, Canada
name: Resto-Pub Ryna

reviews.text: We had delicious brunches here. For a moderate price you get massive portions of food. You get to try a bit of everything from Quebecois cuisine. Our brunch had baguette, meat pie, potatoes, eggs and fruits! They also have homemade jam which was yummy! Kept us full for the whole day. We also had one of the most amazing hot chocolates here. Loved it and would come back next time we visit Quebec city!

A sad, dry, omelette.
Tired decor.
Good location.  Lots of windows and light.
Maybe I just chose the wrong dish.  Maybe the entire menu sucks.  I know I won't be coming back to find out.
It's a family friendly place, I feel welcome when I go with my baby, she receives just nice comments and gently gestures from employees and customers. Food is ok, good pizzas.
Probably the best breakfast served in town. Steak and egfs ftw
The space here is very compact (a lot of places for little space available). Still, the food was nice and well executed. The menu was elaborate and the price was fair. Parking is bad (no parking lot)

formatted_address: 38 Rue Saint Louis, Québec, QC G1R 3Z1, Canada
name: Restaurant Parmesan - Italian Resto - Steak - Wine Cocktails - Live Music

html_attributions: Restaurant Parmesan - Italian Resto - Steak - Wine Cocktails - Live Music
Restaurant Parmesan - Italian Resto - Steak - Wine Cocktails - Live Music
Restaurant Parmesan - Italian Resto - Steak - Wine Cocktails - Live Music
Restaurant Parmesan - Italian Resto - Steak - Wine Cocktails - Live Music
Restaurant Parmesan - Italian Resto - Steak - Wine Cocktails - Live Music

reviews.text: Kudos to Doris for finding this Italian gem, Restaurant Parmesan in Olde Quebec City. With live music, friendly and cozy atmosphere, we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. We started out ordering a nice bottle of dry red Bujolais wine and sharing a bruschetta appetizer; then on to linguini with clams and spring vegetable linguini, finishing up with a couple of cappuccinos, a creme brulee and a maple syrup pie for dessert. The accordion player and singer was very good, funny and entertaining. The meal was fabulous , we couldn't have been more happy. Our server, Luigi, was attentive, courteous and friendly. Our total bill came to $ 120 CAD ($ $90 USD). Very enjoyable, highly recommend.

My wife and I are visiting from Texas and this is our first time in Old Quebec City. We are major foodies and this restaurant was so fantastic. From the authentic atmosphere to the friendly and accommodating staff and ESPECIALLY the food! If we could give more stars we would! How this establishment doesn’t have a higher rating is baffling!!! If you are visiting or even a local this is a must stop! The food and staff will make you feel like family!!!

Very nice restaurant in the heart of Old Quebec.  Cool European feel sitting by an open window as tourist walk by.   Inside looked clean.  Its tight in there, but get over it, space is premium in a town like this.  Food was good, especially liked the spaghetti with meat sauce and chicken parmesan.   Staff was friendly but super busy so be ready with what you want.   They had a guy playing an accordion in there that added a nice touch.  And the bathrooms, upstairs have several stalls so no lines and they were clean.  Just stay out of the way of waiters as you go.

This is my favorite restaurant in Old Quebec Canada!!! I've never been disappointed with any dish I've eaten here. The music is lively and fun. It fills up quickly with ppl and they're so friendly. Come and enjoy a family like atmosphere.

A great restaurant to visit! The French Onion Soup, Surf and Turf, and Veal Marsala are all delicious. The staff are very friendly and gives a lot of information about the place if you ask.

I wish I took pictures of the inside, they have very nice collections of bottles molded into different figures - plus La Dolce Vita filmed here!

formatted_address: 3094, boul Cartier O, Laval, QC H7V 1J5, Canada
name: Pontos Bar Social Club

reviews.text: Great staff

formatted_address: 1769 Avenue Pierre-Péladeau, Laval, QC H7T 2Y5, Canada
name: Sharx

reviews.text: Amazing place, great ambiance if you want to have a nice evening with some friends, bowling alleys, cold drinks, a good variety of alcohol selections, intriguing and exquisite Portuguese cuisine with a dash of Japanese, the place is huge! The waitresses are very professional and courteous applying great service to their customers. A place you must visit when touring the city of Laval, but remember when going in there; It’s quality over quantity!;)

The service was very slow. I mean it was "really" slow. Don't get me wrong, the people there are very nice, however, the price you are paying for bowling is ridiculously overpriced. It cost ~20$ PER PERSON to play ONE GAME. Now, it's crazy to me that they don't charge per hour like other places, but the price you are paying is crazy. I did not try the food, but I tried their drinks and they do not put alot of alcohol.

To the employees saying sorry for the small pre-opening menu. The issue is not the small menu, it's the lack of service. Waited 30 mins at the bar and never got the drink I ordered. Then got seated at a table and tried ordering again. Took another 30 mins to receive drinks. 1 hour has passed and finally a few of the drinks came in but no water even tho it was asked for 3 times. The waiters are very non chalant, bartender has no memory and takes way too long to complete orders. There is no communication between the staff. And the bowling alleys are always prioritised over the tables. You just lost over 400$ in sales. Our group just walked out and went to another bar next door. Train your staff please (and maybe give them a dress code because the bartender should not have worn that red dress, super inappropriate and does not suit her at all). Btw it was not a busy night.

Service was lacking in every aspects. 30 minutes wait to get Our drinks . We got served plates that weren’t supposed to be served to our table. Since we were sitting in front of the kitchen (way to close from the kitchen btw) we heard the commotion between the chef and the waitress. The manager just walks around without really saying or doing anything. He even sat down at a certain point and start dosing.. the food is bland , no spices. Calamari, portugese chicken unfortunately are tasteless. The chicken seem to be boiled first, grilled a few minutes and then soaked in piripiri sauce. chicken is white, watery and tasteless. Nothing compared to the real portugese chicken of Romados, PiriPiri etc..  The supposedly spicy mayoto accompany  my calamari was also tasteless. 
Bowling is 17.25$ per person ( expensive)
There were mistakes with the drinks that we ordered while bowling too. They ran out of a type of alcool so she just brought tequila instead . I don’t do tequila?!?!
Once we got a hold of our waitress to tell her that we didn’t order tequila she said that they were out of whatever  else we ordered. she brought back the shotS of tequila and came back with their drink menu. At this point we were discouraged and just wanted to get the f. Out.
We finished our game, went to give our shoes back, and waited at least another 15 minutes to get our bills. People in my group were really becoming frustrated and felt like we should have walked out without paying our bills to teach them a lesson... but we are good people.. 
Never going back there! Unfortunate cuz it is a place with great potential. Ive been in the restaurant business for 20 years. They need help !! good managers and experienced staff or else they will go down.
Nice decor but definitely different from the old Sharx near Guy

formatted_address: 410 R. Saint-Vincent, Montréal, QC H2Y 3A5, Canada
name: Bevo Bar + Pizzeria

reviews.text: Perfectly sized pizzas with detailed flavor profiles. The staff was delightfully friendly and full of great suggestions and comments! Made our visit extra special. Staff was very respectful too, noticing we were deep in conversation and still gnawing at our pizzas after good time he only returned to the table to fill up our waters, letting us stay focused and enjoy our time together. Great ambiance and setting, would love to come back and sit outdoors in the summer.

A very lovely place to dine. My Chardonnay was very very nice. Our server (Kayla) was very polite and very knowledgeable based on what was being served and the origins. 

My only bad thing I can say is we sat outside and there was a sewer and time to time bad smell would come out.

But overall check it out and you will enjoy it.

Absolutely stunning decor. In love with the rustic vibe of Old Montreal. The pastas are exquisite. For vegetarians, the mushroom pasta is delicious! Will highly recommend this establishment to others!
Incredible food!  I absolutely adored the tortellini and pizza!  Service was great too!

$$ Really big restaurant the service is a bit slow... But pizza are really fast to be served after 11 they only serve pizza don't really like that

Pizza are pretty good can get pretty expensive real quick

But the food was good

formatted_address: 115 Rue Saint-Louis, Terrebonne, QC J6W 1H4, Canada
name: Le Transit Bistro Bar

reviews.text: Nice staff weird people
Music and booze

Pas les meilleurs produits ni les meilleurs prix. L'ambiance est un peu déprimante, mais le staff est super sympathique. Très cool pour organiser des spectacles, mais il faut amener beaucoup de matériel qui manque au bar.
Il y a une belle terrase
Bel endroit et bonne ambiance je vais y retourner c'est garantie

formatted_address: 6551 Durocher, Outremont, QC H2V 3Z4, Canada
name: Le Dodécaèdre

formatted_address: 814 Avenue Myrand, Québec, QC G1V 2V5, Canada
name: Cactus Restaurant Bar

reviews.text: We had chicken wings and fries here for dinner. The sauces were so delicious! Probably one of the tastiest BBQ sauce I've tried. Don't know how they made those magical chicken wings. We had a mix of sauces (BBQ, Buffalo and spiced-honey). They were all good. Great service too!

Food is goood! try the spicy chicken wings.Lots of choices of tex-mex fdishes as well as pasta and burgers. Excellent beer selection and live entertainment . The staaff is young and the ''terrasse '' is the place on a nice summer night as welle as cooler nights(gaz burners). This is your typical restaurant-bar with a tex-mex spice to it. You off course have your choice of mexican food but you also have other options and a good choice of beers and spirits.

Great beer selection, great menu and most importantly, incredible terrace! The Cactus is, even though in a modest building, a monument of the area where students and young professionals have been stoping by for a beer, nachos and wings... for decades now! If you are looking for Pretty people and great atmosphere on a sunny day for your happy hour, this is the place!

35 cents chicken wings on monday. Good service overall. Suicide sauce is weak and way to vinegary i was not impress, was ready for way more spicy especially with the name but the rest is good. Good selection of beers and snacks overall. First time ever for me, not sure if i would go another day of the week since i went there for the cheap wings. 4/5 overall
At Mondays, chicken wings for $0.35 each!!! Good beers options on draft. At summer is really nice sit outside.

formatted_address: 59 Côte du Passage, Lévis, QC G6V 5S8, Canada
name: Bistro Bar La Barricade

reviews.text: Excellent local bar. Several visits made over the past few days. Excellent range of beers. Staff friendly and efficient. Would visit again if not moving on.
This is a nice place to come for a cold beer. Nice decor in a quaint part of town. Good service.
Excellent bar, nice waiter and good atmosphere
I love this place, not too expensive, not too crowded. The perfect place for a good beer with a group of friends.
Barricade is life barricade is love

formatted_address: 2450 Boulevard Laurier, Québec, QC G1V 2L1, Canada
name: 3 Brasseurs Laurier

reviews.text: Many place to seat, regular pub food. The pizzas (Flems) are good. Crafted beer is also nice.

Good ambiance. They have good fresh beer with a lot of varieties to try. Very nice pizza as well, made in a very original ways. If you want to try something new in a lovely environment, you should try it. Just give a call and make a reservation before coming because you may not have a seat.
Great location. Nice setting. Variety of food choices and drinks. All came perfectly done.
Lively on Friday night! It's a real menu for man let's say! It's missing a bit of color and freshness on the salad side. ;-)
Best service, best food, reasonable prices!

formatted_address: 625 Rue des Rocailles, Québec, QC G2J 1A9, Canada
name: Le Gazebo

formatted_address: 17 Rue Saint-Stanislas, Québec, QC G1R 4G7, Canada
name: Beclub Bistro Bar

reviews.text: This place was one of 5 Restaurants we stopped in during our Old Quebec City Food Tour we too last June during our 3 month trek across wonderful Eastern Canada. Our tour guide claimed they had the best mac & cheese in town and we all agreed. It was simply awesome! So give yourself a treat when in the area and try them for yourself. Awesome

Awesome restaurant and dining experience! My wife and I were visiting from the States and found this place on a whim. Place was greatly decorated and nice drink selection. Service was awesome, great food knowledge and recommendations. Would highly recommend!

A very cozy place with fantastic food. I visited this place through one of the local tours and had to returned the same evening for some more. Their Mac and cheese is simply delicious! Their smoked chicken sandwich is absolutely fantastic! The ambiance was great and the staff were friendly and helpful. I will be returning again!
Loved the food here. A definite place to eat while in Old Town Quebec. Everyone in our party really enjoyed their meal.

Cute restaurant with great lunch special for $16.5 with entree, appetizer, coffee and a small chocolate for dessert. The celery root soup was sweet and delicious. The coffee was very strong and unexpectedly good. The mac and cheese was unique- it has a big chunk of cheese laying ontop. The mac and cheese would be excellent if it was less salty.

formatted_address: 3872 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2W 1Y2, Canada
name: La Cabane - Resto Portugais - Tapas/Seafood - Poutine Salads Burgers - Wine Bar/Cocktails - Loterie Video

reviews.text: This is the ideal place to go when on the Plateau Mont-royal. Good food at a reasonable price. Strongly recommend !
Fun place, good food and not expensive for all the beer and food I consumed.

La cabane is one of the best restaurants I’ve ever been to. The food is great and the service is fantastic. Hubie, the owner, is such a great guy. He is friendly and he knows pretty much everyone. He was the one who invented their famous Portuguese styled poutine. I am shocked at how many 1-star ratings this restaurant has. Overall, great place!!! 10/10 recommend
Great food and awesome staff. Kitchen open late. A great little restaurant / bar on the main.

This is my favorite spot because the kitchen stays open late. The food is great and the price is reasonable for what you get. I always meet people in the restaurant business there, whether they are servers, restaurant or bar owners. This gives you an indication of how good the food is. Check out the specials of the day. You get a great value.

formatted_address: 452 Place Jacques-Cartier, Montréal, QC H2Y 3B3, Canada
name: Trattoria Gio

reviews.text: Excellent location and food! Good wine selection. We had the lobster 'special' with half lobster, mussels, scallops & shrimp for around $60 US. The seafood was super fresh and perfectly prepared. Even if you're not hungry, it's the perfect open air and people watching place to be!
Great tourist spot and good service.  I recommend sitting outside to watch
Good prices and ok pizza. Would recommend for a quick bite

This restaurant is very cute, and staff is very helpful. I had the spaghetti pesto, but it was just alright. The sauce was too creamy and didn't have much flavor. However, I would definitely come back and try another dish!

Great Italian restaurant in the heart of Old Port! I went with my boyfriend and we really enjoyed our evening. The ambiance is very cozy and romantic and the food is delicious! I had the Caprese pizza and the crust was thin and crispy with just the right amount of toppings. We also had the homemade Tiramisu which hit the spot right after our meal! A must try if you're in the area :)

formatted_address: Canada, 66 Rue Saint Louis, Quebec City, QC G1R 3Z3, Canada
name: l'Omelette - Petit Déjeuner

reviews.text:
The service was great. We are traveling as a large-ish group (5) with an infant on top of that. They accommodated us very well. They gave us a large table and took our stroller aside and gave us a high chair with a tray. We were grateful for the space and the ability to help with our baby.

The food.... Well, we went for dinner and they had a series of specials. It seemed great. Choice of soup or salad, main, and dessert. We each ordered a different item, but all decided on the salad. The salad came with very little dressing, which is typically fine, but it was basically lettuce, bell peppers, and onions (white onions). Not at all the refreshing salad any of us were looking for. Once our main dish arrived, there was an additional salad on each of our plates. At this point we all regretted ordering the salad as our starter. This second salad was merely lettuce and had a sweet mustard dressing. Much better!

All of our main dishes seemed to be cooked as bulk tray items which they would just take what was necessary as people ordered. It wasn't super fresh, and was overall, underwhelming.

For dessert we had two options, which are not advertised before it is time for dessert. They were not bad, I just like to be informed. Either cheesecake with cherries or a mocha hazelnut cake. I ordered the cheesecake and again was underwhelmed. It wasn't very cold and seemed to be missing the normal sweet factor you expect cheesecake to offer. My family did not mention anything regarding the other option.

The food is okay, not terrible, but probably not worth the price. The accommodations were incredible, and the staff were so friendly.

Variety of cafe food along with a full bar. My wife had the BBQ Poutine, which was delicious. I had a Croque Monsieur which was decent. I also had a dirty gin martini, don't judge me. It was perfect. 

The best part was the staff. They were incredibly friendly and a lot of fun. Definitely worth a try!

We ate here our first night in Quebec City. The prices are reasonable, and the food is good. Nothing really stood out, but it was serviceable. The staff were pleasant and efficient. We were served fairly quickly, something we later found to be unusual in some restaurants in Quebec City. We passed by here when looking for a quick meal as my 1 year old was about done for the night. They seated us quickly, brought us some drinks, and the food followed shortly thereafter. I really wanted some Poutine while in Quebec, and they delivered, That alone was worth it.
Great place. Is like be in your own home with your friends
Excellent place for breakfast. Sumptuous healthy meal, a great way to start the day. They have a variety of options and prices are very affordable. Service is quick and nice ambiance.

formatted_address: 3807 Rue Saint-André, Montréal, QC H2L 3V9, Canada
name: Bistro CÔ ÚT - Montréal

reviews.text:
The broth was very rich and flavourful. Its a shame I’m only visiting the city. I will definitely be coming back, it’s the best pho I’ve ever had in my life.

Everything else we tried (papaya salad, imperial rolls and fresh spring rolls) were all equally amazing.

What an experience, the food was really good and the ambience cozy. I will definitely come back to taste the rest of the menu!!
Thank you for the good service.

Simple menu full of tasty items. We really enjoyed the pho and their spring rolls. The imperial rolls were very good as well. Also enjoyed the chicken wings and scallops. Service was friendly and attentive. Prices were reasonable.

I love coming here for a nice evening meal! This Vietnamese restaurant is very attentive to vegetarians and vegans and delivers in flavour and portion size! The atmosphere is calm and perfect for intimate conversations! I personally recommend the vegan pho and red vegetable coconut milk curry! Delicious!
Great food and a super motivated and friendly staff. The restaurant looks stylish and is super clean. I think we found our new favourite Vietnamese restaurant in town :)

formatted_address: 7244 Boulevard Maurice-Duplessis, Montréal, QC H1E 4A7, Canada
name: Cafe Danesi

reviews.text:
Been going here for several years to eat in or take out.
Only 1 incident in all those years so overall good place to eat
The Pizza is AMAZING especially if you like thin crust
The Subs are also extremely good
Good calzoned

Great little local café.
Excellent eats not a single bad item on the menu
The best Food in RDP and in my opinion anywhere in Montreal especially the Burgers !!
Had the B-Mac pizza it was really good.

formatted_address: 580 Boulevard Saint-Martin O, Laval, QC H7M 3Y2, Canada
name: Barbies Resto Bar Grill

reviews.text: Fast and good service. The food is great with a nice choice of dishes. Price is ok .

Good food! And wonderful people!
Rest room needs to be renovated and cleaned up.
An Ok place to go for dinner. They have a nice decor, which is lounge style. The food is average, but, still worth it. Good selection on the menu. Friendly staff.

As its name says "Barbies" they serve food related to BBQ. Meat, hamburgers, pizza, soups, chicken, etc. They have an spectacular menu. I tried Steak BBQ (24$), and the tastes were really good. It's not expensive and affordable. I could recommend them. Their service and the staff is out of series. They deserve a good review because my experience was really good. Ah! They have menu for kids too. Ideal for family. They have terrace too.

The service is excellent, very decent prices too!  The "Table d'Hote" includes soup, main course, desert and coffee all for $18 bucks. I can go there with my family (party of 5) and keep the bill below $100. 🙂

formatted_address: 3455 Rue St-Hubert, Montréal, QC H2L 3Z8, Canada
name: Mini Stéréo Elvira’s club

reviews.text: Best time evaaaaa

formatted_address: 1071 Côte du Beaver Hall, Montréal, QC H2Z 1S5, Canada
name: ÉCLIPSE DIX71

reviews.text: Cest dla pur marde service en anglais un peu en francais n'ouvre meme pas a 22h comme cest ecrit sur leur site une personne ma dit que cela ouvre a 22h30 un autre me parle en anglais il me dit 23h pas le droit de porter des botte mais ont est en plein hiver donc jai reournee chez moi  en plus ont est au quebec et cest obliger de parler francais quil se force moi je ne retourne plus la bas cela gache une soiree

formatted_address: 4564 Avenue Beaconsfield, Montréal, QC H4A 2H7, Canada
name: ÉQUIPE RAKATAK INC.

formatted_address: 1212 Rue Bélanger, Montréal, QC H2S 1H8, Canada
name: Roseville cafe bar

reviews.text: Nice and enthousiasme owner
Great neighborhood bar.  The staff is always friendly and helpful.
Great bar , fun place and great staff
Nice friendly cafe,good espresso

L'ambiance lors de match de hockey vous fera sauter de votre siège à chaque montée et crier sans relâche lors d'un but des canadiens. J'ai vraiment aimé le service et le prix des boissons était très abordable. Je ne comprend pas le concept des repas offerts puisque la fojs où j'y ai été, ils servaient du McDo... ils devraient offrir une meilleure selection.

formatted_address: Entrée sur Maisonneuve, 1550 Rue Fullum, Montréal, QC H2K 3M4, Canada
name: Le Rose-Marie

reviews.text: New owner and chef have created an Italian gem!  Fresh pasta dishes!! Great cocktails! Well curated wine list!  Wonderful decor and ambiance!!  What more do you need!?!?! Musn't go by old reviews for previous French Bistro at this location, solid Italian fare with locally sourced produce and meat offered now. Run don't walk, you'll be well rewarded!

Great food served in a  lovely comfortable decor, in an up and coming sector of Montreal. My meal started with a bitter-sour cocktail that was fabulous, prepared by our friendly host.  The chef stopped by our table to chat and shared his love of all things food.  The homemade pasta was fantastic.  The arancini are definitely a good choice as is anything with mushrooms!
Great atmosphere! The chef outdid himself! Wonderful Italian food. Varied dishes to satisfy your taste buds! I shall return.

My wife and I came here for Valentine's Day. The service was fantastic, the ambiance was cozy and warm, but most importantly the food was impeccable. We ate from the Valentine's Day tasting menu and personal favorite was the fazzoletti with guanciale, pistachios, and squid.
Chef Michael Lemme's menu is definitely one to try!
The food was spectacular. The staff was very knowledgeable of both the menu & wines. Such a great atmosphere, I can't wait to go back.

formatted_address: 6175 Rue de la Sarriette, Québec, QC G3E 1M6, Canada
name: SAG Audio - Sonorisation Avant-Garde

reviews.text: De tout !!!

formatted_address: 150 Rue Sainte-Catherine O, Montréal, QC H2X 3Y2, Canada
name: La Boulangerie Moderne - Complexe Desjardins - Café - Pizza Sandwiches Salads - Déjeuner Traiteur

html_attributions: La Boulangerie Moderne - Complexe Desjardins - Café - Pizza Sandwiches Salads - Déjeuner Traiteur

reviews.text: Good option for a quick breakfast and morning start, specially if you are tourist and located near Place des Arts. The bread & coffee are really good and they have great selection. The price is a little expensive and we agree with some comments and reviews, the staff are not that happy working there, but anyway Montreal staff are usually like that, so we are used to it.
Grilled cheese, good. Awesome mayo. I liked the opera cake. I don't care if people smile or not if they make a good job.
Is this normal / Safe to eat ?
Boulangerie is their specialty, everything you try is delicious. Breakfast (omelets) nothing special.
The pastries taste as good as they look! I got the almond croissant, it's very different than the ones I've tried before because the jelly is on the outside rather than the inside!

formatted_address: 1600 4e Avenue, Québec, QC G1J 3C3, Canada
name: Alimentation Escompte L'Impact

reviews.text: this is the best store in Quebec when i entered there for the first time i thought i had died and gone to heaven. it was the best day of my life. i will never forget this experience
Best selection of beer I have seen in QC city. Local and imported, they also have some good wine. Not dep wine. Stuff you wouldnt find at the SAQ.
Best place to buy craft beers in all of Quebec City, biggest choice at best prices! Don't get fooled by other places with their radio commercials, this is the place to go!
Incredible beer selection!
Best spot in Limoilou to buy craft beer!

formatted_address: 5955 Rue Saint-Laurent #101, Lévis, QC G6V 3P5, Canada
name: Le Corsaire

reviews.text:
Quite a nice location and a summer view to die for. The beer is of great quality and the staff very friendly. The food is actual and well prepared and the prices are fair to somewhat expensive for that kind of place. 

I wasn't a fan of having my food served on skateboards. The novelty factor isn't so great and the boards are cumbersome and the food falls everywhere. I think they could let the quality of their meals do its magic and drop the weird plating antics.

All in all, I wholeheartedly recommend this place but take extra napkins for when you'll miss having a plate!
Great stop for lunch before heading back to Quebec City on the ferry! We had 2 beer flights, the cheese board and duck drumsticks and it was all delicious! Really enjoyed the pirate theme as well

This pub is in a great location. It’s full of locals and the atmosphere it’s fun and energetic. The servers speak English and were helpful and courteous. We were very impress with the view and the food.

This place rocks. Great food and specials as evidenced by the cod and seal plate. Solid pub menu and great microbrews. Definitely worth the the ferry trip from Quebec and for you tourists that ferry trip is a great photo-op. Located about 200m from the ferry terminal. I'd say a must add to your this to do here even if the place risks to be overrun with tourists from a local point of view.

Atmosphere is nice. The servers are cute and the overall "gourmet" type of food is nice. The menu often changes since it's made by the chief cook. There's often new things to try so I'd recommend it to anyone who is sick of all those boring fast food menus.

formatted_address: 1476 Rue Crescent, Montréal, QC H3G 2B6, Canada
name: Mambo Supper Club

formatted_address: 16 Rue Maguire, Montréal, QC H2T 1B8, Canada
name: Pizzeria Magpie Mile End

reviews.text:
Came here to catch up with a friend and it was nice! The pizzas aren't too expensive and I found the portions good for sharing. The service was fast and nice. We ordered the pizza of the day which was a pizza with roquette and buffalo cheese and the margarita. Both great and delicious.

It has a very nice intimate ambiance, soft lighting and warm glows of candlelight. It doesn't get too loud and even at full capacity it doesn't feel crowded.

Nice cozy restaurant in the mile end. It is pretty small so make a reservation if possible. Also, the tables are very close to each other. We tried the octopus as an appetizer and two different pizzas. The octopus was amazing and the pizzas were good but not filling enough in my opinion. Also ordered a tiramisu for desserts which was okay. Overall it’s a nice restaurant with a good ambiance!

Went early on a weekday, so it wasn't crowded and service was quick. Small homey place with creative Neapolitan-style pizzas, some limited entrees, and house cocktails. Ordered a salad and two pizzas for three people and it was more than enough. Pizzas were excellent - these are true Neapolitan pies, soft and runny in the middle with a well developed cornicione. Service was friendly. Family friendly atmosphere.

The pizza is great. One of the best in Montreal. Smaller space with a great ambience. Service was good and the restaurant is clean. We had a party of 16 and the pizza was prepared quickly. Would recommend.

Crust is nice and bubbly brown. But there was barely any sauce and way too much flour. Also crust was a bit too floppy, my friend thought it was undercooked but I think that's just how their dough is. But I do really like the simplicity and attention to detail they have for their ingredients

formatted_address: 9597 Boulevard Maurice-Duplessis, Montréal, QC H1E 4M6, Canada
name: Peety Pops Resto - Sambuca

reviews.text: Very delicious pizza and pasta. Quick service so great for lunch!
Great coffee
They're chicken sandwiches are delicious, I was introduced to this place and i regularly do the drive from Laval all the way to get their specialty chicken sandwich!!!!
Nice and friendly environment,  good food at good prices
Very friendly staff, family members and the breakfast is to die for. Excellent quality and reasonably priced.

formatted_address: 6961 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2S 3E1, Canada
name: Signorvinomtl™ Italian Restaurant & Wine Bar

reviews.text:
You know the spontaneous evening was a success when you were ready to tap out after the 3 appetizers but continued to eat through the main 2 dishes and topping it off with fried donut filled with Nutella straight from Italy. 
Now I understand why it’s so hard to recommend the best dishes- EVERYTHING WAS JUST SO GOOD! 🤤 Go get yourself some REAL Italian food.

Never underestimate a woman that can eat more that you.
Signorvino is a must in the Italian part of Montreal, great food, super intimate atmosphere & Marco the owner is such a great person ! See you soon my friend.
Great food & drinks and services! Love this place :)

I had the opportunity to come to Signor Vino for a meal and I'm glad I finally came. I've had this restaurant on my list of places to visit for a good while and this was really worth it. I had a Negroni to start with that was very tasty and well made. The party I came with shared several appetizers and my favourite was the octopus one. The wine we had was a Sicilian Syrah that was very, very good. The wine selection is really something to behold. My favourite part was my main dish which was a seafood pasta dish. I will definitely come back and recommend it to anyone.
Cozy italian restaurant with good food, good wine selection and great service!

formatted_address: 1380 Ch Ste-Foy, Québec, QC G1S 2N6, Canada
name: Le Sacrement Bistropub Microbrasseries

reviews.text: Visited this place with family. Great atmosphere,  good service, really good food, beer,  and wine.
Great place to take some really good beers. service is good, food is great and great local beers
Great place to take some really good beers. service is good, food is great and great local beers
A great array of Quebec microbrews to sample - food *can* be good.
À good mix of local beer, as well as microbrewery. Decent pub food. Nice location.

formatted_address: 7225 Boulevard des Galeries d'Anjou, Anjou, QC H1M 2W2, Canada
name: 3 Brasseurs Anjou

reviews.text: The food it’s soooo delicious, and the desserts are fantastic. The service is very good. Definitely coming back when I visit Montreal again.

Really like to go there after a long day at the office. Beer is very good staff is very helpful and gentle. Food is okay. I feel like it's never too crowded which is a good thing because you can arrive without reservation and they can probably find you a spot even at rush hours on Thursdays and Fridays. Wouldn't bring children there although there is no problem at all. Just people can be loud and drinking a lot so I don't think it's a good place for children to go to.

If you want to go out with your best friends and drink beer, this is the place! Now if you are curious, try the micro brewery bear. Different color, taste, flavour. I like to discover. My friend always orders Blanche de Chambly with a slice of lemon and salty peanuts.
Good food and great time to spend with friends..
Wasn't able to properly cook meat to asked preference, however staff was kind, environment was calm

formatted_address: 400 Place Jacques-Cartier, Montréal, QC H2Y 3W1, Canada
name: Comptoir 400

reviews.text: We were lucky enough to stumble upon this lovely cafe for breakfast this past Sunday.  Wish I had gotten the name of the man that took care of us.  He was a delight!   Highly recommend.

It's warm place with excellent  service and awesome food. 
The hot chocolate is the best for winter.
I would definitely come back to this place.
If you're near by, do not hesitate and go try the pizza.
Ps: the XXL pizza can feed 4-5 people.

If you're looking for a good New-York style pizza in Montreal, with a nice terrace and lovely situated in the Old Port of Montreal, I would highly recommend this place. Also be sure to try the Caramel Ice Cream Dulce De Leche !
We had Americano and Montrealaise pizza. Very good, hot and crispy. I believe it was baked in wood fire oven. The drinks were a little bit expensive and there were no refills.
Great pizza place. Very authentic delicious pizza 🍕 and desserts 🍨 served here!

formatted_address: 305 Rue Saint-Charles Ouest, Longueuil, QC J4H 1E5, Canada
name: Café Terrasse 1957

reviews.text: I go with my wife to this lovely place  a lot! This is my favorite place to eat.  I visit this spot routinely. The food is excellent, the staff is helpful and the price is decent. I enjoy eating in this restaurant over a nice meal.
Great service, fantastic food and ambiance. Highly recommended.
Very cool place to relax after a work shift. Good beer, good food, nice place. Visited in summer and was very pleased by the place in general

We were hungry and looking for a place to eat. The food here is okay, but the prices do not reflect the quality of the dishes. The French fries were not fresh, they were frozen. My partner's poutine was on the cold side--how do you make cold poutine?! His poutine, my Croque Monsieur, a Perrier, and a beer totalled around $65!!!  Maybe you're better off just getting drinks here during a hot summer day. The staff was friendly, but the wait for our food was long.
Nice place friendly staff , casual ambiance.Good service good regular drinks. Nice decor but nothing to WOW about the place. But would definitely go back at some point.

formatted_address: 227 Rue Saint-Zotique E, Montréal, QC H2S 1L2, Canada
name: Le Zotique

reviews.text: Food, service and ambiance are too notch, great resto-bar for small groups
Great beer, food, and friendly staff!!

By far the most Horrible experience ever and even worse management. I arrive with a few friends eager to enjoy a meal and much to our dismay we were greeted by the sight of a person  whom i can only imagine is the boss, berating and chastising his workers. A professional would have done so away from the public eye. To add insult to injury, an overly inebriated man who made sure to explain to us that he was "a great friend of the boss" spent his time constantly touching on and making me and  my friends uncomfortable. To say i felt disrespected is an understatement. The music was enjoyable only when it wasnt muted out by the sound of the boss and his misogynistic friends discussion.  The only good part about my night was the friendly staff and good food. Needless to say ill never be going back and dont suggest it to anyone
A little pricey, nice location, waitress seemed to be in a hurry for us to leave in the afternoon. Weird. Nice beer selection.
Interesting and ever changing offering of craft beers. The big nachos are definitely too big for a single person.

formatted_address: 205 Rue Saint-Vallier E, Québec, QC G1K 3P2, Canada
name: La Cuisine

reviews.text:
Wow. What a spectacular restaurant. The decorations are perfect. The food was delicious and gentleman who served us was incredibly helpful. He spoke both English and French. I loved the old school video games available at the tables. 

If you’re in the area definitely check it out. This is a real taste of the Quebec flavor.

We visited this place TWICE in our 5 day stay in Quebec City. The plates are delicious, the prices are really good. Portions are filling. The onion soup was AMAZING! They have a good selection of beers and wine. The atmosphere is cool with video game consoles all around as well as board games that you're welcome to use if you'd like! The service was awesome, very friendly and professional staff. We're definitely coming back next time we're in town.

I had read the good reviews of La Cusine and wanted to try it while in Quebec City recently. Metered street parking in front of the restaurant and thankfully the payment machine had a button for English translation. All the reviews were true about this funky hole in the wall place dispensing good home style dishes. The blackboard menu is in French but I was able to distinguish some of the main dishes all priced at $11.52 CAD so I had the lasagna with a side salad and it was very good and plentiful.
