Only one soup of the day was listed but I asked if they also had French Onion Soup and they did priced at $6.52 CAD; it was excellent and I was glad I asked about it. There is an open kitchen with regular home appliances and a microwave oven. Service was prompt. Glad I went out of the way to find La Cuisine. Although most pay with cash, they do take credit cards.

This place has a comfortable approach and a homey atmosphere. One of the most interesting and thrifty places I've ever been to! The vintage chairs and 70's swag lamps had me wanting to go thrift shopping. The choices of beer on tap were great! The kitchen is visible from the tables and you can watch the chef prepare the food while you play any of the various vintage games... I'd love to go back!

This is place is awesome, wish I had found it at the beginning of the trip, not on the last day. Seriously considering calling in sick so I can stay in QC longer just to come here again a few times. Fantastic atmosphere, cool 50's furniture, classing video games and well prices delicious food. What more could you ask for? Actually... forget calling in sick... maybe I'll just quit....

formatted_address: 1707 Rue Saint-Denis, Montréal, QC H2X 3K4, Canada
name: Patrick's Pub

reviews.text: Went here on a night out with my friends, city and cozy atmosphere, friendly staff and a good variety of drink options. Not sure if it’s a regular special but on the night we were there, there was a 4 for $15 shots special which we ordered a few times! Ordered the potato wedges which were a bit pricey at $8 but they were probably the best wedges I’ve ever had! Would definitely come back when visiting Montreal :)
Nice place! Many great beer options that make you go back and again to try them all. Price is fair and the place is good for couple or group of friends.
Really unique and comfortable bar stools and solid starter type menu in an old school pub setting.
Very nice place for a drink. And because it’s a pub you can eat too 😉
It was awesome! The nachos to share and wings were devine! Looked like a local pub and great friendly feel to hangout.

formatted_address: 6375 Boulevard Monk, Montréal, QC H4E 3H8, Canada
name: Bar Et Lounge Université De Ville-Emard Inc

reviews.text: Awesome place . Great staff . But at 3 am you have to  LEAF

They have Karaoke on Sunday night. Which is really nice when you don't have a "normal" work schedule, since most of bars and similar establishments don't have events so at least you still can go out with some friends to have fun. Plus, most of the time, they offer you a shooter each time you go sing a song.
Beer on tap was flat. The manager was rude made sure I didn't feel welcome, even though his bar was empty. And they don't take visa.

Meilleure bar du sud ouest ❤️avec les plus belle barmaides 😍 belle ambiance pour faire la fete ou faire de nouvelle rencontre tout le monde est chaleureux et aimable le bar est tres beau et propre il a de la tres bonne musique bienvenus a tous 🥰
Bar acceuillant, bon Staff ! Je recommande :)

formatted_address: 1696 Rue Montcalm, Montréal, QC H2L 3H4, Canada
name: Village

formatted_address: 2269 Rue des Ormeaux, Montréal, QC H1L 4X2, Canada
name: Bar Des Ormeaux

reviews.text: la Barmaid du lundi soir est succulente

formatted_address: 1179 Avenue Cartier, Québec, QC G1R 2S9, Canada
name: Blaxton Cartier

reviews.text: We had a lovely brunch here just yesterday. They had a wide array of offerings, the service was first class, and the food was wonderful.
Sports bar vibe. Got the linguine carbonara, very good.
We were a group with no reservation. We had our drink. We left happy.

Wonderful dining experience on a very popular street. The food was fantastic including the poutine and brie burger I had. The beer selection was good as well. Sitting outside was wonderful on a warm summer night, but the inside has plenty of sports bar/restaurant charm as well.
AMAZING!!! Love it! Very well managed, great and fast service regardless of how crowded it is. A blend of casual and elegant atmosphere, with TVs all around so you dont miss any action.

formatted_address: 8489 Boulevard Saint-Michel, Montréal, QC H1Z 3E7, Canada
name: Brasserie Place 37

reviews.text: Pour ceux qui aiment les machines à sous Roulette Poker ect
Les lumières allumées ont ajoutées beaucoup à mon expérience , c'était conviviale ! J'ai adoré bravissimo !!!
J'adore l'ambiance, surtout le salon VIP. Par contre, je donne 4 étoiles puisqu'il n'y avait pas de grenadine.
Super
Super ambiance, j'adore la labatt.

formatted_address: 1245 Rue Saint-André, Montréal, QC H2L 3T1, Canada
name: M Montreal

reviews.text: Had such a great time here. Only stayed for 1 night but it was just great. When we got there, we were offered a tour. Staff was very welcoming. Hot tubs on the roof were the highlight of my trip. This hotel is great for young adults. The bar in the basement was so lit! Met lots of new people. The only thing that could have been better was breakfast. But it wasnt horrible.

Great hostel! Granted that this is my first experience in one, it was amazing. There is a cash only bar downstairs that is open until 3 am with pool and a foosball table ($2 CAD each). There are daily events down there as well. Pillows, blankets, sheets, and towels are provided. Extra towels are free to take of you need but you must obtain them before 11 pm. There is a washer dryer for $3 CAD each available too. Complimentary breakfast. And free luggage holding. Hot tub and bar on the roof. No complimentary shampoo/soap so bring those with you. There is also a convenience store/pharmacy one block away if you need to purchase anything. The reception building and residents building are separated by an outdoor courtyard. Staff are friendly and delightful. There is a parking lot across the street but it is recommended to park at a further underground lot.

Outstanding is an understatement! I was up for Igloofest and had an amazing time. The team puts in serious effort to make sure you enjoy your stay. In addition, all the activities/amenities make it easy to make new friends. The food was fantastic and affordable too.  I’ll definitely be back again!

M Montreal is an award winning hostel and for a reason.  The staff was extremely friendly and gave a tour of the facility upon check in.   The place was clean and it had every amenity your used to (kitchen, laundry, etc.) as well as 2 Hot Tubs a bar on site and curtains for your bunks. They also have a small cafe which you can order food that was pretty good but I'd go elsewhere. This is by far the best Hostel I've been to around the world! 15 minute walk from Old Montreal and China Town, 1 hr fro Mont Royal and La Banquise.  Great Location.

I had a good time at this hostel. They have an ATM on the main level, a nice kitchen with free breakfast, and good areas for relaxing. The downstairs bar is a nice addition and I was there for comedy night was was pretty fun.

I also like that the beds at curtains so there was more privacy.

Note: you will need to bring your own lock as well as soap and shampoo.

formatted_address: 1429 Rue Bishop, Montréal, QC H3G 2E4, Canada
name: Kafein cafe-bar

reviews.text: Cute, good coffee, quite large by downtown standards, so you can sit and chill without worries.
Used to love this place but it's closed now. Now a bahn mi restaurant :(
I like this place and keep on coming back: relaxed student café, good coffee and soup and sandwiches are made on place. Good cookies as well...

I must have had hot chocolate here.. Not sure though? 

I know where it is located.

Cute little spot to study, the playlist was great and the whole vibe was nice. Some Funny stuff like the comically short tables kinda hindered the experience, but the rest was good. They host a lot of event so it is a good idea to keep up to date on what's happening there. Overall i would recommend

formatted_address: 1624 Rue Sainte-Catherine O, Montréal, QC H3H 2S7, Canada
name: KINKA IZAKAYA MONTREAL

reviews.text:
I went there with my girlfriend, for diner, and chose their combo menu and it was worth it!

For entry, I had their beef salad, accompanied with fish soup, rolled eggs and fried chicken roll. 

As for the main meal, I chose the Gyūdon, which was really delicious!

Overall, it was a great place to visit, with a nice ambiance, and the food was excellent. I definitely recommend anyone wanting to eat Japanese cuisine, to visit this restaurant.

Very nice service and great ambiance. The tapas are delicious but the portions are small. 

This place is perfect for people who are not looking to be full and simply wanna have a good time with friends.
🐢

Let me start by saying it was a group of about 15 people, and we were there for almost 4 hours. That being said, amazing food and the service was second to none. Everyone shared everything and no one was disappointed. Any meat dishes were cooked beautifully, the noodles were done perfectly, the vegetables tender but not mushy and everything sauced well. Our waitress kept up with everyone and was quick on the delivery. The atmosphere as a whole was friendly and energetic. I wouldn't reccomend it if you're looking for a nice quiet night out but would reccomend in general.

I enjoyed the format of ordering many tapas-sized dishes and sharing, which made the final bill pretty cheap. The food was decent considering the price, but what really turned me off was how loud the music was in then evening. I had to scream to talk to the person sitting next to me and I could not hear the conversation happening in front of me. This was particularly inconvenient since I came with a big group of friends. The service was also quite slow... 2 of my friends somehow had their orders forgotten and only received their dish 30 mins after everyone else had finished eating, after having to remind the waiter and other waiters present. One of my friends did not have to pay for the dish, but my other friend who suffered the same experience had to pay for the dish in full. I would only recommend eating here during the day or at least when it is less busy.
One of my favorite places when dining out with friends. The food is tasty and the price is reasonable. The staff members are enthusiastic and helpful. Love their Undo, Karubi and Miso a lot.

formatted_address: 5800 Boul Métropolitain E, Saint-Léonard, QC H1S 1A7, Canada
name: Le Sélect Dancing Club

reviews.text: Must visit if you are in town!!!inside you can enjoy the Biodome...

Amazing place to have fun with a group of friends.
Fridays are latino music nights, and Saturdays are more dance/club hits, with a great crowd every time. Always lots of people, which makes a great party atmosphere, but the place is very big, with a big dance floor, so you always have space to move and dance. The staff is the best, they are amazing and so friendly, never in a bad mood. By far my all time favorite club!
Nice place to be at on a Saturday night. Though entrance fees are too much.
Music on a Saturday night was all dance/techno. Not a good variety.
Good Latin music on Fridays. If you like to dance salsa, this is the place. The floor is in very good shape for Salsa en linea

formatted_address: 2450 Boulevard Laurier, Québec, QC G1V 2L1, Canada
name: La Belle & La Boeuf - Burger Bar (Laurier)

reviews.text:
Where and how to start!
Such beautiful surroundings, decor,style and cleanliness. You can order soft drinks , beers ,cocktails with such a super friendly staff. 
The menu varies and the food is delicious. 
When you think about a hamburger at a fast food restaurant with frozen meat products that are at $8.00. Here at least you are getting fresh quality and quantity for a truly reasonable price.
The food, drinks and staff are fantastic and know what is being served.  These pics speak for themselves.  Absolutely a return in the near future.

We stopped by today and decided to try the food here. 
Food quality: 4/5
Service: 5/5
Overall experience 4/5

We tried different burgers. The one burger that stood out was the OMG burger which was cooked to perfection.  

The reason one star was taken off was because the hostess did not let us sit in the main room since we had a 2 year old with us. We had to sit the side facing the mall. That’s poor management!
Food is great. Wait is long. Came here twice on a trip to visit Quebec City, and both times had me waiting to get a table, but it was worth it. Service was great too.
Great food. The poutine is amazing and the burger is phenomenal. A 60 oz pitcher of a bunch of flavored liquor is only 26 bucks. Great atmosphere and attached to the mall.
Cool atmosphere and tasty food with good portions.  Service was SLOW!  our experience last year was much better.  Try the OMG or mushroom burger.  Both shown.

formatted_address: 1102 Rue de Bleury, Montréal, QC H2Z 1N4, Canada
name: Monsieur Restaurant+Bar

reviews.text: Went here with a group of six and had a wonderful time. Staff were friendly and accommodating and service was good all night. We had cocktails and appetizers to start, which were delicious. I had to run out early so the kitchen hustled to serve my salmon (perfectly cooked and beautifully prepared!) before the other mains. I just wish I could have stayed for dessert. Highly recommend

All around an incredible experience. The service was excellent and very professional. Great atmosphere with nice background music. The food arrived quickly and was beautifully plated. We ordered the Wednesday special $1 oysters, calamari,  gnocchi, and fish of the day (the best honey garlic glazed salmon I've ever had). Would definitely recommend this underrated Montreal gem.

I accidentally reviewed these folks with another restaurant that I disliked. 

I can tell you that these people are great, the food was great, drinks amazing, and the price fair. 

We showed up late and right after closing, they stayed open late for us and served us as if it were the start of dinner. 

We will always visit them when we are up.

Came for both lunch and dinner. They change their lunch menu often so make sure to head to the website to see what’s on the menu beforehand. 

Nice little restaurant with good service. The waitress was literally running to our table in order to refill our wine glasses. Items on the menu are pretty good. Prices are high but standard for downtown. They also have 1$ oysters on Fridays. 

Overall good experience and would recommend for groups.

We chartered the entire restaurant for a dinner event.  The staff were all very friendly, willing to share their recommendations about the food and drink.  We had a set menu with many appetisers and 5 main courses.  I had the pork belly appetiser and the wild mushroom and asparagus risotto.  The other mains included an organic cheesburger, duck, salmon tartar, mussels, and beef carpachio.  The appetisers included a summer salad and fried calamari.   They then offered dessert sharing platters with fresh berries, carrot cake, creme brule and a chocolate cake.  It was the perfect size for about 40 people.  I do highly recommend.

formatted_address: 1222 Rue Peel, Montréal, QC H3B 2T6, Canada
name: Montreal Bachata Zouk Festival

formatted_address: 10 Rue Saint-Antoine, Québec, QC G1K 4C9, Canada
name: Bar Artefact

reviews.text: I stayed at L'Auberge St-Antoine with friends and the bar became a rallying place for us. We had before dinner drinks there and went back after to have a night cap. I also had lunch there twice. The staff is very professional and courteous. They make great cocktails and the wine list is good. I had the burger and the club sandwich for lunch and both were excellent. This bar is part of the reason I love L'Auberge!

Stopped here for pre dinner drinks and oysters.  Good large oysters from PEI.  $3/each.  We sat in a small area around the corner of the bar with large windows from floor to ceiling.  Good service, nice atmosphere.
Delicious cocktail menu in a chic, cozy, modern setting.
Nice place to have a drink before going to the restaurant
Sub-par service and food should have been better.  Manager useless.

formatted_address: 3426 Rue Notre-Dame Ouest, Montréal, QC H4C 1P2, Canada
name: Cyr - Restaurant & Bar de Glace

reviews.text: Friendly staff. Nice decoration and positive vibe. The price are little high but worth to try. Ice bar with fantastic vodka collection is highly recommended for vodka lover!

WOW. !!!!!

My wonderful wife surprise me on my birthday this past Wednesday by taking me to this culinary and Vodka experience....

Let me say I'm not easily impressed with quality of food, cleanliness, knowledge of staff and overall ambience.

So let me say this....

I experienced a total culinary delight and their Vodka ice bar is a must. The knowledge staff made this night exceptional. Thank you Patrick.

Will be back.

Rick & Laurel

Stunning decor! Really great service & well made cocktails!!  What a lovely experience going down to the vodka ice bar, the entire experience was made extra special with the knowledge and friendliness of our guide.  Got to experience some unique vodkas from Sardinia & right here in Quebec which was a nice surprise.
Very nice decor, great cocktails and good food. They have an impressive cold room for vodka tasting. Service was excellent.
Nice atmosphere, nice people. Service was very slow. Ordered dinner at 8:30, served at 10:45. We were offered tequila shots for the inconvenience. Food was decent.

formatted_address: 399 Avenue Laurier O, Montréal, QC H2V 2K3, Canada
name: Restaurant Mikado

reviews.text:
Best sushi restaurant in Montreal. I've been here numerous times, and the food is consistently great. The fish is fresh, and the sushi are beautifully balanced, refined and expertly crafted.
The sake list is also unmatched in Montreal.
Highly recommend if you are craving upscale sushi.
Decent high-end sushi spot. Most rolls we got were good, but The Anzie one (clam) was really memorable. Would recommend to try at least once.

Best sushi place I have ever been to. Went here for my birthday tonight and last year can never go wrong. Service is a bit slow but is expected, you can see the chefs out in the open making the sushi fresh in front of you. Ordered some appetizers; edamame, mikado salad, dumplings both shrimp and vegetable. Of course lots of sushi rolls. Since it was my birthday they also brought me like six different kinds of ice cream with chocolate to put on top.

For us, this is best Japanese fusion restaurant. Fish selection is always fresh and the quality is always of the highest standard. Staff is nice, chef super friendly. My fav dishes: sashimi plate, salmon skin salad, salmon/tuna royal, uni nigiri, scallop super sweet and fresh at all time, hotate with plum sauce, ask the chef special “fuji hand roll” (not on the menu but they know what it is) super awesome cone with lots of tasty fish no rice. Must end your experience with “chocolate moelleux” for dessert, excellent. Always feel like home here.

Amazing high end sushi. If you're not worried about racking up a good bill, this is one of the best spots in Montreal. They hold sea urchin (uni) on their regular menu, and sometimes get special cuts like "Toro" tuna. Ask for their current specialties. It's also very much a family business, and if you're lucky enough to have the younger son as your waiter, you will witness first hand how much passion goes into making this restaurant a Montreal institution.

formatted_address: 7880 Rue Sherbrooke E, Montréal, QC H1L 1A5, Canada
name: Brasserie Champlain

reviews.text: Perfect for small gathering. Not very expensive
Nice atmosphere! Live music! Great prices! Awesome staff!
Very nice, it was quiet but a good place to relaxe and sit back n enjoy the good ol' hockey game, maybe during the playoffs next year
Cheap bear, need to say more?
Ok

formatted_address: 1810 Route des Rivières #402, Saint-Nicolas, QC G7A 2P6, Canada
name: La Boite à Malt

reviews.text:
Microbrewery with craft beers and gastro pub food.  

I knew I would enjoy the experience when I saw a rack of hot sauces.

I had the fried calamari which had a tasty batter and dip.

This was followed by fish and chips which had a nice crispy batter.  You can upgrade your fries to a poutine which is a great deal.  

The staff (William)was amazing and busy...this is a happening place.  The patio seemed to be a great hang-out. 

Definitely would come back.

Fantastic food, amazing beer, great service. I would highly recommend the pulled pork sandwich and pair it with the flight of four beers.  I asked for a random selection for the flights and loved every one.

I've been there a few times with some friends and I must say that I love this place, nice ambiance, very good service and they take care of regular customers. The beer is awesome as well. A must visit if you can.

Great beer brewery pub. Excellent food and beers (granted some of the styles are not my thing) but based on a sampler these folks score big. Food was also very good : personal pizza and pretzel. Wish I could find a solid non - greasy pretzel in the USA! Service was also top notch as we worked through French to English translations.

Kitchen had a problem but our server took care of us. 40 minute for the appetizer to show up then they were out of 3 of our entries.  Visiting from the US but as I said our server kept us informed. Food and beer were great  just timing with kitchen.  If I make it back I would try again

formatted_address: 308 rue Ste-Catherine Est Montréal, H2X 1L7, Québec, UQAM Pavillon J.-A.-DeSève, Montréal, QC H2X 1L7, Canada
name: Ginkgo Café & Bar

reviews.text:
We were thrilled to visit this place for the first time because of the beautiful decor and good ratings, however our first visit left us a little disappointed. 
Upon arrival we asked a table for two, were asked if we had a reservation but we didn’t. So they took us to the far back, in a place that’s outside the restaurant and more on UQAM grounds. As we made our way through the restaurant, many tables were vacant with a “reserved” sign on top.  
It was a little slow to get a server.  We also noticed it was taking time for other tables too.  
Our food tasted ok, with both toasts from eggs Benedict on the burnt side.  Our coffee spoon was poorly cleaned (see picture)
We finished our meal and paid and the indoor tables were still empty.  So why make us sit outside if the tables are going to be left vacant?  We felt this was poor table management from the restaurant. 
Overall there was no love connection.  we felt it was nice to “discover” a new location but we don’t feel as though we would return. 
A generous 3 stars

Decent place for brunch! Prices are pretty high but that's most brunch places nowadays. The menu has some very nice choices and I'm for sure going to come back and try some more things. My cousin and I visited to have a catch up session and it was great! We sat outside, it was a beautiful day, servers were nice, and it wasn't crowded for a saturday morning. 

I ordered the plate that comes with mini crepes, bacon, two eggs, fruits, and mini potatoes. I thought the bacon was really good but the mini potatoes quite ordinary. I got a chocolate dip for my crepe which was an extra charge but it was worth it! I got my eggs poached which was a bad decision because without hollandaise sauce it just tastes kinda weird.

The service was horrible. We went there for brunch and we had a reservation. We get there and the waitress tells us that this is not a fast food place, it’s a restaurant with an arrogant tone. and we were like we know, we made a reservation.The waitress was so arrogant and cold towards me and my friends from that moment. Then, when she was passing by with the menus, she almost cut my friend’s eye with them. we were shocked. The waitress was just looking down on us. We did not feel welcomed there. They really act like they are above everyone else.  The food was not even that good, it was BASIC. I have had better with a much , MUCH better service ! 
Please go somewhere you and your dollar are appreciated !!

Lovely place. Huge windows. Loads of natural light. Food was alright. It was not the best but it was not bad either. I just did not find anything special about it that would make me go back and visit the place over and over again. They accomodate big groups and i find that the menu is very straightforward which i like. Friendly service. Would recommend to a friend.

My favorite spot! I went with my friends to Montreal for the weekend and I'm so glad my friend picked this spot. Everything was delicious and the waiter was super helpful. The mimosas were really good as well. I wish I could remember what everyone ordered but everything was so good! Would come back!

formatted_address: Mile End, Montreal, QC H2V 4H3, Canada
name: Les Gouays

reviews.text: really nice place

formatted_address: 5080 Rue Saint-Ambroise, Montréal, QC H4C 2G1, Canada
name: Brasserie McAuslan

reviews.text: Nice place. Good quality of beer. The food quality is not very high. We had burger and quinoa salad. The atmosphere is good. There is an area for kids to play.

Great place to hang out and drink their amazing beer 🍺 
Nice view with music
It's a really nice place. I'll definitely visit again. Only feedback - service speed could have been faster.

One of the more famous Quebec breweries and available across Canada, I was excited to check this place out and it didn't disappoint. We did the tour, which consisted of a video, tasting, and chat about the beers and brewery. They do open fermentation so we weren't allowed in the actual brewing area.

Note that there's an Annex that is pub-style, and a large Terrace around back next to the river (weather dependent). They seem to serve slightly different beers as the seasonal Maple Ale was only available in the Annex.

My go-to terrasse in the summer on the weekend. Bike or run in via their access to the canal to enjoy a frosty cold beer/cider or try them all on the sampler paddle. I wouldn't recommend eating here, though. Food is extremely average.

formatted_address: 217 Rue Saint-Charles Ouest, Longueuil, QC J4H 1E1, Canada
name: L'Gros Luxe Vieux-Longueuil

reviews.text: Very nice ambiance! Lots of people at night and cozy place to expend with friends and loved ones. Simple menue, not a lot of options but great options which makes it easier to choose from. I like this chain to come once in a while. Can't never go wrong!
Tasty quality food with fair prices.  Enjoyed everything we ordered

Unfortunately after waiting at the restaurant for half an hour we had to leave because the rest of our group couldn’t find parking.The staff was very understanding and our waitress was very nice and patient.  We didn’t have the chance to try the food but the prices are very reasonable. I look forward to coming back!
Awesome menu and wonderful service but a little too loud.
Great restaurant but we did have a little misshap with the waitress. We got double what we ordered, but they fixed thay and we had a great night. Try the tater tot poutine!

formatted_address: 1874 Rue Jean-Talon, Montréal, QC H2E 1T6, Canada
name: Cafe Expresso Lina

reviews.text: Excellent for watching games with group of friends
Great coffee at good prices, friendly staff.
Good service. European soccer matches on the big screen.
Very good ice cream and good service
I enjoyed the music. It was very spacious. The staff was very friendly

formatted_address: 5515 Av de Monkland, Montréal, QC H4A 1C8, Canada
name: Restaurant Mikado Monkland

reviews.text: Best sushi in NDG, Sushi man is the best! I love the quality of the fish and the ambiance when you sit at the bar.
Always fresh and delicious with some really unique rolls.  A personal favourite for many years!

We enjoyed our dinner here. We had some sushi as well as one main dish. All were fresh and tasty. Reason for rating is that it was very expensive, as sushi tends to be, but still... It was good, but we weren't blown away and it's not an outing we can afford on a regular basis.

It was my first time at this location. The food was delicious. They do have lunch specials available as well. We went a la carte. The miso soup was tasty and a nice portion. We tried the appetizer tuna tempura. It was good but not spectacular for the price or serving size. The sushi and sashimi were all melt in your mouth fabulous. The service was also very good. It is a pricey lunch but well worth it. If you are having a sushi craving it is probably the best in the area.

Love this sushi spot in MDG. The quality is always on point. Note there are some sushi roles not on the traditional menu worth ordering: the MDG roll and Ashley Roll are some of the best in my opinion. Get the sorbet/ice cream desert served on a artist pallet. Always a good time here.

formatted_address: 2325 Rue de l'Université Local 1312, Québec, QC G1V 0A6, Canada
name: Le Pub Universitaire

reviews.text: It is recomended , specially on wednesdays for its super cheap wings, so delicious, but a little bit crowded on wednesdays

I was very appreciative of the staff there. I am mainly English speaking and they were very accommodating in helping me with the menu, amd making me feel welcome. The chicken burger tasted very fresh, and it was delicious. The fries were perfect. Thank you.
Great food and a good ambiance

Nice bar/restaurant that serves decent food with decent beer and good service. It's well situated for getting there by bus, though the parking options are limited for cars unless you pay for a spot. The special on wings is what makes this place shine for me: 25 cents per wing from 5pm till 10pm? Sounds like a deal to me! Awesome place at night too: it becomes a decent dance club/ bar later on in the night. Only downsides are the long waiting lines and small dancefloor. Apart from these, it's quite enjoyable.
Really low prices for cocktails! Not a super high class crowd, but pretty fun people. Recommend for an inexpensive good time. Ok  music.

formatted_address: 862 Rue Sainte-Catherine E, Montréal, QC H2L 2E3, Canada
name: Station des Sports - Centre Ville Est

reviews.text: Super nice breakfast pub spot! The food was ok, took the healthy option but still cake with fried potatoes. Otherwise eggs were done to perfection and were tasty. Somehow people that sat after us and ordered their food after us got served before us... which was not really nice.

Good place to catch the game if you're in town, they got TV's galore!! The entire menu is in French, and I ordered the nacho (not sure why), guess I was pretty toasted lol. Majority of my dude's ordered wings so after I finishing the nachos I ordered wings as well. The wings we're 🔥🔥🔥, I would have been pretty salty if I had had them.

There's nothing too special about Sport station, it's your classic TV filled bar with a lot of tables. It's good for a night out with friends centered around sports. The food is average and has everything you would expect from a bar like this.

I love this place. A lot of service., beers and great food. A bit pricey but worth it all the way.
There are tv screens on each wall everywhere so if you like sports you have it.
Really accessible, close to the metro.

We were there last year during FIFA. It was exciting.  We had the best nachos - the chips tasted like popcorn.  Today things were not so good.  The place was dead - very few people and golf was on the TV's.  The nachos were OK but  were made with different chips - they did not taste like popcorn.  The chips were heavier and slightly greasy.

formatted_address: 195 Rue Saint-Vallier O, Québec, QC G1K 1J9, Canada
name: Brasserie Griendel

reviews.text: Brewery was excellent! Lots of house-brewed beers and guest brews. Waiters/bartenders are friendly and ready and willing to put up with your requests to practice your (admittedly broken) French! Wonderful experience and very cool atmosphere
Great place to have a beer. Their beer selection is great. The food is okay and a bit pricey for what you get. The ambiance is also very nice.

We started with the charcuterie board which was delicious. They only give you a few tiny pieces of bread and charge you $2 more for extra... the tiny pieces of bread were definitely not enough to go with the charcuterie board. Other than that the other food was delicious. We had the fish and chips and the peach salad. The peach salad portion was a bit on the small end.

Great spot in Quebec City. Really good burger, loved the beers and laid back atmosphere. The place also got great light in the afternoon, and they had a wheelchair accessible bathroom, no stairs required.
The beer (kolsch) and the burger I had were excellent. Their poutine is also delicious

formatted_address: 5121 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2T 1R9, Canada
name: Hollandaise - Breakfast/Brunch - Smoked Meat Burgers - Wine Beer Cocktails

html_attributions: Hollandaise - Breakfast/Brunch - Smoked Meat Burgers - Wine Beer Cocktails
Hollandaise - Breakfast/Brunch - Smoked Meat Burgers - Wine Beer Cocktails
Hollandaise - Breakfast/Brunch - Smoked Meat Burgers - Wine Beer Cocktails
Hollandaise - Breakfast/Brunch - Smoked Meat Burgers - Wine Beer Cocktails
Hollandaise - Breakfast/Brunch - Smoked Meat Burgers - Wine Beer Cocktails
Hollandaise - Breakfast/Brunch - Smoked Meat Burgers - Wine Beer Cocktails

reviews.text:
Well done, Hollandaise team for days!

We liked -- nay -- loved our experience here. Shout out to the great service and affordable, delicious food. Clean washrooms are always a plus. Would recommend!

Sincerely, 
Alex and friends

I really enjoyed this restaurant, the variety of dishes is incredible and the prices even more.
 
I ordered the eggs Benedict Greek, I can say that they are experts in hollandaise sauce. My husband ordered the breakfast combo 2 and we really fell in love.

The table next us ordered a sweet crepe and the smell was so irresistible, we ordered the nutella pancake and melted marshmallows, It was the perfect ending.
Friendly staff. $8 for crepe, and $12 for main course in photo. Fresh pressed orange juice avaliable. Lots of variety and selection.
Benedictine eggs are delicious here! Great service. (And it's Spanish-friendly as well)
Very good place for breakfast and launch.food is very affordable and delicious.highly recommend.everything homemade and fresh,will go with family and friends soon👍👍👍👍

formatted_address: 1315 Rue Sainte-Catherine E, Montréal, QC H2L 2H4, Canada
name: Bar Aigle Noir

reviews.text: One of my favourite bar in Montreal. Staff is really friendly, beers are quite cheap and the general atmosphere is nice.

Very busy place. Good beer selection. The staff is very polite and friendly. Promotions are often held here, if you sign up for 909gay,com and create a profile, you can get a free private room for 2 hours and a free cocktail.

Not a bad place physically. Have patio in summers. Drinks are not expensive either. However compared to other places such as le stud, I find people at this location to be a little more pretentious. There is also less diversity in their customer base. I have witnessed many times how bartenders serve certain people first, some others have to wait. There is a pattern. I generally try to avoid this place and go there only when my friends insist.

Great bar. Staff were really friendly and helped us decide what to do later. The atmosphere in the bar was really friendly and lots of energy and good music. Loved the decor and with an open patio ... A perfect place to stop.
Such a great bar, nice vibes and they play Disney movies!

formatted_address: 2471 Rue Notre-Dame Ouest, Montréal, QC H3J 1N6, Canada
name: September Cafe

reviews.text: This is my second time at this cafe, and I always leave impressed. I love their space. I love the simple interior decor, and I love the chill music. I love the benches, the outdoor patio, and the long shared-space table. They have amazing iced lattes, and their pancakes are delicious and filling. Do not miss this spot if you’re in Montreal!

Bitter espresso-milk balance finely tuned, but the taste is quite random. Amazing taste, with good, stylish ambiance within, which aren't enough covers for the room for improvements in regards to customer service. By all means, great takeout place.

I work nearby and have been there about ten times in the past 8 months. Yes, sometimes crowded. Not their fault people like them and tend to hang out intently working on laptops, etc. It is a nice space. Coffee is excellent - especially enjoy the flat white. Food is surprisingly good. Breakfast sandwich is tastier than it has any right to be with the simple ingredients. Haloum, green apple, kale, etc. toast is very good as are the various bowls. If you don't have an issue with the crowds, you can ignore the haters.

Love this coffee shop! Delicious food and great coffee. However, computers are not allowed on weekends, which is good to catch up with friends but not ideal for people looking to work in such a nice environment.

Location at 1700 St Patrick.....wow. Just got charged $5 for a latte and they wouldn't give me more oat milk to fill up the remaining of my portable cup... Can't believe it.
Location at Notre Dame has way better customer service

formatted_address: 4177 Rue Saint-Denis 2e étage, Montréal, QC H2W 2M7, Canada
name: Bar La Shop

reviews.text: Really great place - nice music, nice staff, place to dance with good sound and good music and place to sit and hang out / play pool or foosball as well.  The availability of free ice-cold water is AMAZING; super appreciated! Drinks are really reasonably priced. Really friendly and relaxed, great crowd - people are there for the music and to dance/hang out with friends, not like some places with dress codes and expensive drinks where they won't let you in if you're wearing comfortable running shoes for dancing, they charge you for water, and everyone is on their phone all the time, only smiling when they're taking pictures of themselves (which is near-constantly). I'm glad people who want that have their places to go, and that I don't have to go to those places, because there are places like Bar La Shop!

They have an Art battle event every month! It is sensational!!! Drinks are in good price and atmosphere here is great.

The art battle event is few artists have 20mins free drawing time and battle for 3rounds, you can bid the painting you like after as well.
We went to an improv show and we loved it. We could bring our food and eat there and the drinks were nice.

The night I went there was amazing!

I wasn't expecting so much friendliness among the crowd, that was a big surprise.  How the people would actively talk and laugh with each others.  

This was definitely a game changer for stress relief on a week day!  Tuesday August 6th to be more precise.

The music was really good, DjNee rocked that place with quality beats and bounces!

I never thought I would end up in a place with so much energy on a random working day like that.  I usually stay home and focus for work.

But I needed that stress relief and got way more than expected!

Big ups to those who made that evening and made me discover a jewel in french electronic music, in the person of DjNee, an amazing performance from a girl that will live long to make more happy music enthusiastics like me !  

Alas I hope so! :-)
Awesome bar cheap drinks great staff and a wicked sound system every once and a while for special events. Much love great place!

formatted_address: 1333 Rue Sainte-Catherine E, Montréal, QC H2L 2H4, Canada
name: Saloon Bistro Bar Inc

reviews.text:
Nice place to go for breakfast or brunch on weekends.  The food is consistent over the years and you know what to expect.  It is also a good place for lunch in the Summer when the terrace is open.
The staff is also friendly so over all a strong ratio of quality - price.

Saloon is our first stop when we get into town.  We love stopping in for lunch and a cocktail or two before checking in to our Airbnb.   It's right on St Catherine's.  The food is always consistently good.  I have noticed the menu changes often.   This time I had their salmon tartar with salad.  It was delicious.  It's served on stone slate with a side of bread chips.   The salmon was fresh and very nicely seasoned and prepared.  The salad was good with slightly too much dressing.   I'll ask for it on the side next time.   It came with a very good vegetable soup.  The quesadilla was good as well.  Nice size and well prepared.  The service is always welcoming and the atmosphere is fun and relaxed.  They have a full bar.   During the spring and summer months they have plenty of outdoor seating to people watch.   Saloon is never a miss.

Great food! Menu options are diverse and good portions sizes. Particularly impression with the duck drumsticks, vegetarian lasagne, salmon grill and Chinese stir-fry. 

Table service was attentive and friendly. The atmosphere was fun and buoyant.
Very good food and drinks. Great atmosphere and reasonable prices. Service a little quick but location is everything, and the staff are very friendly and bilingual.

Saloon Bistro Bar has long been a staple in the Village. It is worth a visit for the décor and ambiance. There are two levels indoors, and a terrace in the summer. Go here for brunch, dinner, or drinks. The menu is extensive, and updated every so often. When there is a lineup, it moves quickly. Not quickly enough for a bad date though. Go with friends ;)

formatted_address: 1433 Rue City Councillors, Montréal, QC H3A 2E4, Canada
name: Biiru

reviews.text: Really cool restaurant. Always busy but cozy. The food offerings are very interesting and delicious. Staff is very friendly and prompt. I would definitely recommend anything on the menu. One of my favourite Japanese restaurants in Canada 🇨🇦.

Very good place, food is fresh and delicious. We were a big group with predefined menus, and the organization and service was a bit fuzzy, but quite acceptable in these circumstances. I will definitely try again but in smaller groups.

Salmon was amazing!

Small cozy Japanese restaurant in the heart of Downtown ! Their plates are like tapas , they are meant to share, but portions are very generous ! Fresh fish and meat with great seasoning and spices ! My husband and I shared everything and we were so full after these 5 plates. My least favorite was the dumplings, but this is my personal opinion, because in general I prefer dumplings steamed . The ramen salad was delicious and refreshing!  Loved our time there ! Will visit soon !

One of the best restaurant experiences I’ve had! Great food and the service was better than expected. The staff really take pride in their job of creating an exceptional environment for everyone to enjoy their dishes. Will come back every time I visit the city. Cheers!

Want good Japanese food, go here! They are great, with great staff and good food. Lunches can take awhile but if you have the time it's really good!
I'm in love with their ramen soup, but they only have when it's cold.

formatted_address: 6656 Rue Beaubien E, Montréal, QC H1M 3B3, Canada
name: Bar Jo

reviews.text:
Realy like this place,
Nice food and awesome people👍
Great prices great service
Awsome food, great place, good price and super barmaids...
Good service, friendly there's parking in evening kitchen is opened.
Good place to have above average quality comfort food and a beer.  Great for sports fans - multiple screens.  A Cage Aux Sports type place, just smaller and more intimate.

formatted_address: 858 Rue Sainte-Catherine E, Montréal, QC H2L 2E3, Canada
name: Stereo

reviews.text:
Staff members are amazing! Very helpful and you can tell they are caring.  Everyone needs to be very careful with their drinks, no matter how hard staff is trying to keep drugs out, people find a way to get them in and some of those people will try to drug you.  So everyone have fun and be careful. And always be nice to the staff 
!
Absolutely the best place in Montreal for techno music culture ! And also Best after in city !

Great place to finish off your night dancing till wee hours in the morning. 

The sound system is incredible and the dance floor is great. Although I’m not so much into  techno/deep house, the DJs were pretty sweet. Or I guess the sound system made up for it. 

Only giving it 4 stars because the guy:girl ratio was pretty terrible.

This is the best Afterhours club I've ever been to. Such a rare commodity in North America and many that remain pale in comparison to Stereo in terms of quality and overall design. No other spot with a similar capacity has sound this good. Hats off to the staff and owners for keeping the club running well.
An experience like no other! Best sound system, acoustics, music, artists, and crowd...there's simply nothing like it elsewhere! There's no place like (((home)))

formatted_address: 2440 Rue Fleury E, Montréal, QC H2B 1L3, Canada
name: Bar Rosso Nero

reviews.text: Great place everyone is extremely nice and welcoming
Very average bar
Great bar with great ambience and great service
Sympathique et convivial. Je recommande!

Salade césar et poutine excellentes!
Très bons choix de boissons!!!
Verdict génial, tout comme l'ambiance à chaque fois que j'y vais!

formatted_address: 3422 Rue Notre-Dame Ouest, Montréal, QC H4C 1N9, Canada
name: Caffè Farina

reviews.text: Caffè Farina is an adorable café with beautiful decor, amazing service and incredible food! The waitress was very kind and checked up on us frequently to make sure everything was okay. We have been on vacation for the past few days and this is the best food we’ve eaten this week by far! Definitely recommend coming here.
Great experience! The food was delicious and service was very good. The cheesy fries are soooo good. Nice relaxed and cute vibe. I'll be back!

Caffè Farina is a little gem of St Henri. A perfect brunch spot if you're not quite in the bacon and eggs mood. It's rare in Montreal to find a place that has reasonable but delicious pasta dishes, like their cavatelli or mafalda that we thoroughly enjoyed, for less than 15-16$ a plate. 

One thing that earned a star removed - the service when arriving left a bad taste in our mouths. At the front, like most places, there's a sign saying to await being seated. Unfortunately for us, we waited... And waited... And waited. Without being acknowledged, or at least waved at, by one member of staff. A line even formed behind us at 2 in the afternoon on a Saturday, when there were less than 3 full tables in the restaurant, and the waitress behind the bar had finished serving a client and apparently started taking stock. We took it upon ourselves after a 7 minute wait, to walk in ourselves and the waitress explained another waitress was in the back and caused the wait. But I definitely suggest removing their sign if the wait-staff won't be looking to the door to seat new patrons (a few of the liner-uppers behind us left to find another restaurant while waiting unacknowledged).

Overall the atmosphere is relaxed and well thought out, and the food delicious. The service left something to be desired, but sometimes it's well worth it if the food is just that good.

Coffee is really well done. The weekend brunch is delicious and reasonably priced. They have a good mix of salty and sweet options and not too many choices to get overwhelmed. The Parmesan potatoes are a must! The space is cozy and modern. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

The food and menu selection is tops.. very good dishes, creative and innovative with dishes of the month.  Very nice place, cozy modern with flair.  Service could be a little better tho, a little slow

formatted_address: 856 Rue Sainte-Catherine E, Montréal, QC H2L 3T1, Canada
name: StereoBar

reviews.text: It cost 30$ per person, the music was way too loud and the music was ultra repetitive like the same beat for 20 minutes none stop. I really feel you need to be drunk or on drugs to enjoy this place. The bathrooms were absolutely disgusting. Don't even bother to go here.m.just go to the club until 3 am. I left after 30 minutes... really disappointed
Awesome club, the after hours spot is also great. Great music, great sound, we'll ventilated. Love it!
Great club!! Awesome music and sound. Laid back crowd and cheap amazing size drinks. Never been to a club where they serve such large size drinks for such a reasonable price! Definitely recommend!!
I need new feet because of this place! Great jams.
Great place to have fun! The sound is perfect. Very nice ambience :)

formatted_address: 1439 Blvd. Shevchenko, LaSalle, QC H8N 1P2, Canada
name: Barcode

reviews.text:
Great place to enjoy a couple of drinks
The owner is really cool 
Highly recommended
The vibe of the bar is amazing !

owner was rude, bartender was a snot, vibe was killed instantly. 
seriously not pleased at all. would not recommend.

Grenat place great food.
The owners are fun To talk and have fun whit .  best time To go is Every day is a good day 😃
Wings are the best.. cheese sticks are amazing !!

formatted_address: 327 Rue Saint-Laurent Ouest, Longueuil, QC J4H 1M5, Canada
name: Resto-Pub Chez Vincent

reviews.text: Nice place on a corner with outside seating.  The menu had a variety of choices.  I had the hamburger steak.and escargot with cheese.  Both were to my liking.  A nice wine list was provided with a variety of cocktails and beer.  The service was wonderful.  When they realized we spoke English, they were able to accommodate.

This restaurant is my favorite. I eat in many restaurants but to this place I go the most. The team is very helpful and the cuisine they offer is so fresh and tasty. I am always happy to have a good dinner in this restaurant. I recommend this place with pleasure.
Good food good prices great service
Great prices on beer and food. The all you can eat mussels are to be tried. They also have great home fries!

It was ok.  Soup was cold, chicken entree was obviously store bought.   Too loud, lights too bright.  Main dish was ok, waitress super nice.   Next time I come in the summer for a 5-7 instead.  I was disappointed with the food 😕

formatted_address: 1603 Rue Ontario E, Montréal, QC H2L 1S5, Canada
name: Grenade - Resto-bar et terrasse

reviews.text:
Grenade is such a fun bar! Very trendy and hip. 

I like their theme nights, I went to a full moon party there once and they were serving these bucket drinks, they were great. 

They also have nice snacks and a good beer selection. 

Service is quick and everyone is very nice.

I recommend!

Had a really great experience here the staff was super friendly, spoke english and French. I loved the vibe of the place, for a Tuesday it was really bumping. Good beers on tab along with cocktails. Food is really good the ramen was great.

If you are looking for an AMAZING poutine go here!! The 5 spice chicken poutine is something I will now crave forever. Also the dumplings were crazy good. Service and atmosphere were great. Lacking was the cocktail menu unfortunately. The options were limited and upon asking I was told they were singles and if I wanted to make it a double they would have to charge me for 2 drinks! $22 for a double is awful. Cocktails should be doubles and if they are not the upcharge to make it one should not cost more than a shot which was $4 for their well tequila.

Really fun time while watching the final of the World Cup. Worth noting that reservations are necessary when a big event like this one is happening. We had their bottomless mimosas along with the Saigon Toast. It was so good! Jean Sebastien was super chill and took care of us while we watched the game. Very enjoyable experience, would totally come back!
The bar is nice and has good drinks. Also they have amazing food!

formatted_address: 4606 Rue Notre-Dame Ouest, Montréal, QC H4C 1S4, Canada
name: Cordova

reviews.text: Very nice drinks and the tapas are amazing. Nice decor and great service too.
Really nice cafe/ tapas bar.  Tasty food. Amazing drinks and of course, good coffee.
Fave place in the city. Staff is like family! Would recommend.
I popped in for a latte and decided to grab a bite. Polenta bolognese + salted padrón peppers. Such perfect comfort food. They complimented one another beautifully. And great service as usual.

Quaint coffee shop/bar with a nice array of cocktails.
I was impressed by every drinks we ordered.

formatted_address: 1485 Rue Ottawa, Montréal, QC H3C 1S9, Canada
name: Brasseur de Montréal

reviews.text: The beer was great. The pizza we chose was a bit bland. But overall very welcoming. I would recommend a stop.in if you likeicro brew beer.

We had a birthday party with mostly adults and a few kids16-17. The waiter asked the kid for tips... In the end it was another party member who paid a tip for the kids. My friend only bought an appetizer before leaving and the waiter was like " that's not alot of tips". She was also a kid18-.
Pretty cool place to grab a pint. Prices add up when you eat. I love their Dry Goudy Stout!

Somewhat hidden, but worth seeking out. They have a terrasse during the summer if you want to sit outside, but there's not much appeal -- lots of construction going on this booming part of Montreal. In terms of food and drink, it's top notch. I ordered the brisket and it was on par with anything I've had in Texas. I went during a quiet time, so didn't have a chance to see if the service was slow during peak timea. My experience was first class. The only thing I would suggest would be to improve the menu options for non meat eaters. Maybe a vegan 3-bean chili? And a grilled cheese with onions and apple?
Good service and good food. Portions are good and prices are reasonable.

formatted_address: 3435 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2X 2T6, Canada
name: Mundo Lingo Tuesday

reviews.text: I went a couple of weeks ago to practice a little bit of English. To be honest, I spoke more in Spanish, however, I found some friendly folks there. So, I can say that this is a good place.
Friendly and nice place, good service but as far as Mundo Lingo is concern... nothing much happening, maybe because it is summer but I will try it again later in the year!
Friendly, regular, lots of people old and new. Best language exchange events I've tried so far.

Great! Love the idea ! People are open and interesting! 
You can make friends from all over the world and you can talk tothem in their native language!

This event is so great to keep practising languages and meeting new cool people from all over the world. I always find someone interested in exchangins some spanish for italian, portuguese or french. I love it. Its every tuesday night and its my favorite excuse to go out on a weekday.

formatted_address: 2332 Boulevard Edouard-Montpetit suite c-1509, Montréal, QC H3C 3J7, Canada
name: Les bars tendres

formatted_address: 2020 Rue Crescent, Montréal, QC H3G 2B8, Canada
name: Jet Night Club

reviews.text: i was there for NYE, not sure what some people are complaining about however i got served all night.. there was alcohol flowing till closing time. ambiance was great, DJ's were on fire people people were having fun .. I will admit that the dance floor was wet however its NYE, come on guys, its to be expected.. As for the tips situation, i found it odd at 1st as well  that they would ask for tip money however the bartender explained to me that service wasn't included and as someone who works in the hospitality business, i get it, that's how these people make their money..  all in all good job guys

I liked the fact that you could party and dance downstairs but if you wanted a break you could go upstairs and sip a beer where the music is less loud. The staff was also friendly. The 10$ minimum  for credit is unnerving. Also, the floor was sticky.

This club made me feel very unsafe and very uncomfortable. The doorman is SUPER rude. The poor guys in front of me had a turbin on their head and were told they could not go in the club. If you’re not a woman they charge you $15 plus another $12 for a coat check. Everyone in this club looks like they’re 16 years old. If you’re an American RUN RUN RUN away. They’re many other better clubs. Do your research. Also, I bet they pay people to give a five star review. DONT GO TO THIS CLUB.
Went there as part of a uni reading week tour, and it was great. Staff was friendly, music was really good, and all around a great experience. $3 coat check also was a bonus.

Went to Jet for NYE and it was not something I would ever pay for again. The tickets were completely over priced for an open bar that you could only get certain drinks. The bartenders were rude, and would only serve you if you were giving them a tip. And if the tip wasn’t enough they wouldn't give you your drink. They completely over sold tickets to the point where you couldn’t even walk. Not something I would experience again. Don’t waste your money on one of their events.

formatted_address: 809 Rue Ontario E, Montréal, QC H2L 1P1, Canada
name: Le Cheval Blanc

reviews.text: Great place for delicious craft beer and classy/safe dive bar. Guaranteed to hear The Smiths or New Order in the background. I’ve had beers here for more than 25 years and it’s always been an amazing place to go to, a bone fide institution. Hope that Cheval Blanc has at least another 25 years ahead, with little or no change!

Bar tender was cute. We came here with our 'Passport En Fut' ... Which I suggest looking into of you like microbreweries.  The bartender wasn't very helpful with picking the beer tho... Just showed us the menu.  Great atmosphere tho! Beautiful patio out front! I recommend this place. I enjoyed a pint of the blonde lager.
Classic place for a good beer. Cool snacks and amazing vibe. Cool bar and plenty of room for you. The beers are tight, the pickled cheese was incredible and their nachos were good stuff.

Cheval blanc is in my opinion one of the top microbreweries in the country. Original, jaw-dropping beers at a ridiculous price, all in a congenial, jovial atmosphere. This place convinced me not to give up booze.
Among the best breweries in town. You will get a miss beer once in a blue moon but generally the quality is high. Try the 4% stout if on tap.

formatted_address: 4560 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2T 1R3, Canada
name: JackRose

reviews.text: Nice ambience, friendly staff but you need to make a reservation to get a nice table

We came on a Sunday night which they have the oysters event for a 1$each . First of all , the staff were super friendly and welcoming.  The service was efficient and fast.  The oysters were good quality . The food was as good. We had the filet mignon tataki....Delicious ! Super tender it melted in your mouth.  The chef was so awesome that he made me a special  batch of caramelized onions for me because I'm diabetic and they usually put honey . I didn't even ask , he offered and my Angus burger was fantastic . Oh and can't forget the beautiful and trendy decor .
Saw they served brunch so tried it out and I liked it. Will be back again soon.

The music they play is really good for dancing!
Not all the bottles that they offer are one the menu.

Service was awesome! The food was good. I ordered the burger Angus, find it a bit salty but the 1$ oysters were pretty good. We had 4dozens! Good company, good food, good experience! Will recommend! 👍🏼

formatted_address: 2187 Rue du Souvenir, Montréal, QC H3H 1R9, Canada
name: VIP Montréal

reviews.text: Only ever been outside it but I actually had a really wonderful time. There was parking right out front. Do yourself a favour and go there on a Monday around noon, you're in for a treat.

I can never stay away from this place. But really, somehow I always end up here. I've always ended up enjoying my time spent at VIP and each one has been a memorable experience. Only once was I let down when they were out of chocolatines but I was offered a free croissant for the inconvenience. I would recommend this club to my friends if I had any. Will definitely go again.

I had a great experience at VIP Montréal. I stopped by on my way back to Toronto from Saguenay. I showed up in the afternoon and stayed there all day and night. The staff was very welcoming. One of them even took me and my friends out to eat and watch a live concert in downtown! 10/10 would recommend.

Overall this place was enjoyable but there was a serious lack of seating in the dining area. I had to stand the whome time and order my drink several times. The bartender in the ratty Hershey hat rolled me a beer on the floor. It was covered in hair but atleast it was cold! Beer is beer after all, you should check this place out! Open 24/7 in the back, they will let anyone in if you ask nicely.
Thought I lost myself, but I was wrong...  I let go of all my failures and regerts. Couldn't be happier in this age of sexual enlightenment and emotional blossoming

formatted_address:
10888 Chemin de la Côte-de-Liesse
Lachine
QC H8T 3C3 Chemin de la Côte-de-Liesse, Lachine, QC H8T 3C3, Canada
name: MVIII Bistro Bar

reviews.text: Couple things to note.  Typical bar food...had the wings and the poutine...solid. No complaints on food quality.  This place is hidden in the back of a Holiday Inn Express, found it via my typical google maps recon.  I didn't notice any signage, but it's off the main lobby on the back right. The bartender/waitress was hard working and made sure everyone was happy. Glad I found it... (:
Great little place tucked away in the hotel. They have a tiny kitchen but the food quality is spot on! Friendly staff and nice decor... Lots of big screens if you like sports and good sound system.
I was pleasantly surprised at the good service and food.  The food prices are good.  The thing I wasnt expecting was the cost of my rum and coke costing almost as much as my meal ($11).
Different management since that one bad review. Don't pass this place up! Cozy atmosphere, good food, friendly bartender/host.
Got food poisoning from the under cooked fish. Still frozen in the middle. Don't order the fish and chips!

formatted_address: 8600 Boul Langelier, Saint-Léonard, QC H1P 2Y7, Canada
name: Café Victoria's

reviews.text: Great place to go for a bite or just to have a coffee, the staff is fantastic and very professional! Highly recommend! Thank you again! Definitely going back! :)
My friend from Greece loved it
I have Been coming here for years the quality of service never diminishes. Great restaurant.
Very well managed.pleasant staff.exellent pub food especially   "espresso cafe "
Great stop for a good lunch. Nice choices and fresh food.

formatted_address: 1432 Rue Crescent, Montréal, QC H3G 2B7, Canada
name: Authority Nightclub

reviews.text: I stopped there for my 20th birthday. It was the worst club I have even been. Let me explain why I do not recommend this nightclub. First, the bouncers in the street entrance told us that for all the girls in our group it would be 10$. In addition, the girls would have access to the open bar and that it was 5$ for each boy. We ended up trying it. When we got the the coat check, we were told that it was 10$ for every girl, being there on the moment we payed. Once inside, the given drinks were diluted and the bartenders denied us from having the alcoholic drinks because it was "free". The atmosphere inside was dead only 5 people were dancing, later they left and we were the only clients in the club. If you searching for a place to drink and   with a good "vibe" this is not the place to go.

It's a nice venue  that I discovered tonight. 
Be prepared to wait to get served at the bar because it took me and other people more than 10-15 minutes to be able to order a drink. One of them was just ignoring us, too busy to drink shooters with other clients who came to the bar after us. Thank God for the other one who was super nice and professional. 

It'd be good to put some Air Conditioning so we can breathe a little. I understand that you want people to buy drinks, but come on..  I was sweating without even moving.

Security: few were unprofessional,  but its not all if them (one thirsty, one of them wad ignoring us when we were talking to him).
Nice place but a lil bit small. Good music tho.

Parce qu'on ne peut pas mettre 0 étoile. Nous étions 6 dans le club un samedi soir, le staff était plus nombreux que les clients... La musique est vraiment limitée et le prix des consommations est atrocement cher. 10$ pour une bière en bouteille, c'est juste inadmissible! et l'intérieur fait très vetuste pour un nouveau club... passez votre chemin!

Because we can't rate 0 star. We were 6 at the club, nobody dancing and there was more staf than clients... Music was not good and the price of the drinks was so expensive. 10$ for a bottle of beer... it's unacceptable! The inside was old and with no personnality... Run away fom this place!

formatted_address: 1112 Rue Sainte-Catherine O, Montréal, QC H3B 1H4, Canada
name: Club 6/49

reviews.text: Fun place to come and dance, plenty of people at all levels who come to dance. The only thing I wasn’t too fond of was the waiter who insisted I tip him after giving him a tip once already. After bringing around the second round of drinks he just stood there and said “are you not going to tip me?”. Aside from that it’s a decent place.
Great place, great vibes, enough space to dance. Just about the corner is a salsatheque, but there was absolutely no space to dance.
The black girl and man at coat check are very rude...

My friend and I went on a Monday night where they give salsa lessons, for the price of 7$ at the door. The class and teacher were really fun. However, they kept my bottle of water at the door, and the owner/bartender wouldn't give us glasses of water when we asked, even after we purchased a bottle of water for the astronomical price of 4$. And on top of that, there is only hot water in the bathroom. Would definitely not go back.
Took the bachata lesson here and everything was explained in a way we understood and it was really fun.

formatted_address: 364 Rue de la Commune E, Montréal, QC H2Y 1J3, Canada
name: Terrasses Bonsecours

reviews.text: I have been once a year in the last 5 years for private party, work event, terrasse evening with friends, it’s always the same... terrible experience and too expensive.  There are so many better places in Montreal.  Would never recommend that place.  It’s all about location, doesn’t mean it has to be terrible though.  Maybe rethink the experience!

Checked out this place for a mid day drink while vacationing in Montreal. We were walking around old Montreal and on a rather cooler day, decided to take a walk around the harbor.

This place is bit of a walk, but the set-up itself is pretty good and it was the 7 of us and we were seated in a Cabana - comfortable seating too.

We ordered some finger food and a few drinks - nothing great about both and we found this place to be a little expensive. Service however was excellent and they have a very friendly and welcoming staff.

Really beautiful sights and had a good vibe and energy from the packed house.  The drinks are very expensive.  Even a simple non specialty beer costs at least 7$.  Definitely more of a tourist trap than for the locals.

Has wine, cocktails but nothing microbrewed

Went for my b-day, the hostess was completely lost didn't understand what was going on (and it wasn't busy) and I had reservations already. 

They also gave my guy friends a hard time cuz of their fanny packs, something about credit card fraud? But all the girls have giant purses that can fit a medium dog... Also I'm pretty sure you don't need a bag for credit card fraud...the bouncer did offer to drive my friends back to the car with the golf cart but if they didn't have a car to put their stuff in, it would have been a very unhappy situation for all. 

Anyway, the vibe is cool the music is good (deep house style) and you're in a good location. The food and drinks are good and well priced especially given the location.

Caution: The unfriendly ignorant hosts that you'll meet at the door are the worst thing you'll encounter there. They act rude and look down to the customers like they own the town ! When you pass them it gets better !!!

We went to terrasses Bonsecours on a Wednesday evening and the place wasn't crowded. Despite that,  since we didn't have a reservation, the "door gals" told us to go and "find a seat at the bar" suggesting we should keep coming back to them to see if a table is available, no need to say we went back several times and they didn't give a damn, talking and flirting among each other ! 

The cocktail is great,  the food is very good and our bartender was nice. The portions are small like appetizer though. The DJ is a good one too.

formatted_address: 5175A Av du Parc, Montréal, QC H2V 4G3, Canada
name: Café Résonance

reviews.text:
What a nice and unique place! It is quiet and contemplative with really interesting jazz playing at a comfortable volume. 

The staff were very friendly and welcoming and the coffee was delicious and beautifully prepared.

This place is incredibly unique and somewhat of a local treasure. The food is all vegan and tastes incredibly fresh (I'm a huge fan of the chili). There are many places to do work during the day and in the evening there's live jazz music in the back.

Great spot with very affordable breakfast and snacks! Vegan and great! Service is also friendly and quick. It gets a little dark because it is in a semi basement. There is a space for music performances which is pretty cool! Overall, I highly recommend.
Enjoyed coffee and a breakfast sandwich at Cafe Resonance. The place is a cafe by day and bar by night. Hip vibe and nice staff. All vegan!
Very nice place! All the workers are very polite and friendly, food is very tasty and it is great spot to work and study! Very impressed! Good job, guys!

formatted_address: 789 Rue Jean-Talon O, Montréal, QC H3N 1S3, Canada
name: Rotisserie Panama

reviews.text: Amazing food! Amazing experience! Amazing team! Special thanks to Louis!❤️ very respectful team and EXQUISITE FOOD! I recommend you this restaurant and you will never regret it! You will want to go there all the time!😂 the portions are equivalent to the price!
Great place to eat for any occasion. Service is always friendly & relaxed. Food is excellent with lots to choose from. Reservations for weekends & special events are best bet. Street parking only.
We came here yesterday, the food is AMAZING. The service was amazing, food came quickly.. it was delicious. 100/100 RECOMMENDED you will not be dissapointed

What a great place to go with your friends and family on a Friday night dinner party. If you look around everyone is pretty much ordering the same dishes, pikilia, fried zucchini and eggplant, saganaki, grilled octopus, horta, sea bass, lemon potatoes, and on the weekend get the roasted lamb. Make sure you leave room for their delicious honey soaked loukoumades. Prices are very reasonable, for 6 of us under $300 including wine. Bravo!
We went as a big group of 40 people, they had no issues accommodating. Service was fast and food was good and well presented. Thank you once again!

formatted_address: 5417 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2T 1S5, Canada
name: Birona Cuisine Méditerranéenne - Wine Bar/Cocktails - Vegan/Vegetarian - Boite a Lunch - Catering/Traiteur

Birona Cuisine Méditerranéenne - Wine Bar/Cocktails - Vegan/Vegetarian - Boite a Lunch - Catering/Traiteur

reviews.text:
The concept of this place is simple. When you order a plate of hummus, it comes with a coleslaw salad and a small pita plate.

They also have salads (make your own or choose from the menu), and sandwiches.

The interior is gorgeous, it's a nice open restaurant with plants hanging and light streaming in. Very clean. 

Service was fast, we were given a number and were able to sit down anywhere we wanted. It took about 5 minutes to get our food after we ordered at the bar.

The hummus was delicious. I got the traditional which is just hummus, tahini, and chick peas. The presentation was beautiful and the portion was more than I could handle. If you try it out, just know it's enough food for two. 

Overall, good food and good portions. I will come back and try the rest of the menu for sure.

Birona is located in the Mile-End (so great place to have a drink after), among other great restaurants. Ballsy move, but they measure up quite nicely. The decor is tasteful, but unpretentious. They have private as well as communal tables. If you go for brunch, I highly recommend the vegetarian.  Plates of beautiful and delicious dishes will line up in an overwhelming, yet exhilarating way. Of course, the hummus is great, but don’t let the « hummus bar » nomenclature stop you. It’s much more than that, and it’s some of the best and comforting food I can think of. Its Mediterranean dishes are simple yet bold and packed with flavours. For those who easily feel intimidated by unfamiliar food, I simply recommend you to let Alon, chef and owner of the restaurant, to take charge of your orders. Really, I couldn’t recommend it more.
Great food ambience and service! Really good brunch on weekends. No credit cards.
Excellent food. Very friendly environment. I highly recommend the 5 plates sample to share.

Good hummus bar in montreal in a great decor and a generally good ambiance. The menus (they have 2 sets) is a bit confusing and requires explanation. We ordered the hummus tasting and though it was generally good, some choices were amazing  (falafel hummus) while other were ok (Iraqi hummus). We also tried the couscous which was very tasty. Quite a few of the tapas on the menu were not available that day which was dissapointing particularly as it was not mentioned beforehand by the staff. The food took quite a bit of time to arrive (30 min) which was a bit surprising. The portions, although they seemed small for the price were quite filling.The staff is nice but lacks a bit in experience and seems a slightly confused. As for the chef he was quite present in the room but busy talking to "les habitués" so unfortunately we could not get a sense of his passion for food unlike what other reviews mention.  All that said the menu is interesting enough that I would visit again to try other items.

formatted_address: 1995 Rue Masson, Montréal, QC H2H 1A5, Canada
name: L'ENTRE-POTS Déjeuner dîner

reviews.text: Love the place. Stayed around this area and has been a very pleasant surprise. Portions are generous, food tastes amazing, fresh orange juice and excellent coffee...
When theres nothing else around . Cheapest on the menu is 16$ for a sandwich on normal bread with a side salad = gentrification power. But it was good. But ill never come back.
One of the most original brunch I have ever eaten! Indian fusion, American and French cuisine make for a great combination at L'Entre-Pots. The naan bread and fried chicken is a must!
So excellent!  Tasty, special and big plates!  Very good service.  Will try to go back when in that neighbourhood.
Love that spot! Pas cher, food is excellent, massive portions  and  customer service A+

formatted_address: 8247 Boul Métropolitain E, Anjou, QC H1J 1X6, Canada
name: La Poule en Feu

reviews.text: Great pub food at a great price! Recommend the family platter for groups.
Very nice! The staff are very friendly, nice decor, a very nice cozy place to enjoy a quiet drink or watch a little tv.
Best portuguese chicken! Very friendly staff 👍🏽
Consistent dishes, chicken grilled to perfection and service is so friendly. Prices are affordable
Took the 1/2 chicken to-go and it was delicious as the rosé sauce from the pasta complemented the chicken nicely too. Pasta was great as well!

formatted_address: 845, Route Marie-Victorin, Saint-Nicolas, QC G7A 3S8, Canada
name: Bar Le Bocage

reviews.text: Très bonne ambiance et beucoup d'espace de quoi être tranquille entre amis ou avec une date 😁

Endroit très convivial, un mélange de jeunes adultes et de plus vieux qui y sont réguliers. Il y une allée de bowling juste à côté du bar, et le vendredi c'est soirée karaoke, donc bien des rires et du plaisir si on se laisse aller un petit peu.
Endroit bien tenue salon de quilles restaurant
Nice place !

formatted_address: 895 Rue De La Gauchetière O, Montréal, QC H3B 2M4, Canada
name: Deli Planet - - Burgers Poutine Smoked Meat Pizza - Wine Bar Cocktails - Loterie Video - Private Parties

html_attributions: Deli Planet - - Burgers Poutine Smoked Meat Pizza - Wine Bar Cocktails - Loterie Video - Private Parties

reviews.text: Stopped at this restaurant while walking to the underground entrance of the Fairmont hotel. The breakfast was delicious and for a great value. Our server was friendly and the service was quick. Highly recommend especially if you’re arriving or leaving by train, its location is convenient.
One of my favourite breakfast places in Montreal.  I'm here at least 4-5 times a month for client meetings or just to meet a friend. Inexpensive and good service.

Excellent food, drinks, and a fantastic staff! I highly recommend this establishment for a quick lunch and I guarantee it would make a great venue for a party. Ask for Marissa or Ruby, they're wonderful!!

Service is good and could be a little bit faster, food is good, decoration is funny and inspired on marvel cartoons kinder supermanish. Room is clean and very big inside,  personnel is professional and respectful. Parking in downtown is difficul. The central station has one and is not cheap. Recommended for anyone passing by the area.
Great pulled pork sandwich! Good happy hour deals. Loved the Long Island tea! Brandi was a fabulous waitress.

formatted_address: 750 Boulevard Crémazie O, Montréal, QC H3N 1A2, Canada
name: Cuizine 80 - Sports Bar - Pizza, Burgers, Subs, Poutine Delivery - Habs games

reviews.text: I live in the area, their food (pizza) is very good...and they deliver!

Tasty food , Great quality , Amazing restaurant , highly recommended .

One of the spots that's open very late and that does delivery . No matter what time at night we order , the food is always hot and fresh.

The crust of the pizza taste like actual homemade dough and pizza. 
The truffle burger and chicken pizza are one of the flavorful items . 

Overall , I would be ordering again .

Keep up the good work

We were pretty disappointed. My sub was really burnt, my onion rings were extremely soggy. It took over an hour for delivery on a sunday at 3am. We threw more than half of our food in the garbage. We won't be ordering here again. Poutine was okay and edible, nothing special. Hot dog was good.
Easy to miss but they make good and fresh food.At night whenever i get hungry and everything is close i call them.
Fantastic restaurant. Food is always hot and fresh when delivered. Amazing customer service. I order from them often. The blue cheese chicken pizza is to die for. 5/5 stars

formatted_address: 1039 Rue Beaubien E, Montréal, QC H2S 1T3, Canada
name: Isle de Garde Brasserie

reviews.text:
Really good and nice place.
We went their because it was the only place serving food at almost 3pm but what a good surprise! 
Short menu but good quality

I found it a bit cramped, but I guess I can't fault them for being popular.

The food was good, and priced-fairly. The beer was also pretty good. The service was on point considering how busy it was.
We'll made beers (especially liked the lagerbier and biervollo). Friendly, welcoming service. Really nice afternoon sampling various styles.
The most delicious truffle fries, and tasty little drinks. Isle de Garde is the perfect spot for a tasty bite, and a soak in the sun on the patio.
