nice space. big selection on draft and wide variety. staff were super friendly. Didn't eat but the food looked good. Instagrammable branding if that's your thing

formatted_address: 993 Boulevard Saint-Martin O, Laval, QC H7S 1M5, Canada
name: Grigio

reviews.text:
Baby friendly restaurant. 

Pretty nice decor, a bring your own wine restaurant you can’t miss, Food is good and well priced :) will definitely come back again.

The service was very good too! 

The only problem were the fruit flies ~ fix that problem and it will be a definitely 5 stars :)

Food was fine. Service a little slow but it’s Saturday night and to be expected. 
What wasn’t acceptable was that as a single dad with a 5 month old I had to ask members of our party to go change my child’s diaper because the only changing table is located in the women’s washroom. Men have kids too, we even change diapers... won’t be going back.
I love this restaurant it is very cozy and the food is delicious, since it is pricey I only go for lunch.

I went there for Lunch. They have Soup to Dessert menu for lunch at below 14 CAD. Very delicious food, great and fast service, good ambience. They have the great and very energetic server named Vince, I didn't need to wait much.

If you want a warm and friendly welcome, you will not get it here. Once seated, we had to wait quite a while before placing our order, in fact we wanted to just get up and leave thinking that they forgot about us. The food when it arrived however was good including the coffee and desert. 
When I paid the bill, I didn't get a thank you and/or come again soon, seems the generous tip was not enough for this waiter. Even though the food was good, I would not go back because of the slow and unfriendly service. I rate the food a 4 star and the service a 1 star.

formatted_address: 5700 Boulevard Industriel, Montréal-Nord, QC H1G 3H9, Canada
name: Brasserie Montréal Nord

reviews.text: Fun place

Horrible place.bad service.
Funeral house has better ambience that this place.
This is a : No Go place.
Good
Low class but cheap cheap cheap
Good staff!

formatted_address: 1415 Rue de la Montagne, Montréal, QC H3G 1Z3, Canada
name: La Société Montréal

reviews.text: Excellent service, refined menu. Lobster rolls and Bagel with Montreal smoked meat were great. They have fresh lobster and know how to let it shine (even as add on to the salad). Desserts are exemplary, lemon meringue tart was so well done. Will visit again
A perfect place to enjoy French food in downtown Montreal. Great food and service! Snail is Highly recommended

This is one of my favorite go to places in the city. When I want a quiet break from the day, I stop here for a rest. The staff is attentive and professional. The ambiance is elegant European bistro. Love it.

Nicely prepared food.  The beef tartare was flavourful.  Cod was tasty.  Generally the dishes were well prepared, and service was friendly.  It was busy when we went (on New Year's Day), but service was not shortchanged.  Prices were reasonable as well.

Delightful vintage atmosphere. Interesting as far as interiore décor. Food-wise  the menu would benefit from a little revamping. Very basic food. I expected something more original. Maybe the place is more popular as an evening hang out than for brunch. Definitely worth visiting even if only for the ambient.

formatted_address: 5760 Avenue Royalmount, Mont-Royal, QC H4P 1K5, Canada
name: Linton Bridge Club

formatted_address: 333 Boulevard Lévesque E, Laval, QC H7G 1C5, Canada
name: Marina Commodore Ltee

reviews.text: Location is decrepit, and building exterior looks like it's about to collapse, but interior ambiance is unique and interesting. Staff attitude and pleasantness is wildcard, with some friendly and some not so much. Cleanliness is okay, nothing to write home about. Marina is well located, individual dock spots are small though.
a nice little bar, reminds me of some roadhouse bar in the us, once your enter the place you don't feel your in Laval anymore.
Its a very quiet place
Basic marina in Pont Viau.
Amazing service, cheap alcool.

formatted_address: 6505 Rue des Écores, Montréal, QC H2G 2J8, Canada
name: Randolph Pub Ludique Rosemont

reviews.text:
This location is great even if it is a bit hard to find, it's really on the corner of the street and the door/sign is not very noticeable. Spacious and they still have a great variety of games and good and drinks. Came here with a friend and we actually played monopoly because we both realized we had never played a full game. We thought it would last longer but at 2 it's really not a very long game. The game masters are great and have great suggestions, we just ended up talking and playing monopoly though.

We were there for 6pm on a Tuesday and it really starts to get packed up around 7-8pm. 

The entree fee is around $7 now but that's not bad for all the games you get to play! 

The food is well priced and you get a lot. The big fries are enough to feed like 5 people, bummer you only get 2 choices of sauces. We got curry and tartar, both great! I also ordered the mac and cheese and it was really good. I wish they would add popcorn to the menu.

First time coming here today - great experience. 

Nice ambiance, lots of games and great food.

There is vegetarian choices on the menu, tons of cocktails, milkshakes, coffees, desserts. Great for lunch & supper.

The employees explain all/any game to you. They can even suggest games if you're not too sure what to play.

Lunch was a great time to come here as it wasn't very busy and employees are more free to answer all your questions. 
As the day goes on it does get busier.

We were a group of 6, but you can also be 2 people to play and have a great time. 

There is also free parking nearby in the residential streets.

This place is a paradise, for people who wants to play with or against friends, the food is awesome, u can have a big glass of sangria for 14$ taxes included. Right now if you go there between monday and Wednesday u can have 50% on the food. Isn't that amazing!? They give a huge amount of food for the price enough for 2 people. I really love to go there with my friends

Amazing place, a must in Montreal if you love board games or looking for something fun. 

I don't know if the menu changed, but it feels so much better now. The food is good and the portions are big. 

I love the space and look of the place, it's really open. The only negative if that there are so many people you can barely hear each other. 

Highly recommend this place and any other Randolph's.

I loved going there with a few friends! The service was great and food, although a bit on the expensive side, was great! Plus if you don't know what to play, they have a crew dedicated to help you and explain the rules of any board game!

formatted_address: 4800 Rue Wellington, Verdun, QC H4G 1X2, Canada
name: Le Baobab Café

reviews.text: A great space to study with good coffee and a rather extensive food menu for a typical cafe. It was a bit chilly inside, although we came in a very cold day!
Excellent coffee place with a friendly space for kids. The staff is friendly and very helpful with recommendations. I enjoy coming here and the vegetarian food is delicious.

Food was ok. Service was ok too. Place doesn't look particularly great.

It's pretty neutral. I'll go back for sure because it's perfect to get work done, but it's kinda bland.

What can I say. I love the place a did a lot freelance work there this summer. But whoever owns it seems to be letting it go. It's often dirty or tables unwashed even when there's 2 staff with no other clients.
Cozy little coffee shop ! It's usually calm and everyone is welcomed there :) Their chai latte is amazing ! It's perfect if you want to work in a cafe

formatted_address: 1701 Rue Lapierre, LaSalle, QC H8N 2M4, Canada
name: Cafe Pete's Bar

reviews.text: Not a great place
Bel endroit gens sympayiques

formatted_address: 5080 Rue Saint-Ambroise, Montréal, QC H4C 2G1, Canada
name: Pub L'Annexe St-Ambroise

reviews.text: If you like stout you have to try their oatmeal stout. It's dark and intense! Well roasted malts gives you aromas of coffee and chocolate, nice and creamy head as well.

Great place. Great food. Great beer. 
A little complicated to get there by public transportation ( 20 mn walk from Place Saint-Henri or Jolicoeur metro station ).
But in despite of that, it worth it! 
There is parking available, though.
Cool pub, relaxing atmosphere. Love that they're open all year so that you can still go to the Annexe when the Terrasse closes after summer.
Quaint, cozy, great service, delicious food, and fun. Its a little gem in St. Henrie, full of history and great beer. Recommend 100%

The staff really takes care of their patrons. They are not short sighted. Winning life long customers is their gsme. The bar is cozy and you can be private. The summer terasse is huge and lively. They also have experimental beers on tap like a maple brown the last time i was there. Dont skip this brewery. Good is fantastic pub fair as well. Atoine took great care of us.

formatted_address: 6500 Boul Henri-Bourassa E, Montréal-Nord, QC H1G 5W9, Canada
name: Obsession Night Club

reviews.text: Have a friend who was working there as a barmaid for 3 months and never got paid. Plus, the ambience is really not that nice. I don't recommand it at all.
This club is very fun. It’s quite nice and feels exclusive. Only wish there was more of a proper dance floor. Warning - many people smoking inside lol.
The newest, hotest club in town !

Endroit où se divertir 

Buffets tres appréciés

Barmaid et acceuil plus que parfait

Carte de membre vient fréquemment en promotion

Menu megabouffe est convenable ; hate de gouter aux sushis obsession 

Côté variété tarifs très abordables

Côté "fesses" y en a pour tous les goûts 

J Adore proprio et personnel t aimes ou t aimes pas ... mais viens faire ton tour meme si t e timide si t as des defauts physiques ... ce club obsession est bâti pour les obsédés du PLAISIR (physique. auditif. gustatif. ... y a des spectacles pour tous âges et goûts)

C est dans la diversité qu offre la belle ville de Montreal que nos portes te sont grandes ouvertes

Spa piscine casier ...

Il ne manque que toi et ta gang ♡♡♡

Bel endroit, nous y avons été pour la première fois un samedi..Gens respectueux , beau décor  et du plaisir selon ce qu'on cherche! ;) il semble avoir des commentaires négatifs louches ici (compétiteurs ou avant les rénos en septembre ?) , nous conseillons de l'essayer par vous-même ! Nous y retournerons...

formatted_address: 150 Rue Bernard O, Montréal, QC H2T 2K2, Canada
name: L'Gros Luxe Mile End

reviews.text:
Cute little brunch spot, it's a chain. Good greasy spoon. Lots of vegetarian options. Almost half the menu is vegetarian. 

Cheap price, service is also good. Our waiter was completely bilingual, because we also switched between English and French.

One little thing is the menu layout is slightly confusing because sometimes the right side has the vegetarian alternative in green, and other times the left and right are completely different. Not a big deal but as a designer, this did confuse me and it took me a little time to understand the menu.

The music is awesome, the food is delicious and affordable. Go if you can! 

I've eaten here a handful of times and never been disappointed.

Absolutely loved the restaurant. The service is great! I have to say that I was very impressed with the service. They were very friendly. The food and drinks came out very fast. The menu is great and it has vegetarian AND vegan options. 

Definitely try the avocado fries. My friends who are not vegan enjoyed the vegan meals!! That says a lot I think. Very cool place to grab a drink and hang out with friends. One of my favourite restaurant!

Food was amazing!! Had several Gluten Free option that tasted great!! Service was moderately lack luster though. Had a great vibe to the place. Just need to work on the service and this place would be a hit!

A gem of a place to be on a Friday lunch! Pulled pork was juicy and so well done! The pickled cabbage was amazing, had a nice crunch and the acid broke the pork richness. The sweet potato fries are must! Forget normal fries get this.. wide selection of beers so you won't get out of here thirsty..a special vege menu as well so it's a win win!

formatted_address: 156 Rue Roy E, Montréal, QC H2W 1M2, Canada
name: Else's

reviews.text: Good place. Their fried chicken taste good and can be really spicy. If you like spicy food I would recommend this place. It's a fast food place so don't expect a lot. Their food is on point. Service is fast. And everything can be really a spicy. Try it out for yourself

My homie's all had food, ribs, orange chicken, salad and spicy chicken wings; I only went to drink. I ordered the house stout, but of my favorite drink was the Gin & Tonic. I've never really liked Gin & Tonic but they make them pretty well, and they have a happy hour where you get 2 drinks for $11; can't beat that!!

Else’s is a hidden treasure, you have to know that it exists in order to find it. One block from busy Saint-Laurent boulevard, and with all the enchantment of Le Plateau. Great drinks and great food. The decor is very unique and very Montreal.

Big windows, everything is hand painted, great history, great staff, great food, great booze list, plants everywhere and lots of style. Oh and the prices are amazing. Really couldn’t hope for more. Great place for a date!
Only had a quick drink before dinner.  They have a good drink selection. The lighting is a bit lacking.

formatted_address: 10719 Rue Lajeunesse, Montréal, QC H3L 2E7, Canada
name: Brasserie Au Coin Du Metro

reviews.text: Love this place ! Staff are very friendly as well as the people that are there

Well located 2 steps from metro station Henri Bourassa they open till 3 AM every day and have gambling machines. They serve all kind of alcoholic beverages. Not suitable for young kids. A lot of screens every where in the restaurant. Menu is limited to regular Stull like steak and fries hamburgers salad a etc...Nothing in particular. Deserts are served as well and breakfast starts early.

Closes late so it's a nice place to go when everything else is closed. I went there late at night after my gym session.

Great service. Great food. Can't complain. I love the place.

I barely looked at the waitress once and she flew towards me like a rocketship to give me the bill. It's the best service I've had in my life. I'm not rich but I tried to give her a nice tip anyways. I'm happy to live near that place.
Food was fine, beer selection is very generic, solid service.

Not the most beautiful place in the city but this place is a must visit if you want to watch a match or a fight with friends (or even all alone). They have almost all the games, just ask for them. Their service is normally good if you are lucky and their food and beer are decent and not too expensive. I like the place.
But sometimes, if you go all alone, you'll sit there and get fully ignored by the staff... (I have had to leave the place unserved a couple of times)

formatted_address: 11340 Rue Sherbrooke E, Montréal-Est, QC H1B 1B7, Canada
name: Resto-Bar Larry

reviews.text: Nice place to have food and keep your eyes busy
Nice place for breakfast with the boys
Super bar ! Nous y sommes entrés par hasard et avons reçu un accueil merveilleux, très chaleureux et amical. Merci pour ce moment et Vive le Québec !
For real je suis czi qui aille autant de patnais dans les reviews j’ai jamais osé rentrer la
Serveuses très sympas et un menu excellent 😁

formatted_address: 3500 Blvd. de la Côte-Vertu, Saint-Laurent, QC H4R 2X7, Canada
name: Firegrill Ville St-Laurent

reviews.text:
Where to start. 

The welcome in was great, even the hostess knew what items to eat for vegetarian options which is marvelous.

From the appetizer - the cheesy bread was delicious. Cooked to perfection. 

Salad - hard to mess up a salad but it was good

Mac & Cheese - it was so good. Good well, cheesy enough, noodles cook good and it had a wonderful flavor to it. 

Steak - my buddy got the steak and he was in love. It was moist, juicy, tender and cooked to absolute perfection as you can see in the picture

Potato was fantastic

Service was wonderful. Food was magnificent. Would highly recommend this place.
Warm and welcoming place! Celebrated my friends birthday. Food is delicious!

Great atmosphere.
Very open menu, something for everyone.
Staff is welcoming and professional.
Fantastic service.
I have busted here a few times over the years as I travel to Montreal.
And have yet to be disappointed in my meal or experience.

Excellent. Delicious and well-prepared food, positive atmosphere and vibe in the restaurant, helpful and professional staff, and quick and brilliant service. these are the reasons why i want you to visit this place and i will definitely come back to this restaurant again
I love Firegrill, service, service and service. Did i mention,  service. The food is amazing. Great place for a date night, and you can catch a movie next door, before or after.

formatted_address: 108 Rue des Soeurs Grises, Montréal, QC H3C 2R1, Canada
name: Joiea Sociale

reviews.text: We had a special event here and it was wonderful. The staff, the chef, and the owner went above and beyond to accommodate. Very authentic italian food, with several menu items you are unlikely to find in Montreal. Can't wait to go back.

Went for lunch. It was 8 of us and the service was a bit long. But the food was good, the staff was very nice and apologized for the delay. The decor is very nice and we had a good time.

Update: went for dinner a month later. It was only 3 of us this time and the service was much faster.

Was visiting Montreal recently and wanted to find an Italian restaurant in the Old City.  Based on reviews, location and the menu picked Joiea Sociale.  Had a wonderful evening experience there!  The food was excellent and the service perfect.  The fit-up in an old building was interesting and very appropriate for that part of Montreal.  Had a great evening being there and would highly recommend this restaurant to others!

First time here and certainly not the last. Service we received from the manager was stellar and our waitress was extremely helpful for the wine picks. Food was A+, freshness and portions for the price. Keep up the good work guys. Positive vibes.

The pizza is good. However, the dishes are in metal ; so when cutting the pizza the plate will get scratched. Effectively, causing u to eat metal. Not to mention, the plates are already scratched up from previous use.

Check images

formatted_address: 1472 Rue Peel, Montréal, QC H3A 1S8, Canada
name: Café Vasco Da Gama

reviews.text: Very good cafe. Coffee was delicious, imported I believe. Fruit was fresh. The breakfast wrap with smoked salmon & egg was delicious. Service was wonderful.
Nice place to grab a quick bite or more. Enjoyable food and drinks with high quality welcome from staff. Good place to know in downtown Montreal.

Our first time eating here after living in Montreal for a decade. We have a Portugal trip coming up and felt like starting with a Portuguese experience.
The latte, however on the lukewarm side was tasteful, the breakfast is simple and small. 
A nice experience overall, worth checking out at least once.
My favourite café in Montreal. The drinks and pastries are tasty and the staff members are so nice.
Great food, lot of choice, for lunch you can stop there quickly to eat something or drink something ! People there are nice too ! Thanks

formatted_address: 105 Rue Saint-Charles Ouest, Longueuil, QC J4H 1C7, Canada
name: La Distillerie no.4 - Dinette & Cocktails

reviews.text: Delicious food, amazing and professional staff, and the best cocktails around!

Being new comers to South Shore's bar & restaurant business they make a strong statement among their competitors. We tried multiple drinks and four meals which were all with strong presentation and would light up your taste buds. As for the drinks Manhattan was executed with perfection when mixed with good quality bourbon. Surprisingly a classic drink like this was not present on the menu. As for the Mad Men it was a hard try for becoming classical old fashioned and leaves a grey palette behind it. Overall La Distillerie leaves a sense of great service and care for their (for now) few customers.
Very nice atmosphere with good food and obviously good drinks!
Can't have just a drink.... need to have food!  Beware!   Don't go there for just a cocktail!
Awesome drinks, barmaid will do amazing custom drinks on request!

formatted_address: 3956 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2W 1Y3, Canada
name: Resto Bar Champs

reviews.text: Ticket guy very 😎🤙, 1 thing, bar needs new sound engineer

Where do I start? The sanitation? The food? The drinks? The ambiance? The businesses morality (or lack thereof)? It's all bad and I do not know how they are in business. Bottom line, I don't know any worse dumps in Montreal.
Used to be good under the old owners. Not so much anymore.
Great bar, friendly staff, very clean.
Great service,  cheap food, big screen tvs

formatted_address: 8865 Rue Hochelaga, Montréal, QC H1L 2N3, Canada
name: Café bistro Napoli

reviews.text: Comfortable atmosphere, welcoming place to relax with some delicious food,the coffee here is absolutely perfect and the best italian sandwich  from the first bite to the last 😚👌👌👌👌👌
Great tasting Italian eatery. I tried the bignos and they were very generous on sausage as it should be. I highly recommend.
Coffee is great here. Have to go back and try the pizza it looked really good!!
Really good coffee!!!
Cool small place. Mostly regular having a good time together, but as an outsider of the groip I was treated very nicely and properly !

formatted_address: 95 Rue Jean-Talon O, Montréal, QC H2R 2W8, Canada
name: Brasserie Harricana

reviews.text:
I saw the tiniest glass of beer on a menu. For the first time. Ever. It’s 5 oz. Like my sexy swim shorts. The only thing tinier than this serving is my bestie whom I went there with! 

I loved the beer - and our server, Alex (Alexander?) was amazing. He recommended great beer and also food. His shift ended before I was done eating. The coworker who took his place was also super amazing. I did not get her name though. :(

The place has great ambiance and decor. Had I found true love, I would have brought, said true love, to this spot for the ambiance... and the color scheme of the place....

The service is fantastic, and so is the beer and food.  The waitress steered is away from the fried chicken because there was only to of us.  (It was too much food.) We started off with the tartare  and escargot, and our waitress have is pairings based on our preferences. We finished with the grilled vegetables and the roasted lamb.  All were great.

One of the best microbreweries in the city. No matter how often I go, I never get tired of this place. The service, the atmosphere, the food and the selection of beers are excellent. If you enjoy sour, acidic beers, this place is a must.

They have good deals during lunch time. In the evening, you can order the platter for 2, which I highly recommend, since you get to taste different type of beers with delicious bites.
Food and beer were delicious. Portions were generous

A bit more posh for a brewpub, and I like it, especially for the food, which is often an afterthought here in Montreal's beer scene.
Lovely decor, but perhaps a bit too over lit. Strange enough, the patio section is nothing more than old bleachers with a coat of paint, which kinda clashes with the rest.
Service is very professional, which is another breath of fresh air in a town full of grungy pubs.
But the real star here is the beer. Lots of interesting styles, like saisons, Berliner weiss - with optional syrups - and sours. But they also have more typical styles, all are good to amazing.  They also make nice looking cocktails.
All and all, a great place for a date, a bite, a pint.

formatted_address: 789 Côte Sainte-Geneviève, Québec, QC G1R 3L6, Canada
name: Pub Nelligan's

reviews.text: Staff are amazing. Passionate and proud about what they serve! Awesome vibes from the venue with a perfect playlist. Wine and food was delightful, only downside was cold chips but the amazing, fresh food made up for it!

Sooooo, this place is a combo of an modern Irish pub meets Québécois fun. There was only the one bartender (François) working about 25 patrons and he rocked it! Fast as hell and as friendly as one can be in a busy pub! Trust me I know cuz I've been "in the weeds" behind the bar from working that side of the wood for over 15 years. It's not easy to to keep track of every order, pickup & clean glassware and still entertain your audience. Hats off and Très bien fait monsieur!
They have a good beer selection and many types of whiskey etc. Not a place for food.
Cool vibe. There was an Irish music jam session.
This is a wonderful place with an extensive collection of whiskey. The staff is lovely, the prices are excellent, and the atmosphere is very welcoming!

formatted_address: 4316 Boul Henri-Bourassa E, Montréal-Nord, QC H1H 1L8, Canada
name: Phat Grill Express

reviews.text: Nice place clean too the food is very good I recommend people to go eat at PHAT GRILL restaurants
Medium food & bad service. Would not go again
The food and customer service was horrible. I don't recommend this place to anybody.
DO NOT ORDER FROM THEM!! Waited 5 hours for my order!! FIVE! Worse customer service ever! They hang up on you and the food isnot great!! 5 bloody hours!!
I ordered a fritay and they only gave me chicken and plantain . The chicken wasnt cooked it was still pink i had to put it back in thr oven .  Very disapointed :(

formatted_address: 109 Rue de Louvain O, Montréal, QC H2N 1A4, Canada
name: Brasserie Silo

reviews.text: Great beer,great place and great people,couldn't be better!
Great place!
Très belle place et bonne bière sur le menu de l'ouverture!
Plusieurs variétés de bières, pas encore de bière brassée sur place, mais devrait être disponible la semaine prochaine.
Bonne bière dans un environnement décontracté, c'est un plaisir dans ce quartier!

formatted_address: 2200 Rue Beaudry, Montréal, QC H2L 3G3, Canada
name: Di'laor's Palace

formatted_address: 1255A Rue Crescent, Montréal, QC H3G 2B1, Canada
name: 3 Brasseurs - Siège social

reviews.text: I paid a reasonable price for this “combo” the steak was well done, onion ring were okay. But the Mac & cheese was out of my taste, it wasn’t even cheese looks like cream and it was really cold. Staffs were great, but the service not as great as 3Brasseurs on McGill. It took a while before our food arrived.
Love this chain and this location in particular. So many beer and food choices with quick and friendly service! Beer and cheddar soup is my favourite.
Love this place. Love the chain. You know where you're at with Trois Brasseurs
Terrible service I ever had in my life.
Wonderful customer service and great food

formatted_address: 1232 Rue de la Montagne, Montréal, QC H3G 1Z1, Canada
name: Club 1234

reviews.text:
Went there with the boys on Sunday June 29th and was amazed by the sounds of Crookers from Italy... probably one of the best DJ sets I've ever seen.

The club was pretty cool as well.. not too pricey.
We paid 15$ to get in and about 6 bucks a beer.

Would definitely go back.

Not a good environment: I was on my 2nd drink that got spiked by some loser 8 years ago and it still bothers me since they threw me out like a dog. He was there ready to take me home and I literally was blacking out. I am LUCKY that my friends found me before and took me home and pushed the guy away big time. So thanks 1234 and CINQ for ALMOST getting me raped once upon a time.

This club has the look, and sounds but it was nothing special. The staff was nice up untill this girl bartender asked if myfriends and i wanted to buy bottles which if i may add were WAYY over priced .The staff was rude and ignorant. I wouldnt recomend this club .

My friends and I were very disappointed with the service we received on saturday 23rd. First of all we got VIP passes which would allow us to get into the club for free (just like any other club) we also made reservations earlier. They made us pay 10 dollars each and discovered that VIP meant 5 dollars off the cover charge. We proceeded to get into the club and it was DEAD and the music SUCKED. We were there for about 5 mins and decided to leave. We went to the front desk to complain but the lady who was in charge at the front didn`t even listen to us. Overall, the club was the worst we have ever been to and we felt 100% ripped off.
II'm lovin!

formatted_address: 5732 Rue Sherbrooke Ouest, Montréal, QC H4A 1W8, Canada
name: Notre-Bœuf-de-Grâce

reviews.text: In my opinion, one of the best burgers in Montreal! I had the classic burger and it was super tasty, I particularly liked the bread, soft and sweet ! Excellent fries as well ! The place is really cool and the name of the items on the menu made me laugh !

Best burger place in town! Tater tots in a burger what a amazing idea! The Bloody Devil is also a must try (my personal favorite) 🤤 be warned the portion sizes are generous. My girlfriend and I share one small side of fries with our burger for both, this way we avoid waste and we are still super full.

Yesterday we went out for dinner with our girls. From the moment you walk in and hear the music, it's rocking with 70's, 80's, 90's and more. They greet you and bring you to your table. The service was AMAZING and fast and very attentive!! The food we all ordered burgers!!! Juicy to say the least and DELICIOUS!!!
This is a MUST PLACE to go with your better half, family or friends for a fantastic evening!!

It's good. Best burger is their Classic burger.  As someone who has worked in fast food restaurants, they need to improve the fries and mostly the onion rings. Too crispy,  overcooked and the main issue is that they do not change the oil often enough so they are very dark instead of a nice golden color. I will definitely return for the classic burger.
We went for my boyfriend's birthday and it was absolutely fantastic. Food was really good. Service was good. And for a Friday it was kind of quiet so we were able to enjoy talking.

formatted_address: 1669 Rue Sainte-Catherine E, Montréal, QC H2L 2S3, Canada
name: Bar le Cocktail

reviews.text: The best shows are held here. Great cocktails. The staff is very polite and friendly. It often hosts interesting events. If you sign up for 909gay,com and create a profile, you can get a free private room for 2 hours and a free cocktail of your choice.
Very pretty karaoke drag bar with a great view of the stage from the 2nd floor but the bartenders are very slow up there. They sometimes host underwear parties here which are kinda lame.
Great bar! Cool ambience! Good drink prices! They host RuPaul’s Drag Race viewing events, and it gets really alive then!
Great drinks, amazing vibe and entertaining drag shows. What more could you want! Fantastic performances all round, but especially from Tracy Trash! Loved the entire atmosphere.

I wish there was lower than one star !! I was there with a friend ( we are a straight ethnic couple). The moment we stepped in it seemed as if the barman/waiter did not want us to be there. We ordered a drink thinking we could keep the bar tab open, we asked to pay at the end and he said “no”. The portion of my drink (Baileys) was less than a quarter of the glass. Furthermore, some weird white object was in my drink. I asked to have the drink changed and again the waiter said “ no”. At this point, we felt unwelcome and left our drinks there. Despite the fact that we were his only customers in the entire bar. My friend and I strongly felt discriminated against. Piece of advice to anyone considering going to this bar “AVOID AT ALL COSTS”.

formatted_address: 1177 Chemin de la Canardière, Québec, QC G1J 2C3, Canada
name: Brasseurs sur demande

reviews.text: Good microbrewery, with interesting beers such as curry saison. However, their NEIPA is one of the best I've had of the style.
Small with a great range of beers.

Great hidden gem. Bar manager was a pleasure to chat with about the brewery and how they decide what beers to make. Also gave great suggestions for dinner in the area. Oh yeah, beers were really good.
Awesome choice of beer at a really good price. The best around
Nice little tasting room with beautiful local painting and the beer is on tap or botle with a choise frome gose to stout for about 10 taps.

formatted_address: 1701 Boulevard Graham, Mont-Royal, QC H3R 1G7, Canada
name: Sara Tsouli

formatted_address: 1218 Rue Sainte-Catherine E, Montréal, QC H2L 2G9, Canada
name: Le Date Karaoke

reviews.text:
This is a definitely a fun place to go in Montreal! I find it amazing that people are still able to sing (solo or group), while interacting with everyone else. Get a bit drunk and go for it!
The drinks are nice, the public is cool, the DJ is awesome (great singer btw)!
Great place to get to know new people, both anglo/francophone.

Looking to have an AWESOME night?! This place is (L)it. The energy is fun and super laid back at the same time. Absolutely love the vibe and look of the place. Yummy drinks and cheap prices for said drinks (with prices depending on when you’re there). Helpful servers and an awesome music curator/DJ/hypebeast. You actually feel comfortable enough to get up on stage! I will definitely be back.
Terrible experience the first time there. Bad music played, poor staff (never been to Karaoke and heard so many unheard of songs).

This is the seconde time this happens we were a group of 7 last week and we had a good time. Always ask for the receipts when you order and when you pay.. they see us "as a group a little drunk and enjoying our time" and the staff assume we are not keeping track of our drinks !!!!!!!!! keep your receipts Because the bar staff tend to say you didn't pay. This is an old scam coming from staff who think they can take advantage of their clients.  I think the bar staff is skimming money off the cashiers. So always ask and keep your receipts !

Horrible experience. Friend ordered some water and they only offered her bottled water. When the time came to pay, the server was incredibly pushy about getting a tip. Made my friend pretty anxious when she didn't give a tip over a bottle of water. My friend was willing to remedy this and I even offered some change just to get him off our backs (it wasn't much but better than nothing). He gave me my change back and continued to harass my friend. Other friend had enough and told the server to leave our friend alone. We left after.

Tips are for good service, which you won't find here.

formatted_address: 3141 Rue Masson, Montréal, QC H1Y 1X9, Canada
name: Pot Masson

reviews.text:
We went for brunch on a Saturday and they were able to seat 6 of us quickly (we called half an hour prior) and were really chill about the rest of our party arriving late. 

The specialty coffees are pretty small, but the food is delicious and really, really well priced. 
Service was abnormally slow when we went but I feel like it was a one off, and we ended up getting a plate of home fries on the house, which was sweet of them to do.

It took more than 1 hour once we asked for the bill to get the right items and pay. The vegan options on the menu weren't available anymore, the only replacement was more fruits. Coffee took 30 mins to receive and some of the orders were wrong. None of those things separately were that bad but all of them added together resulted in a pretty awful experience.

It was the second time we tried the place and our previous visit was pretty much the same.
Busy brunch time, so service was very poor. They need to get more organized. You get what you pay for: food and drinks are very cheap, nothing special. Nice decor.
Cheap ingredients, microwave bacon, poorly prepared and overpriced. Unfortunately, I don't recommend this spot.
Great place, great ambience and of course great food for a small price. Been going on and off for 2 years now and never disappoints. Try it out - such a cute little place! (Breakfast is a must!)

formatted_address: 52 Rue Saint-Jacques, Montréal, QC H2Y 1L2, Canada
name: Joverse

reviews.text: We went here for a birthday dinner while in town. I ordered the crab cakes (2), and a side of fries. The food came pretty fast and was very tasty. The service was good as well. The drinks are pretty standard but the overall ambience sets the night off right. I was told this place turns into upscale venu at night with an exotic lounge type vibe, unfortunately we already had reservations else but next time I'll definitely check it out. Side note, the bathroom area downstairs looks pretty dope, like a large log cabin.

Went for a late dinner to celebrate my friend’s bachelorette party. Overall the food is good. Salmon tartar was good but missed seasoning, filet minion was excellent and the sauce was delicious. Group pricing was reasonable. Vegan options as well.
They also let us bring our own cake! would definitely recommend since it’s more of a supper club vibe.

The experience was quite horrendous. 
We arrived for a dinner party with reservations at 9 and only received the food at around 11:10 which would have been made a tad more acceptable if I didn't have my seat torn from under me a second after they brought us our dessert. We asked if it were possible to at least swallow our donuts before obliterating our eating area and bringing the bill, but they explained that they had no choice but to remove our seating area and proceeded to tuck away all our seats and clear the table as if we weren't all about to pay a quite pricey meal. The cocktails were also poured in glasses the size of a thimble (a slight exaggeration). The one star is for the quality of food, but honestly what's the point of good food if we have to swallow it whole like a boa constrictor. If I wanted to eat my food in a rush, we could've gone to a fast food restaurant and if they don't want to allow people to have a proper sit down meal they shouldn't advertise the place as anything more than a club or bar. Also, the way we had to exit the place was through some odd passageway in the back which wasn't that big of a deal...but quite sketch.
Fun place always nice crowd and good music
Nice Square Always Busy

formatted_address: 3400-A Ch Ste-Foy, Québec, QC G1X 1S6, Canada
name: MC Lounge

reviews.text: Great ambiance, tomato soup was on point ant the Caesar salad with duck was surprisingly tasty
Le service est vraiment excellent! Le serveur adore vraiment sa job! Contagious happy face and happy service! Thanks
Très dispendieux. Ne recommande aucunement. Mieux vaut aller dans un pub.
Toujours bon et souriant
Toujours une belle expérience ici!!

formatted_address: 7545 Boul Henri-Bourassa E, Montréal, QC H1E 1N9, Canada
name: Café Players Bar

reviews.text: Great tunes every Friday evening!

What an incredible price for such good food the services amazing. Coolest waitress in town if you want to get them on the machines outside machines but the restaurant really takes pride in their food.

By the way it's a new administration and it's over 3 that they're here.

Give it a try
Great across the street from my work my regular watering hole great place friday nite blues jam nite a must hope to see to see u there
The girl  that worked at the bar wasn't very nice wasn't really talked with us plus when I say thank you she doesn't answer back it's kind of rude.she shouldn't be good working there
It sucks it's the worse place on the planet

formatted_address: 3518 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2X 2V1, Canada
name: SHAKER Cuisine & Mixologie

reviews.text:
Came here for pre-night out drinks and food. My friends had been before and said the food was good and then the restaurant turned into a club so it might be worth it to try out. 

I got the tartare and some fruity cocktail thing. The tartare was pretty good and on Monday's they are all 50% off! The drink was soso but I also don't like alcohol so I can't be surprised. 

Prices are in the mid-range, food quantity is adequate, and service is pretty fast and attentive given how fast paced it is. 

Around 11pm they remove the tables and chairs and only the bar and the seating around the restaurant remain. This is what they mean by it turns into a club. People weren't really dancing though so we ended up trying other clubs.

I'm not a club person though and I feel like I've tried it enough times to say I most likely won't be going out to clubs again in the near future.

We would like to get something new when the power went out. Came here to have lunch on Tuesday. It’s a huge sport bar with great vibe. We ordered two salmons poke bowl and Cochonnet burger. The burger tasted great and juicy. The poke bowl was full of my favorite ingredients but the rice was chewy. Maybe we’ll try the other burgers after 5 pm on Tuesday next time.

I’ve been to Shaker twice now; the first time was after midnight for the clubbing part of the night and the second was around 7:30 on a Friday evening for some drinks and food with a couple of coworkers. Both times the music was great and their drinks did not disappoint. I also love their decor and had no problems with the staff. My only issue though was that we were freezing cold both times and that is because the door to come in opens directly into the place. There is no additional door or curtain to block out the cold that is our brutal Montreal weather. I think once they fix this issue the place will be a 5 star in my opinion.

Really like the place, food was good enough and not that expensive. After a while the restaurant turned to a club and the music was quiet good too. A good place where you can easily go with your friends
The customer service was good but the ribs need good improvements. Try to consult the chef for some test, perhaps a new recipe. I wasnt the only one complaining about the ribs!

formatted_address: 1243 Rue Metcalfe, Montréal, QC H3B 2V5, Canada
name: Dominion Square Tavern

reviews.text: Really liked the ambiance. The waiters are all men, all in jeans and white shirts and nice butts - tending to serve the best they can . Mussels were amazing - it is a big portion that would be enough for two if you're not really hungry. Definitely will keep this place for special occasions

Start with a beautiful interior filled with "old school " charm and populate it with friendly attentive staff in crisp white shirts.  Add to that some delicious food and you're ready for a relaxing dining experience. The smoked salmon was excellent as was the bangers and mash. Recommended.

We chose this restaurant for our 5th Anniversary and we didn't regret at all! We got an amazing spot where we could check all the classic and gorgeous decor. The ambience is cozy, the staff are very efficient and friendly, the food was really tasty and delicious. We just regret to not go there before, since it was the first time in 10 years living in Montreal! We totally recommend!

This was a lovely tavern with an old world feel.  The atmosphere was casual and fun.  The food was amazing!!  The serive was 1st class.  This is great place to have supper or lunch in downtown Montreal

A hidden gem in that takes you back in time, this is a must see for anyone missing London. Simple but great menu with a plethora of drink options for everyone’s taste. Not sure what to have? Ask the amazing staff for their recommendations, you won’t be disappointed.

formatted_address: 2600 Boulevard Laurier, Québec, QC G1V 4M6, Canada
name: Resto Bar Beyrouth-Cite

reviews.text:
This is the worst Taouk place I have ever been. The guys didn't want to serve and they were almost apathetic.

The shawarma was cold and with no taste. $15.99 for that.

if I could put zero stars I would, the plate is nothing like it should be, the meat is dis-gus-ting, the salad is ridiculous, no garlic sauce just a weird mayo, old rice. It was uneatable, I wouldn't eat it for free and it's pricier than Amir. C'est pathétique
Way over priced. Meat wasnt off the giant meat rolls. Minimal veggies. No humus. No harissa. No pickles.  No hot peppers. Smallwst drink ever. 17$  go to Subway insteaf

Please read.... Where do I start. It was Christmas day so everything is closed with the exception of some places. I ordered from here and I was not impressed at all. First of all I used uber eats and requested cutlery but nothing was sent. The Tabbouleh calls for parsley, tomatoes, onions and cracked wheat. Get ready for old lettuce, tomatoes, some parsley and couscous. I had the shish taouk and shawarma plate. The portion was large but again... old lettuce, the chicken was literally boiled and chopped(nothing close to shawarma) and I don't know what shish taouk is supposed to be like but it was donair shavings. I left half of it scared I'll get sick and have to call in to work the next day. I give one star for the potato wedges and the garlic sauce which was kind of tasty enough to mask how unpleasant everything else was. I don't know why the owners don't improve their quality when so many people leave bad reviews.

24 hours are rare in quebec, this is the best alternative you'll have to mcdonalds. The meals are tasty, with vegetarian options and you can end up with something quite healthy for fast food. Also tony is the best 💪💪💪

formatted_address: 1134 Avenue du Mont-Royal E, Montréal, QC H2J 1X8, Canada
name: Barraca Rhumerie

reviews.text: The place is well located. The bar has a really nice decor and on the back they have a terrace which is heated. This is the place to go if you want to try good rums. The stuff is really awesome and the service is fast. We had fish and cuban (pork) tacos and they were good.

Drinks tasted great and some came in really cool looking totem shaped ceramics. The ambiance was great and decent service. 
Had decent selection of food menu but I find the fish tacos and chicken a little dry. The pizza on the other hand was delicious!

If you go late enough, maybe you'll get to see their bouncer who looks like Idris lol
The drinks are amazing! I love rum and this place has so many to choose from. The food on the other hand : to avoid, very bland.
Great ambience, if you love karaoke this is a pretty great place to go for a nice drink and a good sing off!
Always a great place to go. Thank to MC and her team. Never hesitate....just go there! Happy new year to the Barraca's team.

formatted_address: 4729 Rue de Verdun, Verdun, QC H4G 1M9, Canada
name: Salle Manuel Fierro

formatted_address: 4750 Rue Notre-Dame Ouest, Montréal, QC H4C 1S8, Canada
name: Bistro Bar Notre-Dame

reviews.text: Very unfriendly barmaid, wouldn't let us past the door. Asked for IDs even though we are nearing 30 years old and clearly not 18. Walked in and walked right out. Just horrible service. May be a racism thing, I'm not sure why she was so rude.
La Barmaid was super nice
Very friendly staff and a cozy atmosphere, with a decent pool table.
Good vibe. Very good prices
Friendly staff, great beer prices and a juke box for all your favorite hits. They even have slot machines.

formatted_address: Delta 3, 2875 Boulevard Laurier Suite 170, Québec, QC G1V 2M2, Canada
name: La Bête

reviews.text: Fantastic food. Great atmosphere. Wonderful service. And really good wine. Not sure what else you can ask for. It's modern and classy at the same time. Food is delicious beyond comprehension.

The price definitely worths the food! It’s one of our greatest experience in Quebec City. We ordered two dishes but we got two same dishes. We were pretty surprised that the waiter told us we can keep it if we want and it’s not charged. And he was getting our another order. The service is absolutely wonderful. We would come back to try the streaks if we come to Quebec City again :)

This restaurant offers an amazing range of steaks, both small and large so everything is covered.

The service was brilliant and although the tip was included I felt that the server completely earned the tip I gave her.

My starter was beautifully cooked and presented, cannot fault it. The desert was the same.

My issue with this restaurant as with many restaurants in NA is the meat and fries were massively over seasoned. Maybe it's where I originate from Europe where food is generally less seasoned and is often left to the consumer to season themselves, but I couldn't help but think that a steak that was cooked to perfection was ruined by way too much salt.

The parmesan and rosemary fries were the same, all I could taste was the rosemary and any flavour from frying in duck fat was completely lost.

It's a shame because this restaurant comes so highly rated and I paid a premium price to find this out...

We went here with a couple of friends from the QC City area. First time for all of us so had no expectations. It's was really great. The look and feel is old school steakhouse with a modern twist. The attentive staff were more than happy to bring a sample plate of their cuts of meat to show the different styles available. The wine selection was good. The meals were well prepared - though one of the four orders was not cooked as ordered BUT quickly corrected. All in all a great location with free interior parking when validated by the restaurant.
Great place for a date. Food was great. Plates large and the service great. No complaints.

formatted_address: 1 Rue Saint-Paul O, Montréal, QC H2Y 1Y6, Canada
name: Modavie

reviews.text:
Wife and I had the venison and mushroom ravioli entree, which we split.  Ravioli was tasty and venison was melt in your mouth delicious, prepared medium rare.  Sauce was excellent. Wife had the escargot appetizer and said it was probably the best she ever had. I had lobster bisque which was OK - waiter said it was classic french style. Coffee after dinner was delicious. Service was excellent. 
4 glasses of wine, two appetizers, splitting an entree and two cups of coffee - $162 Canadian (about $120 U.S.) before tip.

Had a great time here. This was a place my girlfriend and I went to for our delayed Valentine's Day dinner. I got the steak frites and it was one of the best versions of that dish I've had. On top of the great food, the staff and servers were really friendly and helpful. There is also live music that really makes this place have a great atmosphere. Really enjoyed this place, will be going again

We students had the chance to experience Modavie during Montreal's yearly event Happening Gourmand and its more affordable options. Welcomed in the best way possible, we received an excellent service along our three-course meal. Great live jazz to top it off, although die-hard jazz fans could be disappointed by the performance. All in all, we had a great time and highly recommend for romantic dates!

The ambiance is top here. They have a nice wine selection and live band is a plus. The waiter was patient and friendly. I came here to experience their menu with Happening Gourmand. I will come back. The second floor, where I sat, had a piano player and singer. The ground floor had a drummer and a guitarist. The moods were very different. I will return to watch the drumset

My boyfriend and I stopped in originally just for a pint and ended up grabbing a late lunch. The French Onion soup and Beef Tartare were EXCELLENT! Fantastic wine selection (though we did not partake) and local brews on tap. The kitchen and staff were very accommodating of my boyfriend's food allergies - going above and beyond our expectations. Would highly recommend. A++

formatted_address: 701 Côte de la Place d'Armes, Montréal, QC H2Y 2X6, Canada
name: Brasserie 701

reviews.text: Love love love this place. The service: impeccable ...the food was amazing.... loved the atmosphere. We were a group of 15 or so...surprise party for moi! I'm still so impressed how fast our food came out all at the same time ...wow ...great job guys. The staff is so friendly and accommodating.

I went to this place with my wife and her sister. We were there for #happening gourmand and we all took the flank steak. Just got one word to describe it: wow! Not only the food was good, but our server was amazing too. We got served by Gavin. He was serving multiple table, but when he got to yours you feel like you are his only table. Thanks again Gavin for this wonderful experience!
Really nice atmosphere/interior. The service was a little slow but the prices are reasonable for what you would find in old port. The food (brunch) was was great.

The price was not too bad with 17 for an entree and main but the music was a bit much. Interesting to listen to English music that is meant for clubbing at full volume but it might be because this is meant for a younger crowd. The food was not great. The breakfast poutine was barely warm, and the pancakes were thick and dry. It felt like a tourist get away but that might be who they cater too with the unlimited mimosas for 30 so long live the drunken bride and bridesmaids as the drink their way through a weekend away in Montreal.
Absolutely amazing breakfast and setting. All the dishes have their own unique taste and additions. The smoked salmon on bagel with cream cheese will change your life. Can’t wait to go back!

formatted_address: 601 Grande Allée E, Québec, QC G1R 2K4, Canada
name: Sul'Side - Bières & Burgers

reviews.text: Great beer selection, and had one of the greatest poutine there during La poutine week event.

We stayed a hotel near the restaurant (30 secs away) and visited there on 10/11/2017 around 9pm, and the food and service were excellent. I tried my first poutine ever in my life and it was AMAZING. Food, Beer, Service.. everything was PERFECT even price was reasonable. The owner is very friendly and welcoming!! we will definitely visit there again. Thanks for giving us fantastic Quebec memory! - From Florida
First visit was disappointing...came back a second time after speaking with manager and meal was great, service excellent, very busy time during the FEQ.
It has an old chevy step van as a bar inside. Burgers are good the fries not so much.  Good craft beer selection and a friendly owner.
Great place for late night snack. Tried the calzone poutine during the Poutine Week, was delicious. Staff was very friendly.

formatted_address: 605 Boulevard Curé-Labelle, Laval, QC H7V 2T5, Canada
name: Restaurant Lordia

reviews.text: This restaurant is my number one place.  Of all restaurants I know I like it most. I never miss an opportunity to go to this restaurant. Whenever  I want to go to a special supper, this restaurant comes right away to my mind. outstanding and all kinds of  food and a large menu.helpful crew, and pleasant ambience. And very important, the cost is decent. I tell about this place with no doubt.

Had a really good time there. It started pretty late, but we kept on dancing between the services. The band was entertaining and the music was diversified a bit. At one point, we were dancing because we were waiting for another service. The food was really good and there were few choices brought to the table. If you are going and have allergies, be sure to remind them and check at every service. As it is going on late, it is not really convenient for people who have to go back to Montreal by bus or metro. Anticipate uber, taxi or other alternatives. We had to leave around midnight, right before the main course. The party was still going on!

The star goes to the entertainment team and the great singer. But the food big Zero! The worst I've have. What a shame to serve cold, reheated food, small portions, and slow service. Even the water tastes weird! The only time we saw the waiter was when he was asking if we done. 
And the bathrooms make you want to puke! Save your money and go elsewhere.
An amazing experience and night. Live music + DJ. Authentic Lebanese experience. Belly Dancer, amazing tasty unlimited food. Amazing service. Truely remarkable.

I recall the food here was better when I came a few years ago. However, we were recently invited there for an occasion, and we were 40+ guests. The service was absolutely embarrassing - so bad that the host who had invited us was SERVING us our drinks!!! What an outrage. The administration ought to be ashamed by this. The food was mediocre, anything vegetarian was OK, but the meats tasted weird (particularly the beef). Suffice it to say I am never returning here nor recommending it.

formatted_address: 2850 Boulevard de la Concorde E, Laval, QC H7E 2B4, Canada
name: La Maison Pékin

reviews.text:
Incredibly rude, will not waste my time ordering from this place again. Placed an order for delivery and got hung up on has soon has the person said 'Pay in cash'. 
An hour later when the food finally arrived, the driver had the audacity to ask for extra tips on top of the amount that was included in the delivery. I was paying for food...not for the College for this persons kids.
Food wise...way too greesy, tasted like it was re- heated in the microwave.
Total waste of time and money ordering from here.
Very good food and service, worth every penny (20$, tip included, all-you-can-eat)
I had delivery a couple of times and I wasn't impressed with the food unfortunately.
Combo #2 😭😭😭😭 salty ++++...I had some sugar to try to eat😔....please less salt...cuz it can cause blood pressure to young for that

Went there with my friend and ordered a general tao and singarpore noodle. Service was quick (7-8 minutes both dishes were served on our table), food was decent and exotic decorations. Would come again!!

formatted_address: 1469 Rue Crescent, Montréal, QC H3G 2B2, Canada
name: Copacabana

reviews.text: My first time in Montreal, and my first time in a Montreal club! Club Copacabana was nothing but amazing! Myself & my friend are glad that we chose this as our first option! The bar tender was absolutely amazing and such a sweetheart! She was so fun and friendly! Really giving us a great vibe! The DJ was LITTTTTTTTT! Didn’t ruin the tempo, didn’t talk over the music and such a great variety! If you’re looking for a great experience and a great time, Copacabana is such a fun time and definitely recommended!!

If you want to hear songs like "follow the leader," and "la gasolina" aaaand hear them played more than twice in a matter of an hour, then this is your place. I couldn't have been more disappointed in the music choice.  Particularly for a  place advertised as a Latin club, I was expecting...I don't know...good music? Popular music in our community?. The oldest merengues were played ( to clarify, old merengues are not bad...old cheesy merengues are bad and that is what they chose to play), played maybe 2 salsa which the DJ changed in 20 seconds,  and not one bachata. Not one. I almost shed a tear. The drinks were tiny, expensive for what it was and watered down...and they have the audacity to charge an entrance fee. Btw, I was there on a Saturday night. Come on guys, do better.

If you are gay i do not recommend this club for you . Me and a group of friends were having a great time dancing on the dance floor and one of my cousins who likes the same sex started twerking and dancing in a middle of a circle when ONE OF THE WORKERS PASSED BY AND KICKED HIM and I got it on video! We were all shocked and it ruined all of our moods. We didn’t want to start problems so we just stayed and continued to dance but I never will set foot in there again and do not recommend anyone to either.

Worst night club ever, they will charge you for a drink and don't give it to you. 
Do not waste your money. Very bad experience.

Hands down the worst club on the strip. Service was rude, the drinks were watered down, and there were hardly any people compared to the other clubs. Overall not a good vibe. There are a lot of good clubs in Montreal spend your money elsewhere.

formatted_address: 67 Rue Jarry E, Montréal, QC H2P 1T1, Canada
name: Café Lounge 5

reviews.text: Great place good people and very cheap. Staff is excellent 😍😍😍
Nice operators, cozy ambiance
Great place to hang out and have a few drinks.! Cozy place great staff great people💃🏻💃🏻💃🏻
Great staff
Long time no see !

formatted_address: 3350 Rue Ontario E, Montréal, QC H1W 1P7, Canada
name: Darling Bowling

reviews.text: Love this place. Real québécois atmosphere with its disco theme, poutine and pitchers of draft.

Nice, fun bowling place. Music was great! One of our lanes had repeated issues but staff mixed them. Food was fine, good for the occasion. Will likely go back. It's a bit far from the center of Montreal though.

Nice local bowling with tiny balls and pins.
Quite cheap, good beer and food on site.
Very nice for group.
Not too crowded, so it's good fun to go there

Don't know how my friends found this place, but this was so much fun. Mini bowling balls I guess but they had beers and some good fries and chicken wings. It takes very little for us to start having good times and enjoy. The games got competitive and didn't realize we had spent close to 2 hours there. Try this out for a fun evening!

Haven't been bowling in so long that I almost forgot what it was like! I had so much fun, especially since it was a Thursday and it was disco night! Oh yes, you read it: Disco Night!! That being said, if you're looking to play with the big regular balls, you'll be disappointed: they only offer the small ones. But if you're fine with the small ones, you'll have a lot of fun! And as a bonus, Alcool is cheap! So yeah, plenty of fun..!

formatted_address: 399 Rue Saint-Jean, Québec, QC G1R 1N8, Canada
name: Le Projet

reviews.text: Amazing building. So much history and it is all up on the walls to read about. The beer selection is easy to read through too and the prices are really good considering how it is all good beer. The service was perfect. The vegan selection is pretty much non existent but don't let that stop you. The hummus is awesome and the beer is even better. Loved it.

Service is fun, people working here know they beers and it is just fun to be in the place.
Great list of beers, and you can order very descent food to go along with your beer.
I will definitely return here next time I'm in town.

Le Projet has an extensive selection of local beers. To accompany this they have a limited but adequately diverse menu. The flights of four beers are by far the best attraction though the atmosphere and service are a nice bonus as well. I would heartily recommend checking it out!
Great selection of beer and cider.  I had a cider flight.  Beautifully prepared and presented food.  Nachos were great.  Mushroom something was different and delicious

Fun, great food and awesome architecture to look at. There are 30 to choose from and all are on display on numerous chalkboards throughout the pub/gastropub (it's so much more than a microbrewery). Servers are very cool, professional and knowledgeable. 
We had the large Nachos...twice! Yes we went back again during our extended weekend trip! The nachos are loaded with fresh tomatoes, corn, Greek olives...and come with loads of amazing guacamole! You can add sourcream for $1.  
So good!

formatted_address: 975 Roméo-Vachon Blvd N, Dorval, QC H4Y 1H1, Canada
name: Le Metropole Café Bar

reviews.text: Service inadmissible. On s'est fait regarder croche pour avoir commandé un verre d'eau avec un café filtre à 5 balles même pas bon.
Pire expérience de restauration de ma vie.

formatted_address: 710 Rue Bouvier suite 200, Québec, QC G2J 1C2, Canada
name: FOR SUPER RICH

formatted_address: 5263 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2T 1S4, Canada
name: Le Bay Cà Phê

reviews.text: Amazing food and crew! The portion’s great and I love how they don’t lose a smile. I’ve been here three times now and haven’t been disappointed. They open during the lunch time too which is a bonus for people who want to enjoy pho without being crowded at night, or if you work nearby and need a good filling lunch.
Friendly staffs, food is okay! If you’re looking for a real Vietnamese restaurant you may look for somewhere else, cuz the menu is limited. But overall it’s good!

Saying this teleport me to Vietnam might be a bit over, but well not so over as well. :) Cozy place, quite, good food, good place to spend a night chatting over authentic delicious food.

chef is Vietnamese, 100% authentic!Love their beef option!
Nice Vietnamese restaurant. Good food and great friendly service.
Excellent food and drinks. The service was fast and pretty lovable. I'll go back for more tastes!

formatted_address: 760 Avenue Ogilvy, Montréal, QC H3N 1N7, Canada
name: Okkari Resto-Bar

reviews.text: Tank you
Great community

formatted_address: 991 Avenue Ogilvy, Montréal, QC H3N 1P3, Canada
name: Resto-bar Portara

reviews.text:
Small cozy Greek spot. 
Honestly the best Porc Souvlaki sticks I've had outside of Greece and that's saying something.
Experience Greece in montreal...authentic greek dishes with a twist!
The food is excellent . you feel like home . .i highly recommend Friday night .
Good greek food

the food is very good.The best home fries we had for years,the ambiance reminds you of Greek hospitality .And the bouzouki night very fun,The music brings you back in time and in the present .The DJ really knows to read his people, music from all over the world if you ask.Loved it and it became one of our groups favourite

formatted_address: 1458 Rue Crescent, Montréal, QC H3G 2B6, Canada
name: Ayers Rock - Bar

reviews.text: went on opening night.. fun vibe
Best bar in town

Super endroit, le staff est accueillant, bonne musique de plusieurs style différent pour plaire à tout le monde et bonne bière pas cher le lundi. 3$ la pinte est un super bon deal. Le happy hours commence à 16h et fini à 20h avec des rabais tel que 5$ ta pinte de bière et plusieurs cocktail.

formatted_address: 821 Rue Scott, Québec, QC G1R 3C8, Canada
name: La Buvette Scott

reviews.text: I’m a local & it’s one of my favourites in the city, food is always exceptional & mostly locally sourced. It’s quality over quantity, so don’t expect big portions. Always a good selection of drinks & Dave will always have some good music on. Affordable oysters at happy hour. Book in advanced.

Oyster lovers dream! This place was absolutely amazing! Looks are definitely deceiving, and the menu is small but you can't beat the quality of the three food. My husband and I walked in and there were originally no tables available but the owner caught us before we left and told us he had a table available for 2 hours before the next reservation, hooray! Oysters are $1.50 before 7 and we demolished 44 of them. They were light and sweets and served on a bed of sea salt and with delicious mignonette sauce. Yummy! The servers were nice and knowledgeable and spoke English very well. They even gave us some local spots to visit. If you love oysters then you need to stop here.

Experience was great! These guys really put some work into who they source their beer and produce from, something I didn't expect from a what looked like a bunch a shaggy dressed college kids. We were 3 people and decided to let the cook make whatever he wanted for us (something I recommend doing at any restaurant, the cook will often serve you up his greatest hits). We went through about 5-6 courses and I was really impressed at the level of execution. Food came out quick with a surprising level of finesse! Here is the best part, the price! With 5-6 dishes you can get a really solid feel for a restaurant, ordered 2 light beers that didn't overpower the food. Only paid about 65 bucks tax in! The service offered just the right amount of intimacy, waiter was charming and took the time to chat when he felt it was appropriate. I would describe this restaurant in one word as SMART. They knew how to cater to the local clientele offering great value in one of the more modest neighborhoods in downtown QC.

Great atmosphere, and the staff are incredible.   Small plates with fresh made food. Menu changes all the time based on availability.   Great pairings of drinks to go with the food.   Staff know the food well and are happy to take time a describe each dish.   Will definitely be back.

A mixed experience. Small plate of pheasant, tasty but not very filling. No 0 beer available for drivers. Coffee very bitter and acidic, however the baclava is very good. Rather noisy but the service is friendly and prompt

formatted_address: 3979 Bd Taschereau, Saint-Hubert, QC J4T 2G5, Canada
name: Scotyz

html_attributions: Red Devil Custom Cruisers Montreal Mike Zambeez

reviews.text: Really great experience! Went there for a birthday for a family member. Lots of room, playing good music. Clean and friendly staff. Food was tasty and fresh cant complain. Lots of beer on tap, plus they offer pitchers. Seems they have specials everyday for various pub food and beer. Keep up the good work, would go back if I'm in the area for a beer!

Best chicken wings on the shore! The food here is really good. Watch for the specials and enjoy with your favourite drinks! Great little hole in the wall bar with Darts, Karaoke and so much more. If you’ve never been you’ve gotta go... but seriously try the all you can eat chicken wings!
This place simply knows how to serve their customers. Always with a kind mindset. The food is affordably priced, constantly flavorful and clean.
Great place to eat and drink at. I go over there to eat sometimes and to go visit my father who is a frequent visitor and I absolutely love their menu. Would recommend to anyone in the area.
Friendly staff great ambience good prices great food

formatted_address: 4021 Rue Ontario E, Montréal, QC H1W 1T3, Canada
name: Taverne Ontario Enr

reviews.text: Damn jme sens à st-fé ! Petite place tranquille. Bon service et belle table de pool.

Une taverne authentique d'Hochelaga! Absolument pas gentrifiée! J'ai payé une tournée à 5 personne pour moins de 15$... pourboire inclus!

C'est un endroit très tranquille: quand le petits bars branchés du coin sont pleins è craquer cette taverne est prête à vous acceuillir avec tout vos amis confortablement assis!

Service rapide et un acceuil simple et vrai!

formatted_address: 4471 Rue Sainte-Catherine E, Montréal, QC H1V 1Y6, Canada
name: Bar L'Escale

reviews.text: I work here love it merci

Toujours la bataille, mauvais service  pas comme avant  faut payer pour la musique et ils bais le sound faut pas oublier ton manteau ou ton verre ça va être volés .dans encien temps des concours de billard et criblage pour 1000$j ça fermait a5h de matin et  dans 20ans  jamais un bataille juste respect et fun un gang qui connaît pour 50ans mais quand il ont changé propriétaire cetais la mérd.je m'amuse mieux toute seule
Superbe soirée avec un accueil chaleureux et un service dynamique!!! 😉👍💫
Un endroit habituellement tranquille, mais nous nous sommes retrouvé une quinzaine d'amis pour un anniversaire et la barmaid à été excellente 👌
Chaleureux et  prix abordable. Les toilettes pourraient être un peu plus propre par contre.

formatted_address: 636 Rue Cathcart, Montréal, QC H3B 3C4, Canada
name: Le Vieux Dublin Pub & Restaurant

reviews.text: Nice place. Decoration is well done. More a drinking place than an eating place in my opinion. But food is correct. Service is correct. Accessibility  is correct. Parking can be difficult in this area. It's More an afterwork place for me. Price range in the upper level. Knowing some Irish people I was there a couple times. Recommended for people who likes kinda  pub life style.
Great Irish pub. Very traditional. Great service  had drinks and cicken wings with friends. It was great.

I had the lamb Curry it was excellent along with a Guinness which was also great. Would definitely recommend this pub envy downtown area. Many different burgers on the menu but the curry was definitely great.

This great real feel pub kept me same during my business trip in Montreal!  Mainly due to Pat and Big G, bartenders that definitely do a job that they love! cheers! This place has probably all of the best Irish whiskey, and their beer selection is fantastic!  A must if you want to chill without the big noise. BTW their fish 'n' chips is REALLY good!
Excellent value and great staff! Cannot comment on the food other than the fries that were good. A tad too loud for my liking.

formatted_address: 4300 Boulevard Guillaume-Couture, Lévis, QC G6W 6N1, Canada
name: Resto-Pub Ryna

reviews.text: Excellent service ! Buffet A1
Nice up to date  place with cozy fashionable decor.. Food is absolutely delicious! Very noisy place though cause by the new setup...but overall it is a nice restaurant!

I am not amazed by this restaurant. 
Ambient is not attractive or well designed. 
Food is below average: pizza was way too spicy for the type ordered, desserts were unsatisfactory.
Waiter was mixing orders, can't do two things at a time and price is not competitive. The only thing that saved the night was the company of great friends.
Nice food, eat as much as you can, nothing fancy but good taste.
Great place for a quick lunch

formatted_address: 175 Rue Sainte-Catherine O, Montréal, QC H2X 1Z8, Canada
name: Place DesChamps

reviews.text:
Awesome. Simply excellent in all aspects. Service was great, not too intrusive, rightly tuned. We were a group of 8, had a reservation and i had a chance to taste at all the dishes at the table. On the height we were, everybody agreed to say that it was awesome. Salmon was great, black blood sausage were awesome with their various  mashed potatoes, beef of the moment was tasty in its sauce and cooked just right, had the duck leg over sweet mashed potatoes and cranberries gravlax and it was also delicious. Tasted the beef tartare and it was on top too. Entrees were also all good. 
Bref, to sums it up, make sure you have a reservation. Then go ahead cause i hope that your experience will be as good as ours :) 

Favorite dish of the evening would have been for me the beef tartare, followed by the boudin / black blood sausage. Dessert is split between the crème brûlée and the crunchy chocolate praline.

A very wonderful meal before the opera was had here. The appetizer was an interesting take on a capresse salad, and I will be stealing it for supper parties. We sat at the bar and they were very attentive and had excellent recommendation, in fact the bar tender picked my whole me, and I was not disappointed. The salmon tartar was yummy although it was more similar to gravlax than Asian style salmon tartar but it was good. They were quick and the food was good, which is always a plus when you have a performance to go to. I shall return.
Nice poutine au magret, reasonably priced, good service!
Excellent service, affordable prices.

Very overpriced restaurant service was very nice however very very slow the prices are outrageous for what you get  $16 grilled cheese that was tasteless I don't think it was two year old cheddar I think it was Kraft cheddar. The $6 french fries were soggy. They did have a reasonably priced wine list.

formatted_address: 1005 Rue Saint-Jean, Québec, QC G1R 1R8, Canada
name: Bistro bar

formatted_address: 30 Rue Émile-Despins, Charlemagne, QC J5Z 3L6, Canada
name: Pic Bois Bistro Terrasse

reviews.text: This is definitely a place to check out, the have their base menu but they also have a menu that changes often. Been here twice and have not been disappointed yet. If they have the dessert celebration I would recommend it as it is a deep fried cookie. Can not go wrong with deep fried cookie.
Excellent .the Ceasar Salad is awesome and also the beef Tatar
Food was nowhere close to decent. Service was good.
The Tomahawk steak is to die for! Great service and ambiance.
Tasty!  I love this place and ambience!!

formatted_address: 325 Rue de la Couronne, Québec, QC G1K 2T7, Canada
name: Laurentien Buvette Gourmande

reviews.text:
An always changing small menu, with food that is prepared to the highest quality. I have yet to have a poorly cooked meal, and I have had nothing but the best service.

Although I am anything but a regular (in just a bus driver from the US), having only stopped in once or twice, I was shocked that the bartenders and kitchen staff recognized me. These guys are some of the best. I highly recommend you dine here.

Wow. A great food experience indeed. A fresh market menu that can and does change daily. All items are freshly made and delicious. The vibe is warm, casual, comfortable and could be romantic if that's what you need. Nice selection of draft beers and glasses of wine. Liquor options available too. Good music playing all night. I'd come here for a few drinks at the bar to chill. I'd definitely come back for the wonderful food experience. For the two of us, we shared a cold app, two hot apps and an entree. Supremely delicious and perfect amount.

As soon as you enter the front door you can feel the ambiance of this place, warm, friendly and inviting. A fantastic soundtrack playing and perfect mood lighting and interior decor make this a cozy establishment. This is just how a gastro pub should be.  I can't rave enough about the ambience, it's fantastic!

They have a rotating menu, so nothing will be the same day to day, all farm to table here from small local farms- so it's fresh!  

Valarie, our server, guided us through the menu and the dining  adventure.  She was absolutely fantastic, courteous, professional and extremely helpful to these non French speaking visitors. 

The dishes are served tapas  style, enough for two people.

The food is mouth watering delectable delicious, created and crafted with pride and that's reflected in the seasoning ,  flavor and presentation of the dishes. 

Our best dining experience in Quebec.
Very long wait times and very small portions but excellent. Be sure to try the brownies!
Fantastic food with great local beer plus amazing customer service 💯 Especially Charles was amazing making our dining experience unforgettable 👍

formatted_address: 360 Rue Saint Jacques VS-201, Montréal, QC H2Y 1P5, Canada
name: La Voûte

reviews.text: AMAZING SERVICE!! The music was fun and building was beautiful but what really amazed me was how helpful the staff are! I lost my phone and was prepared for the worst (anyone who loses anything in a nightclub can understand) but when I asked one of the bouncers they had found it and returned it to me within 5 minutes! High class

The only club worth hitting up in Montreal ! Incredible vibe, amazing music and their staff truly make the experience all the more better. Whether you love clubbing or hate it, if you enjoy a good time you’ll love it. I could literally rave about this place all day but I think once you visit La Voûte it’ll speak for itself ! 11/10

Everyone from the door to the host, waitress, and security at the nightclub were all very friendly and professional. Our entire group agreed this was the best night we ever had in Montreal!   It has never failed to disappoint and we have always had a great time there.  We will definitely be going back here next time we are in town.
Ok place with ok music. The crowd there...is another story. Very busy in Saturday night. Big place.
Best high-end nightclub in Montreal! Staff is A1, great service! Come early if you don’t want to be waiting in line. Like any great place, you have to be ready to spend money..

formatted_address: 4105 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2W 1Y7, Canada
name: Le Majestique Montreal

reviews.text:
