Wow, amazingly fresh food and great drinks. Didn't think we would get full on veggie plates but we were wrong. Ordered about 4 different plates for 4 people and we were all satisfied. 
Great friendly service to boot!

This place was a hit. We ordered multiple trays of oysters, The specials, a bunch of cocktails and a number of other dishes. They were all delicious. Especially the oysters. All fresh and quick to table. The whole experience was a pleasure and it remains one of my favorite restaurants in the city (speaking as a visitor)

Oysters were fresh. Although they were out of one type, pei selection was fine. Lobster salad was tiny, do not order if you like to eat a full meal for dinner. Loses points for that and no menu (or anything) on website. Overall good food and nice for atmosphere. Service was fine.

Great place to have drinks. Service was good, the waiter offered us a free drink because our drinks took much longer than expected.

Cocktails were good and the vibe was excellent. We were able to have conversations without feeling like we had to yell. 

Middle tables were a little awkward and sometimes you felt like it got a little too congested but it was manageable.

Cozy place, super small. I like coming here for the oyster and the atmosphere. Gets a little louder late night though. Difficult to hear conversations. The food was just okay. Would give the food another shot. But definitely coming back for oysters in good company .

formatted_address: 1306 Rue Olier, Montréal, QC H3C 1W4, Canada
name: Association Montréal Beach

reviews.text:
Love that there is beach volleyball in the middle of the city but it's just so badly organized (even when you're playing) and the website is horrendous. A little better care and service would make this much more enjoyable. It's a tad too laid back, you can't have laid back organization even though the leagues are just for fun. The lights at night are too blinding, and sometimes they forget to play music and it makes it way more enjoyable with music. And they didn't cancel even though there was rain so we lost some games.

That being said, it's pretty well priced, courts are good except 1 or 2 courts have issues with things under the sand that you can like, trip on.
Went for charity event.. nice place

A lively floodlit beach oasis in the heart of the city. Volleyball courts a plenty and a buzzing Tiki bar to boot. Even better, it is super easy to get to as located conveniently on the Lachine Canal bike path. Drop-in games, league fixtures and tournaments a plenty to choose from.
The courts are super well kept and the cost is super reasonable to play drop in!
Good facilities and friendly staff! Some of the courts are in need of a bit more sand, but that's not a deal breaker at all. Great time!

formatted_address: 44 Route du Président-Kennedy, Lévis, QC G6V 6C5, Canada
name: Dooly's Lévis

reviews.text: 🎼Very Good!!!🌛
Best poolroom in town!!!
Cool

Billard correct! Bière manque de pétillant!
Ailes de poulet trop cuite!
Prix très élevé en fonction de la qualité.
Le vendredi c'est ailes et bière à rabais ☺

formatted_address: 3 Place Ville Marie Suite 400, Montreal, QC H3B 2E3, Canada
name: CHRONEXT Lounge

formatted_address: 1 Carré Westmount, Westmount, QC H3Z 2P9, Canada
name: Taverne On The Square

reviews.text: The food was amazing, we had the steak tartare and gnocchi with truffle, simply divine. The wines were also delicious, they have private importations, among the best wines I tasted in my life. The sommelier explained us the story of each wines, it was a unique experience! Really recommend this place and they have wine by the glace, perfect to taste different wines.
I had a great time in this place. We enjoyed the awesome vibes and the menu. The staff members were very amiable. I am happy we ultimately decided to visit this restaurant.

Good service although staff is young and constantly interrupting and/or taking dishes away while others at the table were still eating. Some servers were loud and unruly serving other tables, clearly in party mode with their friends (patrons). 
The food is overrated (in our humble opinion). Bread (which was sparsely served as one slice cut in 1/2 until we mentioned something) was stone cold and crumbling apart in our hands. The roast cauliflower was delicious but cold. One of us had to send back our main dish as it was not fresh (fish). 
Ended up with overpriced macaroni which was good but the pleasure factor was no better than Kraft mac n cheese. 
Wines were ok but first round had to be sent back as it was “off”. 
All in all, I  don’t get it what the fuss is all about.  Absolutely nothing spectacular. Once was enough. Yuck!
Natural wine selection was amazing. We went with what Jon Circone recommended and were thoroughly impressed- service was fun, classy and yet unpretentious. Beautiful atmosphere.

Drinks were great, had both the Old Fashioned and a Stormy Mike. Dinner was even better, really interesting take on Salmon Tartare and the Grilled Calamari and Shrimp was cooked to perfection.. Lindsay G was the perfect waiter, you should ask to be seated in her section. Courteous and attentive without being invasive. Can't recommend enough.

formatted_address: 34 Rue Rachel O, Montréal, QC H2W 1G1, Canada
name: Rotisserie Portugalia

reviews.text: In my opinion they make the best Portuguese chicken in town! The pork chops are a MUST try! I’d give a 5-star to the pork, chicken & lamb. Quail was good but not my fav.

My husband and I had a time. The owners, the staff and regular customers were VERY polite, funny and respectful. The dishes were delicious, meat is very tasty. Great ambiance. Most of all, the customers services was excellent. Rotisserie Portugalia restaurant gives us THE  best welcoming.
Amazing staff, awesome food.

was refered to this place to have a great chicken sandwich. 
did not disappoint. 
$6 gets you a freshly cooked chicken sandwich. 
I recommend everyone to try this place out.  

from the outside you will never know this place serves good food like this  .
Excellent service. Food is plenty and delicious. 5 stars hands down

formatted_address: 2800 Rue Masson, Montréal, QC H1Y 1W7, Canada
name: Quai No.4

reviews.text: Nice neighborhood bistro, food is great. Cocktails are generous and well done. Looking fwd to try more of this place. Great for a date idea!
Food was delicious. And they allowed us to change place because we were becoming a large group. The service was impeccable.
Good selection of drinks and beers. The food is okay. Music was fine, not too loud. Waiter was very kind.

I don't normally leave negative reviews but I'm super disappointed with this place. Waited 15 minutes at the door to be seated and got ignored so I sat myself, asked the bartender if the $15 food special was on and was told it was when it wasn't (language barrier problems so a bit more understandable), waited forever for bland mac and cheese, then watched 3 staff members argue behind the bar instead of letting me pay ($20 instead of $15) and leave. I just moved to the area so I was hoping this would become a regular spot for me but I definitely won't be going back

Food is good, over all great atmosphere but waiters attitude destroyed the evening. They have attitude and begged for Atleast 15% tip and told us he has to pay for our meals if we don't pay the tip and became rude. If they can improve this they will understand a returning client is more important than 5% extra tip. The waiters attitude was a it thick. Won't go after that behaviour which ended up as we were servicing the waiter. If just the food it's 5 star.

formatted_address: 3959 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2W 1Y4, Canada
name: Casa Minhota - Portugais - Tapas Seafood Steak - Wine Bar/Cocktails - Private Parties/Events

reviews.text: Great Portuguese seafood restaurant! The server was very welcoming and giving me a chill friendly vibe. The food was very good!  Loved the spicy shrimps and the seafood paella :) the interior was extremely cute too! Went for Sunday lunch and there are still few tables left, however, I do recommend to make reservations since it's quite easy with Google map.
Awesome Portuguese steak.  Great place in Montreal.  Highly recommend it.
Really nice place, small and cozy. The waiters are very nice and friendly. Prices are ok depending the plates. Great atmosphere, will definitely consider when I am in the neighborhood

Excellent food, excellent service! 
Great experience every time we go!
We even hosted a baby shower at this restaurant and it was absolutely amazing!
Great little Portuguese restaurant in Montreal. Highly recommended!

formatted_address: 84 Rue Sainte-Catherine O, Montréal, QC H2X 1Z6, Canada
name: Restaurant Le Café du Nouveau Monde

reviews.text: Great place for lunch! A wonderful menu that suits many traditional tastes. Always happy and satisfied when I go there. Excellent service. Best to reserve.
Nice place. Staff is super nice and helpfull. The food is soooo good. I miss the old salmon tartare recipe though because I don't really like the new one.
Always so good, sometimes a wait at the door but once you're sitting down service is really fast.
Very good service, good food, good ambience
We went there for MTL a Table and the waitress were awesome and the food very tasty ! Loved it

formatted_address: 385 Rue de la Commune E, Montréal, QC H2Y 1H2, Canada
name: BreWskey Taproom

reviews.text: This place might deserve a 5 but our food was not good. The meatballs were cold on the inside, and then heated as a whole dish so the tomato was dry. The beer selection was amazing. The waiter was great too, very nice guy. When we first arrived they had live music which made the place very loud. I was only aware of the upstairs part after visiting the washroom. For my first time here I had a good time.

Definitely a nice selection of beers.  The ones we had were really good.  Not your typical micro brew that’s trying so hard to be different that the beers are too much in your face.  These were nice, smooths and very much unique in their own way.  The vibe wasn’t great, but it was probably because it was a Monday evening and quiet.  Find a way to block the bright lights from the kitchen into the dining area... it kills the dark and mellow mood... just a suggestion.

Enjoyed my visit. The rib was perfect! Beers I selected even so. If you are into craft beers I would suggest to go here.

Note: Brewskey Bar is one level up. Entrance from the street parallel or take the internal stairs

Nice location and selection of drinks, variety of beer. The staff was pretty friendly. 

It was a nice atmosphere and seems like a great place to come for a drink after work. 

Downsides were a few things I tried to order weren't available- one was an appetizer and two were cocktail ingredients that knocked out a few options. 

The service was friendly but they get swamped quick. I think we would have ordered more if they had come around more often to grab out order. We spent a solid 15 trying to get our servers attention. 🤷
If you are looking for good crafted beer, this is the place you must visit for. Food options are less. Staff is very humble and prompt. Loved the sitting arrangements. Must visit pub.

formatted_address: 775 Avenue du Mont-Royal E, Montréal, QC H2J 1W8, Canada
name: Taverne Saint-Sacrement

reviews.text: Great spicy fried chicken, ok Accras. They have happy hour from 5 to 7 with beer at 5,50. Service is really bad, very unfriendly waiters and lazy when asking for further information regarding the menu
Lovely little pub. Good wine selection with really good food. Limited pub menu. Attentive service and a fun atmosphere. Sears are old church pews so not very comfortable
good music good service decent choice of beer just a regular casual place to have a drink
Nice ambiance. Service good. Nice place for a drink!
Really great ambiance, food is always amazing, and such a caring staff!

formatted_address: Rue Marmier &, Avenue Henri-Julien, Montréal, QC H2S, Canada
name: Mile Ex Festiva

formatted_address: 3500 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2X 2V2, Canada
name: Club École Privée

reviews.text:
The music is amazing and the club is always packed. If you like a crowded club with good rap music this is definitely the place for you.
Arrive early if you do not have a guest list.

This club is always packed and huge line. I used BACKDOOR MTL for table reservation and bottle service. So happy I did so that i could skip the line. Best experience and highly recommend this club and using BACKDOOR MTL is a must.

Great service one of the best clubs in montreal.
I used Backdoor MTL for table reservations and line skip

Best club in the city. Hands down. The service is good, the staff is friendly, the music is amazing, and the sound system is remarkable. The bottle selections are great, the crowd is nice and young, and famous rappers always pull up to École Privée!

Our group reserved with Backdoor MTL and we had the best time! école privée is a high intensity night club and definitely is now a favourite. Thankfully we booked with Backdoor and when we arrived we skipped the HUGE line. Will no doubt be back soon.

formatted_address: 1950 Rue Claude-Gagné, Laval, QC H7N 0E4, Canada
name: Westwood Bar & Grill

reviews.text: I personally really like the vibe there and the food is pretty good too.
amazing time with my friends. LOVE the ambiance and the service was great. Thank you and would definitely come back.
We had an amazing night thanks to our waitress Anabel, who guided us thru the menu and wine selection. highlights were the Dumplings, Tuna maki & Baked Cod. 10/10 would recommend to a friend.
Horrible service and way over priced for the portions!! Dirty bathrooms 🤮

My girlfriend and I ordered a bottle of Pinot red wine from Santa Barbara. For entrées, we got tuna & shrimp makis with salmon tatar. And  for the main course, we got filet mignon and  black cod. Delicious food & great vibe. Also, the waiter was kind to suggest us know what to order. We'll come again for sure.

formatted_address: 5860 Avenue de Lorimier, Montréal, QC H2G 2N9, Canada
name: Broue Pub Brouhaha

reviews.text:
Very nice selection of microbrewery beers. Plates were good to huge in size. Food was tasty.
We got a surprise from the cuisine with a humongous Nachos plate (see photo). Couldn't finish it...
Service was courteous. Prices are fair.

Very good food as always. Hot duck is an awesome staple with a twist. Just a very good smoked duck sandwich plate with salad and fries. Of course the beer choice is great, the selection of Québec micros as well as their house beers. Unpretentious place with staff that will take the time to explain their products. Good job Brouhaha!

We were at Lirimier Ave to pic up some pictures and we stopped to have lunch at Brouhaha Pub. There is a good selection of beers and the staff are friendly enough to give you some samples that you can drink and choose the one you like most. The food was also good and the ambience was calm and nice for lunch time, we believe should be fun to go for a happy hour too. We recommend it !
Good beers, ok food for snacking but not that good
Craft beers were tasty! One of my favourite spots in Montreal for poutine.

formatted_address: 1800 Rue Notre-Dame Ouest, Montréal, QC H3J 1M5, Canada
name: Bird Bar

reviews.text: The venue has a nice vibe, but like many small restaurants, the tables are close to one another. The menu is affordable but lacks of variety. It's mainly chicken, which is a place to go if you want to enjoy poultry. Flavor wise, nothing out of the ordinary. They have a few vegan options (popcorn "chicken", fries and salads).  Service was good, but I probably wouldn't go back.

Bird Bar came highly recommended to me and did not disappoint! I’ve been for weekend brunches as well as dinners and have always enjoyed. The atmosphere, the food & drinks, the service... all outstanding! Make sure to try their mock-pock ;)

Great atmosphere, Clean washrooms, wait staff was attentive and friendly. Service was quick and efficient. The food was mediocre and certainly not worth the price tag. The chicken had a thick breading that was not really crispy and the sauces were ok. French fries were good, spicy mayo had too much lime in it.  I would go again to try a different item but its tough given it’s supposed to be known for its chicken.

Went there on Sunday. Good music and great ambiance, wasn't too crowded on a Sunday evening. So many things I wanted to try on their menu but i picked the mac and cheese balls as an appetizer and the deep friend shrimp tacos as the main with a side of French fries and jalapeño corn bread.  The tacos were SO GOOD. Perfect size and perfectly done. Mac and cheese balls were really good and not dry. Also loved the jalapeño corn bread. Service was really good however it took forever to get our bill. We waited so long to have the waitress notice that we were done and waiting to leave since my friend and I had plans after. Same for when they brought the bill. Overall the food was really good and I will definitely come back since there's so many other dishes I want to try!

Delicious food. Went on a whim, and was only disappointed by the staff serving the 8 other people who arrived after us, before even getting us water. Ordered the shrimp tacos and fried chicken. Had 2 cocktails as well and found it to be overpriced. Cute decor, very hip. Might try it again.

formatted_address: 51 Rue Rachel O, Montréal, QC H2W 1G2, Canada
name: T & T Tacos and Tortas - Mexican resto- bar

reviews.text: Really good place to eat the fancy kind of tacos! They make them just like how tacos were originally; small sized with a soft-shell full of flavor. I really loved their beef and grilled cactus taco.

Pretty limited selection of tacos, but the tacos available are all uniquely amazing. There is only one vegetarian option (but it's tasty nonetheless). The staff are excellent and the atmosphere is cosy.

Probably the best tacos on the Plateau.   The tacos Al Pastor are very authentic and tasty.
Tortillas are a 4/5 which is why I’m not giving this place 5 stars but would still recommend it to anyone who likes mexican food.

Great food, service and atmosphere!

The wait time can be a bit long on busier nights but you never feel "forgotten!"

The tacos are amazing. Try the fish ones! 
Drinks aren't weak so you'll be having a good time in no time!

The art on the walls are always a conversation piece seven if it can be a bit loud.

All that said, make it a point to go when you're in Montreal!

Cheers,
Good quality food. The pulled pork tacos were delicious. Portions felt a bit small for the price. Service was okay. The Margheritas were very generous in size. Overall a good experience.

formatted_address: 20815 Boulevard Henri-Bourassa, Québec, QC G2N 1P6, Canada
name: Restaurant Les Frères Toc

reviews.text:
Went to eat here on a whim. Really enjoyed our meal.

Wednesday night, so apparently live music not to mention 50 percent off of the wine. Already in my good books.

Extremely decently priced table d'hôte and the food offered was excellent. 

The wait staff was awesome, very helpful and very attentive. Meals came exactly at the right time and made for smooth conversation between me and the wife.

Great atmosphere. I will definitely be going back when the patio is open.

Looks good, nice atmosphere, but that's it... Food is basic... Way too expensive for what it is... And the service here is slow, they pay not attention to ypu and even if you wave or make signs, they run the other way... If I could give zero 🌟 I'd do it

Ordered a beef tartare that tasted nothing. No not nothing. Sometimes i had a bite that tasted like fish ... ?  Friends ordered burgers that weren't worth the price and the fries are quality mcdo.... And it was impossible to have a service... Tried to get the server at our table by waving hands and calling him and nothing did it. Don't go waste your money there
Great place. Live band at night time. Lots of  choice for food. Would strongly recommend.
Nice restaurant. Good food. Not exceptional but good quality-price ratio.

formatted_address: 10215 Rue Thomas-Paine, Montréal, QC H1C 0B6, Canada
name: Les Productions Pachanga

formatted_address: 1800 Rue Sherbrooke Ouest, Montréal, QC H3H 1E5, Canada
name: Maiolo Montreal

reviews.text: I have to agree Maiolo is the BEST Italian food in Montreal! We went for dinner recently and were very impressed by everything! The space is clean, very cozy and intimate. The staff is incredible, truly amazing. We loved how knowledgeable and friendly they where and that they all similarly sharply dressed. We had appetizers that were amazing, my family kept commenting on how delicious the cherry tomatoes where! The pasta is all hand made and fresh, and you can taste and feel it! The homemade cheesecake was the final touch at the end which was to die for! This was a complete experience, made us feel like we where in Italy, it was that good!
The food was great,  I felt like we were in Italy.  The waiter Paolo didnt miss a beat.  We will definitely be back again next time we are in town.

I am torn. I want to rate this restaurant higher and will be back to see if my experience is different.  Excellent staff, the waiter was a perfect professional, the food was great except for the meatballs which were Luke warm and tough but the tomato sauce was piping hot. The Bufala cheese with kale and beets was exceptional. I'm thinking the issue with the meatballs was an oversight, will have to try again.

Best restaurant in Montreal! The service was excellent and the food was absolutely delicious! This was probably the best restaurant I have ever visited and I highly recommend!! I would rate higher if i could.

this place had amazing Italian food all of the smoothies for great they had fresh bread they brought it to us right away. sometimes we come here just for quick lunch and it's amazing they have great specials during the lunch hour. The dinner here can have long Waits I suggest making a reservation a couple days in advance if you want to eat dinner here at a reasonable hour. the wait staff is friendly and it doesn't matter if you speak English or French they will help you either way. All in all this place is a great spot to get some authentic Italian food in Montreal.

formatted_address: 1201 Avenue Van Horne, Outremont, QC H2V 1K4, Canada
name: Damas

reviews.text:
I've never eaten somewhere quite like this. The attention to detail, presentation, service, cleanliness, and overall experience is so intentional and purposeful. They genuinely have a great restaurant and they want you to have a great time. My family and I came here for my birthday and we opted for the tasting menu which has like 10 services. I can't even begin to tell you what we ate, but we ate so much we all wanted to die at the end of the meal. They kept serving us delicious meal after delicious meal, we had to take the last 2 services to go! 
If you're a fan of hummus, grilled meats, fish, cheese pastries, fattoush salad, and so on, this place will satisfy you and then some. 

Everyone is so polite and wonderful and patient. An absolute amazing experience here and I would recommend to anyone.

Early dinner on Sunday because we can't get any reservation. Service was top notch. I love the service, my little man broke a glass, and they just clean the floor flawlessly. Best kids meal ever.
We had a tasting menu. Huge portion, worth a try. We were recommended not to take with the wine pairing due to our time limitations. Very honest. 
Food was phenomenal, the least favorite was the dessert.

Incredible. We visited recently for a family birthday celebration and it was a really great experience. The atmosphere is wonderful, the staff are very attentive, professional, knowledgable and friendly. The food is extraordinary. A very very high quality of Syrian food and we'll definitely return. A magical evening from beginning to end. Thank you.

This restaurant is no doubt one of the tastiest place in the region. Whenever I come to this place I am incredibly satisfied. They maintain their very high  standard service and the topmost level of meals  they offer. You definitely will enjoy this this restaurant. Very  recommended.

Outstanding food - Honestly tell the experts if you have any allergies or intolerances and let them pick the menu for you! They know best and they are awesome at selecting the best pairings and fresh menu selections. 

This place is a gem!
Service is outstanding!
Food is absolutely amazing!

formatted_address: 151 Rue Ontario E, Montréal, QC H2X 1H5, Canada
name: Mme Lee

reviews.text: An absolute disastreous establishment. I was part of an organizing commitee for an event at this "club". After confirming our event many weeks in advance, with a clear contract and agreement, the managers stopped responding the day of the event. At the time of the event, as our guests started arriving no staff was present at the bar. Yes, you read that correctly; after having multiple conversations confirming the event the bar managers did not show up. Our event manager called the two contacts she had with Mme Lee's and they refused to answer. We had planned events with Lee's in the past and have been fairly successful and have recommended to other clubs and faculties of our university to host events there. Rest assured. after this horrendous debacle, we will no longer be visiting this bar, planning events at this bar or even considering stepping foot there. This reflects a lack of competence and irresoponsibilty on the hands of all those involved in the management of this club. To add to this absolute hell fire of a situation, Mme Lee management has withheld our revenues from previous fundraising events. As a patron of the club and someone who has communicate with those running the establishment, I would highly recommend you stear clear of Mme Lee's.  (Also, cultural appropration?)
Great Club, good vibes, and the bouncers are SOOO nice!!!
Good experience, staff nice and drinks are reasonably priced!!
Had a blast in the VIP section. Love their new booth! The DJ was really good! All my friends enjoyed!
Nice staffs, good liquor, good atmosphere

formatted_address: 6315 Boulevard Léger, Montréal-Nord, QC H1G 1L4, Canada
name: Bar Au Petit Tonneau

reviews.text: Cool
Ce bar est un lieux quand on a envie de faire un peu plus la fête est de prendre un petit coup avec la boisson et les gens qu'ils y vont, sont très bien.
Boooooring!
Bon service
Très platte

formatted_address: 6075 Boulevard Wilfrid-Hamel, L'Ancienne-Lorette, QC G2E 2H7, Canada
name: Quebec Broue

reviews.text: Fod is great .must visit if you have a chance.
Good steak with nice bear and service

Service was horrible walked instead of the door waiting on somebody seat me finally sat myself bartender leaves bar to come get my drink order 15 minutes later a waitress comes to get my dinner order went the entire meal without a refill, then waited probably 10 minutes or more before they came back and asked for check food was mediocre
Food is very good and the staff is great
Nice place food is good. Classic resto/bar

formatted_address: 1405 Rue de Louvain O, Montréal, QC H4N 1G6, Canada
name: 3 Brasseurs Louvain laboratoire (fermé au public)

formatted_address: 2073 Rue Saint-Denis, Montréal, QC H2X 3K8, Canada
name: Le Psy Bar vins et fromages

reviews.text:
It was really good ! Went there last night with a friend and the staff was extremely friendly, even though they didn't speak english well, they did their best to accommodate us! Which was awesome !!!

 They had a small selection of drinks to choose from, no special orders. For example my friend requested a Amaretto Sour but, it was not on their list so they couldnt make it...which  was fine. 
But it could be cool if they had a larger selection or could make specific drinks too!  

We also ordered a regular cheddar grilled cheese. The cheese was top-notch and real cheddar which was a plus, the bread was regular bread. I only wish the bread matched the cheese in regards to quality due to the cost... but it was still really delicious none the less. 

It is a great little place though on St Denise with a small terrace and great staff! Will love to go back !!
Great little place with unique decor, beautiful bottles of wine and tasty plates! The exceptional service is just a bonus.
Good wine, good cheese, nice atmosphere and bartender very friendly, I highly recommend!
Cozy place with a nice selection of cheeses. They do grilled cheese sandwiches with French onion soup and also lots of options for charcuterie.
Amazing place!!!  I highly recommend this! You must try the 🧀 & 🍷!  One of the best terraces on St.-Denis!

formatted_address: 245 Rue Sherbrooke Ouest, Montréal, QC H2X 1X8, Canada
name: Benelux

reviews.text: If you're visiting Montreal and want to feel like a local, go to Benelux. They brew their own beer and have a nice selection to choose from. The atmosphere is friendly, grab one of their euro-style hot dog if you're feeling hungry. Bonus points for their fantastic summer terrace.
Was recommended by a friend to come here. The server was very professional and pleasant. The beer was excellent as well
Best beer in Montreal. A hidden gem that warrants weekly, maybe daily pints for locals! Get the euro-dog + pint special before 8pm
Alex and Kelly are amazing. The Black Russian and Godfather shots were fantastic
Nice place to chill open till 3 am. Good beer but prices could be lower for other drinks than beer. Amazing service. Reduced 1 star for prices but if u live close by it's a really good place to go.

formatted_address: 1077 Rue Drummond, Montréal, QC H3B 4X4, Canada
name: Decca 77

reviews.text: They do a great justice to French cuisine. Not all items on the menu were available, which was a bit turn off.

Amazing food, staff and general service. Had the Mixed Greens and it was wonderful, it wasn't drenched in vinaigrette and had just enough lemon to taste perfect. For dinner I had the Flank Steak (medium rare :D), and it was just amazing, no doubt one of the best I've ever had. As for the staff, it was a bit slow, but it was worth it, and the chairs were very comfortable ;)
Exelent.🙂

Good tasting food but the portions are ridiculously small, hence the overall value for the money is very poor. I realize this is not a fast food restaurant where it is quantity before quality , but it doesn't mean the customer has to be gouged in order to enjoy a good meal. I ordered a simple pasta dish (no meat sauce). It was a tiny portion, suitable for either an average 5-year old or someone who is anorexic . This is totally unacceptable considering that pasta is very inexpensive to make. Collegues ordered other plates with similarly tiny portions. If you must eat there, make sure you had eaten something within the previous hour OR you plan on eating something very shortly afterwards. The only reason i gave it two stars instead of only one is because the taste, presentation and decor were good.
Great food but often takes longer than expected to be served

formatted_address: 409 Rue McGill, Montréal, QC H2Y 2G3, Canada
name: Le 409

reviews.text: Great ambience and amazing Indian fusion food. The chef himself is double checking all the dishes being served and meets guests when he can. Amazing location as well. They serve lunch and dinner.  Definitely worth a try. Don't miss out.
Genuine Indian food. Interesting way of presenting the food and the taste was on point. Surely recommend giving the place a try ! :)

Trendy nice restaurant for business or leisure.  Had a business lunch and ambience was modern, and chic.  Lunch menu had a good selection and pricing (for Old Port Montreal) increadibly reasonable at roughly $20 per person without alcohol.  Hard to beat that.

I could picture this a great 5 a 7 meet up location with clients or friends.

Recommend it.

Le 409 is a new project located in the old port. I personally would like to describe it as  a retro Indian upscale restaurant. Beautiful decor but definitely on the higher end side; can’t complain because the location is very much self explanatory. This butter chicken was $16 but felt like it wasn’t even enough for one portion. It was good but not memorable. Maison Indian Curry on Jean Talon still remains my favourite restaurant. 

My sister calls me picky but not difficult. I just simply tell her that after gaining that extra 10lb, I know my food pretty well. 😝

Overall a nice experience. The service was kind, quick and professional. The food was good, seasoned well enough. We were a large group and I took an extra naan which added 5$ to the lunch bill.  I love Indian food and I work around the corner, but 30$ for the small portion and a naan bread is ridiculous and my salad had none of the veggies that were supposed to be in there (not even one chickpea or tomato). You can find many other delicious and reasonable restaurants in the area, so keep that in mind. Enjoyable but in my opinion, not worth the price for what you get.

formatted_address: 1171 Rue Sainte-Catherine E, Montréal, QC H2L 2G8, Canada
name: Stock Bar

reviews.text:
Third time in Montreal, third time here. Very clean and professional. The reason for my review being so low is the inconstancy with the dancers. Most are very friendly and will sit and chat with you and make conversation for a bit before asking you to spend money on them and are very nice about it if you say no, but then there are some who simply walk up to you and straight up tell you to take them to the back as their way of saying hello, then there are some who just sit at the bar all night and don't even bother to come around and say hi.
Drinks are reasonably priced, and the shows are decent (some are better than others), but some of the dancers could learn to be more personable.

Great staff, good atmosphere, hot dancers. Would be five stars but for my first experience there I found the dancers to be too passive. If you want a dance from them you have to seek them out and ask - shouldn't it be the other way around; shouldn't they be going around making you want to get one...?
Cleanest strip bar in the village. Boys are muscle/jock type. It’s part of the brand. Usually $5 cover.

Great place BUT they still let the women in.  They have a separate "women's" night on Wednesday yet every night there is always screaming obnoxious women here making the men uncomfortable.  As soon as the women come in it changes the atmosphere for the worse and people start to leave.  Keep your main clientele happy and comfortable.

Fun and surprisingly comfortable. The show goes on all night & there's always something interesting to see. You can book a private dance if you like, but there's not a hard-sell when the friendly dancers come around to introduce themselves to you. The cover is low and the drinks are reasonably priced.

formatted_address: 345 Rue Villeray, Montréal, QC H2R 1G8, Canada
name: Mesón

reviews.text: Fun Atmosphere with open air seating. Our waiter was very knowledgeable and suggested the perfect bottle of wine for us. The food was delicious and carefully prepared and presented

Amazing brunch.  We were surprised at the food quality at this time of day.  Generally breakfasts are hard to stand out but this place is a great exception!  From the omelette to the french toast and olive jam... Not one thing to complain about.  Great find!  Place opens at 10am on Saturdays though.  Enjoy!
My favorite restaurant in the city never disappointed

I have had 3 dinners in Montreal this week and each night it gets better.  We at at Meson last night and it was one of the best meals I have had in years.  The Secreto Iberico is out of this world good.  I also recommend Coca's they are amazing flatbreads.  On top of the excellent food the wine was great and the service outstanding.  Our waiter is originally from Portugal and provided great service and explained the menu and made great recommendations.  Whenever I am in town I will eat here.

The fantastic little brother restaurant of Tapeo, the restaurant that singlehanded you revived Villeray district. Along side this other gem of a place, Mesón, they’ve given life to entire neighborhood and should get some sort of royalty for each new place that opens.

They didn’t pioneer Spanish food in Montreal but they certainly took it to a new level. Unlike Tapeo, that focus on tapas, Mesón presents typical Spanish dishes, the kind your grandmother would make if she was a fantastic cook and plated like Gordon Ramsay.

You will eat well, you will drink well as well because of the carefully selected wine list, many of private import variety. 

Great vibe, decor, place is always jammed so book ahead.

And to mention the fantastic brunch, which has been a great way to introduce people to restaurant. It is my favourite brunch place in town, I love the uniqueness and variety of the dishes (along with free use of chorizo in many menu items). Can’t speak highly enough of the second act they’ve accomplished with their brunch approach. Now during the day and at night, it’s well worth a visit...
